original: skyo bcas sems can yongs smin byed //
analyzed: skyo bcas sems can yongs smin byed //
translated: With weariness, one brings beings to full maturity.🔽And:🔽Addictions, bad friends,

original: ces pa dang / nyon mongs goms dang grogs ngan dang // phongs dang gzhan gyi dbang nyid de //🔽mdor na rigs kyi nyes pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa dang / nyon mongs goms dang grogs ngan dang // phongs dang gzhan gyi dbang nyid de // mdor na rigs kyi nyes pa ni /
translated: poverty, and dependence on others🔽are, in brief, the four faults

original: rnam pa bzhir ni shes par bya //🔽zhes gsungs so //🔽bdun pa ni nges pa'i tshig gi dbang du byas te de ni /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir ni shes par bya // zhes gsungs so // bdun pa ni nges pa'i tshig gi dbang du byas te de ni /
translated: of the spiritual gene.🔽The seventh is the etymology.

original: phyogs sam sa la skyob pa ni go'i sgra ste /
analyzed: phyogs sam sa la skyob pa ni go'i sgra ste /
translated: It is a refuge from the direction or place, with the suffix -a.🔽The suffix -a is used for mountain, light, earth,

original: ri 'od sa dang rdo rje dang // mtho ris ba lang mchog rnams la //
analyzed: ri 'od sa dang rdo rje dang // mtho ris ba lang mchog rnams la //
translated: diamond, heaven, bull, and so on.

original: mkhas pas go sgra shes par bya //🔽zhes brjod pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: mkhas pas go sgra shes par bya // zhes brjod pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The wise should know the suffix -a.

original: yang snying rje'i dbang gis ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba ngan par thim pas na ku la'o //
analyzed: yang snying rje'i dbang gis ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba ngan par thim pas na ku la'o //
translated: Also, it is a kula because of compassion, since it dissolves into the bad destinies of the hells and so on.

original: gzhan dag ni yon tan gyi tshogs kyi rten du 'gyur ba'i phyir na ku la zhes skad kyi dbyings bstan pa'i rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni yon tan gyi tshogs kyi rten du 'gyur ba'i phyir na ku la zhes skad kyi dbyings bstan pa'i rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: Others follow the etymological explanation that it is a kula because it becomes the basis of the collection of good qualities.

original: ming gi don ni yon tan skyed pa'i phyir rigs nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: ming gi don ni yon tan skyed pa'i phyir rigs nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the term is that it is called the lineage because it produces good qualities.

original: 'di ni sa bon dang nus pa'i ming go don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni sa bon dang nus pa'i ming go don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the name for a seed and a potentiality.🔽The nature of the realm of the Dharma itself is the lineage of the bodhisattva.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kho na zhes bya ba ni dang po bsdus pa'i don gyi skabs su /🔽sgrub pa yi ni rten gyur pa //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kho na zhes bya ba ni dang po bsdus pa'i don gyi skabs su / sgrub pa yi ni rten gyur pa //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang // zhes gsungs pa thugs la bzhag nas 'dir 'di skad smos so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang // zhes gsungs pa thugs la bzhag nas 'dir 'di skad smos so //
translated: The verse was spoken here by the author of the treatise, having in mind the verse in the Compendium of the Teachings:🔽The support of the practice🔽is the nature of the realm of the Dharma.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i chos ni sgrub pa rnam pa bzhi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i chos ni sgrub pa rnam pa bzhi la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Dharma that is taught is the four practices and so forth.

original: gzhir gyur pa ni chos kyi dbyings te rtogs pas de dang 'brel pa'i bdag nyid byang chub sems dpa' rnam par bcu gsum la rigs zhes bstan to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhir gyur pa ni chos kyi dbyings te rtogs pas de dang 'brel pa'i bdag nyid byang chub sems dpa' rnam par bcu gsum la rigs zhes bstan to zhes bya ba la /
translated: The realm of the Dharma is the basis. The nature of the bodhisattva who is connected with it through realization is taught to be the lineage in the thirteen stages.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: The bodhisattva

original: bdud rtsi thob byed lam ni 'di min gyis //
analyzed: bdud rtsi thob byed lam ni 'di min gyis //
translated: is not the path that leads to the attainment of immortality.

original: lam ngan spongs la lam la mnos shig ces //
analyzed: lam ngan spongs la lam la mnos shig ces //
translated: Abandon the bad path and enter the path.

original: lta ngan sems can mthong nas go byed de //
analyzed: lta ngan sems can mthong nas go byed de //
translated: Seeing beings with wrong views, he makes them understand.

original: rgyu des byang chub sems dpa' zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rgyu des byang chub sems dpa' zhes brjod do //
translated: For that reason he is called a bodhisattva.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis na /
translated: In this way,

original: byang chub la dgod pa'i phyir sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub la dgod pa'i phyir sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: a hero for the sake of enlightenment is called a bodhisattva.

original: rnam pa bcu sum la zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bgrang pa'i bcu gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu sum la zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bgrang pa'i bcu gsum ste /
translated: With thirteen aspects means with the thirteen aspects that are enumerated.

original: de yang dang po ni sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de yang dang po ni sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa bzhi'o //
translated: Moreover, the first four are included in the path of preparation.

original: lnga pa ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: lnga pa ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: The fifth is the path of seeing.

original: drug pa ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //🔽bdun pa dang dgu pa ni de dag nyid kyi bral ba @48a * //
analyzed: drug pa ni bsgom pa'i lam mo // bdun pa dang dgu pa ni de dag nyid kyi bral ba @48a * //
translated: The sixth is the path of cultivation.

original: dang bral ba'i thob pa gnyis so //
analyzed: dang bral ba'i thob pa gnyis so //
translated: The seventh and ninth are the two, the freedom of those two and the attainment of freedom.

original: brgyad pa ni sa 'od byed pa nas sa drug pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni sa 'od byed pa nas sa drug pa'i bar ro //
translated: The eighth is from the stage of The Radiant up to the sixth stage.

original: bcu pa ni sa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: bcu pa ni sa bdun pa'o //
translated: The tenth is the seventh stage.

original: bcu gcig pa ni sa mi g-yo ba nas chos kyi sprin gyi bar ro //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa ni sa mi g-yo ba nas chos kyi sprin gyi bar ro //
translated: The eleventh is from the stage of The Immovable up to The Cloud of Truth.

original: bcu gnyis pa ni skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dang srid pa tha ma pa'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa ni skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dang srid pa tha ma pa'o //
translated: The twelfth is the one who is obstructed by one birth and the one in his last existence.

original: bcu gsum pa ni khyad par gyi lam rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: bcu gsum pa ni khyad par gyi lam rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The thirteenth is the special path, the vajra-like samadhi.

original: de la skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i sa pa ni 'gro ba rnams la sangs rgyas kyi bya bas nye bar gnas pas gdul bya phal mo che bstan pa la dgod par byed pa'i phyir na de'i 'og tu bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du bzhugs pa la
analyzed: de la skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i sa pa ni 'gro ba rnams la sangs rgyas kyi bya bas nye bar gnas pas gdul bya phal mo che bstan pa la dgod par byed pa'i phyir na de'i 'og tu bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du bzhugs pa la
translated: On that, the level of being impeded by a single birth is the level of abiding in accordance with the wishes of beings, because it is the level of abiding in accordance with the wishes of beings, abiding in the activities of a buddha for the sake of beings.

original: sogs pa ldem per dgongs pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sogs pa ldem per dgongs pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: After that, the Buddha's intention is taught through the door of indirect intention, as stated in the following:

original: de la 'gro ba 'ga' zhig bstan pa 'di la gzhug pa'i phyir dang por de'i skrag pa spang ba'i thabs kyis bdag dang gang zag dang phung po dang khams la sogs pa yod par bstan pa dang / chos thams cad med pa dang ; chos thams cad rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: de la 'gro ba 'ga' zhig bstan pa 'di la gzhug pa'i phyir dang por de'i skrag pa spang ba'i thabs kyis bdag dang gang zag dang phung po dang khams la sogs pa yod par bstan pa dang / chos thams cad med pa dang ; chos thams cad rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang /
translated: In that regard, in order to introduce some beings to this teaching, first the methods for abandoning their fears are taught. For example, the existence of the self, the person, the aggregates, the elements, and so on are taught, as well as the nonexistence of all phenomena, the dependent origination of all phenomena,

original: chos thams cad phyin ci ma log cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal lo zhes kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la brten te gsungs pa dang / chos kyi phung po gcig gsungs par mi mdzad kyi /
analyzed: chos thams cad phyin ci ma log cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal lo zhes kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la brten te gsungs pa dang / chos kyi phung po gcig gsungs par mi mdzad kyi /
translated: The Buddha taught the Dharma in a variety of ways: sometimes he taught that all phenomena are unmistaken and naturally luminous, and sometimes he taught in terms of the imputed, dependent, and fully present realities.🔽 He did not teach a single Dharma aggregate, but rather taught the eighty-four thousand Dharma doors in accordance with those to be trained.

original: gdul bya la brten cing chos kyi sgo mo brgyad khri bzhi stong snyed bstan pa dang / byang chub kyi spyod pa rab tu dka' ba bsten te nyon mongs pa la gnas pas ni byang chub de thob po zhes bstan pa dag gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs pa dang /
analyzed: gdul bya la brten cing chos kyi sgo mo brgyad khri bzhi stong snyed bstan pa dang / byang chub kyi spyod pa rab tu dka' ba bsten te nyon mongs pa la gnas pas ni byang chub de thob po zhes bstan pa dag gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs pa dang /
translated: He taught that those who follow the bodhisattva way, which is so difficult to follow, and who remain in the afflictions will attain enlightenment.

original: mtshan nyid pa ldem por dgongs pa dang / gnyen po la ldem por dgongs pa dang / sgyur ba la ldem por dgongs pa dag dang / yang /🔽tshogs dang chos kyi sku dag dang // 'gro ba'i don ni spyod pa yis //
analyzed: mtshan nyid pa ldem por dgongs pa dang / gnyen po la ldem por dgongs pa dang / sgyur ba la ldem por dgongs pa dag dang / yang / tshogs dang chos kyi sku dag dang // 'gro ba'i don ni spyod pa yis //
translated: These are the four kinds of implied teachings: implied teachings for the purpose of introducing disciples to the teachings, implied teachings concerning characteristics, implied teachings concerning antidotes, and implied teachings concerning transformation.🔽The buddhas are the same in terms of the accumulations, the dharmakāya,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pa ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pa ste //
translated: and their activity for the sake of living beings.

original: zhes pa la brten nas 'das pa'i dus kyi sangs rgyas kha cig kyang nga nyid yin no zhes bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas 'ga' zhig gi mtshan thos pas phyir mi ldog par 'gyur zhes dus ring mo zhig na 'gyur ba la brten pa dang /
analyzed: zhes pa la brten nas 'das pa'i dus kyi sangs rgyas kha cig kyang nga nyid yin no zhes bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas 'ga' zhig gi mtshan thos pas phyir mi ldog par 'gyur zhes dus ring mo zhig na 'gyur ba la brten pa dang /
translated: Based on the statement, Some buddhas of the past were also me, it is taught that some buddhas are irreversible from enlightenment.🔽 Based on the statement, By hearing the name of some buddhas, one will become irreversible, it is taught that this will occur after a long time.🔽 Based on the statement, If one serves buddhas equal to the sands of the Ganges river, one will then comprehend the meaning of the supreme vehicle, it is taught that this will occur after a long time.

original: sangs rgyas gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed la rim gro bya ba byas na de nas gdod @48b theg pa mchog gi don khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes ston pa don gzhan la brten pa dang / gang zag 'ga' zhig la dang por sbyin pa'i legs pa brjod de de yang phyi nas sbyin pa smad pa la sogs pa bstan pa gang zag gi bsam pa la brten pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed la rim gro bya ba byas na de nas gdod @48b theg pa mchog gi don khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes ston pa don gzhan la brten pa dang / gang zag 'ga' zhig la dang por sbyin pa'i legs pa brjod de de yang phyi nas sbyin pa smad pa la sogs pa bstan pa gang zag gi bsam pa la brten pa ste /
translated: Based on the statement, First, the excellence of generosity is praised, and later generosity is criticized, it is taught that this is based on the thoughts of the individual.

original: de ltar na mnyam pa nyid la dgongs pa dang / dus gzhan la dgongs pa dang / don gzhan la dgongs pa dang / gang zag gi bsam pa la dgongs pa ste dgongs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mnyam pa nyid la dgongs pa dang / dus gzhan la dgongs pa dang / don gzhan la dgongs pa dang / gang zag gi bsam pa la dgongs pa ste dgongs pa bzhi'o //
translated: Thus, there are four intentions: intention directed at equality, intention directed at another time, intention directed at another meaning, and intention directed at the thoughts of persons.

original: 'di dag ni theg pa chen po la snang ba lta bur gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni theg pa chen po la snang ba lta bur gzung bar bya ste /
translated: These should be held to be like the light of the Mahāyāna.

original: zhu ba'i 'og tu za ba la //
analyzed: zhu ba'i 'og tu za ba la //
translated: After the request, the reply:

original: mar gyi nying khu sbrang rtsi dang // kha ra dag ni bdud rtsi bzhin //
analyzed: mar gyi nying khu sbrang rtsi dang // kha ra dag ni bdud rtsi bzhin //
translated: Like the four ambrosias—ghee, honey, sugar, and molasses—

original: ma zhu zos la dug du 'gyur //
analyzed: ma zhu zos la dug du 'gyur //
translated: they become poison for those who eat without digesting.

original: de bzhin rab rgyas bdud rtsi yis //
analyzed: de bzhin rab rgyas bdud rtsi yis //
translated: Likewise, the nectar of the extensive becomes

original: dgongs pa'i tshig la mi mkhas shing //
analyzed: dgongs pa'i tshig la mi mkhas shing //
translated: poison for those who are not skilled in the words of intention

original: byis pa'i blo dang ldan pa la //
analyzed: byis pa'i blo dang ldan pa la //
translated: and have the mind of a child.

original: mi bzad pa yi dug tu 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: mi bzad pa yi dug tu 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: It becomes unbearable poison.

original: de ltar dgongs pa brgyad kyis 'gro ba'i don la 'bad pa ni rta 'dul sbyong byed pa ltar nges par dul bar 'gyur bas na de dag nyid theg pa gsum gyi lam la sems can ma lus par 'god pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhan gyi don gyi go rims
analyzed: de ltar dgongs pa brgyad kyis 'gro ba'i don la 'bad pa ni rta 'dul sbyong byed pa ltar nges par dul bar 'gyur bas na de dag nyid theg pa gsum gyi lam la sems can ma lus par 'god pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhan gyi don gyi go rims
translated: Thus, the effort for the sake of beings by means of the eight thoughts of the great person is definitely a discipline, like the discipline of a horse. Therefore, they are the order of the aims of others, which have the characteristic of establishing all sentient beings without exception on the paths of the three vehicles.

original: so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, they are called the “aims of others.”

original: don 'di la dgongs te sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas su bstan par mdzad do //
analyzed: don 'di la dgongs te sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas su bstan par mdzad do //
translated: With this aim, the bodhisattva of the tenth stage is taught to be a buddha.

original: de'i 'og tu 'khor ba ji srid pa la sogs pa ni skabs bdun par zhib tu rnam par 'byed pas shes par 'gyur bas 'dir mi brjod do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'khor ba ji srid pa la sogs pa ni skabs bdun par zhib tu rnam par 'byed pas shes par 'gyur bas 'dir mi brjod do //
translated: After that, the remaining seven topics, such as the duration of cyclic existence, will be analyzed in detail in the seventh chapter, so they will not be discussed here.

original: gang dag tha mar bstan pa 'di sangs rgyas kyi sa la sbyor bar byed pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang dag tha mar bstan pa 'di sangs rgyas kyi sa la sbyor bar byed pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: Some apply this final teaching to the buddha stage, but that is unreasonable.

original: de ltar na sngar smos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bcu gsum zhes pa ji ltar drangs /
analyzed: de ltar na sngar smos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bcu gsum zhes pa ji ltar drangs /
translated: In that case, how can one interpret the statement, “Thus, the thirteen bodhisattvas mentioned previously”?

original: lhag ma'i tshig gi don ni go sla bas rnam par ma phye ste /
analyzed: lhag ma'i tshig gi don ni go sla bas rnam par ma phye ste /
translated: The meaning of the remaining words is easy to understand, so they are not analyzed here.

original: rnam par bshad pa'i rim pa bzlog pa 'di ni dang por bshad pa'i gzhi byang chub sems dpa'i dbye bar rigs par bsams te de ltar bshad par zad do //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa'i rim pa bzlog pa 'di ni dang por bshad pa'i gzhi byang chub sems dpa'i dbye bar rigs par bsams te de ltar bshad par zad do //
translated: This reversal of the order of explanation is merely an explanation in accordance with the above analysis of the bodhisattva as the basis of the first explanation.🔽This is taught by the passage beginning with “Just as the Sravakayana, etc., is the cause of the realization of the Sravakas, etc., in the same way, the Bodhisattvayana is the cause of the realization of the bodhisattvas.”

original: ji ltar na nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'i rim gyis dmigs pa de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te nyan thos dag ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa ltar rigs tha dad pa dang de
analyzed: ji ltar na nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'i rim gyis dmigs pa de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te nyan thos dag ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa ltar rigs tha dad pa dang de
translated: The Sravakas do not assert that there are different lineages and that there is a cessation of the lineage, as do the Yogacarins.

original: chad pa yod par 'dod pas na sems can thams cad ma nges @49a * //
analyzed: chad pa yod par 'dod pas na sems can thams cad ma nges @49a * //
translated: Therefore, since they assert that all sentient beings have the lineage of the Buddha, they assert that the lineage is not definite.🔽Thus, according to your own system, even though the nature of the lineage is one, it is tenable that there are different lineages due to the mere difference in realization, which is due to conditions.

original: pa'i rigs can du 'dod pas na de ltar 'dod pa khyed nyid kyi lugs kyis rigs kyi ngo bo gcig yin yang rkyen gyis byas pa'i rtogs pa tha dad pa tsam gyis rigs tha dad par 'thad pa ltar kho bo cag kyang rigs kyi rang bzhin chos kyi
analyzed: pa'i rigs can du 'dod pas na de ltar 'dod pa khyed nyid kyi lugs kyis rigs kyi ngo bo gcig yin yang rkyen gyis byas pa'i rtogs pa tha dad pa tsam gyis rigs tha dad par 'thad pa ltar kho bo cag kyang rigs kyi rang bzhin chos kyi
translated: In the same way, we also assert that the lineage is one in nature, but that there are different lineages due to the difference in the realization of the Dharma, which is due to conditions.

original: dbyings gcig pu kho na bzhin du 'dod kyang de rtogs pa'i rim pa las rigs khyad par can bcu gsum du 'dod ces pa 'di ni bstan bcos las grags pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: dbyings gcig pu kho na bzhin du 'dod kyang de rtogs pa'i rim pa las rigs khyad par can bcu gsum du 'dod ces pa 'di ni bstan bcos las grags pa'i dpe'o //
translated: Although it is asserted to be just the one basic element, it is asserted to be the thirteen special lineages from the stages of realizing it. This is the example known from the treatise.

original: slar chos nyid du zhes pa ni bstan par sla ba dang go bar sla ba 'ji rten la grags pa'i de'o //
analyzed: slar chos nyid du zhes pa ni bstan par sla ba dang go bar sla ba 'ji rten la grags pa'i de'o //
translated: Again, in reality is the one known in the world that is easy to teach and easy to understand.

original: sgrub pa'i rten du gyur pa ji skad bshad pa'i zhes pa ni 'das ma thag pa byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bcu gsum po rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i rten du gyur pa ji skad bshad pa'i zhes pa ni 'das ma thag pa byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bcu gsum po rnams kyi'o //
translated: The basis for accomplishment is the just-explained of the thirteen types of bodhisattvas.

original: dmigs pa gang yin zhe na snyam du phyogs snga ma rtog pa la dmigs pa gsungs te tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa gang yin zhe na snyam du phyogs snga ma rtog pa la dmigs pa gsungs te tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: What is the object? is the former position. The object is stated: The object is the object of the former position.

original: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'di gang zhig yin /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'di gang zhig yin /
translated: What is this called object?

original: 'di ltar chos mngon pa las ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / ming la ma byang ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / brda la blo ma byang ba dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos mngon pa las ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / ming la ma byang ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / brda la blo ma byang ba dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang /
translated: Thus the Abhidharma explains that the fivefold collection of sense consciousnesses, mental consciousness, mental consciousness not trained in names, mental consciousness not trained in signs, views, pride,

original: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams por ba de las gzhan dag dang ; gang dag bor ba de dag dang / zad pa med pa dang / skal ba mi 'dra ba'i khams dang / sa kun tu 'gro ba rnams dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dmigs pa bzhi gtan la ma phebs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams por ba de las gzhan dag dang ; gang dag bor ba de dag dang / zad pa med pa dang / skal ba mi 'dra ba'i khams dang / sa kun tu 'gro ba rnams dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dmigs pa bzhi gtan la ma phebs pa rnams dang /
translated: those phenomena concomitant with them, those other than them, those that are not abandoned, the inexhaustible, the realms of dissimilar fortune, those that pervade all levels, those future objects that are not ascertained,

original: gang bor ba rnams dang / rtag pa la sogs par skyes pa'i 'dzin pa rnams dang / de dag las bzlog pa'i rnam par 'byung ba rnams dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa ma bor ba rnams dang / de spang ba rnams kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: gang bor ba rnams dang / rtag pa la sogs par skyes pa'i 'dzin pa rnams dang / de dag las bzlog pa'i rnam par 'byung ba rnams dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa ma bor ba rnams dang / de spang ba rnams kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: those that are abandoned, those that are apprehended as permanent and so on, those that are the opposite of them, those that are not abandoned as objects of knowledge and those that are abandoned.

original: yul yongs su chad pa dang / de la bzlog pa dang / yul la bkra bar mi 'dzin pa dang / de las bzlog pa dang / dngos po dang bcas pa dang / de las bzlog pa dang / dngos po dang / kun brtags pa dang /
analyzed: yul yongs su chad pa dang / de la bzlog pa dang / yul la bkra bar mi 'dzin pa dang / de las bzlog pa dang / dngos po dang bcas pa dang / de las bzlog pa dang / dngos po dang / kun brtags pa dang /
translated: the focal object of the five sense consciousnesses is a specific object, the opposite of that, the focal object of conceptual consciousness is a variegated object, the opposite of that, the focal object of the five sense consciousnesses is a substantial object, the opposite of that, the focal object of conceptual consciousness is an imputed object, the focal object of the five sense consciousnesses is a real object, the opposite of that, the focal object of conceptual consciousness is an unreal object, the opposite of that, the focal object of the five sense consciousnesses is a distorted object, the opposite of that, the focal object of conceptual consciousness is a non distorted object, the focal object of the five sense consciousnesses is an obstructed object, the opposite of that, the focal object of conceptual consciousness is an unobstructed object.🔽If the focal object is classified in twelve ways, which of these is taken as the focal object here?

original: phyin ci log dang / de las bzlog pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i dmigs pa ste rnam pa bcu gnyis su phye ba'i dmigs pa bstan na 'dir de dag @49b las gang dag gzung zhe na /
analyzed: phyin ci log dang / de las bzlog pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i dmigs pa ste rnam pa bcu gnyis su phye ba'i dmigs pa bstan na 'dir de dag @49b las gang dag gzung zhe na /
translated: The focal object of the five sense consciousnesses is a specific object, the focal object of conceptual consciousness is a variegated object, the focal object of the five sense consciousnesses is a substantial object, the focal object of conceptual consciousness is an imputed object, the focal object of the five sense consciousnesses is a real object, the focal object of conceptual consciousness is an unreal object, the focal object of the five sense consciousnesses is a distorted object, the focal object of conceptual consciousness is a non distorted object, the focal object of the five sense consciousnesses is an obstructed object, the focal object of conceptual consciousness is an unobstructed object.

original: re zhig yul la bkra bar mi 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa rab tu smad pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i dmigs pa mchog dag ni 'dir mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: re zhig yul la bkra bar mi 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa rab tu smad pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i dmigs pa mchog dag ni 'dir mi gzung ngo //
translated: Here the focal object of the five sense consciousnesses is a specific object and the focal object of conceptual consciousness is a variegated object are not taken because they are inferior. The focal object of the five sense consciousnesses is a substantial object and the focal object of conceptual consciousness is an imputed object are not taken because they are superior.

original: lhag ma bcu las kyang byang chub sems dpa' dang po bzhi ni sngar bstan pa ltar rnam par rtog pa'i rigs bzhi ma spangs pas na phyin ci log dang kun brtags pa'i dmigs pa dang yang 'brel zhing dmigs pa lhag ma rnams kyang ci rigs su sbyar ro
analyzed: lhag ma bcu las kyang byang chub sems dpa' dang po bzhi ni sngar bstan pa ltar rnam par rtog pa'i rigs bzhi ma spangs pas na phyin ci log dang kun brtags pa'i dmigs pa dang yang 'brel zhing dmigs pa lhag ma rnams kyang ci rigs su sbyar ro
translated: Also, from among the remaining ten, the first four bodhisattvas are related to the objective support of error and the imagined, because they do not abandon the four types of conception, as previously explained. The remaining objective supports are related to the remaining bodhisattvas as appropriate.

original: // byang chub sems dpa' lhag ma dgu ni lhag ma'i dmigs pa brgyad dang 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // byang chub sems dpa' lhag ma dgu ni lhag ma'i dmigs pa brgyad dang 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The remaining nine bodhisattvas are related to the remaining eight objective supports.

original: yang gzhan dag ni byang chub sems dpa' bcu gsum po ni thogs pa med pa'i dmigs par 'dod do //
analyzed: yang gzhan dag ni byang chub sems dpa' bcu gsum po ni thogs pa med pa'i dmigs par 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that the thirteen bodhisattvas are related to the objective support of the unobstructed.

original: dge sbyong tshul nyid ces bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa gtsor gyur pa ste ji skad du chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: dge sbyong tshul nyid ces bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa gtsor gyur pa ste ji skad du chos mngon pa las /
translated: The nature of the spiritual training is the truth of the path, as the Abhidharmakośa states,

original: dge sbyong tshul ni dri med lam //🔽zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong tshul ni dri med lam //🔽zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: The spiritual training is the stainless path.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i lus kyi las zhes bya ba ni phan pa'am gnod pa'i sems dang bral ba'i bzo byed pa'am kha zas za ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i lus kyi las zhes bya ba ni phan pa'am gnod pa'i sems dang bral ba'i bzo byed pa'am kha zas za ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The so-called indeterminate physical action is the creation of crafts or the eating of food, etc. with a mind free from the intention to benefit or harm.

original: rnam pa gnyis pa'i dbye ba bzhi nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gzhung rtsa ba las zung du sbyar ba phrag bzhi bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis pa'i dbye ba bzhi nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gzhung rtsa ba las zung du sbyar ba phrag bzhi bstan pa rnams so //
translated: The fourfold nature of the two types of classification is the four pairs taught in the root text.

original: chos can stobs bcu ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos can stobs bcu ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The subject is the ten powers.

original: stobs bcu nyid chos can te stobs re re la yang dpag tu med pa'i stobs mnga' mod kyi mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: stobs bcu nyid chos can te stobs re re la yang dpag tu med pa'i stobs mnga' mod kyi mdor bsdu na /
translated: The ten powers themselves are the subject. Although each power has immeasurable power, in brief,

original: stobs bcur bstan to zhes mdo las gsungs pas na rang gi yan lag ni 'dir chos su brjod do //
analyzed: stobs bcur bstan to zhes mdo las gsungs pas na rang gi yan lag ni 'dir chos su brjod do //
translated: it is taught in the sutras that they are taught as the ten powers. Therefore, here, the term dharma refers to its own branches.

original: gzhan dag ni sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos kyi gtso bo ni stobs bcu yin pas 'dir chos can gyi sgras ni gtso bo bstan la mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan ni chos kyi sgras bstan par 'gyur ro zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos kyi gtso bo ni stobs bcu yin pas 'dir chos can gyi sgras ni gtso bo bstan la mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan ni chos kyi sgras bstan par 'gyur ro zhes 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that since the ten powers are the primary phenomena that create a buddha, here, the term subject refers to the primary, and the qualities such as the four forms of fearlessness are taught by the term dharma.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa la zhes bya ba la de lta bu ni dmigs pa rnam pa bcu gcig rnams so //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa la zhes bya ba la de lta bu ni dmigs pa rnam pa bcu gcig rnams so //
translated: Such as these. Such means the eleven kinds of objective supports.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni grangs rnam pa bcu gcig tu gzhag pa'i dmigs pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni grangs rnam pa bcu gcig tu gzhag pa'i dmigs pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The words such as indicate that the eleven kinds of objective supports are merely illustrative,

original: rgyas par ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ma lus pa la dmigs par rigs pas na chos thams cad ces bstan te /🔽rgyal sras rnams kyis mi bslab pa //
analyzed: rgyas par ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ma lus pa la dmigs par rigs pas na chos thams cad ces bstan te / rgyal sras rnams kyis mi bslab pa //
translated: for it is reasonable to posit all the objective supports as the entire content of the selflessness of dharmas and persons.

original: de ni 'ga' yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: de ni 'ga' yang yod ma yin //
translated: There is nothing at all that is not to be learned by the victors’ spiritual heirs.

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //🔽rtog pa ji lta bus rim @50a * //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o // rtog pa ji lta bus rim @50a * //
translated: Thus it is said.🔽By what kind of conception is there a gradual objective support?

original: gyis dmigs pas na zhes bya ba la rtogs pa'i rim pa mi 'dra ba'i shugs kyis ni sngar dmigs pa bcu gnyis las ci rigs su phye ba yin te /
analyzed: gyis dmigs pas na zhes bya ba la rtogs pa'i rim pa mi 'dra ba'i shugs kyis ni sngar dmigs pa bcu gnyis las ci rigs su phye ba yin te /
translated: The force of the different stages of conception is the division of the twelve objective supports as appropriate.

original: las dang po pa rnams ni mngon par zhen pas dmigs la /
analyzed: las dang po pa rnams ni mngon par zhen pas dmigs la /
translated: Beginners have an objective support that is full of attachment,🔽but the later ones have an objective support that is the opposite of that.

original: phyi ma phyi ma rnams ni de las bzlog par dmigs pa'i phyir te de ni rtogs pa ji lta ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma rnams ni de las bzlog par dmigs pa'i phyir te de ni rtogs pa ji lta ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of by what kind of conception.

original: gzhan dag ni byang chub sems dpa' bcu gsum po de dag kun kyang dge ba la dang por dmigs shi /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni byang chub sems dpa' bcu gsum po de dag kun kyang dge ba la dang por dmigs shi /
translated: Others say: All those thirteen bodhisattvas first focus on virtue and gradually, in the end, focus on the ten powers.

original: rim gyis tha mar stobs bcu la dmigs pa'i bar du dmigs pa ni rtogs pa'i rim pa'o zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: rim gyis tha mar stobs bcu la dmigs pa'i bar du dmigs pa ni rtogs pa'i rim pa'o zhes 'dod do //
translated: The stages of realization are the stages of focusing.

original: ched du bya ba zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' de dag don ci zhig gi ched du dmigs pa de lta bu la dmigs pa sgrub par byed ce na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ched du bya ba zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' de dag don ci zhig gi ched du dmigs pa de lta bu la dmigs pa sgrub par byed ce na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: With regard to the term purpose, what is the purpose for which bodhisattvas accomplish the practice of focusing on such objects?

original: de'i lan du ni sems can thams cad rim gyi rim gyis sems can gyi mchog sangs rgyas nyid du bya'o zhes yid la byed pa'i phyir sems dpa' che ba nyid de /
analyzed: de'i lan du ni sems can thams cad rim gyi rim gyis sems can gyi mchog sangs rgyas nyid du bya'o zhes yid la byed pa'i phyir sems dpa' che ba nyid de /
translated: The answer is that they think, I will gradually bring all sentient beings to the supreme state of buddhahood and thus they are great beings.

original: de dag la sogs pa'i don chen po gsum gyi rim pas dmigs zhes bya'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa'i don chen po gsum gyi rim pas dmigs zhes bya'i tha tshig go //
translated: They focus on objects in terms of the stages of these three great purposes.

original: gal te de ltar sems can thams cad sangs rgyas mi'i mchog tu gyur na sems can thams cad kyi mchog gi sems can thams cad gang zhe na ;
analyzed: gal te de ltar sems can thams cad sangs rgyas mi'i mchog tu gyur na sems can thams cad kyi mchog gi sems can thams cad gang zhe na ;
translated: If all sentient beings become buddhas, the highest of humans, then what sentient beings are the highest of all sentient beings?

original: de ni rang rang gi sangs ma rgyas pa'i gnas skabs la dgongs pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de ni rang rang gi sangs ma rgyas pa'i gnas skabs la dgongs pas nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no error because this is intended to refer to the state of not being a buddha.

original: dmigs pa ni ched du bya ba de dag mthong nas dmigs pas na dang po ni dmigs pa 'byung la de nas ni ched du bya ba de'i mthus 'byung bas na /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni ched du bya ba de dag mthong nas dmigs pas na dang po ni dmigs pa 'byung la de nas ni ched du bya ba de'i mthus 'byung bas na /
translated: The object is the object of observation, since one observes those objects of attainment and then, through the power of those objects of attainment, one arises.

original: 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sde'i zhal snga nas mda' ltong du gzhug pa dang 'ben la phog pa'i dpe dang dus nye ba dang ring ba'i dbang gis 'di gnyis bstan pa mdzad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sde'i zhal snga nas mda' ltong du gzhug pa dang 'ben la phog pa'i dpe dang dus nye ba dang ring ba'i dbang gis 'di gnyis bstan pa mdzad do //
translated: Arya Vimuktisena explains that these two are taught through the power of proximity and distance, using the analogy of an arrow being shot and hitting a target.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo gang yin zhe na zhes pa la de'i rang gi ngo bo ni sngar sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i ming tsam zhig lan mang du byung bas na /
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo gang yin zhe na zhes pa la de'i rang gi ngo bo ni sngar sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i ming tsam zhig lan mang du byung bas na /
translated: What is its nature?

original: da ni de'i ngo bo ming can ston cig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da ni de'i ngo bo ming can ston cig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Now, teach the nature of that which has a name.

original: de'i lan du ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi yul la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i lan du ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi yul la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The answer to that is stated in the verse beginning, “The object of the three omnisciences,” and so on.

original: 'dir don ni 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir don ni 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the meaning is taught as follows:

original: khyod kyis dris pa'i sgrub pa'i ngo bo de ni mdor na rnam pa gnyis te ji ltar zhe na @50b goms pa'i mthu ma thob pa'i phyir sgo du ma nas spyod pa'i sgrub pa bzhi ni skabs dang po gsum gyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: khyod kyis dris pa'i sgrub pa'i ngo bo de ni mdor na rnam pa gnyis te ji ltar zhe na @50b goms pa'i mthu ma thob pa'i phyir sgo du ma nas spyod pa'i sgrub pa bzhi ni skabs dang po gsum gyi dbang du byas te /
translated: The nature of the accomplishment that you asked about is, in brief, twofold. How is that? The four accomplishments of conduct through many doors, because of not having attained the power of familiarity, are posited as the nature of the first three chapters.

original: de'i ngo bor bzhag la yun ring gu 'dris pa'i mthus dge ba sgrub pa ji snyed pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rten dang ldan par bsdus te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bor bzhag la yun ring gu 'dris pa'i mthus dge ba sgrub pa ji snyed pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rten dang ldan par bsdus te /
translated: The accomplishment of all that is to be accomplished, the power of long familiarity, is subsumed in the support of the six perfections.

original: bsgrub par nus pa'i sgrub pa drug ni skabs lhag ma bzhi ma bzhi rnams kyis sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par nus pa'i sgrub pa drug ni skabs lhag ma bzhi ma bzhi rnams kyis sgrub pa'o //
translated: The six accomplishments of what is to be accomplished are accomplished by the remaining four chapters.

original: de la rje btsun gyi zhal snga nas ni go cha'i sgrub pas sgrub pa gnyis bstan la /
analyzed: de la rje btsun gyi zhal snga nas ni go cha'i sgrub pas sgrub pa gnyis bstan la /
translated: The revered master explains that the armor practice and the practice of engagement are the two practices.

original: lhag ma 'jug pa la sogs pa ni sgrub pa dang po'o zhes dgongs pas dus gcig gi tshul gyis ston par mdzad do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma 'jug pa la sogs pa ni sgrub pa dang po'o zhes dgongs pas dus gcig gi tshul gyis ston par mdzad do zhes bya'o //
translated: The remaining practices such as the practice of entry are the first practice.

original: yang gzhan dag ni skabs bdun par ni pha rol tu phyin pa gcig gis kyang ma lus par sgrub par nus pas na mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa bzhi la zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam pa gsum la zhes bya bar rigs so zhes bya bar 'dod do
analyzed: yang gzhan dag ni skabs bdun par ni pha rol tu phyin pa gcig gis kyang ma lus par sgrub par nus pas na mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa bzhi la zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam pa gsum la zhes bya bar rigs so zhes bya bar 'dod do
translated: Others assert that since one can practice all six perfections in the seventh chapter, the phrase four realizations should be three realizations.

original: // de la go cha la sogs pa'i sgrub pa dang po rnam pa gsum ni go rims bzhin du 'jug pa dang / zhugs pa khyad par can du gyur pa dang / 'bras bu thob pa mngon du byed pa rnams yin la /
analyzed: // de la go cha la sogs pa'i sgrub pa dang po rnam pa gsum ni go rims bzhin du 'jug pa dang / zhugs pa khyad par can du gyur pa dang / 'bras bu thob pa mngon du byed pa rnams yin la /
translated: The first three practices such as the armor practice are, respectively, the practice of entry, the practice of special engagement and the practice of attaining the result.

original: sgrub pa tha ma ni ma lus pa gcig tu dbyer med pas sgrub cing snga phyi'i char yang mi lta bar sgom pa'o zhes bya bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa tha ma ni ma lus pa gcig tu dbyer med pas sgrub cing snga phyi'i char yang mi lta bar sgom pa'o zhes bya bar shes par bya ste /
translated: The final practice is to practice by knowing that everything is indivisible and to meditate without regard to earlier and later times.

original: de ni rnam pa thams cad skad cig la mkhyen pa'i dang por sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa thams cad skad cig la mkhyen pa'i dang por sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the initial application of the knowledge of all aspects in a single instant.

original: go cha'i sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus rnam pa gsum po go cha dang sbyor ba dang sems can gyi don bya ba dag las 'dir ni go cha'i brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: go cha'i sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus rnam pa gsum po go cha dang sbyor ba dang sems can gyi don bya ba dag las 'dir ni go cha'i brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: The armor practice is to be understood as the essence of the armor practice of the three kinds of effort: armor, application and benefit for sentient beings.

original: go cha yang pha rol tu phyin pa sum cu rtsa drug dag tu sgrub par sems kyis sran btsugs pas de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs pas na go cha dang chos mthun te /
analyzed: go cha yang pha rol tu phyin pa sum cu rtsa drug dag tu sgrub par sems kyis sran btsugs pas de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs pas na go cha dang chos mthun te /
translated: Armor is the resolution of the mind to accomplish the thirty-six perfections. It is armor because it is not overcome by adverse factors.

original: de bas na go cha brtan par gyon pa la thams cad 'grub pa'i phyir de dang por bstan te /
analyzed: de bas na go cha brtan par gyon pa la thams cad 'grub pa'i phyir de dang por bstan te /
translated: Therefore, since everything is accomplished for one who wears firm armor, it is taught first.

original: dgos pa bsgrub la mkhas rnams sran thub pas //🔽dka' ba rnams kyang dka' ba med par rgal //
analyzed: dgos pa bsgrub la mkhas rnams sran thub pas // dka' ba rnams kyang dka' ba med par rgal //
translated: The wise, being patient, accomplish their purpose.

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: So they cross over difficulties without difficulty.

original: yang de ni du zhe na /
analyzed: yang de ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are there?

original: drug tshan drug gis ji bzhin bshad //
analyzed: drug tshan drug gis ji bzhin bshad //
translated: Six groups of six are explained as they are.

original: ces bya ba'i bka' lung 'dis sum cu rtsa drug mdo dang mthun par bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i bka' lung 'dis sum cu rtsa drug mdo dang mthun par bstan to //
translated: This statement of the scriptures shows thirty-six in accordance with the sutras.

original: de la slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas ni bstan @51a * //
analyzed: de la slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas ni bstan @51a * //
translated: Here, the teacher says:

original: pa gang dag bsdus pa ni rab tu phye na go ba'i yan lag tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa gang dag bsdus pa ni rab tu phye na go ba'i yan lag tu 'gyur te /
translated: The teachings that are collected are divided into branches of understanding.

original: dper na gzugs zhes bstan pa'i tshe rgyu dang rgyur byas pa dag gis dbye bas bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs zhes bstan pa'i tshe rgyu dang rgyur byas pa dag gis dbye bas bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when form is taught, it is taught by dividing it into primary and derivative.

original: bstan pa gang rab tu rgyas pa de dag ni bsdus pa go bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bstan pa gang rab tu rgyas pa de dag ni bsdus pa go bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The teachings that are expanded are understood by the collection.

original: dper na gzugs gang ji snyed pa ni phung po lnga pa'o phung po'o zhes pa'am /
analyzed: dper na gzugs gang ji snyed pa ni phung po lnga pa'o phung po'o zhes pa'am /
translated: For example, all forms are the five aggregates, or the aggregates.

original: ji ltar rgyal ba'i yum gyi mdo'i le'u rab tu mang po dag 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sde'i zhal snga nas le'u brgyad du gdags pa mdzad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal ba'i yum gyi mdo'i le'u rab tu mang po dag 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sde'i zhal snga nas le'u brgyad du gdags pa mdzad pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the many chapters of the Mother of the Victorious Ones, the Perfection of Wisdom Sutras, were compiled into eight chapters by the noble Vimuktasena.

original: 'dir yang sum cu rtsa drug drug tu bsdus na go sla bar dgongs pas go cha'i sgrub pa rnam pa drug go zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir yang sum cu rtsa drug drug tu bsdus na go sla bar dgongs pas go cha'i sgrub pa rnam pa drug go zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Here, too, it is easier to understand if one compiles the thirty-six into six. Therefore, it is said, “The armor practice is of six kinds.”

original: 'di la rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig med par ni bsdu bar mi rigs pas na /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig med par ni bsdu bar mi rigs pas na /
translated: Since it is not appropriate to compile without some reason,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa drug dang chos mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa drug dang chos mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, “Because of the similarity with the six perfections, such as generosity.”

original: sbyin pa la brten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug car de'i tshe de'i rgyu las byung zhing de'i nyams su len pa las phye bar zad pas na rgyu gcig las 'byung bar 'dra bas na ches mthun pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la brten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug car de'i tshe de'i rgyu las byung zhing de'i nyams su len pa las phye bar zad pas na rgyu gcig las 'byung bar 'dra bas na ches mthun pa'o //
translated: At that time, the six perfections based on generosity arise from that cause and are distinguished by practicing that. Therefore, they are very similar because they arise from the same cause.

original: gzhan dag ni gdul bya chos kyi rnams par dbye ba la mi rmongs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gdul bya chos kyi rnams par dbye ba la mi rmongs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Others say that in order to prevent disciples from being confused about the classification of phenomena,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de lta de ltar gdags pa mdzad pas ming gi chos mthun pa zhes bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug kho nar zad de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de lta de ltar gdags pa mdzad pas ming gi chos mthun pa zhes bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug kho nar zad de /
translated: The Bhagavat has designated it in this way, and the nature of the name of the dharmas in common is only the six perfections.

original: gal te nyan thos la sogs par yongs su bsngos na des pha rol tu phyin par ga la 'gyur zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: gal te nyan thos la sogs par yongs su bsngos na des pha rol tu phyin par ga la 'gyur zhes 'dod do //
translated: If it is dedicated to the sravakas, etc., how can it become a perfection?

original: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa thob nas sgrub cis pa'i don te de'i 'og tu ni 'dun pa tsam gyi spong pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa thob nas sgrub cis pa'i don te de'i 'og tu ni 'dun pa tsam gyi spong pa'o //
translated: The meaning of “practice of engagement” is that, having attained the engagement in the dharmadhatu, one practices.🔽With this very meaning in mind, the master Sri Buddhajñana said:

original: don 'di nyid las dgongs te slob dpon dpal sangs rgyas ye shes kyi zhal snga nas smon pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi yin la /
analyzed: don 'di nyid las dgongs te slob dpon dpal sangs rgyas ye shes kyi zhal snga nas smon pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi yin la /
translated: The aspiration thought of enlightenment is that of all worldly beings.

original: 'jug pa byang chub kyi sems ni sa dang po rab tu dga' ba las brtsams te'o zhes bshad do ;
analyzed: 'jug pa byang chub kyi sems ni sa dang po rab tu dga' ba las brtsams te'o zhes bshad do ;
translated: The engagement thought of enlightenment begins with the first bhumi, the Joyful.

original: / mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba ni nang stong pa nyid la sogs par mi dmigs shing rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / zhib dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma dang / smon pa dang /
analyzed: / mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba ni nang stong pa nyid la sogs par mi dmigs shing rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / zhib dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma dang / smon pa dang /
translated: nor does one apprehend anything in terms of permanence, happiness, self, beauty, emptiness, signs, wishes,

original: dus dang / khams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'dus byas kyi @51b khams dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams rnams gang du yang mi dmigs shing de dag med do zhes kyang mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dus dang / khams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'dus byas kyi @51b khams dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams rnams gang du yang mi dmigs shing de dag med do zhes kyang mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: times, realms, the realms with and without outflows, or the conditioned and unconditioned realms.

original: ched du bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ched du bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Purpose” means the emptiness of non-apprehension, the factors of awakening, the unshared qualities of the Buddha, etc.

original: mi slob pa'i chos rnams kyi ched du sngar yun ring du 'dris par bya ba rnams bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i chos rnams kyi ched du sngar yun ring du 'dris par bya ba rnams bsgom pa'o //
translated: It is the cultivation of those with which one has long been familiar for the sake of the qualities of the adept.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni 'bras bu la dmigs te 'jug pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni 'bras bu la dmigs te 'jug pa'i don to //
translated: “Omniscience” means the engagement in the object of the result.

original: de ltar 'jug pa byas pa la zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam bskyed pa la'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa byas pa la zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam bskyed pa la'o //
translated: Thus, “having generated the path of application” means having generated the path of seeing.

original: tshogs kyi lam skye bas zhes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam skye bas zhes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam 'byung ba ste /
translated: “Having generated the path of accumulation” means having generated the path of meditation.

original: 'dir sangs rgyas kyi rgyu'i tshogs rdzogs par byad pas na tshogs te /
analyzed: 'dir sangs rgyas kyi rgyu'i tshogs rdzogs par byad pas na tshogs te /
translated: Here, the path of accumulation is so called because it is the completion of the accumulation of causes for buddhahood.

original: dngos su na chos du ma'i don to //
analyzed: dngos su na chos du ma'i don to //
translated: In fact, it is the meaning of many dharmas.

original: des na las dang po pa'i sa nas khyad par gyi lam gyi bar du tshogs yin mod kyi /
analyzed: des na las dang po pa'i sa nas khyad par gyi lam gyi bar du tshogs yin mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, from the stage of the beginner up to the special path, it is the accumulation.

original: bsgom pa'i lam 'dir nus pa mthu can gyis chos rgyas pa la dmigs pas na 'di la tshogs kyi gtso bor gyur bas tshogs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam 'dir nus pa mthu can gyis chos rgyas pa la dmigs pas na 'di la tshogs kyi gtso bor gyur bas tshogs zhes gsungs so //
translated: However, since in this path of meditation, it is the primary accumulation because it focuses on the extensive Dharma with powerful ability, it is called the accumulation.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs la stong pa nyid nyi shur gsungs pa la /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs la stong pa nyid nyi shur gsungs pa la /
translated: The accumulation of wisdom is explained in twenty kinds of emptiness.

original: kha cig ni 'dir ni lam gyi skabs kyi ye shes gtsor ston pa ni 'bras bu'i ye shes me long lta bu la sogs pa gtsor ma bstan to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni 'dir ni lam gyi skabs kyi ye shes gtsor ston pa ni 'bras bu'i ye shes me long lta bu la sogs pa gtsor ma bstan to zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that here, the wisdom of the stage of the path is primarily taught, but the resultant wisdom of mirror-like and so on is not primarily taught.

original: 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sde'i zhal snga nas ni de dag kyang 'dir drangs te brjod par rigs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sde'i zhal snga nas ni de dag kyang 'dir drangs te brjod par rigs te /
translated: The Arya Vimuktasena says that it is proper to quote them here.🔽These twenty emptinesses are the differences of the mirror-like wisdom of equality.

original: stong pa nyid nyi shu po 'di dag ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes me long lta bu dang bcas pa'i bye brag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid nyi shu po 'di dag ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes me long lta bu dang bcas pa'i bye brag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Accumulation of the Stages

original: sa'i tshogs zhes bya ba la 'dir sa'i tshogs de ni rgyas par khong du chud par bya na sa'i nges pa'i tshig dang / sa'i dbye ba dang / rang bzhin dang / shas che chung gi chos dang / yongs su sbyong ba dang / sa de dag thob pa'i lus yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: sa'i tshogs zhes bya ba la 'dir sa'i tshogs de ni rgyas par khong du chud par bya na sa'i nges pa'i tshig dang / sa'i dbye ba dang / rang bzhin dang / shas che chung gi chos dang / yongs su sbyong ba dang / sa de dag thob pa'i lus yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
translated: Here, if the accumulation of the stages is to be understood in detail, it is proper to explain the verbal roots of the stages, the divisions of the stages, the nature of the stages, the qualities of the greater and lesser, the purification, the bodies that are taken up in attaining those stages,

original: kun rdzob kyi ye shes dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ; sa de dag gi rtags dang / 'bras bu rnams brjod par bya bar rigs so //🔽de la nges pa'i tshig ni spyi dang so so bas gnyis te /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi ye shes dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ; sa de dag gi rtags dang / 'bras bu rnams brjod par bya bar rigs so // de la nges pa'i tshig ni spyi dang so so bas gnyis te /
translated: the conventional wisdom, the discordances, the signs of those stages, and the results.🔽The Verbal Roots🔽The verbal roots are twofold: general and individual.

original: re zhig spyi'i dbang du mdzad nas ni //
analyzed: re zhig spyi'i dbang du mdzad nas ni //
translated: First, from the general perspective,

original: dge ba bsgrub pa sna tshogs la //
analyzed: dge ba bsgrub pa sna tshogs la //
translated: In the various practices of virtue,

original: dga' bas rtag par thams cad du //🔽gnas phyir byang chub @52a * //
analyzed: dga' bas rtag par thams cad du // gnas phyir byang chub @52a * //
translated: with joy, always, in every way,

original: sems dpa' yi //
analyzed: sems dpa' yi //
translated: the bodhisattvas🔽abide.

original: sa rnams gnas pa yin par 'dod //
analyzed: sa rnams gnas pa yin par 'dod //
translated: Thus the stages are considered to be abodes.

original: 'byung po dpag med 'jigs med phyir //
analyzed: 'byung po dpag med 'jigs med phyir //
translated: Because they are the fearlessness for the immeasurable beings,

original: dpag tu med pa de dag la //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa de dag la //
translated: on those immeasurable stages,

original: phyi phyir gong du 'gro ldan phyir //
analyzed: phyi phyir gong du 'gro ldan phyir //
translated: they proceed higher and higher.

original: de dag nyid ni sar 'dod do //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag nyid ni sar 'dod do // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus they are considered to be stages.

original: de bzhin du so so ba'i dbang du byas te rim pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du so so ba'i dbang du byas te rim pa bzhin du /
translated: Similarly, from the point of view of their individual characteristics, they are respectively:

original: byang chub la ni nye ba dang / sems can don sgrub mthong ba la //
analyzed: byang chub la ni nye ba dang / sems can don sgrub mthong ba la //
translated: The bodhisattvas see that they are close to enlightenment and that they are accomplishing the aims of beings,

original: rab tu dga' ba skye 'gyur te //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba skye 'gyur te //
translated: and so they experience supreme joy.

original: de phyir dga' ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de phyir dga' ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore it is called the stage of joy.

original: 'chal tshul rtsol ba'i dri bral phyir //
analyzed: 'chal tshul rtsol ba'i dri bral phyir //
translated: Because it is free of the stains of faulty discipline and striving,

original: dri ma med pa'i sa zhes bya //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i sa zhes bya //
translated: it is called the stainless stage.

original: chos kyi snang ba chen po ni //
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba chen po ni //
translated: Because it creates the great light of the Dharma,

original: byed pa'i phyir na 'od byed pa'o //🔽'di ltar byang chub phyogs mthun chos //
analyzed: byed pa'i phyir na 'od byed pa'o // 'di ltar byang chub phyogs mthun chos //
translated: it is called the shining stage.🔽Because it burns the firewood of the afflictions,

original: rab tu shes sreg me lta bu //
analyzed: rab tu shes sreg me lta bu //
translated: it is called the flaming stage.

original: de dang ldan phyir sa de ni //
analyzed: de dang ldan phyir sa de ni //
translated: Because of possessing that, this stage is

original: gnyis po sreg pas 'od 'phro can //
analyzed: gnyis po sreg pas 'od 'phro can //
translated: Illuminating, since it burns away the two.

original: sems can yongs su smin byed cing //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin byed cing //
translated: In order to ripen sentient beings

original: rang gi sems kyang bsrung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyang bsrung ba'i phyir //
translated: and to protect one’s own mind,

original: blo ldan rnams kyis bsrung dka' ba //
analyzed: blo ldan rnams kyis bsrung dka' ba //
translated: the wise find it difficult to protect

original: de phyir sbyang bar dka' zhes bya //
analyzed: de phyir sbyang bar dka' zhes bya //
translated: and therefore it is called difficult to master.

original: shes rab pha rol phyin bstan nas //🔽'khor ba dang ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin bstan nas // 'khor ba dang ni mya ngan 'das //
translated: Having taught the perfection of wisdom,🔽in this stage one directly perceives

original: gnyis 'dir mngon du gyur pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gnyis 'dir mngon du gyur pa'i phyir //
translated: samsara and nirvana as nondual,

original: mngon du gyur pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mngon du gyur pa zhes bshad do //
translated: and therefore it is called manifest.🔽Because it is connected with the path of

original: bgrod gcig lam dang 'brel ba'i phyir //
analyzed: bgrod gcig lam dang 'brel ba'i phyir //
translated: single progress,

original: ring du song ba'i sar 'dod do //
analyzed: ring du song ba'i sar 'dod do //
translated: it is held to be the stage Gone Far.

original: 'du shes gnyis kyis mi g-yo'i phyir ;
analyzed: 'du shes gnyis kyis mi g-yo'i phyir ;
translated: Because it is unshaken by the two discriminations,

original: / mi g-yo ba zhes nges par brjod //🔽so so yang dag rig blo bzang //
analyzed: / mi g-yo ba zhes nges par brjod // so so yang dag rig blo bzang //
translated: it is definitely called unshaken.🔽The intellect of the perfect knowledge of each thing

original: sa de legs pa'i blo gros yin //🔽sprin bzhin gnyis kyis nam mkha'i chos //
analyzed: sa de legs pa'i blo gros yin // sprin bzhin gnyis kyis nam mkha'i chos //
translated: is the stage Good Intellect.🔽Like a cloud, it covers the space-like Dharma

original: khyab pa'i phyir na chos kyi sprin //
analyzed: khyab pa'i phyir na chos kyi sprin //
translated: with the two, and therefore it is Dharma Cloud.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhung gang dag tu ji ltar bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhung gang dag tu ji ltar bstan pa rnams so //
translated: The etc. refers to the texts that teach in this way.

original: de la sa'i dbye ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sa slob pas bsdus pa ni theg pa chen po 'dir nges pa'i tshig gis bstan pa'i bcu po rnams so //
analyzed: de la sa'i dbye ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sa slob pas bsdus pa ni theg pa chen po 'dir nges pa'i tshig gis bstan pa'i bcu po rnams so //
translated: The classification of the stages is as follows: The supramundane stages that are included in the learner's stage are the ten stages taught in this Great Vehicle by means of synonyms.

original: gzhan du dad pa'i sa la sogs pa mang zhig 'byung ba ni 'dir skabs ma yin pa'i phyir mi dbye'o //
analyzed: gzhan du dad pa'i sa la sogs pa mang zhig 'byung ba ni 'dir skabs ma yin pa'i phyir mi dbye'o //
translated: Other stages, such as the stage of faithful practice, are not classified here because they are not relevant.

original: sa rnams kyi rang bzhin ni ye shes 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: sa rnams kyi rang bzhin ni ye shes 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The nature of the stages is supramundane transcendent wisdom.

original: sa gnag zhig la chos gang zhig shas che zhe na /
analyzed: sa gnag zhig la chos gang zhig shas che zhe na /
translated: In which stage is which perfection predominant?

original: kha cig na re pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dngos por mi dmigs pas ni sa so sor sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: kha cig na re pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dngos por mi dmigs pas ni sa so sor sbyor bar byed de /
translated: Some say: The ten perfections are applied to each stage because they are not perceived as substantial entities.

original: bsam dang phan pa'i dngos nyid dang // zhes pa la sogs @52b pa 'chad par 'gyur ba rnams ni sa de dang de la shas cher rgyas par spyod pa'i chos te /
analyzed: bsam dang phan pa'i dngos nyid dang // zhes pa la sogs @52b pa 'chad par 'gyur ba rnams ni sa de dang de la shas cher rgyas par spyod pa'i chos te /
translated: The factors that are explained as predominant in each stage are the factors that are extensively practiced in that stage, such as the thought of awakening and the nature of benefit.

original: de ltar byas na mdo dang mthun par 'gyur ro zhes zer la /
analyzed: de ltar byas na mdo dang mthun par 'gyur ro zhes zer la /
translated: If that were so, it would be in harmony with the sutras.

original: gzhan dag na re de ni rigs pa ma yin te /🔽gal te ji skad du 'chad par byed pa'i sa'i tshogs 'di dag ma thob pa thob par byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de ni rigs pa ma yin te / gal te ji skad du 'chad par byed pa'i sa'i tshogs 'di dag ma thob pa thob par byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Others say: That is illogical,🔽because if the accumulations of the levels were not obtained through the path explained here,

original: thob pa la shas che ba zhig yin na de'i tshe sa dgu pa'i tshogs bstan par /
analyzed: thob pa la shas che ba zhig yin na de'i tshe sa dgu pa'i tshogs bstan par /
translated: but were obtained through the ninth level, then the teaching of the accumulations of the ninth level would be illogical.🔽The Compendium of Ascertainment mentions:

original: nges 'byung byang chub shing rnams kyi //
analyzed: nges 'byung byang chub shing rnams kyi //
translated: The qualities of the tree of renunciation and enlightenment

original: yon tan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa 'di mi 'thad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yon tan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa 'di mi 'thad par 'gyur te /
translated: and so on.

original: de dag ni sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yon tan yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yon tan yin te /
translated: These are the qualities of bodhisattvas on the tenth level,

original: des na slob dpon gyis kyang de dag ni sa de thob par byed pa'i rgyur gsal por bstan to zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: des na slob dpon gyis kyang de dag ni sa de thob par byed pa'i rgyur gsal por bstan to zhes 'dod do //
translated: but the master Vasubandhu clearly taught that they are the causes for obtaining that level.

original: de las sa gang la chos gang zhig gis shas che ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rim pa bzhin dang / chos gang gis sa de thob par bya ba'i chos de nyid la yang shas cher slob cing /
analyzed: de las sa gang la chos gang zhig gis shas che ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rim pa bzhin dang / chos gang gis sa de thob par bya ba'i chos de nyid la yang shas cher slob cing /
translated: And one trains mainly in the very subject that enables one to attain that level.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i le'u las /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i le'u las /
translated: The noble Sutra of the Ten Levels says:

original: de la bsdu ba'i dngos po sbyin pa dang ngag snyan pa gnyis kyi shas che bas sems can yongs su smin par byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la bsdu ba'i dngos po sbyin pa dang ngag snyan pa gnyis kyi shas che bas sems can yongs su smin par byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: Therein, by the two means of gathering disciples, generosity and speaking pleasantly, one brings sentient beings to full maturity.

original: yongs su sbyong ba ni zhar la brjod zin to //
analyzed: yongs su sbyong ba ni zhar la brjod zin to //
translated: The thorough preparation has already been discussed incidentally.🔽The bodhisattva levels

original: lus yongs su 'dzin pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: lus yongs su 'dzin pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: The bodhisattva levels are presented in terms of the support,

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi rgyal po dang / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po nyid dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin nyid dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dang byed kyi bdag po rnams dang / stong gi bdag po tshangs pa dang /🔽stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i bdag po tshangs pa chen po dang lha'i bu dbang phyug chen po rnams su phal cher 'gyur bas ser sna dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mu stegs byed kyi gnas dang /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi rgyal po dang / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po nyid dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin nyid dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dang byed kyi bdag po rnams dang / stong gi bdag po tshangs pa dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i bdag po tshangs pa chen po dang lha'i bu dbang phyug chen po rnams su phal cher 'gyur bas ser sna dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mu stegs byed kyi gnas dang /
translated: They become kings of Jambudvīpa, universal monarchs, Śakra, lord of the gods, and the lords of the gods of the Yāma, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇarati, and Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin realms, and they become Brahmā, lord of the chiliocosm,🔽and Mahābrahmā, lord of the great trichiliocosm, and the sons of gods such as Maheśvara.

original: nga rgyal rnam par 'joms par 'joms shing sems can rnams la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal rnam par 'joms par 'joms shing sems can rnams la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: They conquer stinginess, immorality, attachment to the desires, the view of the transitory collection, the abodes of the tīrthikas, and pride, and they cause sentient beings to attain omniscient gnosis.

original: kun rdzob kyi ye shes kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi ye shes kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: From the perspective of conventional gnosis,

original: sa dang po la ni sangs rgyas brgya'i zhal mthong ba dang / ting nge 'dzin brgya la snyoms par @53a * //
analyzed: sa dang po la ni sangs rgyas brgya'i zhal mthong ba dang / ting nge 'dzin brgya la snyoms par @53a * //
translated: On the first level, one sees the faces of one hundred buddhas,

original: sa 'di dag gi yon tan de lta bu la sogs pa phal cher ni 'phags pa sa bcu'i le'ur blta bar rigs so //
analyzed: sa 'di dag gi yon tan de lta bu la sogs pa phal cher ni 'phags pa sa bcu'i le'ur blta bar rigs so //
translated: The qualities of these stages, such as these, should be understood in detail from the Daśabhūmika-sūtra.

original: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni thun mong nyid du gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rigs bzhi brgya rtsa brgyad du gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni thun mong nyid du gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rigs bzhi brgya rtsa brgyad du gyur pa rnams so //
translated: The resistances to these are the four hundred and eight conceptualizations of subject and object.

original: bye brag tu ni ji skad du de las dang po la ni gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: bye brag tu ni ji skad du de las dang po la ni gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: In particular, the first stage has the delusion of attachment to the substantiality of persons and things, the delusion of the passions of the miserable destinies, and the resistances to the virtues of that stage.

original: gnyis pa la ni ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / las kyi 'gro ba sna tshogs la shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / las kyi 'gro ba sna tshogs la shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The second stage has the delusion of error in the subtle precepts, the delusion of the variety of karmic destinies, and the resistances to the virtues of that stage.

original: gsum pa la ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi shin tu rmongs pa dang / thos pa'i gzungs yongs su rdzogs pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi shin tu rmongs pa dang / thos pa'i gzungs yongs su rdzogs pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: On the third, the error of being confused about the desire realm and the error of being confused about the complete retention of what one has heard, and the negative tendencies that are their adverse factors.

original: bzhi pa la ni snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / chos la sred pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / chos la sred pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: On the fourth, the error of being confused about craving meditative absorption and the error of being confused about craving the Dharma, and the negative tendencies that are their adverse factors.

original: lnga pa la ni 'khor ba la shin tu phyir phyogs pa dang mngon du phyogs pa yid la byed pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la phyir phyogs pa dang mngon du phyogs pa yid la byed pa'i shin rmongs pa dang //
analyzed: lnga pa la ni 'khor ba la shin tu phyir phyogs pa dang mngon du phyogs pa yid la byed pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la phyir phyogs pa dang mngon du phyogs pa yid la byed pa'i shin rmongs pa dang //
translated: On the fifth, the error of being confused about keeping in mind the turning away from and the orientation toward samsara, and the error of being confused about keeping in mind the turning away from and the orientation toward nirvana,

original: de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: and the negative tendencies that are their adverse factors.

original: drug pa la ni 'du byed 'byung ba mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma mang du 'byung ba'i shin @53b tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //🔽bdun pa la ni mtshan ma phra mo 'byung ba'i shin tu rmongs pa dang rab tu mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: drug pa la ni 'du byed 'byung ba mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma mang du 'byung ba'i shin @53b tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so // bdun pa la ni mtshan ma phra mo 'byung ba'i shin tu rmongs pa dang rab tu mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: On the sixth, the error of the manifest occurrence of the formation of the appearance of signs, the error of the occurrence of many signs, and the resistance to the elimination of the error of those.🔽On the seventh, the error of the occurrence of subtle signs, the error of the attention to the complete absence of signs, and the resistance to the elimination of the error of those.

original: brgyad pa la ni mtshan ma med pa'i sgrib pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma dag la dbang ba'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: brgyad pa la ni mtshan ma med pa'i sgrib pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma dag la dbang ba'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: On the eighth, the error of the obscuration of signlessness, the error of the power over signs, and the resistance to the elimination of the error of those.

original: dgu pa la ni chos ston pa tshad med pa dang / chos kyi tshig dang yi ge tshad med pa dang / gong nas gong du shes rab dang ; spobs pa dang / gzungs kyi dbang gis shin tu rmongs pa dang / spobs pa la dbang ba'i shin tu rmongs pa dang /
analyzed: dgu pa la ni chos ston pa tshad med pa dang / chos kyi tshig dang yi ge tshad med pa dang / gong nas gong du shes rab dang ; spobs pa dang / gzungs kyi dbang gis shin tu rmongs pa dang / spobs pa la dbang ba'i shin tu rmongs pa dang /
translated: On the ninth, it is the obscuration to the limitless teaching of the Dharma, to the limitless words and letters of the Dharma, and to the higher and higher wisdom, courage and power of retention.

original: de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //🔽sa bcu pa la ni mngon par shes pa chen po'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / gsang ba phra mo la 'jug pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes gsungs pa rnams dang / yang sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni shes bya thams cad la rab tu phra ba'i chags pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang /
analyzed: de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so // sa bcu pa la ni mngon par shes pa chen po'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / gsang ba phra mo la 'jug pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes gsungs pa rnams dang / yang sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni shes bya thams cad la rab tu phra ba'i chags pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang /
translated: It is the obscuration to the power of courage and the obscuration to the power of retention.🔽On the tenth level, it is the obscuration to the great higher perceptions, the obscuration to engaging in the subtle secrets and the negative tendencies that are incompatible with them.🔽And on the level of buddhahood, it is the obscuration to the most subtle attachment to all that is knowable,

original: thogs pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len du gyur pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes gsungs pa rnams te /
analyzed: thogs pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len du gyur pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes gsungs pa rnams te /
translated: the obscuration to the impediment to omniscience and the negative tendencies that are incompatible with them.

original: tha ma sangs rgyas kyi sa'i sgrib pa 'di yang sa bcu pa nyid la ldan pa'i phyir spong ba ma yin yang der bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: tha ma sangs rgyas kyi sa'i sgrib pa 'di yang sa bcu pa nyid la ldan pa'i phyir spong ba ma yin yang der bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The obscurations of the Buddha level are not eliminated on the tenth level itself, but they are included there.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i sgrib pa sa bcu pa nyid la rnam par gzhag par ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa rab tu phra ba'i gnas skabs dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag chags ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i sgrib pa'o zhes sngon gyi slob dpon kha cig gis bstan pa las kyang don gyis na 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i sgrib pa sa bcu pa nyid la rnam par gzhag par ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa rab tu phra ba'i gnas skabs dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag chags ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i sgrib pa'o zhes sngon gyi slob dpon kha cig gis bstan pa las kyang don gyis na 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: The obscurations of the Buddha level are established on the tenth level itself, and some past masters have explained that the obscurations of the Buddha level are the occasion of subtle nonafflictive ignorance and the instinct for affliction.
