original: sa rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs bye brag can 'di ni bdag gi sa la 'jug pa las ;
analyzed: sa rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs bye brag can 'di ni bdag gi sa la 'jug pa las ;
translated: The specific counteragents to the levels are mentioned in the Bodhisattblevel:🔽The ten levels are attained

original: yan lag bcu gcig rdzogs gyur pas //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gcig rdzogs gyur pas //
translated: through the completion of eleven factors.

original: rab tu dga' sogs sa bcu gcig rmongs gnyis gnas ngan len gcig ste //
analyzed: rab tu dga' sogs sa bcu gcig rmongs gnyis gnas ngan len gcig ste //
translated: The eleven factors are the ten levels, such as the Joyous, and the Buddha level.

original: mi mthun phyogs de tha dad do //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs de tha dad do //
translated: The specific counteragents are different.

original: zhes bshad pa'i lugs kyis 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i lung @54a * //🔽gis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i lugs kyis 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i lung @54a * // gis bshad pa'o //
translated: The noble Sūtra Unravelling the Intended Meaning is the scriptural source for this system.

original: sa de dag thob pa'i rtags ni rmi lam gyi rnam pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sa de dag thob pa'i rtags ni rmi lam gyi rnam pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: The signs of attaining those levels should be understood from the descriptions of dream images.

original: de ltar na rmi lam dro bar gyur pa'i tshe na med de der gnyid la sogs pa'i sgrib pa lnga zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rmi lam dro bar gyur pa'i tshe na med de der gnyid la sogs pa'i sgrib pa lnga zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, when you have reached the warmth stage of the path of preparation, you do not have dreams of that sort, because you have eliminated the five hindrances such as sleep.

original: de ltar na ji ltar de dag gi rtags rmi lam du nges par 'gyur zhe na ;
analyzed: de ltar na ji ltar de dag gi rtags rmi lam du nges par 'gyur zhe na ;
translated: You might wonder, “How can the signs of the levels be ascertained in dreams?”

original: de ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang gnyid de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang gnyid de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is true, but there are two kinds of sleep:

original: rang dbang med pa nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid dang / de las bzlog pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang dbang med pa nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid dang / de las bzlog pa nyid do //
translated: that which is involuntary and is characterized by afflictions, and that which is the opposite of that.

original: sbyor ba'i lam nyid du dang po bcom yang ched du byin gyis brlabs pas lus rgyas par byed pa dge bar bgrang ba'i gnyid ni sa de dang de dag la yang nges par yod pas na 'di la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam nyid du dang po bcom yang ched du byin gyis brlabs pas lus rgyas par byed pa dge bar bgrang ba'i gnyid ni sa de dang de dag la yang nges par yod pas na 'di la nyes pa med do //
translated: But sleep is counted as virtue when it is first destroyed on the path of application, and then blessed by the will to benefit others.

original: gzhan dag ni glo bur ba'i shes pa'i snang ba rmi lam lta bur byung ba ni sa de dang de dag la chos thams cad rmi lam ltar rtogs pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi ming gis bstan to zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni glo bur ba'i shes pa'i snang ba rmi lam lta bur byung ba ni sa de dang de dag la chos thams cad rmi lam ltar rtogs pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi ming gis bstan to zhes zer te /
translated: Others say that the dream state is taught by the name of dream because the appearance of adventitious consciousness is like a dream, and on those stages one realizes that all things are like a dream.

original: 'dir lung dang 'gal bar bsgrubs pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'dir lung dang 'gal bar bsgrubs pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of proving that this contradicts scripture?

original: lung gi tshig 'di dgos pa med par sgra gzhan gyis ston par mi mdzad do //
analyzed: lung gi tshig 'di dgos pa med par sgra gzhan gyis ston par mi mdzad do //
translated: The scriptures do not teach by means of other words that are not necessary.

original: de la mtshan ma rnams ni sa dang po la stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gter bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gis yongs su gang bar mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de la mtshan ma rnams ni sa dang po la stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gter bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gis yongs su gang bar mthong ba'o //
translated: In this regard, the signs are that on the first stage one sees the world systems of the great trichiliocosm filled with a hundred thousand times ten million billion treasures.

original: sa gnyis pa la ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang yin pa lag mthil lta bur gyur pa la rin po che bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mas legs par brgyan par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa la ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang yin pa lag mthil lta bur gyur pa la rin po che bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mas legs par brgyan par mthong ba'o //
translated: On the second ground, he sees the trichiliocosm, which is like the palm of his hand, well adorned with many quintillions of jewels.

original: sa gsum pa la ni bdag nyid dpa' zhing lag cha dang go cha sra ba thogs nas phas kyi rgol ba thams cad 'dul bar mthong ba'o //
analyzed: sa gsum pa la ni bdag nyid dpa' zhing lag cha dang go cha sra ba thogs nas phas kyi rgol ba thams cad 'dul bar mthong ba'o //
translated: On the third ground, he sees himself as a hero, holding a weapon and wearing strong armor, subduing all adversaries.

original: sa bzhi pa la ni phyogs bzhi nas rlung gi dkyil 'khor bzhi sa thams cad dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po la me tog sna tshogs kyis mngon par 'thor bar mthong ba'o //
analyzed: sa bzhi pa la ni phyogs bzhi nas rlung gi dkyil 'khor bzhi sa thams cad dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po la me tog sna tshogs kyis mngon par 'thor bar mthong ba'o //
translated: On the fourth ground, he sees the four wind maṇḍalas in the four directions scattering various flowers over the great maṇḍala of the entire earth.

original: sa lnga pa la ni rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i bud med kyi mgo la me tog tsam pa ka'i phreng ba 'dogs par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: sa lnga pa la ni rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i bud med kyi mgo la me tog tsam pa ka'i phreng ba 'dogs par mthong ba'o //
translated: On the fifth ground, he sees a woman adorned with all ornaments placing a garland of campaka flowers on his head.

original: sa drug pa la ni them skas bzhi dang ldan pa'i rdzing gser gyi bye ma bdal ba dangs shing rnyog pa med pa la chu yan lag brgyad dang ldan pas yongs su gang ba me tog autpala dang / ku mu da dang / pad ma dkar pos brgyan pa'i chu mthong nas de la @54b bdag nyid rtse dga' yongs su longs spyod par mthong ngo //
analyzed: sa drug pa la ni them skas bzhi dang ldan pa'i rdzing gser gyi bye ma bdal ba dangs shing rnyog pa med pa la chu yan lag brgyad dang ldan pas yongs su gang ba me tog autpala dang / ku mu da dang / pad ma dkar pos brgyan pa'i chu mthong nas de la @54b bdag nyid rtse dga' yongs su longs spyod par mthong ngo //
translated: On the sixth ground, he sees a pond with four staircases, covered with golden sand, clear and unpolluted, filled with water endowed with the eight qualities, and adorned with utpala, kumuda, and white lotus flowers. He sees himself playing and enjoying himself in the water.

original: sa bdun pa la ni ngos g-yas g-yon gnyis na sems can dmyal ba'i g-yang sa mthong ste /
analyzed: sa bdun pa la ni ngos g-yas g-yon gnyis na sems can dmyal ba'i g-yang sa mthong ste /
translated: On the seventh ground, he sees on the right and left sides the abyss of the hells.

original: bdag nyid ma smas ma nyams par de nas slar ldog par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ma smas ma nyams par de nas slar ldog par mthong ba'o //
translated: He sees himself turning back from there without being injured or harmed.

original: sa brgyad pa la ni phrag pa gnyis na ri dvags kyi rgyal po seng ge ral ba can cod pan thogs pa gcan gzan phra mo thams cad skrag par byed cing gnas par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la ni phrag pa gnyis na ri dvags kyi rgyal po seng ge ral ba can cod pan thogs pa gcan gzan phra mo thams cad skrag par byed cing gnas par mthong ba'o //
translated: On the eighth ground, he sees on his two shoulders the lion, the king of beasts, with a mane, wearing a crown, terrifying all the small animals.

original: sa dgu pa la ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por mthong ste skye bo bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mas yongs su bskor cing mdun gyis bltas te mgo bo'i steng na rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs pas spras pa'i gdugs dkar po 'dzin pa mthong
analyzed: sa dgu pa la ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por mthong ste skye bo bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mas yongs su bskor cing mdun gyis bltas te mgo bo'i steng na rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs pas spras pa'i gdugs dkar po 'dzin pa mthong
translated: On the ninth ground, he is seen as a universal monarch, surrounded by and attended by many hundreds of thousands of millions of beings, holding a white parasol adorned with various jewels above his head.

original: ba'o // sa bcu pa la ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mthong ste /
analyzed: ba'o // sa bcu pa la ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mthong ste /
translated: On the tenth ground, he is seen as the body of a tathāgata,

original: sku mdog gser lta bu 'od 'dom gang ba tshangs pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mas yongs su bskor cing mdun gyis bltas nas chos ston par mthong ngo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sku mdog gser lta bu 'od 'dom gang ba tshangs pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mas yongs su bskor cing mdun gyis bltas nas chos ston par mthong ngo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the color of gold, with a halo one fathom wide, surrounded by and attended by many hundreds of thousands of millions of Brahmās, teaching the Dharma.

original: 'di ni bdag gis 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas zhus pa theg pa chen po'i mdo las gsungs pa rnams bsdus te bkod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gis 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas zhus pa theg pa chen po'i mdo las gsungs pa rnams bsdus te bkod pa'o //
translated: This is a summary of what is stated in the noble Aksayamatinirdeśa Sūtra.

original: gang gis gnas skabs ma yin par mtshan ma 'di dag mthong bar gyur pa ni sngags kyi mthu'am /
analyzed: gang gis gnas skabs ma yin par mtshan ma 'di dag mthong bar gyur pa ni sngags kyi mthu'am /
translated: If you see these signs at the wrong time, it is due to the power of mantras or

original: bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this is the blessing of Mara.

original: sa 'di dag gi 'bras bu ni sangs rgyas kyis 'od byed pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: sa 'di dag gi 'bras bu ni sangs rgyas kyis 'od byed pa nyid yin la /
translated: The result of these stages is the Buddha stage of the Luminous.

original: de la gzhan du yang sa phyi ma phyi ma rnams ni de las snga ma snga mar gyur pa rnams kyi 'bras bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gzhan du yang sa phyi ma phyi ma rnams ni de las snga ma snga mar gyur pa rnams kyi 'bras bur rig par bya'o //
translated: And the latter stages are the results of the former ones.🔽Born from the sun, etc. means that, as the Sutra of the Great Utplillla says,

original: nyi ma la sogs pa las skyes pa dang zhes pa ni ji ltar mngon par 'byung ba'i mdo las nyi ma las skyes pa dang bu ram shing pa'i sngon byung ba 'phags pa mood gal gyi bus sh'akya rnams la bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: nyi ma la sogs pa las skyes pa dang zhes pa ni ji ltar mngon par 'byung ba'i mdo las nyi ma las skyes pa dang bu ram shing pa'i sngon byung ba 'phags pa mood gal gyi bus sh'akya rnams la bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: the noble Maudgalyayana explained to the Shakyas the former lives of the sun and sugar-cane.

original: ma'i mngal du ma btsas pas na dang po'i rigs btsun par grags pa'o //
analyzed: ma'i mngal du ma btsas pas na dang po'i rigs btsun par grags pa'o //
translated: They were born in the womb of a noble family, because they were not born from the womb.🔽Others assert that they were born with a body the color of the sun, gold, jewels, etc.

original: gzhan dag ni nyi ma dang gser dang nor bu la sogs pa'i 'od lta bu'i sku mdog can du skyes pa zhes 'dod cing de ltar byas nas /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni nyi ma dang gser dang nor bu la sogs pa'i 'od lta bu'i sku mdog can du skyes pa zhes 'dod cing de ltar byas nas /
translated: Thus,

original: khyod sku gser mdog 'od gsal ba'i //
analyzed: khyod sku gser mdog 'od gsal ba'i //
translated: Your body is the color of gold, shining with light,

original: tshad ni dmigs su ma mchis te //
analyzed: tshad ni dmigs su ma mchis te //
translated: Its measure is unobservable.🔽Its color is like a flash of lightning,

original: skad cig mdog gser btsod ka dang // myur bar shel 'od 'dra bar gda' //
analyzed: skad cig mdog gser btsod ka dang // myur bar shel 'od 'dra bar gda' //
translated: and its speed is like that of a crystal.

original: zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'i mdo'i tshig rnams kyang legs par drangs par @55a * //🔽'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa'i mdo'i tshig rnams kyang legs par drangs par @55a * // 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, the words of the scriptures are well cited.

original: smon lam shes pas gnas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: smon lam shes pas gnas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Abiding through knowledge of prayers.

original: da dung ngo bo nyid kyi byang chub chen po ma thob tu zin kyang smon lam gyi mthus ni dga' ldan gyi gnas nas babs pa la sogs pa'i mdzad pa bcu gnyis kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i sbyor ba shes pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: da dung ngo bo nyid kyi byang chub chen po ma thob tu zin kyang smon lam gyi mthus ni dga' ldan gyi gnas nas babs pa la sogs pa'i mdzad pa bcu gnyis kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i sbyor ba shes pas gnas pa'o //
translated: Even though one has not yet attained the essence of great enlightenment, through the power of prayers one abides through knowledge of the performance of the twelve deeds, such as descending from Tusita and so on, in order to fully and perfectly awaken.

original: de lta na 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i le'u las /
analyzed: de lta na 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i le'u las /
translated: Thus, the chapter on the ten levels states:

original: smon lam gyi mthus ni sa rab tu dga' ba la yang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar gsungs pas de dag kyang ji ltar na sangs rgyas kyi sar mi bgrang zhe na /
analyzed: smon lam gyi mthus ni sa rab tu dga' ba la yang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar gsungs pas de dag kyang ji ltar na sangs rgyas kyi sar mi bgrang zhe na /
translated: Through the power of prayers, one fully and perfectly awakens on the Joyful Ground.

original: de ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang sa de dang de'i mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ni rab tu nyung ba sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis brgya la sogs pas dman pa'i phyir 'di dang ga la zhig mnyam /
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang sa de dang de'i mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ni rab tu nyung ba sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis brgya la sogs pas dman pa'i phyir 'di dang ga la zhig mnyam /
translated: That is true, but still, the manifest perfect enlightenment of each level is very rare, since it is inferior to a hundred and so on, as previously explained.

original: gnyen po'i tshogs zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig logs na yod par rtog pa srid pa dgag pa'i phyir gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gnyis kho na gnyen po zhes bya ba 'di las
analyzed: gnyen po'i tshogs zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig logs na yod par rtog pa srid pa dgag pa'i phyir gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gnyis kho na gnyen po zhes bya ba 'di las
translated: The collection of antidotes refers to the collection of the path of seeing and the path of meditation alone, since it is possible that some may think that the antidote exists elsewhere and in order to refute that, the antidote to the negative tendencies of the concepts of apprehended objects and apprehending subjects is the path of seeing and the path of meditation alone.

original: gzhan ni 'dir mi btsal lo zhes bstan pa'i phyir bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis de bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan ni 'dir mi btsal lo zhes bstan pa'i phyir bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis de bstan to //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the antidote is not sought elsewhere, one verse is stated in this context.

original: de ltar sngar tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni bsgom pa'i lam du bstan pa yin na /
analyzed: de ltar sngar tshogs kyi sgrub pa ni bsgom pa'i lam du bstan pa yin na /
translated: Thus the practice of the accumulations was previously taught to be the path of meditation.

original: mthong ba'i lam 'dir ci zhig 'brel zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam 'dir ci zhig 'brel zhe na /
translated: What is its relation to this path of seeing?

original: de ltar sgrub pa bzhi lam bzhir bstan pa ni re zhig shas che ba'i dbang du byas kyi /
analyzed: de ltar sgrub pa bzhi lam bzhir bstan pa ni re zhig shas che ba'i dbang du byas kyi /
translated: Thus, the four practices are taught as the four paths, but this is from the point of view of their predominance.

original: de dag re re yang thams cad du mi 'gro ba ni ma yin pas na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de dag re re yang thams cad du mi 'gro ba ni ma yin pas na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault, since each of them is not absent from all the others.

original: gzhan dag ni 'dir gnyen por bgrang ba ni bsgom pa'i lam yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'dir gnyen por bgrang ba ni bsgom pa'i lam yin mod kyi /
translated: Others say: The four practices are counted as antidotes on the path of meditation.

original: mthong ba'i lam yang spyir gnyen po yin par zhar la bstan to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam yang spyir gnyen po yin par zhar la bstan to zhes zer ro //
translated: But the path of seeing is generally taught as an antidote by implication.

original: gnas skabs kyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni lam de dag la yang mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs na gnyen po'i ming thob kyi /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni lam de dag la yang mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs na gnyen po'i ming thob kyi /
translated: The difference in states means that when those paths are in the state of equipoise, they obtain the name antidote.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma brgyad pa lta bu ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la dmigs pa brgyad pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma brgyad pa lta bu ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la dmigs pa brgyad pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por mi 'gyur te /
translated: But the eighth moment of the path of seeing does not become an antidote to the conception of apprehendeds and apprehenders that is held by the eighth that focuses on conventional truths.

original: de ltar na 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sde'i zhal snga nas mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma brgyad pa la byang chub sems dpa'i dgongs pa mtha' yas mdzad pa @55b yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sde'i zhal snga nas mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma brgyad pa la byang chub sems dpa'i dgongs pa mtha' yas mdzad pa @55b yin te /
translated: Thus, the noble Vimuktasena says, “The eighth moment of the path of seeing is the performance of the infinite intention of the bodhisattva.

original: gzhan du na skad cig ma dgu pa la sems can gyi khams la ltos pa med pa'i 'gog par ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan du na skad cig ma dgu pa la sems can gyi khams la ltos pa med pa'i 'gog par ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Otherwise, in the ninth moment, he would fall into cessation, without regard for the realm of sentient beings.”

original: de bzhin du bsgom pa'i lam yang zag pa med pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas skabs kho na gnyen por gzhag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgom pa'i lam yang zag pa med pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas skabs kho na gnyen por gzhag go //
translated: Similarly, the path of cultivation is posited as the antidote in the stage of the accomplishment of the uncontaminated alone.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la /🔽ji skad bshad pa ni gnyen po'i tshogs kyi mthar thug pa'i gnas skabs dang po 'dir ji skad bshad pa rnams so //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la /🔽ji skad bshad pa ni gnyen po'i tshogs kyi mthar thug pa'i gnas skabs dang po 'dir ji skad bshad pa rnams so //
translated: With respect to the knowledge of all aspects as it has been explained, etc.🔽“As it has been explained” refers to the knowledge of all aspects as it has been explained in the context of the culmination of the collection of antidotes.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni bdun pa la sogs pa dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa ni 'di'i rgyu yin pas de skad ces bya zhing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni bdun pa la sogs pa dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa ni 'di'i rgyu yin pas de skad ces bya zhing /
translated: Omniscience is the cause of the seventh stage and so on, and the factors conducive to penetrative insight and so on, and so it is called that.

original: kha cig ni 'di nyid kyi dngos po ste sems bskyed pa bcu dgu pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni 'di nyid kyi dngos po ste sems bskyed pa bcu dgu pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Some are the entities of this stage, such as the nineteenth generation of the enlightenment mind.

original: de ltar de dag ma lus pa sngar sbyangs pa dang phyis 'thob pa la dmigs nas skad cig ma gcig gis 'byung bas na nges par 'byung ba ste tshul 'di ni rnam pa brgyad car la sbyar ro //🔽gzhan dag ni tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa yang yod /
analyzed: de ltar de dag ma lus pa sngar sbyangs pa dang phyis 'thob pa la dmigs nas skad cig ma gcig gis 'byung bas na nges par 'byung ba ste tshul 'di ni rnam pa brgyad car la sbyar ro // gzhan dag ni tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa yang yod /
translated: Thus, all of them are called the emergence of the single instant, since they focus on the prior training and subsequent attainment. This method is applied to all eight topics.🔽Others say that the statement in the sutra, “Venerable Śāriputra, there is also a mundane perfection of generosity,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yod ces bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo'i tshig gis ji skad bshad pa khungs su byas te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yod ces bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo'i tshig gis ji skad bshad pa khungs su byas te /
translated: and there is also a supramundane perfection of generosity,” and so on, is the source.

original: rnam pa de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is this called omniscience?

original: kha cig ni bden pa rnam pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i ye shes skad cig ma bcu drug gis bsdus par 'dod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni bden pa rnam pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i ye shes skad cig ma bcu drug gis bsdus par 'dod do //
translated: Some believe that it is comprised of the sixteen moments of intuitive wisdom which have the four noble truths for their object.

original: gzhan dag ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pas bsdus par 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pas bsdus par 'dod do //
translated: Others believe that it is comprised of the knowledge of all things as they are and as many as there are, in their aspects of being devoid of identity, unarisen, unceased, primordially peaceful, and naturally in a state of nirvāṇa.

original: kha cig ni sangs rgyas kyi sa 'dir ni gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis kyi char dbye ba med pas na mkhyen pa dang mi mkhyen pa dang / dag pa dang / bzang ba dang ; ngan cing mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i mkhyen pa kun rdzob pa mi mngar zin kyang /
analyzed: kha cig ni sangs rgyas kyi sa 'dir ni gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis kyi char dbye ba med pas na mkhyen pa dang mi mkhyen pa dang / dag pa dang / bzang ba dang ; ngan cing mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i mkhyen pa kun rdzob pa mi mngar zin kyang /
translated: Some believe that, since on this buddha ground there is no division into two parts, that of the counteragent and that of the counteracted, there is no conventional knowledge, such as knowledge of what is to be known and what is not to be known, of what is pure and what is impure, of what is good and what is evil, and so on.

original: yin bzhin gyi nor bu la sogs pa ltar mi rtog bzhin du 'gro ba rnams kyis mngon par 'dod pa 'grub pas na gzhan gyi shes pa'i snang ba'i dbang tsam las de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen par brjod @56a * //🔽do zhes zer te /
analyzed: yin bzhin gyi nor bu la sogs pa ltar mi rtog bzhin du 'gro ba rnams kyis mngon par 'dod pa 'grub pas na gzhan gyi shes pa'i snang ba'i dbang tsam las de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen par brjod @56a * // do zhes zer te /
translated: Therefore, it is called “omniscient” only in the sense of being the object of the cognition of others.

original: mkha' lding grub pa ji lta bur /🔽mchod sdong bsgrubs nas 'das gyur nas //
analyzed: mkha' lding grub pa ji lta bur / mchod sdong bsgrubs nas 'das gyur nas //
translated: Like the accomplishment of the garuḍa🔽when the worship-post is accomplished,

original: de 'das gyur nas //
analyzed: de 'das gyur nas //
translated: when it is accomplished,

original: de 'das yun ring long na yang //
analyzed: de 'das yun ring long na yang //
translated: even though a long time has passed,

original: dug la sogs pa sel ba ltar //
analyzed: dug la sogs pa sel ba ltar //
translated: like the removal of poison, etc.,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra bar byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra bar byed do //
translated: this is what they say.

original: yang gzhan dag ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya dang bag chags kyi sgrib pa ma lus pa spangs pas na /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya dang bag chags kyi sgrib pa ma lus pa spangs pas na /
translated: Others say that it is the removal of all the afflictive obstructions, the obstructions to omniscience, and the obstructions of the propensities.

original: mi shes pa dang bral ba'i thob pa'i 'bras bu lag mthil gyi shing tog ltar ma lus pa sgyu ma ltar bkra ba'i ye shes rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni sgra ji bzhin par nges par khas blang ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mi shes pa dang bral ba'i thob pa'i 'bras bu lag mthil gyi shing tog ltar ma lus pa sgyu ma ltar bkra ba'i ye shes rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni sgra ji bzhin par nges par khas blang ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: The result of obtaining freedom from ignorance is like a fruit in the palm of the hand. The wisdom that knows all aspects, like an illusion, is to be accepted literally.

original: yang gzhan dag ni shes bya'i mchog ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid yon te de'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag ni shes bya'i mchog ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid yon te de'i dbang du byas te /
translated: Others say: The supreme object of knowledge is foundation consciousness itself.

original: zhes bya'i gnas dang mtshan nyid la sogs pa bcu mkhyen pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'o zhes gsungs par 'dod do //
analyzed: zhes bya'i gnas dang mtshan nyid la sogs pa bcu mkhyen pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'o zhes gsungs par 'dod do //
translated: They assert that the ten topics, such as the basis of characteristics, are taught because the Buddha knows them.

original: 'dir yang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la snang ba dang bcas pa'i ye shes de mnga'am ci ste ma yin zhes pa las gyur par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la snang ba dang bcas pa'i ye shes de mnga'am ci ste ma yin zhes pa las gyur par shes par bya ste /
translated: Here, it should be understood that the question arises: Does the perfect Buddha possess that wisdom that is accompanied by appearance or not?

original: kha cig ni snang ba dang bcas pa'i ye shes de mnga' bar gyur pa'i tshe gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i nyes par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: kha cig ni snang ba dang bcas pa'i ye shes de mnga' bar gyur pa'i tshe gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i nyes par 'gyur bas na /
translated: Some say: When he possesses that wisdom that is accompanied by appearance, he would possess the faults of object and subject.

original: ye shes rnam pa med pa kun rdzob pa tsam zhig ni rang rig par 'gyur ba ste 'di tsam zhig go zhes sngar bstan pa'i phyogs gsum pa 'dod do //
analyzed: ye shes rnam pa med pa kun rdzob pa tsam zhig ni rang rig par 'gyur ba ste 'di tsam zhig go zhes sngar bstan pa'i phyogs gsum pa 'dod do //
translated: The third position is that the mere conventional, non-aspected intuition is reflexive intuition.

original: gzhan dag ni bskal pa du mar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa brdzun pa'i ngo bo nyid du goms par gyur pa de la snang ba rnams gzung ba dang 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur te ji skad du //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni bskal pa du mar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa brdzun pa'i ngo bo nyid du goms par gyur pa de la snang ba rnams gzung ba dang 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur te ji skad du //
translated: Others say: How can the appearances be the apprehended object and apprehending subject for one who has become accustomed to the falsity of the apprehended object and apprehending subject for many eons?🔽As it is said:

original: 'di ltar mthong dang thos pa ku //
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong dang thos pa ku //
translated: Thus, what is seen and heard

original: 'di la dgag par bya med kyi //🔽gang phyir sdug bsngal rgyur 'gyur ba //
analyzed: 'di la dgag par bya med kyi // gang phyir sdug bsngal rgyur 'gyur ba //
translated: is not to be denied here.🔽But the conception of reality

original: bden pa nyid du rtog pa bzlog / ces bshad pas na /
analyzed: bden pa nyid du rtog pa bzlog / ces bshad pas na /
translated: is to be stopped, since it is the cause of suffering.

original: nges bar snang ba dang bcas pa'i ye shes med na ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen par brjod ces zer ro //
analyzed: nges bar snang ba dang bcas pa'i ye shes med na ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen par brjod ces zer ro //
translated: Thus, if there is no intuition with appearance, how can one speak of omniscience?

original: la la ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba tsam la dmigs nas brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin du yod ces 'dod pas phyogs gzhan dag tu gyur ba'o //
analyzed: la la ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba tsam la dmigs nas brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin du yod ces 'dod pas phyogs gzhan dag tu gyur ba'o //
translated: Some, observing mere natural luminosity, assert that it exists as the nature of the inexpressible.

original: ha cang spros pas ci zhig bya ste 'di ni nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: ha cang spros pas ci zhig bya ste 'di ni nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: What is the use of too much elaboration? This is the summary.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa lhur blang bar bya ste dang bo ni sems bskyed pa las mngon par shes pa la sogs pa lnga bstan ta /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa lhur blang bar bya ste dang bo ni sems bskyed pa las mngon par shes pa la sogs pa lnga bstan ta /
translated: One should strive in the practice of renunciation. First, the five such as superknowledge are taught from the generation of the mind.

original: de nas ni @56b 'dir bsgrub pa rnams pa brgyad do //
analyzed: de nas ni @56b 'dir bsgrub pa rnams pa brgyad do //
translated: Then, here, there are eight types of practice.

original: de nas ni skabs bzhi par rnam pa dag gi nang du spong ba'i lam ste ma lus par spong zhes bya ba'i don bsdu'o //
analyzed: de nas ni skabs bzhi par rnam pa dag gi nang du spong ba'i lam ste ma lus par spong zhes bya ba'i don bsdu'o //
translated: Then, in the fourth chapter, the path of abandonment is included in the aspects. The meaning of abandonment without remainder is summarized.

original: de nas ni skabs lnga bar dmigs pa dang dbang dang rnam pa dang log par rtog pa rnams kyis lhur blangs te bstan to //
analyzed: de nas ni skabs lnga bar dmigs pa dang dbang dang rnam pa dang log par rtog pa rnams kyis lhur blangs te bstan to //
translated: Then, in the fifth chapter, it is taught by striving in the objective support, power, aspects, and wrong conceptions.

original: de nas ni skabs bdun par mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhir phye ste brjod do //
analyzed: de nas ni skabs bdun par mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhir phye ste brjod do //
translated: Then, in the seventh chapter, it is expressed by dividing the characteristics into four types.

original: de nas ni yang skabs brgyad par chos kyi sku'i phrin las nyi shu rtsa bdun las /
analyzed: de nas ni yang skabs brgyad par chos kyi sku'i phrin las nyi shu rtsa bdun las /
translated: Then, in the eighth chapter, the activities of the body of truth are shown by eight topics:

original: byang chub yan lag las rnams ni //
analyzed: byang chub yan lag las rnams ni //
translated: The activities of the branches of enlightenment🔽Are nonwastage, seeing the truth,🔽Abandoning error, and its basis,

original: chud mi za dang bden mthong dang // phyin ci log ni spong ba dang // de gzhi med pa'i tshil dang ni //🔽rnam par byad dang tshogs dang ni //
analyzed: chud mi za dang bden mthong dang // phyin ci log ni spong ba dang // de gzhi med pa'i tshil dang ni // rnam par byad dang tshogs dang ni //
translated: And the branches of enlightenment🔽Are the path, the result,

original: 'dus byas 'dus ma byas pa la //
analyzed: 'dus byas 'dus ma byas pa la //
translated: And the basis of the path.

original: tha dad yongs su mi shes dang // zhes rnam pa brgyad kyis bstan te /
analyzed: tha dad yongs su mi shes dang // zhes rnam pa brgyad kyis bstan te /
translated: The activities of the branches of enlightenment are shown by eight topics:

original: 'di dag so so dang bsdus pas khong du chud par bya ba ni 'dir man ngag go //🔽thams cad mi dmigs pa nyid las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos gzhan med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin kho nas yongs su sbyong bar byed ces sam /
analyzed: 'di dag so so dang bsdus pas khong du chud par bya ba ni 'dir man ngag go // thams cad mi dmigs pa nyid las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos gzhan med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin kho nas yongs su sbyong bar byed ces sam /
translated: The understanding of these individually and collectively is the instruction here.

original: de ltar byos shig ces tshig zur gyis na gdams pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar byos shig ces tshig zur gyis na gdams pa ste /
translated: Because there is no other phenomenon superior to the very observation of nonobservation, one should purify by the very nature of nonobservation, or one should do it that way, is the indirect instruction.

original: tshig 'di ni byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba ril la sbyar bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig 'di ni byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba ril la sbyar bar shes par bya'o //
translated: This statement should be understood as applying to all that has happened and will happen.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sngar bstan to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sngar bstan to //
translated: The perfection of wisdom has been taught above.

original: man ngag gi bstan bcos zhes bya ba ni shes par byed pa'i yul myur du khong du chud par byed pa'i gzhung lugs so //
analyzed: man ngag gi bstan bcos zhes bya ba ni shes par byed pa'i yul myur du khong du chud par byed pa'i gzhung lugs so //
translated: The treatise that teaches the instructions is the scriptural system that causes the object to be known to be quickly understood.

original: aa bhi ni mngon du phyogs pas so //
analyzed: aa bhi ni mngon du phyogs pas so //
translated: Abhisamaya means to approach.

original: sam zhes bya ba ni yang dag par nges pa nyid du brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sam zhes bya ba ni yang dag par nges pa nyid du brjod pa'o //
translated: Sam means to express just as it is.

original: ai ya ni 'gro ba'i don to //
analyzed: ai ya ni 'gro ba'i don to //
translated: Aya means the meaning of going.

original: des na mngon du phyogs pas yang dag pa ji lta bar nges par 'gro bas ye shes rtogs pa'i lam 'di ni mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: des na mngon du phyogs pas yang dag pa ji lta bar nges par 'gro bas ye shes rtogs pa'i lam 'di ni mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this path of the realization of wisdom is an abhisamaya, because it approaches and goes just as it is, to the ascertainment of reality.

original: gzhan dag ni mngon du phyogs par gyur na dus ji lta ba bzhin du de las mi 'da' bar 'bras bu 'byin pas na mngon du phyogs pa'i dus can zhes 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni mngon du phyogs par gyur na dus ji lta ba bzhin du de las mi 'da' bar 'bras bu 'byin pas na mngon du phyogs pa'i dus can zhes 'chad par byed do //
translated: Others explain that it is called an abhisamaya because it produces its result at the proper time, once it has approached.

original: rgyan gyi don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: rgyan gyi don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of ornament has been explained.

original: skabs ni le'u zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skabs ni le'u zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word chapter means section.

original: dang po ni gnyis pa la ltos pa'am /
analyzed: dang po ni gnyis pa la ltos pa'am /
translated: The first is in relation to the second,

original: yang na mchog gi don te /
analyzed: yang na mchog gi don te /
translated: or it has the meaning of supreme,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni skabs ma lus pa'i lus yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni skabs ma lus pa'i lus yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the knowledge of all aspects is the body of the entire section.

original: 'grel pa zhes bya ba ni don tsam @57a * //
analyzed: 'grel pa zhes bya ba ni don tsam @57a * //
translated: The word commentary means just the meaning.

original: gyi'o ; / skabs dang po'i 'grel bshad rdzogs so /
analyzed: gyi'o ; / skabs dang po'i 'grel bshad rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the first chapter is complete.

original: // / de ltar skabs dang po'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnams rnam par bkrol nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar skabs dang po'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnams rnam par bkrol nas /
translated: Having thus explained the verses of the first chapter,

original: da ni skabs gnyis pa dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni skabs gnyis pa dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain the second chapter,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs pa ni lam shes pa nyid med na med pas lam shes pa nyid gsungs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs pa ni lam shes pa nyid med na med pas lam shes pa nyid gsungs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said that the realization of omniscience itself is not without the knowledge of the path, so the knowledge of the path is taught, and so on.

original: lam shes pa nyid ni de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid ni de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The knowledge of the path is intended as its cause.

original: nga rgyal bcom pa'i rgyud kho na la skye'o zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nga rgyal bcom pa'i rgyud kho na la skye'o zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to understand that it arises only in the continuum of one who has destroyed pride, it is said:

original: 'dir nga rgyal dang zhum pa gnyi ga bsal ba la lam skye'i gang yang rung ba cig dang ldan pa la ma yin pa ni mngon par 'byung ba'i mdo las rgyal po zas gtsang ma'i lam ji ltar bskyed pa'i dbang du byas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dir nga rgyal dang zhum pa gnyi ga bsal ba la lam skye'i gang yang rung ba cig dang ldan pa la ma yin pa ni mngon par 'byung ba'i mdo las rgyal po zas gtsang ma'i lam ji ltar bskyed pa'i dbang du byas pa lta bu'o //
translated: Here, the removal of both pride and depression is in accordance with the path of any of the four noble truths.

original: 'dir lha rnams zhum pa med cing nga rgyal dang ldan bas de spang bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir lha rnams zhum pa med cing nga rgyal dang ldan bas de spang bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: Here, the gods are without depression and have pride, so he removes those.🔽The word “here” means in the sutra.

original: tshig zur gyis rten brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo las zhes bya ba'i don te /🔽tshig le'ur byas pa las ni //
analyzed: tshig zur gyis rten brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo las zhes bya ba'i don te / tshig le'ur byas pa las ni //
translated: In the verse it says:

original: lha rnams rung bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lha rnams rung bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to make the gods suitable

original: zhes smos pas dngos kho nar bstan to //
analyzed: zhes smos pas dngos kho nar bstan to //
translated: It is taught explicitly.

original: mdo las ni dngos su bcom ldan 'das kyis mthu che ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa bcu las 'od bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan cing zur gyis rten bstan pa'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: mdo las ni dngos su bcom ldan 'das kyis mthu che ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa bcu las 'od bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan cing zur gyis rten bstan pa'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: In the sutra, the Bhagavān explicitly teaches the inconceivable light from among the ten inconceivable great powers, and implicitly teaches the basis.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni zhi ba'i dbyings nas langs te'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni zhi ba'i dbyings nas langs te'o //
translated: The noble listeners and solitary realizers who are free from attachment arise from the basic space of peace.

original: cig shos byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni da lta nyid nas so //
analyzed: cig shos byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni da lta nyid nas so //
translated: The other, the bodhisattvas, do so right now.🔽Since they have not completely eliminated the afflictions,

original: nyon mongs pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni dngos su'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni dngos su'o //
translated: the bodhisattvas do so directly.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub tu thugs bskyed pa las 'khrungs pa rnams kyang sh'akya'i bu mi mo 'tsho ma bdag gir mdzad pa la sogs pa'i thabs la mkhas pas 'gro ba'i don du nyon mongs pa ma spangs ba lta bur ston pas na 'di 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub tu thugs bskyed pa las 'khrungs pa rnams kyang sh'akya'i bu mi mo 'tsho ma bdag gir mdzad pa la sogs pa'i thabs la mkhas pas 'gro ba'i don du nyon mongs pa ma spangs ba lta bur ston pas na 'di 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are born from the buddhas’ generation of the mind of awakening also demonstrate, through their skillful means, such things as the Śākya girl Gopā taking them as her husband, that they have not eliminated the afflictions for the sake of beings.

original: byang chub sems de ltar yongs su shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ched du'am 'di logs su bsgom pa'i 'thad pa ni mi dgos kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems de ltar yongs su shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ched du'am 'di logs su bsgom pa'i 'thad pa ni mi dgos kyi /
translated: This is how the bodhisattvas’ awakening mind should be understood.

original: rang gi lam la de dag gi yon tan rdzogs par shes par bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: rang gi lam la de dag gi yon tan rdzogs par shes par bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that one should understand that those qualities are perfected on one's own path.

original: sh'a ri'i bu nyan @57b thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi shes pa dang spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'o zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu nyan @57b thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi shes pa dang spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'o zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Sariputra, whatever is the knowledge and abandonment of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, that is the great bodhisattva's obtainment of forbearance for the non-arising of dharmas.

original: de la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa yang gnyis te /
analyzed: de la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa yang gnyis te /
translated: Therein, the obtainment of forbearance for the non-arising of dharmas is also twofold:

original: chog par 'dzin pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa dang sa mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: chog par 'dzin pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa dang sa mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: the non-conceptuality of contentedness and the immovable stage.🔽The reason for this is that the bodhisattvas have not seen the truth of the ultimate, and the buddhas have seen it.

original: tshad mar gyur ba'i skyes bus ma gzigs pa'i rgyu 'thad pa dag gis zhes bya ba 'dis ni lung gi tshad ma ston te /
analyzed: tshad mar gyur ba'i skyes bus ma gzigs pa'i rgyu 'thad pa dag gis zhes bya ba 'dis ni lung gi tshad ma ston te /
translated: The words, by means of the reasons that are not seen by the person who is the valid cognition, indicate the valid cognition of scriptural tradition.

original: nga byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pas ni chos gang yang skye ba'am 'gag pa ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis so //
analyzed: nga byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pas ni chos gang yang skye ba'am 'gag pa ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis so //
translated: The passage, When I was seated at the site of enlightenment, I did not see any dharma that arose or ceased, and so on, indicates the valid cognition of scriptural tradition.

original: bden pa'i dmigs pa la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa skye'i zhes bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar skyes bu la bsnun pa'i mtshon cha ni dang por go cha phugs nas de'i 'og tu 'dod pa'i skyes bu la phigs pa'i dpes so
analyzed: bden pa'i dmigs pa la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa skye'i zhes bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar skyes bu la bsnun pa'i mtshon cha ni dang por go cha phugs nas de'i 'og tu 'dod pa'i skyes bu la phigs pa'i dpes so
translated: The factor conducive to penetrative insight arises from observing the four noble truths.

original: // lung las nyan thos rnams ni gzhan gyis bstan pa la ltos nas rang gi byang chub rtogs par 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni /🔽ji skad du 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las /
analyzed: // lung las nyan thos rnams ni gzhan gyis bstan pa la ltos nas rang gi byang chub rtogs par 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni / ji skad du 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las /
translated: The factor conducive to penetrative insight arises from observing the four noble truths.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi rnam grol sgra phyir 'gro //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi rnam grol sgra phyir 'gro // zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: The factor conducive to penetrative insight arises from observing the four noble truths.🔽The factor conducive to penetrative insight arises from observing the four noble truths.🔽The factor conducive to penetrative insight arises from observing the four noble truths.🔽The factor conducive to penetrative insight arises from observing the four noble truths.🔽The factor conducive to penetrative insight arises from observing the four noble truths.🔽The factor conducive to penetrative insight arises from observing the four noble truths.🔽The factor conducive to penetrative insight arises from observing the four noble truths.🔽The factor conducive to penetrative insight arises from observing the four noble truths.🔽The factor conducive to penetrative insight arises from observing the four noble truths.🔽The factor conducive to penetrative insight arises from observing the four noble truths.🔽The factor conducive to penetrative insight arises from observing the four noble truths.🔽The factor conducive to penetrative insight arises from observing the four noble truths.🔽The factor conducive to penetrative insight arises from observing the four noble truths.

original: don 'di nyid kyi dbang gis slob ma zhes 'di dag brjod de nges par slob dpon dgos pas so //
analyzed: don 'di nyid kyi dbang gis slob ma zhes 'di dag brjod de nges par slob dpon dgos pas so //
translated: The factor conducive to penetrative insight arises from observing the four noble truths.

original: gzhan dag kyang brjod pa dang bcas pa'i chos bstan pas dge ba la 'jug par byed do zhes 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'di dag thos pa sgrogs par byed pas na thos sgrogs so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang brjod pa dang bcas pa'i chos bstan pas dge ba la 'jug par byed do zhes 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'di dag thos pa sgrogs par byed pas na thos sgrogs so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: They are called “those who proclaim what they have heard” because they proclaim what they have heard.

original: sngon zhes bya ba ni bskal pa brgya'i bar du ste //🔽bse ru bskal pa brgya yin rgyus //
analyzed: sngon zhes bya ba ni bskal pa brgya'i bar du ste // bse ru bskal pa brgya yin rgyus //
translated: “Previously” means up to a hundred eons.

original: zhes bshad pas so //
analyzed: zhes bshad pas so //
translated: Because it is explained that the rhinoceros horn is one hundred eons.

original: rang gis byang chub rtogs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rkyen gyi mthus te rang rgyal ba rnams ni rkyen gyi 'du shes can zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: rang gis byang chub rtogs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rkyen gyi mthus te rang rgyal ba rnams ni rkyen gyi 'du shes can zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: “They realize enlightenment by themselves” means through the power of conditions. Because it is said that pratyekabuddhas have the notion of conditions.

original: spang pa ni gzung ba'i rnam par gyur ba phyi rol gyi yul rnams rang bzhin med par shes pa ni med dang chu la sogs pa yang dang yang du 'jig pas rtogs par sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spang pa ni gzung ba'i rnam par gyur ba phyi rol gyi yul rnams rang bzhin med par shes pa ni med dang chu la sogs pa yang dang yang du 'jig pas rtogs par sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Elimination” is the transformation of the apprehended. The realization that external objects lack intrinsic nature is easier because things like water and so on are destroyed again and again.

original: 'di tsam las ni chos kyi phyogs gcig la bdag med par rtogs par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di tsam las ni chos kyi phyogs gcig la bdag med par rtogs par bstan to //
translated: This much teaches the realization of selflessness in one part of phenomena.

original: btags pa'i chos nyid mi 'gal bar rab tu ston pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar btags pa yang chos kyi dbyings las rab tu ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //🔽tshigs le'ur byas pa'i don nye bar @58a * //
analyzed: btags pa'i chos nyid mi 'gal bar rab tu ston pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar btags pa yang chos kyi dbyings las rab tu ma 'das pa'i phyir ro // tshigs le'ur byas pa'i don nye bar @58a * //
translated: The phrase “the non-contradictory teaching of the reality of the imputed” means that, because the way things are imputed does not go beyond the dharma-dhātu.

original: mtshon pa lhur len pa'i gzhung gis zhes bya ba ni de las de dag rnam pa'o zhes ma smos kyi /🔽lam shes nyid kyis skad cig ma //
analyzed: mtshon pa lhur len pa'i gzhung gis zhes bya ba ni de las de dag rnam pa'o zhes ma smos kyi / lam shes nyid kyis skad cig ma //
translated: The phrase “the text that is intent on the illustration of the meaning of the verses” means that, although the verses do not say “those are the aspects,”

original: zhes smos pas na /
analyzed: zhes smos pas na /
translated: the prose commentary says, “The path knowledge itself is momentary.”

original: mthong ba'i lam de la rnam pa ji snyed yod pa'i don ni ma bshad kyi //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam de la rnam pa ji snyed yod pa'i don ni ma bshad kyi //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the number of aspects that exist on the path of seeing is not explained.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bcu drug tshig le'ur byas par nye bar mtshon pa nyi tsher mdzad par zad de /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bcu drug tshig le'ur byas par nye bar mtshon pa nyi tsher mdzad par zad de /
translated: The prose commentary only illustrates the sixteen moments of the path of seeing in the verses.

original: rnam pa'i dbye ba ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs pa'i skabs su ston pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems te /
analyzed: rnam pa'i dbye ba ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs pa'i skabs su ston pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems te /
translated: The classification of the aspects will be taught in the section on the complete realization of all aspects.

original: bshad pa ni sngar /
analyzed: bshad pa ni sngar /
translated: The explanation is as follows.

original: dmigs pa dang ni rnam pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ni rnam pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “the object and the aspect” and so on.

original: ma bshad pa ni 'og nyid nas //
analyzed: ma bshad pa ni 'og nyid nas //
translated: The unexpressed are those explained below.

original: gzugs rtag ma yin mi rtag min //
analyzed: gzugs rtag ma yin mi rtag min //
translated: Form is not permanent, nor is it impermanent.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'chad pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'chad pa rnams so //
translated: The explanations such as these are unexpressed.

original: de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes pa ni skad cig ma'i don tsam du shes par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes pa ni skad cig ma'i don tsam du shes par bya'o zhes so //
translated: The phrase “should be viewed in the same way” means that one should understand them to be mere momentary objects.

original: bsgom pa'i go rims la sogs pa ma bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i go rims la sogs pa ma bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because the order of meditation and so on are not taught.

original: gal te de dag zer pa ltar skad cig ma'i khyad par tsam du zad na de'i tshe mthong ba'i lam rim gyis bsgom pa'i rim pa ye ma bstan par 'gyur ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras bsdus pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i dus na yid la
analyzed: gal te de dag zer pa ltar skad cig ma'i khyad par tsam du zad na de'i tshe mthong ba'i lam rim gyis bsgom pa'i rim pa ye ma bstan par 'gyur ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras bsdus pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i dus na yid la
translated: If they were mere distinctions of momentariness as they claim, then the order of meditation on the path of seeing would not be taught at all, and so on. The word “and so on” includes the order of mental attention

original: bya ba'i rim pa yang ma bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba'i rim pa yang ma bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that is not taught in the context of equipoise.

original: skyon gzhan yang /
analyzed: skyon gzhan yang /
translated: Another fault is this.

original: dmigs pa dang ni rnam pa dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni dngos su yang khyed kyi de lung dang 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ni rnam pa dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni dngos su yang khyed kyi de lung dang 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase “with respect to object, aspect, and so on” means that your theory is also directly contradicted by scripture.

original: de ltar na 'di ni rnam par rig pa bcu drug dang che 'bring yin gyi skad cig gi chos ni ma yin no //🔽gdul bya brjed par bya ba nyung ba nyid dang zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam 'di 'byed pa'i rgyu gang yin zhes rtsod pas mang du smra ba dgag pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni rnam par rig pa bcu drug dang che 'bring yin gyi skad cig gi chos ni ma yin no // gdul bya brjed par bya ba nyung ba nyid dang zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam 'di 'byed pa'i rgyu gang yin zhes rtsod pas mang du smra ba dgag pa'am /
translated: Thus, this path of cultivation is distinguished in terms of the sixteen moments of understanding, but not in terms of the moments of the path.🔽The phrase “the disciples are few who can be taught to forget what is to be forgotten” is a response to the objection that the path of cultivation is distinguished in terms of the causes of differentiation. It is a response that rejects the objection by saying that the path of cultivation is not distinguished in terms of the causes of differentiation.

original: gdul bya gang dag lam 'di'i byed rgyu la gnas par brjod du rung ba de dag ni ches nyung ste rab tu dkon no zhes bstan pas lam 'di rnyed dka' bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya gang dag lam 'di'i byed rgyu la gnas par brjod du rung ba de dag ni ches nyung ste rab tu dkon no zhes bstan pas lam 'di rnyed dka' bar bstan pa'o //
translated: Or, it is a response that teaches that the path of cultivation is difficult to attain because it teaches that the disciples who are fit to be taught the causes of the path are very few, that is, rare.

original: yang gdul bya rnams 'bras bu la gzhol bar shugs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ste bsgom pa'i lam gang yin pa la mos pha yid la byed pa la sogs pas der gzhol ba nyid du zhugs par bya ba'i phyir ni dang por byed
analyzed: yang gdul bya rnams 'bras bu la gzhol bar shugs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ste bsgom pa'i lam gang yin pa la mos pha yid la byed pa la sogs pas der gzhol ba nyid du zhugs par bya ba'i phyir ni dang por byed
translated: Again, in order to engage disciples in the result,🔽the result is the path of meditation. In order to engage in that path, one engages in the mental contemplation of aspiration and so on.🔽

original: pa drug po 'di dag der gzhol zhing 'jug par bya'o zhes lam du skye ba'i rgyu bstan pas de dag la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: pa drug po 'di dag der gzhol zhing 'jug par bya'o zhes lam du skye ba'i rgyu bstan pas de dag la gdams pa'o //
translated: Again, in order to impel disciples to the result, that is, in order to impel them to the path of cultivation through attention that is devoted to the result, these six are taught as the cause of generation on the path.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i @58b bye brag ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang de dang bral ba gtsor gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i @58b bye brag ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang de dang bral ba gtsor gyur ba'o //
translated: The distinction between that with and without impurity is primarily the presence or absence of conceptualization.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni mos pa dang bsngo ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa dag ni dag pa 'jig rten pa'i gnas skabs rjes kyi ye shes kyis sbyor ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni mos pa dang bsngo ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa dag ni dag pa 'jig rten pa'i gnas skabs rjes kyi ye shes kyis sbyor ba yin la /
translated: Here, the summarized meaning is as follows: The mental attentions of devotion, dedication, and rejoicing are the subsequent knowledge that is the occasion of the pure mundane state.

original: mngon par bsgrub pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Accomplishment is the wisdom of meditative equipoise.

original: de dag kyang nyan thos la sogs pa la yang ci rigs su ldan pas khyad par can du bsgrub pa ni rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang nyan thos la sogs pa la yang ci rigs su ldan pas khyad par can du bsgrub pa ni rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Since these are possessed by śrāvakas and so on, as is appropriate, the purification is the accomplishment of the distinctive.

original: gzhan dag gis ni sa dri ma med pa nas ji srid sa bdun pa'i bar du ni bsgom pa'i lam zag pa dang bcas pa rnams yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni sa dri ma med pa nas ji srid sa bdun pa'i bar du ni bsgom pa'i lam zag pa dang bcas pa rnams yin la /
translated: Others say: From the stainless stage up to the seventh stage, it is the contaminated path of meditation.

original: sa brgyad pa la sogs par ni mngon par bsgrub pa'i bsgom pa'i lam yin te /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la sogs par ni mngon par bsgrub pa'i bsgom pa'i lam yin te /
translated: On the eighth stage and so on, it is the path of meditation that is accomplished.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po bsgom pa'i lam thams cad pa dkyus ma gang yin pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po bsgom pa'i lam thams cad pa dkyus ma gang yin pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba las /
translated: The path of meditation that is the antidote to the class of affliction is the ordinary path of meditation that is explained in the future.🔽It is asserted to be ninefold

original: de ni rgyun chags yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni rgyun chags yin pa'i phyir //
translated: because it is continuous,🔽small, medium, great,

original: chung dang 'bring dang chen po dang / chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yis ;🔽/ de ni rnam pa dgur bzhed do //🔽zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang chen po dang / chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yis ;🔽/ de ni rnam pa dgur bzhed do //🔽zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: small-small and so on.

original: rnam par dag pa ni dngos su na bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dus mngon sum pa dang ring bdag gi bye brag bshad par zad do //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ni dngos su na bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dus mngon sum pa dang ring bdag gi bye brag bshad par zad do //
translated: Purity is the result of the path of cultivation, and is direct realization of the time of cause and effect, and is distinguished as proximate and remote.

original: de ltar ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi yan lag tu gtogs pa bstan cing rnam pa la sogs pa ni gzhan du bstan to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi yan lag tu gtogs pa bstan cing rnam pa la sogs pa ni gzhan du bstan to zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, the limbs of the path of cultivation are explained, and the aspects, etc. are explained elsewhere.

original: de dag ji ltar yang rung ste sa re re la yang rnam pa dgu dgur ni brjod do //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar yang rung ste sa re re la yang rnam pa dgu dgur ni brjod do //
translated: They are said to be ninefold for each stage, in whatever way.

original: mos pa rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun no zhes bya ba la 'dir mos pa'i rgyu ni lung rnam par dag pa dang rigs pa ni lta ba'o //
analyzed: mos pa rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun no zhes bya ba la 'dir mos pa'i rgyu ni lung rnam par dag pa dang rigs pa ni lta ba'o //
translated: There are twenty-seven kinds of resolve. Here, the cause of resolve is pure scripture, and reasoning is view.

original: 'di'i ngo bo nyid ni nges par byas pa'i dngos po la de kho na ltar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i ngo bo nyid ni nges par byas pa'i dngos po la de kho na ltar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Its nature is to grasp an ascertained thing just as it is.

original: 'di las the tshom zlog pa ste mos pa dang ldan pa ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las gzhan gyis 'phrog par mi nus pas so //
analyzed: 'di las the tshom zlog pa ste mos pa dang ldan pa ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las gzhan gyis 'phrog par mi nus pas so //
translated: It is the reversal of doubt from this, because one who has resolve cannot be led away from one's own tenets by others.

original: rnam par dbye ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is its classification?

original: rang nyid kyi don du yum la mos pa dang / gzhan gyi don du dang / gnyi ga'i don du yum 'di la rab tu mos pa ste ;
analyzed: rang nyid kyi don du yum la mos pa dang / gzhan gyi don du dang / gnyi ga'i don du yum 'di la rab tu mos pa ste ;
translated: One has deep interest in the Mother for one's own benefit, for the benefit of others and for the benefit of both.

original: dang po ni 'di ltar 'gro ba ni bdag bde ba 'dod ces gsungs pa'i tshul gyis na /
analyzed: dang po ni 'di ltar 'gro ba ni bdag bde ba 'dod ces gsungs pa'i tshul gyis na /
translated: The first is as follows. Since beings are said to desire happiness,

original: rang gi ched du 'bad pa med par 'byung ste /
analyzed: rang gi ched du 'bad pa med par 'byung ste /
translated: it occurs effortlessly for one's own sake.

original: 'khor ba thog ma med nas rab tu go mas pas so //🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dang por sems de byung ba na rang dang gzhan mnyam pa'am /
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma med nas rab tu go mas pas so // byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dang por sems de byung ba na rang dang gzhan mnyam pa'am /
translated: Since samsara has been going on since beginningless time, it is very familiar.

original: @59a * // rang dang gzhan du brje ba'i tshul gyis gnyen po sems can mgu bar bya ba'i rim pa dran pa la sogs pas rang gi don du dmigs pa bzlog ste /
analyzed: @59a * // rang dang gzhan du brje ba'i tshul gyis gnyen po sems can mgu bar bya ba'i rim pa dran pa la sogs pas rang gi don du dmigs pa bzlog ste /
translated: When bodhisattvas first give rise to this mind, they recall the stages of pleasing sentient beings, the antidote to the focus on one's own welfare, through the equality of oneself and others or the method of exchanging oneself and others.

original: de nyid gzhan gyi phyir sbyor bar byed la de'i yang phyi ma'i sems la ni dngos po'i stobs kyis mgul nas sprel ba ltar rang dang gzhan gnyi ga'i don 'grub par shes pa nges pa can skye'i snga ma ltar re re zhig la zhe na ba ni med
analyzed: de nyid gzhan gyi phyir sbyor bar byed la de'i yang phyi ma'i sems la ni dngos po'i stobs kyis mgul nas sprel ba ltar rang dang gzhan gnyi ga'i don 'grub par shes pa nges pa can skye'i snga ma ltar re re zhig la zhe na ba ni med
translated: He applies himself to the benefit of others, and he generates the certain knowledge that the benefit of both self and other is accomplished, as if bound to his neck by the power of fact, with regard to the future mind of the other, but not as before, with regard to each individually, because he is not attached.

original: pas so // kha cig ni 'dir rang gi don dus ring du song ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: pas so // kha cig ni 'dir rang gi don dus ring du song ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Some say: Here, the benefit of self is for a long time,

original: sa mi g-yo ba nas brtsams te ni gzhan gyi don te sa de la rang gi don du rab tu zhi ba la gnas pa las gzhan gyi don kho nar slar rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis bslang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa mi g-yo ba nas brtsams te ni gzhan gyi don te sa de la rang gi don du rab tu zhi ba la gnas pa las gzhan gyi don kho nar slar rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis bslang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: but the benefit of others begins from the Immovable stage, because on that stage, he is roused from his abiding in peace for his own benefit, only for the benefit of others, by the perfect Buddhas.

original: sa bcu pa la ni rang dang gzhan gnyi ga'i don te sa 'di la gnas pa ni rgyu mtshan 'di la gnas pa ni rgyu mtshan 'dis na sangs rgyas zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la ni rang dang gzhan gnyi ga'i don te sa 'di la gnas pa ni rgyu mtshan 'di la gnas pa ni rgyu mtshan 'dis na sangs rgyas zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: On the tenth stage, it is the benefit of both self and other, because one who is on this stage is called a Buddha, because he is a sign of the Buddha, by this reason.

original: grangs nyi shu rtsa bdun du brtsi ba'i phyir ni dang po rang gi don du mos pa chung ngu'i chung ngu'i dbang du byas te ni rgyal ba'i yum 'di glegs bam ji skad du gsungs pa ltar bris te bcangs pa tsam gyis sangs rgyas kyi sku gdung pha
analyzed: grangs nyi shu rtsa bdun du brtsi ba'i phyir ni dang po rang gi don du mos pa chung ngu'i chung ngu'i dbang du byas te ni rgyal ba'i yum 'di glegs bam ji skad du gsungs pa ltar bris te bcangs pa tsam gyis sangs rgyas kyi sku gdung pha
translated: The first is from the perspective of the small of the small interest.

original: rol tu phyin pa drug gi rgyu las byung ba rnams rin po che sna bdun gyi mchod rten du bcug ste mchod pa byas pa bas che sa bsod nams mang du 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa drug gi rgyu las byung ba rnams rin po che sna bdun gyi mchod rten du bcug ste mchod pa byas pa bas che sa bsod nams mang du 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that one who merely writes out and keeps this Mother of the Victorious Ones in the form of a book as it is taught in the sutra will accumulate much more merit than if one were to place the bodily relics of the Buddha, which are the result of the six perfections, in a stupa made of the seven precious substances and make offerings to it.

original: chung ngu'i 'bring ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral na /
analyzed: chung ngu'i 'bring ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral na /
translated: The small of the medium is as follows.

original: byung chub sems dpa' byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i mthus rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byung chub sems dpa' byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i mthus rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur te /
translated: Without the perfection of wisdom, a bodhisattva will not become a perfect buddha through the power of generating the mind of awakening and so on.

original: slar ldog pa'i phyir 'di'i mthu che ba phul du byung ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: slar ldog pa'i phyir 'di'i mthu che ba phul du byung ba bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the great and excellent power of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ji ltar rgyal po gser mdog gi mdo las /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal po gser mdog gi mdo las /
translated: As it is said in the Sutra of King Suvarṇaprabhāsa:

original: bskal ba brgyar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' slar ldog par bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bskal ba brgyar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' slar ldog par bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the teaching that a bodhisattva who practices for a hundred eons can still turn back.

original: chung ngu'i chen po ni gang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'dod na 'di la bslabs te /
analyzed: chung ngu'i chen po ni gang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'dod na 'di la bslabs te /
translated: The small of the great is when one wishes to attain nirvana, and one trains in this.

original: sangs rgyas rje btsun bzhugs sam grongs kyang rung 'di nyid ston pa'i mdzad pas nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes 'di'i mthu mos pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rje btsun bzhugs sam grongs kyang rung 'di nyid ston pa'i mdzad pas nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes 'di'i mthu mos pa'o //
translated: One has faith in its power, thinking, “Whether the Lord Buddha is present or has passed away, this teaching remains, acting just like the Buddha.”

original: 'bring gi chung ngu ni rin po che sna bdun gyi mchod rten gyi dpe nye par bzung ste'o //🔽'bring gi 'bring ni de lta bus 'dzam bu'i gling byur bur bkang ba'i dpes so //

translated: Also, with regard to the aspiration for the benefit of others, the small is taught by the statement: “Having made the book, one should demonstrate power by merely holding it and making offerings.”
