analyzed: chung nga'i 'bring ni 'dzam bu'i gling de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis byung bur bka' ba'i dpes bstan pas so //
translated: The small of the medium is taught by the example of the world filled with the relics of the Tathagata.

original: chung ngu'i chen po ni nam bla na med pa yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i bar du nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa'i 'jigs pa med pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: chung ngu'i chen po ni nam bla na med pa yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i bar du nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa'i 'jigs pa med pa bstan pas so //
translated: The great of the small is taught by the example of the fearlessness of the stages of the Sravakas, etc. up to the attainment of the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de ltar na sa brgyad pa 'di dag gis 'jigs pa dang bcas par bstan pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na sa brgyad pa 'di dag gis 'jigs pa dang bcas par bstan pa ci zhe na /
translated: Thus, by these eight stages, what is taught as having fear?

original: mos pa rnam pa gsum gyis mtshams brjod pa kho na zad do //
analyzed: mos pa rnam pa gsum gyis mtshams brjod pa kho na zad do //
translated: It is only the expression of the boundary by the three kinds of resolution.

original: 'bring gi chung ngu ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis byur bur bkang ba'i dpes bstan to //
analyzed: 'bring gi chung ngu ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis byur bur bkang ba'i dpes bstan to //
translated: The small of the medium is taught by the example of the trichiliocosm filled with the relics of the Tathagata.

original: 'bring gi 'bring ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sangs rgyas rnams mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos gsungs pa dang / yang nyan thos la sogs pa gang dag chos 'chad pa de dag ni rgyal ba'i yum 'di yum 'di las byung bar bstan pas so //
analyzed: 'bring gi 'bring ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sangs rgyas rnams mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos gsungs pa dang / yang nyan thos la sogs pa gang dag chos 'chad pa de dag ni rgyal ba'i yum 'di yum 'di las byung bar bstan pas so //
translated: The middle of the middling is the buddhas in the world systems of the ten directions who teach the Dharma of the sutras and so on, and also the shravakas and so forth who explain the Dharma, because they are taught to have arisen from this mother of the victors.

original: 'bring gi chen po ni yum 'di la brten pa ni rgyal po'i skyes bu'i dpe nye bar bzung bas so //
analyzed: 'bring gi chen po ni yum 'di la brten pa ni rgyal po'i skyes bu'i dpe nye bar bzung bas so //
translated: The greater of the middling is based on this mother, as illustrated by the example of the king's messenger.

original: chen po'i chung ngu ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed cig de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis byur bur ba'i dpes bstan to //
analyzed: chen po'i chung ngu ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed cig de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis byur bur ba'i dpes bstan to //
translated: The lesser of the greater is taught by the example of the world systems of the ten directions being filled with the relics of the tathagatas, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river.

original: chen po'i 'bring ni phyogs bcu'i 'phags pa rnams kyi rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid du 'di bstan pas so //
analyzed: chen po'i 'bring ni phyogs bcu'i 'phags pa rnams kyi rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid du 'di bstan pas so //
translated: The middle of the greater is taught as being the very cause of realization for the noble ones of the ten directions.

original: chen po'i chen po ni shing rnams lo ma dang dbyibs dang kha dog la sogs pa tha dad kyang grib ma la bye brag med par bstan pa'i dpes brjod do //
analyzed: chen po'i chen po ni shing rnams lo ma dang dbyibs dang kha dog la sogs pa tha dad kyang grib ma la bye brag med par bstan pa'i dpes brjod do //
translated: The great of the great is illustrated by the example of trees, which have different leaves, shapes, colors, etc. but have no distinction in shade.

original: mos pa rnam pa nyi shi rtsa bdun po chung du nas brtsams pa'i rim pa 'dis mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni de las bzlog ste chen po nas bgrang bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mos pa rnam pa nyi shi rtsa bdun po chung du nas brtsams pa'i rim pa 'dis mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni de las bzlog ste chen po nas bgrang bar shes par bya'o //
translated: The twenty-seven kinds of interest should be understood in this order, from the lesser to the greater. The adverse elements should be understood in the reverse order, from the greater to the lesser.

original: ci 'dir rang kho na'i phyir mos pa la sogs pa brjod dam ;
analyzed: ci 'dir rang kho na'i phyir mos pa la sogs pa brjod dam ;
translated: Is interest, etc. mentioned here only for the sake of the bodhisattvas themselves?

original: yang na rang gi rgyal bskyed ma kho na la mos pa brjod ce na /
analyzed: yang na rang gi rgyal bskyed ma kho na la mos pa brjod ce na /
translated: Or is it mentioned only for the sake of their own and others' enlightenment?

original: phyogs gnyi ga ltar mi bsam gyi rang la sogs pa'i phyir yum kho na la mos zhes brjod do //🔽rang gi don du mos ba na yang gzhan gi ni med pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: phyogs gnyi ga ltar mi bsam gyi rang la sogs pa'i phyir yum kho na la mos zhes brjod do // rang gi don du mos ba na yang gzhan gi ni med pa yang ma yin la /
translated: One should not think in terms of either of these two alternatives. Interest, etc. is mentioned only for the sake of the Mother, i.e. the perfection of wisdom.🔽When one is interested in one's own goal, one is not without interest in the goals of others.

original: lhag ma gzhan gyi don du mos pa na yang rang gi don gyis gal @60b zhig dben //
analyzed: lhag ma gzhan gyi don du mos pa na yang rang gi don gyis gal @60b zhig dben //
translated: And when one is interested in the goals of others, one is not without interest in one's own goal.

original: nyi ga'i phyir mos pa na yang re re la khyab pa ni mi 'dor te /
analyzed: nyi ga'i phyir mos pa na yang re re la khyab pa ni mi 'dor te /
translated: Even though they are not interested in the sun, they do not abandon the pervasion of each by the sun,

original: spyi ni bye brag la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi ni bye brag la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the universal is pervaded by the particular.

original: bstod pa dang bkur ba dang bsngags pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bstod pa dang bkur ba dang bsngags pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Praise, respect, and acclaim

original: 'di dag ni ngag snyan pa ngo bstod kyi rang bzhin ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di dag ni ngag snyan pa ngo bstod kyi rang bzhin ni ma yin gyi /
translated: are not by nature pleasant speech.

original: legs par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la thugs dgyes pas gnas pa kho na bstod pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: legs par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la thugs dgyes pas gnas pa kho na bstod pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: They are praise, etc. because they are the basis of the delight of the bodhisattva who is well established.

original: 'di yang tshogs kyi lam yang dag par sbyong ba'i dus na gnas skabs thams cad du yang 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: 'di yang tshogs kyi lam yang dag par sbyong ba'i dus na gnas skabs thams cad du yang 'byung ba ni /
translated: This also occurs in all situations when the path of accumulation is being purified.

original: las dang po pa'i sa nyid la byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang dag par len pa grub pa'i dbang du byas te de'i tshe de la dge ba'i phyir /
analyzed: las dang po pa'i sa nyid la byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang dag par len pa grub pa'i dbang du byas te de'i tshe de la dge ba'i phyir /
translated: In the stage of the beginner, the bodhisattva vow is accomplished, and at that time, in order to be virtuous,

original: rgyal ba sras dang bcas rnams kyis //
analyzed: rgyal ba sras dang bcas rnams kyis //
translated: the victors and their sons

original: dge ba'i thugs kyi sa rtag par yang //
analyzed: dge ba'i thugs kyi sa rtag par yang //
translated: always think of the stage of virtuous mind

original: bu sdug 'dra bar dgongs pa yin //
analyzed: bu sdug 'dra bar dgongs pa yin //
translated: as if it were their beloved son.

original: zhes bshad de /
analyzed: zhes bshad de /
translated: This is explained in the Bodhisattva Levels:

original: de rgyas par ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i tshul khrims kyi le'ur blta'o //
analyzed: de rgyas par ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i tshul khrims kyi le'ur blta'o //
translated: This should be studied in detail in the morality chapter of the Bodhisattva Stages.🔽By this method, although all are endowed with it, here it is taught in order to show the virtues of the path of cultivation,

original: tshul 'dis na thams cad du ldan yang bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas pa ni 'dir yon tan yongs su bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshul 'dis na thams cad du ldan yang bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas pa ni 'dir yon tan yongs su bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is taught that

original: yams nad 'di rnams zad nas ni //
analyzed: yams nad 'di rnams zad nas ni //
translated: “when these epidemics are exhausted,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs par bstan pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs par bstan pas so //
translated: Thus it is taught.🔽🔽

original: de ltar bstan pa'i tshul gyis na rig byed las /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i tshul gyis na rig byed las /
translated: By this method of teaching, the Vedas

original: yi ge aom ldan phyed dang bzhi //
analyzed: yi ge aom ldan phyed dang bzhi //
translated: are said to be the four and a half feet endowed with the syllable om.

original: tshad du byas pas snyan pa brjod //
analyzed: tshad du byas pas snyan pa brjod //
translated: They are recited with a pleasant sound,

original: 'di ni bstod pa smra ba dang / dgra yi tshangs pa'ang 'di nyid de //
analyzed: 'di ni bstod pa smra ba dang / dgra yi tshangs pa'ang 'di nyid de //
translated: and this is also the Brahman of the enemy.

original: bkur ba'ang de ltar brjod par bya //
analyzed: bkur ba'ang de ltar brjod par bya //
translated: It is also said to be the worship.

original: yi ge dang ldan tshad sngon bzhin //
analyzed: yi ge dang ldan tshad sngon bzhin //
translated: The measure of the syllables is as before.

original: snyan smra snyan tshig rig byed de //
analyzed: snyan smra snyan tshig rig byed de //
translated: Pleasant speech is the Veda of pleasant words,

original: de ni bsngags par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bsngags par 'dod pa'o //
translated: and this is said to be praise.

original: zhes bya ba smras pa bsal te dgu tshan gsum zhes bya ba ni bstod pa'i dgu tshan dang ; bkur ba'i dgu tshan dang / bsngags pa'i dgu tshan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras pa bsal te dgu tshan gsum zhes bya ba ni bstod pa'i dgu tshan dang ; bkur ba'i dgu tshan dang / bsngags pa'i dgu tshan te /
translated: The three sets of nine are the set of nine praises, the set of nine honors, and the set of nine eulogies.

original: de dag kyang rang gi don du mos pa la ni bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang rang gi don du mos pa la ni bstod pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the set of nine praises is for those devoted to their own aim.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don du mos pa la ni bkur ba'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don du mos pa la ni bkur ba'o //
translated: The set of nine honors is for those devoted to their own and others’ aims.

original: gzhan gyi don du mos pa ni bsngags pa'o zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du mos pa ni bsngags pa'o zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The set of nine eulogies is for those devoted to others’ aims.

original: de la dgu tshan dang bo'i dang po ni 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed cig de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis bkang ba'i dpes bstan to //
analyzed: de la dgu tshan dang bo'i dang po ni 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed cig de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis bkang ba'i dpes bstan to //
translated: The first of the three sets of nine is illustrated by the example of as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Ganges River filled with the relics of the Tathagata.

original: gnyis ni yun 'di gzhan gyi thad du song ste bstan pa'i che ba brjod pas so //🔽gsum pa ni sems can gcig 'bras bu dang po la bzhag pa dang / 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can de dag @61a * //
analyzed: gnyis ni yun 'di gzhan gyi thad du song ste bstan pa'i che ba brjod pas so // gsum pa ni sems can gcig 'bras bu dang po la bzhag pa dang / 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can de dag @61a * //
translated: The second is illustrated by the example of going to another place and proclaiming the greatness of the Buddha.

original: gi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa'i dpes bstan to //
analyzed: gi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa'i dpes bstan to //
translated: The third is illustrated by the example of establishing a single being in the first fruit and establishing the beings of Jambudvipa in the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: bzhi pa ni sems can gcig cig 'bras bu gnyis pa la bkod pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni sems can gcig cig 'bras bu gnyis pa la bkod pa bstan pas so //
translated: The fourth is shown by the example of establishing a single being in the second result.

original: lnga pa ni 'bras bu gsum pa la bkod pas so //
analyzed: lnga pa ni 'bras bu gsum pa la bkod pas so //
translated: The fifth is shown by the example of establishing in the third result.

original: drug pa ni 'bras bu bzhi pa la bkod pas so //
analyzed: drug pa ni 'bras bu bzhi pa la bkod pas so //
translated: The sixth is shown by the example of establishing in the fourth result.

original: bdun pa ni rang byang chub la bkod pas so //🔽brgyad pa ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ma lus pa 'bras bu dang po la bkod pa bas /
analyzed: bdun pa ni rang byang chub la bkod pas so // brgyad pa ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ma lus pa 'bras bu dang po la bkod pa bas /
translated: The seventh is shown by the example of establishing in solitary buddhahood.

original: sems can gcig cig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bzhag pa mchog tu bstan pas so //
analyzed: sems can gcig cig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bzhag pa mchog tu bstan pas so //
translated: The eighth is shown by the example of establishing a single being in perfect complete enlightenment, which is superior to establishing all the sentient beings of Jambudvīpa in the first result.

original: dgu pa ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad 'bras bu gnyis pa la bkod pas zhes bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgu pa ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad 'bras bu gnyis pa la bkod pas zhes bstan pas so //
translated: The ninth is shown by the example of establishing all the sentient beings of Jambudvīpa in the second result.

original: bkur ba'i dgu tshan gyi dang po ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad 'bras bu gsum pa la bkod pa'i dpes so //
analyzed: bkur ba'i dgu tshan gyi dang po ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad 'bras bu gsum pa la bkod pa'i dpes so //
translated: The first of the nine sets of praise is shown by the example of establishing all the sentient beings of Jambudvīpa in the third result.

original: gnyis pa ni 'bras bu bzhi pa la bkod pas so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'bras bu bzhi pa la bkod pas so //
translated: The second is shown by the example of establishing in the fourth result.

original: gsum pa ni rang byang chub la bkod pas so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni rang byang chub la bkod pas so //
translated: The third is shown by the example of establishing in solitary buddhahood.

original: bzhi pa ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa bas glegs bam du gyur pa zhig gzhan la byin nam /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa bas glegs bam du gyur pa zhig gzhan la byin nam /
translated: The fourth is to give a copy of the Perfection of Wisdom to someone else.🔽

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed na bsod nams che bar bstan to //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed na bsod nams che bar bstan to //
translated: The fourth is that it is taught that the merit is greater if one gives a copy of the Perfection of Wisdom to another person, or if one reflects on it properly, than if one were to establish all the sentient beings of Jambudvipa on the path of the ten virtues.

original: lnga pa ni gnyis su med pa'i don ji lta bar bstan pa'i che ba bstan pas so //
analyzed: lnga pa ni gnyis su med pa'i don ji lta bar bstan pa'i che ba bstan pas so //
translated: The fifth is that it is taught that the greatness of the teaching of the meaning of nonduality is that it is the perfection of wisdom.

original: drug pa ni yum 'di ni don dang ldan yi ge dang ldan par bstan pa la yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni bsod nams mang po dang ldan par bstan pas so //
analyzed: drug pa ni yum 'di ni don dang ldan yi ge dang ldan par bstan pa la yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni bsod nams mang po dang ldan par bstan pas so //
translated: The sixth is that it is taught that the perfection of wisdom is endowed with meaning and endowed with letters, and that it is the perfection of wisdom that is endowed with great merit.

original: bdun pa ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas rnams la ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis rim gro byas pa bas rgyal ba'i yum 'di yi ge dang don ma nor bar gzhan la bstan pa bsod nams ches mang bar🔽bstan pas so //
analyzed: bdun pa ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas rnams la ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis rim gro byas pa bas rgyal ba'i yum 'di yi ge dang don ma nor bar gzhan la bstan pa bsod nams ches mang bar🔽bstan pas so //
translated: The seventh is that it is taught that the merit of teaching the perfection of wisdom to another person without error with regard to the letters and the meaning is much greater than the merit of serving all the buddhas of the world systems of the ten directions with all necessities for as long as they live.

original: brgyad pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ltar snang bas bskal pa tshad med grangs med par sbyin pa la sogs pa la spyad pa bas rgyal ba skyed ma phyin ci ma log par gzhan la bstan pa ches bsod nams mang du 'phel bar bstan pas so //🔽dgu pa ni 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs pa phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed yod pa rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa bas /
analyzed: brgyad pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ltar snang bas bskal pa tshad med grangs med par sbyin pa la sogs pa la spyad pa bas rgyal ba skyed ma phyin ci ma log par gzhan la bstan pa ches bsod nams mang du 'phel bar bstan pas so // dgu pa ni 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs pa phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed yod pa rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa bas /
translated: The eighth is taught by the statement that it is a much greater increase in merit to teach others the unerring way to generate the victor than to practice generosity and so on for immeasurable, countless eons by a bodhisattva who appears to be a bodhisattva.

original: sems can gcig cig phyir mi ldog pa @61b dam pa la bzhag na 'di nyid bsod nams ches mang du 'phel bar gsungs pas so //
analyzed: sems can gcig cig phyir mi ldog pa @61b dam pa la bzhag na 'di nyid bsod nams ches mang du 'phel bar gsungs pas so //
translated: The ninth is taught by the statement that it is a much greater increase in merit to establish one being in the excellent state of nonreturner than to establish as many sentient beings as there are grains of sand in the Ganges in all the world systems in each of the ten directions, such as Jambudvīpa, in the result of stream entry.🔽The nine sets of praise

original: bsngags pa'i dgu tshan las dang po ni phyir 'ong ba'i dpes so //
analyzed: bsngags pa'i dgu tshan las dang po ni phyir 'ong ba'i dpes so //
translated: The first set of nine is by way of the example of a once returner.

original: gnyis pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i dpes so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i dpes so //
translated: The second is by way of the example of a nonreturner.

original: gsum pa ni dgra bcom pa'i dpes so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dgra bcom pa'i dpes so //
translated: The third is by way of the example of an arhat.

original: bzhi pa ni rang byang chub kyi dpes so //🔽lnga pa ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed cig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bskul ba bas /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rang byang chub kyi dpes so // lnga pa ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed cig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bskul ba bas /
translated: The fourth is by the example of the Pratyekabuddha.

original: sems can cig cig phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la bkod pa bsod nams ches mang ba'i dpes so //
analyzed: sems can cig cig phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la bkod pa bsod nams ches mang ba'i dpes so //
translated: The fifth is by the example of the greater merit of establishing one being in the stage of nonregression than of urging all the beings of Jambudvipa to complete enlightenment.

original: drug pa ni gling bzhi pa'i sems can dpe de ltar nye bar bzung bas so //
analyzed: drug pa ni gling bzhi pa'i sems can dpe de ltar nye bar bzung bas so //
translated: The sixth is by the example of the beings of the four continents.

original: bdun pa ni stong spyi phud kyi sems can dpe de ltar nye bar brjod pas so //
analyzed: bdun pa ni stong spyi phud kyi sems can dpe de ltar nye bar brjod pas so //
translated: The seventh is by the example of the beings of a chiliocosm.🔽The eighth is by the example of the beings of a dichiliochosm and a trichiliochosm and of the worlds of the ten directions, as before.

original: brgyad pa ni stong gnyis pa bar ma dang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams dpe snga ma dang sbyar bas so //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni stong gnyis pa bar ma dang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams dpe snga ma dang sbyar bas so //
translated: The ninth is by the example of the beings of the worlds of the ten directions.

original: dgu pa ni 'dzam bu'i gling nas brtsams te phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can 'di dag ma lus pa phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la bkod pa bas ni phyir mi ldog pa gang zhig
analyzed: dgu pa ni 'dzam bu'i gling nas brtsams te phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can 'di dag ma lus pa phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la bkod pa bas ni phyir mi ldog pa gang zhig
translated: The ninth is that if all the sentient beings of the worlds of the ten directions, as many as the grains of sand in the Ganges River, were established in the stage of nonregression, it would not equal a single nonregressing bodhisattva.

original: myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub bar bya ba'i phyir rgyal ba'i yum 'di ston par byed na ches de nyid bsod nams mang bar bstan pas so //
analyzed: myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub bar bya ba'i phyir rgyal ba'i yum 'di ston par byed na ches de nyid bsod nams mang bar bstan pas so //
translated: The ninth is that it is taught that the merit of someone who teaches this Mother of the Victorious Ones in order to quickly attain complete enlightenment is far greater than that of someone who establishes all the sentient beings of all the world systems of the ten directions, as many as there are grains of sand in the river Ganges, starting from the human realm, in the state of irreversibility.

original: bsngo ba yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba 'di dag 'di lta bur gyur cig ces yul rnam pa bcu gnyis su sbyar ba dang / tshogs rnam pa bcu gnyis po 'di dag gis bdag chos kyi rgyal por gyur cig ces bsngo bar bya ba bcu gnyis su yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsngo ba yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba 'di dag 'di lta bur gyur cig ces yul rnam pa bcu gnyis su sbyar ba dang / tshogs rnam pa bcu gnyis po 'di dag gis bdag chos kyi rgyal por gyur cig ces bsngo bar bya ba bcu gnyis su yang sbyar ro //
translated: The mental state of dedication is as follows. One should dedicate one's virtue to the twelve aspects of the object, thinking, May these virtues become like this, and to the twelve aspects of the subject, thinking, By means of these twelve collections, may I become a Dharma king.

original: lhag ma rnams ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: skabs gnyis pa'i 'grel bshad rdzogs so /
analyzed: skabs gnyis pa'i 'grel bshad rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the second chapter is finished.

original: // / de ltar skabs gnyis pa rnam par bshad par byas na /
analyzed: // / de ltar skabs gnyis pa rnam par bshad par byas na /
translated: Thus, having explained the second chapter,

original: da ni yang skabs gsum pa dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni yang skabs gsum pa dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain the third chapter,

original: gzhi thams cad yongs su shes pa med par lam legs par yongs su shes pa med pas rnams pa thams cad shes pa nyid gsungs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhi thams cad yongs su shes pa med par lam legs par yongs su shes pa med pas rnams pa thams cad shes pa nyid gsungs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “Since there is no thorough understanding of the path without the thorough understanding of all bases, the knowledge of all aspects is explained.”

original: 'dir gzhi thams cad yongs su shes pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /🔽de med par lam legs par yongs su shes pa med pas zhes bya ba ni gnyen po mi mthun @62a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhi thams cad yongs su shes pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te / de med par lam legs par yongs su shes pa med pas zhes bya ba ni gnyen po mi mthun @62a * //
translated: Here, the thorough understanding of all bases is the counter correlate.

original: pa'i phyogs la ltos te /
analyzed: pa'i phyogs la ltos te /
translated: “Since there is no thorough understanding of the path without that” means that the antidote is posited in dependence on the counter correlate.

original: 'jog pa nyid du byed na /
analyzed: 'jog pa nyid du byed na /
translated: If that is done,🔽when there is no understanding of the counter correlate, how could it be known what it is the antidote to?

original: gang gi tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs khong du chud pa med na 'di gang gi gnyen por gyur pa ga la zhig shes par 'gyur zhes dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs khong du chud pa med na 'di gang gi gnyen por gyur pa ga la zhig shes par 'gyur zhes dgongs pa ste /
translated: Thus it is intended.

original: de bas na slob dpon dpal sangs rgyas ye shes kyi zhal snga nas kyang /
analyzed: de bas na slob dpon dpal sangs rgyas ye shes kyi zhal snga nas kyang /
translated: Therefore, the master Śrī Buddhajñānapāda also says:

original: 'di man chad ni thams cad shes pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni thams cad shes pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: From here on is the definition of the knowledge of all things.

original: byang chub gzhan shes par byas nas spang bar bya dgos pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub gzhan shes par byas nas spang bar bya dgos pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Having known the other enlightenments, they must be abandoned.

original: de ltar byas na lnga pa 'di yang rgyu mtshan nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar byas na lnga pa 'di yang rgyu mtshan nyid du bstan to //
translated: Thus, this fifth is taught as the reason.

original: lugs las zhes pa ni 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi bzhed pa las te /
analyzed: lugs las zhes pa ni 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi bzhed pa las te /
translated: The system is the assertion of the noble Nagarjuna,

original: de ni thams cad kyi 'dod par bya ba ba'i phyir lugs so //
analyzed: de ni thams cad kyi 'dod par bya ba ba'i phyir lugs so //
translated: because it is to be accepted by all.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gang //
translated: What is dependent origination?

original: zhes pa ni kun rdzob pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni kun rdzob pa rnams so //
translated: It is the conventional.

original: de nyid shes pa ni de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid shes pa ni de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The knowledge of that is its nature.

original: khyod ni zhes pa ni rje btsun sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: khyod ni zhes pa ni rje btsun sangs rgyas so //
translated: The you is the venerable Buddha.

original: stong par bzhed ces bya ba la /
analyzed: stong par bzhed ces bya ba la /
translated: The acceptance of emptiness is as follows.

original: 'di gang gis stong zhe na /
analyzed: 'di gang gis stong zhe na /
translated: By what is it empty?

original: kun rdzob 'di dag kun rdzob kyis stong pa ste de ltar kun rdzob pa'i rang bzhin ni rtag tu kun rdzob kyis stong pa yin pas cir yang brjod du med pa yin pa'i phyogs 'di las ni 'phags pa nam mkha' mdzod kyi mdo las /
analyzed: kun rdzob 'di dag kun rdzob kyis stong pa ste de ltar kun rdzob pa'i rang bzhin ni rtag tu kun rdzob kyis stong pa yin pas cir yang brjod du med pa yin pa'i phyogs 'di las ni 'phags pa nam mkha' mdzod kyi mdo las /
translated: These conventional realities are empty of conventional reality. Thus, the nature of conventional reality is always empty of conventional reality. Therefore, this position that nothing can be said is in accordance with the noble Cloud of Jewels Sutra, which states:🔽

original: spangs pa med pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid du bstan pa yang legs par drangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spangs pa med pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid du bstan pa yang legs par drangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: These conventional realities are empty of conventional reality. Thus, the nature of conventional reality is always empty of conventional reality. Therefore, this position that nothing can be said at all is well drawn from the teaching of emptiness that has no abandonment in the noble Sky Treasure Sutra.

original: de ltar na theg pa chen po 'dir stong pa nyid ni gsum ste /
analyzed: de ltar na theg pa chen po 'dir stong pa nyid ni gsum ste /
translated: Thus, in this Great Vehicle, there are three kinds of emptiness:

original: kun brtags pas stong pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gis stong pa nyid dang / thams cad kyis stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pas stong pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gis stong pa nyid dang / thams cad kyis stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: the emptiness of the imagined, the emptiness of the other-dependent, and the emptiness of all.

original: ji ltar zhes na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes na /
translated: How so?

original: bdag la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag rnam par rtog pa ngan pa snying por gyur pa kho na yin gyi de dag ni nam yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag rnam par rtog pa ngan pa snying por gyur pa kho na yin gyi de dag ni nam yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The conceptualizations of self and so on are only the essence of bad conceptualization, because they are never apprehended.

original: de ltar ngan par rtog pa des stong pa nyid 'di ni 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi bye brag 'phags par byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar ngan par rtog pa des stong pa nyid 'di ni 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi bye brag 'phags par byed pa rnams so //
translated: Thus, this emptiness is the wisdom of the noble listeners and so on, which makes them noble.

original: 'di ni ma dag par gyur pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba ji snyed pa ni gzhan gyi dbang zhes rnal 'byor spyod pa la la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di ni ma dag par gyur pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba ji snyed pa ni gzhan gyi dbang zhes rnal 'byor spyod pa la la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: This is taught by some Yogacaras and so on, who say that the dependent nature is all the impure minds and mental factors.

original: des gang zhig stong pa ni dngos po kun rdzob pa rnams te /
analyzed: des gang zhig stong pa ni dngos po kun rdzob pa rnams te /
translated: That which is empty of that is the relative, which is things.

original: ma brtags gcig pu nyams dga' zhing //
analyzed: ma brtags gcig pu nyams dga' zhing //
translated: It is delightful when not examined,

original: skye dang 'jig pa'i chos can yang //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa'i chos can yang //
translated: and it has the characteristics of arising and disintegrating.

original: don byed pa dag nus rnams kyi //
analyzed: don byed pa dag nus rnams kyi //
translated: It is the nature of things that can perform functions.

original: rang bzhin kun rdzob pa yin rtogs //🔽zhes bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: rang bzhin kun rdzob pa yin rtogs // zhes bstan pa rnams so //
translated: Understand that this is the relative nature.

original: de ltar na kye rgyal ba'i @62b sras dag khams gsum pa 'di dag ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs pa 'di ji ltar drang zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na kye rgyal ba'i @62b sras dag khams gsum pa 'di dag ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs pa 'di ji ltar drang zhe na /
translated: Thus, how should we interpret the statement, “O children of the Victor, these three realms are mind only”?

original: 'di ni rigs par 'gyur te tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis ni kun rdzob pa ga la zhig shes te /🔽kun rdzob tsam gyis nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa nyi tshes spyod la /
analyzed: 'di ni rigs par 'gyur te tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis ni kun rdzob pa ga la zhig shes te / kun rdzob tsam gyis nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa nyi tshes spyod la /
translated: This is reasonable, for how can those who see only the near side know the conventional?

original: de yang sems tsam kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang sems tsam kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They act with the mere conventional, and only the mind, in the belief in “I” and “mine.”

original: de bas na der ni gzhan gyi dbang gis rjes su 'brang bas de skad gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na der ni gzhan gyi dbang gis rjes su 'brang bas de skad gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said there that the conventional is to be followed by the other-dependent.

original: de ltar na 'jig rten gyi khams chags pa'i rgyu bcu brjod pa'i tshe kha cig ni kun rdzob tu bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten gyi khams chags pa'i rgyu bcu brjod pa'i tshe kha cig ni kun rdzob tu bstan to //
translated: Thus, when the ten causes of the formation of the world-realm are taught, some are taught as conventional.

original: de nyi ster ma zad pa ni kun rdzob par bstan to //
analyzed: de nyi ster ma zad pa ni kun rdzob par bstan to //
translated: And the non-exhaustion of those is taught as conventional.

original: de ltar na gzhan gyi dbang gis stong pa nyid 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan gyi dbang gis stong pa nyid 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: Thus, this emptiness of the other-dependent is its own characteristic.

original: byang chub kyi sems dang po rtogs pa nas brtsams te snang ba dang bcas pa'i ye shes kyi 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang po rtogs pa nas brtsams te snang ba dang bcas pa'i ye shes kyi 'dzin par byed do //
translated: It is grasped by the wisdom that is accompanied by appearance, beginning with the realization of the first stage of the bodhisattva.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa kun tu bzang po de la snang ba dang bcas pa'i ye shes mngon par brjod pa la rtog pa ngan pa'i gnas med do /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa kun tu bzang po de la snang ba dang bcas pa'i ye shes mngon par brjod pa la rtog pa ngan pa'i gnas med do /
translated: In the buddha ground of Samantabhadra, there is no basis for the bad conception that the expression of pristine consciousness with appearance is a knowable object.

original: zhes bstan pa yang rgyu mtshan 'di nyid du zad de /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yang rgyu mtshan 'di nyid du zad de /
translated: This is the reason for the teaching.

original: gzhan du na phyi rol gyi don ston pa ltar snang na ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur /🔽nang gi shes pa'i bdag nyid ni phyir rol ltar snang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i phyogs la yang bdag nyid la bdag nyid byed pa la sogs pa'i nyes par 'gyur la sangs rgyas kyi sa kun tu bzang po la yang snang ba'i tshogs rnams bdag nyid kyi
analyzed: gzhan du na phyi rol gyi don ston pa ltar snang na ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur / nang gi shes pa'i bdag nyid ni phyir rol ltar snang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i phyogs la yang bdag nyid la bdag nyid byed pa la sogs pa'i nyes par 'gyur la sangs rgyas kyi sa kun tu bzang po la yang snang ba'i tshogs rnams bdag nyid kyi
translated: Otherwise, if it appears to be an external object, how could it not be the fault of apprehended and apprehender?

original: ye shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa don med par rtogs par ji ltar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ye shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa don med par rtogs par ji ltar mi 'gyur /
translated: In the position that the inner nature of consciousness appears as external, there would be the fault of something acting on itself, and so on. Also, in the buddha ground of Samantabhadra, how could it not be understood that the collection of appearances is one’s own pristine consciousness, and so on?

original: de bas na slob dpon skal ldan la sogs pas kun rdzob pa gtsor brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na slob dpon skal ldan la sogs pas kun rdzob pa gtsor brjod pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the master Bhavyaputra and so on say that the relative is primary.

original: gzhan dag gis ni kun rdzob tu brjod pas phyogs re rer 'dzin pa bkag pa kho nar zad pas stong pa nyid gnyis po dbu ma chen po las bstan pa ni re rer yung 'gog par ga la mdzad ces bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni kun rdzob tu brjod pas phyogs re rer 'dzin pa bkag pa kho nar zad pas stong pa nyid gnyis po dbu ma chen po las bstan pa ni re rer yung 'gog par ga la mdzad ces bya bar gnas so //
translated: Others, by saying that it is conventional, have refuted only the grasping of one side. Therefore, how could the teaching of the two kinds of emptiness in the Great Madhyamaka be refuted by each of them?

original: stong pa nyid gsum pa ni gnas skabs gzhan du bstan to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gsum pa ni gnas skabs gzhan du bstan to //
translated: The third kind of emptiness is taught in another context.

original: thams cad la yod pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba la 'dis dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba yid la byas te /
analyzed: thams cad la yod pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba la 'dis dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba yid la byas te /
translated: “ Is it not found in everything?” By this, one should understand that he asks, having brought to mind the nature of things, as it is,

original: 'jug pa rnams kyi bsam pa por nas dris par zad ces shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa rnams kyi bsam pa por nas dris par zad ces shes par bya'o //
translated: and having formed the intention of those who engage in it.

original: lhag ma rnams kyi don ni go bar sla bas bdag gis rnam par ma phye'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyi don ni go bar sla bas bdag gis rnam par ma phye'o //
translated: The meaning of the rest is easy to understand, so I have not distinguished it.

original: skabs gsum pa'i 'grel bshad rdzogs so /🔽// / de ltar skabs @63a * //
analyzed: skabs gsum pa'i 'grel bshad rdzogs so / // / de ltar skabs @63a * //
translated: The commentary on the third chapter is finished.

original: gsum pa rna par phye nas /
analyzed: gsum pa rna par phye nas /
translated: Having thus distinguished the third chapter,

original: da ni skabs bzhi pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don dgrol bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni skabs bzhi pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i don dgrol bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain the meaning of the verses of the fourth chapter,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum yongs su shes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum yongs su shes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The three knowledges of omniscience are fully known, etc.

original: 'dir yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni skabs brgyad car bsdus pa'i skabs gsum po 'di dag thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyis bsdus pa dang rgyas par yongs su shes par byed pas so //
analyzed: 'dir yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni skabs brgyad car bsdus pa'i skabs gsum po 'di dag thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyis bsdus pa dang rgyas par yongs su shes par byed pas so //
translated: Here, “fully known” means that these three topics, which are included in the eight topics, are fully known by the wisdom that is included in hearing and contemplation, and are fully known in detail.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni nges par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni nges par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Is” means “is ascertained.”

original: dbang du bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pas rang gi rgyud la bskyed pas rang dbang thob pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dbang du bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pas rang gi rgyud la bskyed pas rang dbang thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: “In order to master” means in order to attain mastery by generating them in one’s continuum through meditation.

original: thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab dag ni mi brtan pas na yon tan rang dbang ma yin la /
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab dag ni mi brtan pas na yon tan rang dbang ma yin la /
translated: Since the wisdoms of hearing and contemplation are unstable, they do not have the qualities of mastery.

original: bsgom pa las ni rang dbang du 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: bsgom pa las ni rang dbang du 'gyur bas so //
translated: But since they are mastered through meditation, they are mastered.

original: de ltar shes rab gsum car 'brel par bya bar rigs so zhes thugs la bzhag nas ni 'phags pa mi pham pa'i zhal snga nas /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab gsum car 'brel par bya bar rigs so zhes thugs la bzhag nas ni 'phags pa mi pham pa'i zhal snga nas /
translated: Thus, having determined that it is correct to connect all three wisdoms, the noble Ajita said:

original: gal te thos pa tsam gyis don //
analyzed: gal te thos pa tsam gyis don //
translated: If the meaning were seen by mere hearing,

original: mthong 'gyur bsgom pa don med 'gyur //
analyzed: mthong 'gyur bsgom pa don med 'gyur //
translated: meditation would be pointless.

original: gal te bsgoms pas don mthong 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te bsgoms pas don mthong 'gyur //
translated: If the meaning were seen by meditation,

original: de tshe thos pa don med 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs la /
analyzed: de tshe thos pa don med 'gyur // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs la /
translated: hearing would be pointless.🔽Thus it is said.

original: yang gzhan las kyang /
analyzed: yang gzhan las kyang /
translated: Again, it is said elsewhere:

original: thog ma nyan 'dod bla ma bsnyen bkur ba 'od dang des byas shing //
analyzed: thog ma nyan 'dod bla ma bsnyen bkur ba 'od dang des byas shing //
translated: First, desiring to hear, one serves the guru.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i chos la rab rtog bsam gtan bsnyen byed byed pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i chos la rab rtog bsam gtan bsnyen byed byed pa //
translated: Through that, one practices concentration, well-examining phenomena as essenceless.

original: bde gshegs nyid ni rtogs 'gyur 'gro ba rnams bsgom sems tshim byed //
analyzed: bde gshegs nyid ni rtogs 'gyur 'gro ba rnams bsgom sems tshim byed //
translated: One realizes the state of sugata, satisfying the minds of beings with meditation.

original: chos nyid 'di 'dra'i spyod pas myur du bde gshegs thob par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos nyid 'di 'dra'i spyod pas myur du bde gshegs thob par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Through such conduct, one quickly attains sugatahood.

original: de ltar bsgoms pas 'dris par bya dgos pa'i phyir na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum sgom par byed pas de bstan zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar bsgoms pas 'dris par bya dgos pa'i phyir na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum sgom par byed pas de bstan zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, because one must become familiar through such meditation, one should apply the teaching of the three knowledges.

original: de ltar na 'di bstan pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di bstan pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of teaching this?

original: sngar ji ltar thos pa la sogs pa byas pa'i skabs gsum nyid goms par byas pas ci zhig mi nus she na /
analyzed: sngar ji ltar thos pa la sogs pa byas pa'i skabs gsum nyid goms par byas pas ci zhig mi nus she na /
translated: What is impossible by cultivating the three times of listening, etc. as before?

original: de'i phyir yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / lam dang ; gzhi zhes pa bsdus pa'i sgo nas sgom par byed ces sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / lam dang ; gzhi zhes pa bsdus pa'i sgo nas sgom par byed ces sbyar te /
translated: Therefore, one meditates by way of the inclusive terms of omniscience, path, and basis.

original: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught as follows:

original: thos pa'i shes rab ni ming 'ba' zhig la dmigs pas rab tu spros pa'i bdag nyid can rgyud 'khrug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa'i shes rab ni ming 'ba' zhig la dmigs pas rab tu spros pa'i bdag nyid can rgyud 'khrug par byed pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of listening has the nature of great proliferation because it focuses on mere names and disturbs the mindstream.

original: bsam pa'i shes rab ni ming don dang 'brel cing rnam par rtog pa @63b cung zad bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa'i shes rab ni ming don dang 'brel cing rnam par rtog pa @63b cung zad bsdus pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of contemplation is slightly more concise in its conceptualization because it is connected with the meaning of the name.🔽The wisdom of meditation is the nature of complete pacification and the collection of proliferation because it focuses on the meaning alone.

original: bsgom pa'i shes rab ni don 'ba' zhig la dmigs pas shin tu zhi zhing spros pa bsdus pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na skabs sang ma dag gcig tu bsdus pa skabs 'di yin pa'i tshul gyis rim pa gzhan du bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i shes rab ni don 'ba' zhig la dmigs pas shin tu zhi zhing spros pa bsdus pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na skabs sang ma dag gcig tu bsdus pa skabs 'di yin pa'i tshul gyis rim pa gzhan du bstan pa yin la /
translated: Thus the three times of listening, contemplation, and meditation are taught in a different order in this treatise because they are included in this context as one.

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la sogs pa gsum yang bsgom pa gong nas gong du khyad par zhugs pa'i dbang gis rim gyis bsdus te bstan par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la sogs pa gsum yang bsgom pa gong nas gong du khyad par zhugs pa'i dbang gis rim gyis bsdus te bstan par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The three, the clear realization of the peak and so on, are also to be understood as taught in order, subsumed by the power of the special progress of meditation.🔽The clear realization of all aspects🔽The clear realization of all aspects sarvakaralakṣaṇābhisamaya is taught in order to show the aspects, all, clear realization and the three knowledges.

original: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa zhes bya ba la rnam pa ni bye brag ste /
analyzed: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa zhes bya ba la rnam pa ni bye brag ste /
translated: Aspects means distinctions.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la sogs pa la chos kyi bye brag ji snyed cig yod par ston pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la sogs pa la chos kyi bye brag ji snyed cig yod par ston pa'o //
translated: It is taught that as many distinctions of phenomena as there are on the buddha level and so on exist.

original: kun zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum car gyi'o //
analyzed: kun zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum car gyi'o //
translated: All refers to all three of the omnisciences.

original: gzhan dag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi re re yang rnam pa kun zhes zer ba ni mi 'thad de de ni dngos su ma bstan pas so //
analyzed: gzhan dag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi re re yang rnam pa kun zhes zer ba ni mi 'thad de de ni dngos su ma bstan pas so //
translated: Others say that each of the three omnisciences is all aspects, but that is untenable because it is not explicitly taught.

original: mngon par zhen pa ni mngon du phyogs te'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa ni mngon du phyogs te'o //
translated: Abhisamaya is abhisamīkṣaṇa, clear realization.

original: sam ni rdzogs par ram /🔽yang na yang dag par ro //
analyzed: sam ni rdzogs par ram / yang na yang dag par ro //
translated: Sam means complete or perfect.

original: rtogs pas ni bsgoms pas khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pas ni bsgoms pas khong du chud pa'o //
translated: Realization is realization through meditation.

original: da ni rnam pa zhes bya ba ni du zhig yod /
analyzed: da ni rnam pa zhes bya ba ni du zhig yod /
translated: Now, how many aspects are there?

original: rnam pa'i rang bzhin ci zhig yin /
analyzed: rnam pa'i rang bzhin ci zhig yin /
translated: What is the nature of the aspects?

original: rnam pa de dag gang gis gzhag / ces rtog pa la /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag gang gis gzhag / ces rtog pa la /
translated: By what are those aspects established?

original: gzhi dang ye shes rnam pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhi dang ye shes rnam pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the teaching of the root text, which states, “The basis, intuition, and aspects,”

original: rtag pa la sogs par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says, “the apprehension of permanence, etc.,” and so on.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang / bdag la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang / bdag la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes the apprehension of happiness, purity, and self.

original: de ltar 'dzin pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs te byis pa rnams sred par 'khyams pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo yang 'di nyid yin pas na 'di ni 'khor ba'i gzhi'am rgyu'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs te byis pa rnams sred par 'khyams pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo yang 'di nyid yin pas na 'di ni 'khor ba'i gzhi'am rgyu'o //
translated: Such apprehension is the antithesis, and it is the principal cause of the wandering of fools in cyclic existence, and thus it is the basis or cause of cyclic existence.

original: da ni gzhi de ji ltar gzung ba ltar med par shes pa'i sgo nas gzhi shes par bstan pa ni //
analyzed: da ni gzhi de ji ltar gzung ba ltar med par shes pa'i sgo nas gzhi shes par bstan pa ni //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the knowledge of the basis by means of the knowledge that it does not exist as it is apprehended,

original: gnyen po'i chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid mi rtag pa la sogs par dmigs pa dang zhes smos te /
analyzed: gnyen po'i chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid mi rtag pa la sogs par dmigs pa dang zhes smos te /
translated: it says, “the apprehension of the reality of the antidote as impermanence, etc.,”

original: de'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: and this should be connected with the phrase “the aspects that are based on that.”

original: ye shes dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ye shes dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam dang 'bras bu ma lus pa ni ye shes rtogs pa'i gnas skabs la brjod pa tsam du zad pas na ye shes zhes bya ste /🔽de'i rnam pa zhes bya ba dang zhes kyang sbyar ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam dang 'bras bu ma lus pa ni ye shes rtogs pa'i gnas skabs la brjod pa tsam du zad pas na ye shes zhes bya ste / de'i rnam pa zhes bya ba dang zhes kyang sbyar ro //
translated: The path and result of bodhisattvas are simply described as the state of realization of wisdom, so they are called wisdom.🔽The phrase “in the aspect of” is also applied here.

original: rnam pa zhes bya ba la /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes ni yon tan smos @64a * //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya ba la / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes ni yon tan smos @64a * //
translated: Aspect.

original: pa'i sgo nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba nas 'dir yang rnam pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: pa'i sgo nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba nas 'dir yang rnam pa zhes smos te /
translated: The wisdom of the tathāgatas is described in terms of its qualities, such as being called omniscience, and here the word “aspect” is used.

original: rnam pa zhes bya ba ni drug pa mang po'i tshig can nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya ba ni drug pa mang po'i tshig can nyid do //
translated: The word “aspect” is a sixth case, plural form.

original: de ltar rnam pa ni gsum zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa ni gsum zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught that there are three aspects,

original: da ni rnam ba'i rang bzhin ci zhig la bya ba de ston pas /
analyzed: da ni rnam ba'i rang bzhin ci zhig la bya ba de ston pas /
translated: now, in order to teach what the nature of the aspects is,

original: rnam pa nyid du gzhag pa ni mtshan nyid de zhes smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa nyid du gzhag pa ni mtshan nyid de zhes smos te /
translated: it says, “The definition of the aspects is that they are posited as the nature of the aspects.”

original: dang por re zhig sngar bstan pa ltar rnam pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag du ma la bya'o zhes bstan cing /
analyzed: dang por re zhig sngar bstan pa ltar rnam pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag du ma la bya'o zhes bstan cing /
translated: First, it was taught that what is called an aspect is to be understood as a particular, as was previously explained.

original: de'i 'og tu bye brag de dag tha dad par rtogs pa srid pas de dgag par ni /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bye brag de dag tha dad par rtogs pa srid pas de dgag par ni /
translated: Then, since it is possible to understand those particulars as different, in order to refute that,

original: chos can mtshan gzhi gcig gcig gi mtshan nyid do zhes tha dad pa spong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos can mtshan gzhi gcig gcig gi mtshan nyid do zhes tha dad pa spong bar byed pa'o //
translated: it is said that the definition of the single basis, the characterized, is that.

original: de la thams cad shes pa'i rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa'i ye shes mtshan gzhi de'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la thams cad shes pa'i rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa'i ye shes mtshan gzhi de'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The twenty-seven aspects of knowing all are the basis of the defining characteristic of the gnosis that realizes the absence of a self of persons by śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: lam shes pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdag med pa rnam pa gnyi ga rtogs pa'i ye shes chen po'i mtshan gzhir gyur pa de'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: lam shes pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdag med pa rnam pa gnyi ga rtogs pa'i ye shes chen po'i mtshan gzhir gyur pa de'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The thirty-six aspects of knowing the path are the basis of the defining characteristic of the great gnosis that realizes the two types of absence of self by bodhisattvas.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa 'i rnam pa brgya rtsa bcu po rnams ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes shes bya'i dkyil 'khor ma lus pa la skad cig gis mkhyen pa'i mtshan gzhi de la brten pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa 'i rnam pa brgya rtsa bcu po rnams ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes shes bya'i dkyil 'khor ma lus pa la skad cig gis mkhyen pa'i mtshan gzhi de la brten pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The one hundred and ten aspects of the knowledge of all aspects are the characteristics based on the knowledge of the Bhagavat Buddhas that knows in a single instant the entire sphere of knowledge.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la ni 'phags pa'i skye bo ma lus pa'i yon tan lhun gyis grub cing 'jug pa zhi bas brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la ni 'phags pa'i skye bo ma lus pa'i yon tan lhun gyis grub cing 'jug pa zhi bas brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in the continuum of a Buddha all the qualities of all the noble beings are spontaneously present and are engaged in peace.

original: gzhan dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam pa las thams cad shes pa dang lam shes pas bsdus pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam pa sum cu rtsa bzhi po rnams ni theg pa thams cad ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu'i rnam par gzhag gi dngos sun thams cad shes pa dang lam shes pa'i rnam par gong du drangs te brtsi'o zhes🔽zer te / 'dir ni spyir mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid sbyar ba'o //🔽thams cad shes pa'i skabs su nyan thos rnams kyi rnam pa bcu drug smos pa ni de dag gi mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam pa las thams cad shes pa dang lam shes pas bsdus pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam pa sum cu rtsa bzhi po rnams ni theg pa thams cad ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu'i rnam par gzhag gi dngos sun thams cad shes pa dang lam shes pa'i rnam par gong du drangs te brtsi'o zhes zer te / 'dir ni spyir mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid sbyar ba'o // thams cad shes pa'i skabs su nyan thos rnams kyi rnam pa bcu drug smos pa ni de dag gi mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Others say: The thirty-seven aspects included in the knowledge of all aspects and the thirty-four aspects included in the knowledge of the path are posited as the aspects of the cause of omniscience because all vehicles are the cause of buddhahood. The actual knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge of the path are counted as above.🔽Here, in general, the basis of characteristics and the characteristics are connected.🔽The mention of the sixteen aspects in the context of the knowledge of all aspects is the characteristic of the path of seeing and cultivation for them.🔽🔽

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam pa bco lnga smos pa ni de dag gi bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtshan @64b nyid do //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam pa bco lnga smos pa ni de dag gi bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtshan @64b nyid do //

original: lam shes pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug smos pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: lam shes pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug smos pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The thirty-six aspects of knowledge of the path are the characteristics of the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam pa brgya rtsa bcu ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes chen po gcig pu de'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam pa brgya rtsa bcu ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes chen po gcig pu de'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The one hundred and ten aspects of knowledge of all aspects are the characteristics of that single great non-conceptual wisdom.

original: yang skabs der bstan pa'i thams cad shes pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun ni tshogs kyi lam dang sbyor ba'i lam dang mthong ba'i lam gyi mtshan gzhi rnams kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang skabs der bstan pa'i thams cad shes pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun ni tshogs kyi lam dang sbyor ba'i lam dang mthong ba'i lam gyi mtshan gzhi rnams kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Moreover, the thirty-seven aspects of knowledge of all explained in that context are the characteristics of the bases characterized by the path of accumulation, the path of preparation, and the path of seeing.

original: lam shes pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa bzhi ni rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: lam shes pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa bzhi ni rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The thirty-four aspects of knowledge of the path are the characteristics of the path of seeing and the path of cultivation, which are the eight liberations and the nine serial absorptions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dag ni bden pa mthong nas bsam gtan la sogs pa'i yan lag zad nas de dag la snyoms par 'jug pa'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dag ni bden pa mthong nas bsam gtan la sogs pa'i yan lag zad nas de dag la snyoms par 'jug pa'i rigs pas so //
translated: Bodhisattvas, having seen the truth, exhaust the branches of concentration, etc., and enter into meditative equipoise on them.

original: spong ba'i lam gyi rnam pa ni bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: spong ba'i lam gyi rnam pa ni bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The aspect of the path of elimination is defined as the concentration of absence of conflict.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi lam ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi lam ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The path of buddhahood is defined as the result.

original: lhag ma rnams ni sngon bzhin te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni sngon bzhin te /
translated: The rest are as before.

original: 'di ni mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi'i sgo nas rnam pa'i rang bzhin ni mtshan nyid du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi'i sgo nas rnam pa'i rang bzhin ni mtshan nyid du bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the nature of the aspects in terms of definition and illustration.

original: gal te rnam pa'i rang bzhin mtshan nyid yin na 'di dag bstan pa'i dgos pa ni ci zhig yin /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa'i rang bzhin mtshan nyid yin na 'di dag bstan pa'i dgos pa ni ci zhig yin /
translated: If the nature of the aspects is the definition, what is the purpose of teaching them?

original: 'og nas mtshan nyid dgu bcu rtsa gcig tu ston pa'i mtshan nyid rnams dang 'di la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'og nas mtshan nyid dgu bcu rtsa gcig tu ston pa'i mtshan nyid rnams dang 'di la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between these and the definitions that will be taught later as the ninety-one definitions?

original: 'di bstan pa'i dgos pa ni dang por re zhig byang chub sems dpa' thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab dag la goms pa phul du phyin pas rgyal ba'i yum bsgom pa la sogs pa la yon tan bcu bzhi yod par shes par byas pas yid spro bar
analyzed: 'di bstan pa'i dgos pa ni dang por re zhig byang chub sems dpa' thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab dag la goms pa phul du phyin pas rgyal ba'i yum bsgom pa la sogs pa la yon tan bcu bzhi yod par shes par byas pas yid spro bar
translated: The purpose of this teaching is that bodhisattvas first of all, through the perfection of their familiarity with the wisdom of listening and reflection, should understand that the mother of the conquerors has fourteen qualities, such as being the meditation and so on.

original: byas la / ji skad du bstan pa'i yon tan thob par 'dod pas skyon ji skad gsungs pa rnams ji ltar rigs par spangs te /
analyzed: byas la / ji skad du bstan pa'i yon tan thob par 'dod pas skyon ji skad gsungs pa rnams ji ltar rigs par spangs te /
translated: With their minds filled with joy, they should then, wishing to attain the qualities that have been taught, abandon the faults as they have been explained.

original: de nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi mtshan nyid rnams shes par byas pas de dag las spang ba dang blang ba dang thob bar 'gyur bar yid la byas la /
analyzed: de nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi mtshan nyid rnams shes par byas pas de dag las spang ba dang blang ba dang thob bar 'gyur bar yid la byas la /
translated: Then, by understanding the characteristics of the three omnisciences, they should keep in mind the things to be abandoned and adopted and the things to be attained.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed de sbyor ba rnam pa nyi shul bstan pa dang bcas pa'i drod la sogs pa rgyud la bskyed la /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed de sbyor ba rnam pa nyi shul bstan pa dang bcas pa'i drod la sogs pa rgyud la bskyed la /
translated: They should then generate the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation and generate the heat and so on of the path of preparation together with its twenty aspects.

original: de nas rnam pa brgya bdun cu rtsa gsum bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i rim pa 'dis ni rnam pa bstan pas ni mthong ba @65a * //
analyzed: de nas rnam pa brgya bdun cu rtsa gsum bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i rim pa 'dis ni rnam pa bstan pas ni mthong ba @65a * //
translated: Then, one should cultivate the three hundred and seventy aspects.🔽This is the order.

original: dang bsgom pa'i lam dag ji ltar bsgom pa gtsor bstan te 'di ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: dang bsgom pa'i lam dag ji ltar bsgom pa gtsor bstan te 'di ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The purpose of the teaching of the aspects is to show the principal cultivation of the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: de nyid kyis na rnam pa ni bsgom pa'i rim pa yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na rnam pa ni bsgom pa'i rim pa yin la /
translated: The aspects are the process of cultivation,

original: 'og nas 'chad pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin pa tsam zhig ston gyi bsgom pa'i rim pa ni gtsor ma gyur pas khyad par ni yod la /
analyzed: 'og nas 'chad pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin pa tsam zhig ston gyi bsgom pa'i rim pa ni gtsor ma gyur pas khyad par ni yod la /
translated: but the characteristics explained below merely indicate the nature of the three kinds of omniscience, they do not principally indicate the process of cultivation.

original: yang bdag gis go sla bar bya ba'i phyir 'dir rnam pa rnams mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhir phye ste bstan kyang /
analyzed: yang bdag gis go sla bar bya ba'i phyir 'dir rnam pa rnams mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhir phye ste bstan kyang /
translated: In order to make this easier to understand, I have distinguished the aspects into characteristics and bases of characteristics and explained them here.

original: dang por rim pa ni 'dir rnam pa ji snyed yod pa bstan la /
analyzed: dang por rim pa ni 'dir rnam pa ji snyed yod pa bstan la /
translated: The order is taught here as the number of aspects.

original: 'og nas ni mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid du ston pas na bstan pa'i lugs tha dad pa'i khyad par yod ces kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'og nas ni mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid du ston pas na bstan pa'i lugs tha dad pa'i khyad par yod ces kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: Since the basis of the characteristics and the characteristics are shown below, it should be understood that there is a difference in the system of teaching.

original: de ltar rang bzhin bstan nas da ni rnam pa de dag gang gis bzhag snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin bstan nas da ni rnam pa de dag gang gis bzhag snyam pa la /
translated: Having thus taught the nature, now, by what are those aspects established?

original: ji ltar phye ba des gzhag gi 'di la rgyu mtshan gzhan ni med ces bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar phye ba des gzhag gi 'di la rgyu mtshan gzhan ni med ces bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that they are established by the divisions, and that there is no other reason for them,

original: de dag kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bye brag gis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dag kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bye brag gis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said they are also by the distinction of the three omnisciences.

original: gsum pa 'di ni rgyu mtshan ston par bya'o //
analyzed: gsum pa 'di ni rgyu mtshan ston par bya'o //
translated: This third one should be taught as the reason.

original: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan des na rnam pa gsum kho nar bzhed do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan des na rnam pa gsum kho nar bzhed do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that by that reason, he accepts only three aspects.

original: 'dis ni grangs nges pa'i rgyu mtshan yang bstan par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni grangs nges pa'i rgyu mtshan yang bstan par dgongs pa'o //
translated: By this, he intends to teach the reason for the definite number.

original: med pa ni rtag pa'i rang bzhin med pas so //
analyzed: med pa ni rtag pa'i rang bzhin med pas so //
translated: Non-existence is the absence of the nature of permanence.

original: mi skye ba ni skad cig gcig las lhag par skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: mi skye ba ni skad cig gcig las lhag par skye ba med pa ste /
translated: Non-arising is the absence of arising beyond one moment.

original: gang skye bas 'phel ba med pa ni byung ma thag tu 'jig pas na chu'i chu bur lta bu'o zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang skye bas 'phel ba med pa ni byung ma thag tu 'jig pas na chu'i chu bur lta bu'o zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: That which does not increase through arising is like a water bubble, because it perishes as soon as it arises.

original: des na med pa ni rtag pa med pas rgyun chad par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid do //
analyzed: des na med pa ni rtag pa med pas rgyun chad par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid do //
translated: Therefore, non-existence is suffering due to the cessation of the continuum, because of the non-existence of permanence.

original: mi skye ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal skad cig re re 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal skad cig re re 'jig pa'o //
translated: Non-arising is the suffering of formations, the destruction of each moment.

original: dben pa ni byed pa po dang gtsang ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: dben pa ni byed pa po dang gtsang ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Isolation is from the doer, the pure one, and so on.

original: mi brdzi ba ni bdag med pa'i phyir bdag gi med par rtogs pas mi brdzi ba ste /
analyzed: mi brdzi ba ni bdag med pa'i phyir bdag gi med par rtogs pas mi brdzi ba ste /
translated: Non-subjugation is non-subjugation by the realization of selflessness, because of the non-existence of self.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang ci rigs su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang ci rigs su shes par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, one should understand the others as appropriate.

original: tshig gi don rnams ni go sla bas rnam par ma phye'o //
analyzed: tshig gi don rnams ni go sla bas rnam par ma phye'o //
translated: The meanings of the words are easy to understand, so they are not analyzed.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bshad pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas byung ba gang yang de bzhin nyid mi ston pa ni 'ga' yang mi srid mod kyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bshad pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas byung ba gang yang de bzhin nyid mi ston pa ni 'ga' yang mi srid mod kyi /
translated: The so-called suchness explained by all Buddhas is that it is not possible for any Buddha who appears not to teach suchness.

original: 'on kyang sangs rgyas kha cig ni theg pa gcig gis ston to //
analyzed: 'on kyang sangs rgyas kha cig ni theg pa gcig gis ston to //
translated: However, some Buddhas teach with one vehicle.

original: kha cig ni gdul bya dman pa dag rjes su @65b gzung ba'i phyir theg pa gsum gyis ston to //
analyzed: kha cig ni gdul bya dman pa dag rjes su @65b gzung ba'i phyir theg pa gsum gyis ston to //
translated: Some teach with three vehicles in order to care for inferior disciples.

original: yang kha cig ni theg pa lngas ston pa ni gdul bya skrag pa spang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang kha cig ni theg pa lngas ston pa ni gdul bya skrag pa spang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Still others teach with five vehicles in order to eliminate the fear of disciples.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa sa'i snying po 'khor lo bcu pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo las kyang /🔽bad kan nad la 'o na 'thung bcug bzhin //
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa sa'i snying po 'khor lo bcu pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo las kyang / bad kan nad la 'o na 'thung bcug bzhin //
translated: As the noble Sāgaramati Sūtra says,🔽Just as milk is medicine for some,

original: de phyir dug tu 'gyur gyi nad mi sel //
analyzed: de phyir dug tu 'gyur gyi nad mi sel //
translated: but for others poison is prescribed,🔽so the Buddha teaches the way of the disciples

original: de bzhin snod min nyan thos theg pa dag / theg chen bshad pa thos na rmongs 'gyur zhing //🔽chad par lta la ngan song lhung 'gyur bas //
analyzed: de bzhin snod min nyan thos theg pa dag / theg chen bshad pa thos na rmongs 'gyur zhing // chad par lta la ngan song lhung 'gyur bas //
translated: to some, and to others the way of the solitary sages.🔽To some he teaches the way of the bodhisattva,🔽and to some he teaches the way of the Buddha.

original: des ni dbang po brtags te chos bstan to //
analyzed: des ni dbang po brtags te chos bstan to //
translated: The Buddha teaches the Dharma after examining their faculties.

original: zhes gsungs te rgya cher ni theg pa gcig tu ston pa 'phags pa dam pa'i chos pad ma dkar po'i mdo las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs te rgya cher ni theg pa gcig tu ston pa 'phags pa dam pa'i chos pad ma dkar po'i mdo las shes par bya'o //
translated: The teaching of one vehicle should be understood in detail from the noble Sūtra on the White Lotus of the Sacred Teachings.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bshad pa'i de bzhin nyid de ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bshad pa'i de bzhin nyid de ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
translated: Thus, that suchness taught by all the buddhas is nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that nirvana?

original: de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa'o zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa'o zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: It is the purification of suchness.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos su bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos su bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught as the Dharma of the Buddha.

original: chos thams cad ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas rnams so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas rnams so //
translated: All dharmas are the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: de dag la mnga' sgyur ba ni spang ba dang / mngon du bya ba dang / bstan pa dang bcas pa dang / skyed pa dang / dgag pa dang / bskal pa skad cig tu bya ba dang / skad cig bskal pa tsam du byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la mnga' sgyur ba ni spang ba dang / mngon du bya ba dang / bstan pa dang bcas pa dang / skyed pa dang / dgag pa dang / bskal pa skad cig tu bya ba dang / skad cig bskal pa tsam du byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Dominion over them is the abandonment, the realization, the teaching, the production, the cessation, the transformation of a kalpa into an instant, the transformation of an instant into a kalpa, and so forth.

original: de ltar chos thams cad la mnga' sgyur ba de ni rang byung gi mthu'o //
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad la mnga' sgyur ba de ni rang byung gi mthu'o //
translated: Such dominion over all dharmas is the power of self-arising.

original: de la rang byung gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rang byung gang zhe na /
translated: What is self-arising?

original: rang byung gi ye shes so //
analyzed: rang byung gi ye shes so //
translated: It is self-arising gnosis.

original: de yang gnyis te chos kyi dbyings dang / srid pa tha ma pas thob pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de yang gnyis te chos kyi dbyings dang / srid pa tha ma pas thob pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Moreover, it is twofold: the basic element of the Dharma and the pristine wisdom of omniscience obtained by one in his last existence.

original: de la chos kyi dbyings kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de la chos kyi dbyings kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: With regard to the basic element of the Dharma,

original: ji skad du 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las /
translated: it is as the noble Array of Stalks says,🔽Some world-realms are destroyed

original: 'jig rten khams rnams la la dag / bsam gyis mi khyab tshig gyur kyang //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams rnams la la dag / bsam gyis mi khyab tshig gyur kyang //
translated: in inconceivable ways,

original: nam mkha' 'jig par 'gyur ba med //
analyzed: nam mkha' 'jig par 'gyur ba med //
translated: but space is not destroyed.

original: rang byung ye shes de bzhin no //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang byung ye shes de bzhin no // zhes gsungs so //
translated: So it is with naturally occurring pristine wisdom.

original: de ji ltar rang byung gi ye shes yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar rang byung gi ye shes yin zhe na /
translated: How is it naturally occurring pristine wisdom?

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyi rnam pas ma byas pa'i phyir dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyi rnam pas ma byas pa'i phyir dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not made by causes and conditions, and because it is the cause of non-conceptual pristine wisdom.

original: gzhan dag ni rgyal ba'i yum las /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rgyal ba'i yum las /
translated: Others say that the Mother of the Victorious Ones

original: ye shes kyi yul ni gang yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ye shes kyi yul ni gang yang ma yin no //
translated: says that the object of pristine wisdom is nothing at all.

original: ye shes kyang gang gi yul yang ma yin no //🔽ye @66a * //
analyzed: ye shes kyang gang gi yul yang ma yin no // ye @66a * //
translated: Pristine wisdom is also the object of nothing at all.

original: shis ni yul med pa'o //
analyzed: shis ni yul med pa'o //
translated: Pristine wisdom is without object.

original: gal te ye shes la yul yod na mi shes par 'gyur ro //🔽zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: gal te ye shes la yul yod na mi shes par 'gyur ro // zhes gsungs pas /
translated: If there were an object of pristine wisdom, it would not be pristine wisdom.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa de nyid ye shes su 'dod de /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa de nyid ye shes su 'dod de /
translated: Thus, the pure expanse of reality is asserted to be pristine wisdom.

original: de ltar byas na shin tu 'dus chos lngas sangs rgyas kyi sa bsdus te zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na shin tu 'dus chos lngas sangs rgyas kyi sa bsdus te zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, it would contradict the statement, “The stage of a buddha is summarized by five topics.
