original: srid pa tham pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pa'i dbang du byas te ni byang chub sems dpa' dus ring du dge ba'i bshes gnyen rab tu mnyes par byas pa'i gdams ngag rab tu bstan pa thos pas tshe de la slob dpon med pa'i ye shes
analyzed: srid pa tham pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pa'i dbang du byas te ni byang chub sems dpa' dus ring du dge ba'i bshes gnyen rab tu mnyes par byas pa'i gdams ngag rab tu bstan pa thos pas tshe de la slob dpon med pa'i ye shes
translated: From the perspective of attaining the pristine wisdom of omniscience through the complete purification of all states of existence, a bodhisattva who has heard the instructions taught by a virtuous spiritual friend whom he has pleased for a long time attains pristine wisdom without a master in that lifetime.

original: brnyes pas na gzhan la rab ma lus pa'i phyir rang byung ste /
analyzed: brnyes pas na gzhan la rab ma lus pa'i phyir rang byung ste /
translated: Because it is not dependent on another, it is self-originated.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: nyer 'gro nga ni sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: nyer 'gro nga ni sangs rgyas te /
translated: O Upatiṣya, I am a buddha.

original: nga la slob dpon su yang med /🔽ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nga la slob dpon su yang med /🔽ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: I have no master.

original: de la rang byung dang po ni sngar bstan pa'i de bzhin nyid sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rang byung dang po ni sngar bstan pa'i de bzhin nyid sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsungs pa'o //
translated: The first self-arisen one is thusness, as previously explained, the speech of all buddhas.

original: 'di ni rang byung gnyis pa bzung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rang byung gnyis pa bzung ste /
translated: The second self-arisen one is taken to be this.🔽It is self-arisen through the power of habituation over many eons.

original: bskal pa mang por goms pa'i mthu las rang 'byung yang 'thob la de bzhin du goms pa'i mthu las chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba ni /🔽goms te sla bar ma gyur pa'i //
analyzed: bskal pa mang por goms pa'i mthu las rang 'byung yang 'thob la de bzhin du goms pa'i mthu las chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba ni / goms te sla bar ma gyur pa'i //
translated: In the same way, through the power of habituation, one gains mastery over all phenomena.🔽As it is said:🔽There is nothing that does not become easy

original: dngos de gang yang yod ma yin //🔽zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dngos de gang yang yod ma yin // zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: through habituation.

original: yun de srid du bsod nams bsags pa'i mthu las kyang dbang sgyur bar 'gyur ba ni /🔽bsod nams ldang pa'i mi yi bsam pa rnams kyang 'grub //
analyzed: yun de srid du bsod nams bsags pa'i mthu las kyang dbang sgyur bar 'gyur ba ni / bsod nams ldang pa'i mi yi bsam pa rnams kyang 'grub //
translated: And through the power of accumulating merit for that length of time, one gains mastery.

original: ces gsungs la /
analyzed: ces gsungs la /
translated: As it is said:🔽Even the thoughts of a person with merit come to fruition.

original: rgyas par ni gzhon nu bsod nams stobs kyi rtogs pa brjod pa'i mdo las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par ni gzhon nu bsod nams stobs kyi rtogs pa brjod pa'i mdo las shes par bya'o //
translated: And this is explained in detail in the Sutra of the Realization of the Youth Sudhanakumara.

original: gzhan yang chos thams cad la mnga' sgyur ba'i gtso bo ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos thams cad la mnga' sgyur ba'i gtso bo ni /
translated: Moreover, the principal mastery over all phenomena is

original: chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa'i //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa'i //
translated: the mastery of the dharmadhatu.

original: 'di ltar chos yod ma yin te //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos yod ma yin te //
translated: Thus, phenomena do not exist.

original: zhes bya ba dang / dngos gcig dngos po kun gyi ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / dngos gcig dngos po kun gyi ngo bo nyid /
translated: And: The nature of one thing is the nature of all things.

original: dngos kun dngos po gcig gi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: dngos kun dngos po gcig gi ngo bo nyid //
translated: The nature of all things is the nature of one thing.

original: gang gis dngos gcig de bzhin nyid du rtogs //
analyzed: gang gis dngos gcig de bzhin nyid du rtogs //
translated: Whoever understands the suchness of one thing

original: de yes dngos kun de bzhin nyid du rtogs //
analyzed: de yes dngos kun de bzhin nyid du rtogs //
translated: understands the suchness of all things.

original: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas gang gis chos kyi dbyings shes na de'i mthus ji ltar 'dod pa tsam la rag las pa 'di nyid yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas gang gis chos kyi dbyings shes na de'i mthus ji ltar 'dod pa tsam la rag las pa 'di nyid yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Through this reasoning, one should understand that when one understands the dharmadhatu, through its power, one has mastery over things, and one can create whatever one wishes.

original: de ltar de bzhin nyid la dmigs te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob @66b pas na dngos po rnams la dbang sgyur pa'i mthu'i sgo nas ni rang byang du bzhag la de nyid sna tshogs ma 'dres par mkhyen pa'i sgo nas ni rnam pa thams
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin nyid la dmigs te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob @66b pas na dngos po rnams la dbang sgyur pa'i mthu'i sgo nas ni rang byang du bzhag la de nyid sna tshogs ma 'dres par mkhyen pa'i sgo nas ni rnam pa thams
translated: Thus, by focusing on suchness and attaining the gnosis of omniscience, one has mastery over things.

original: cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam pa zhes bya ste khyad par ni 'di tsam du zad do //
analyzed: cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam pa zhes bya ste khyad par ni 'di tsam du zad do //
translated: This is the only difference.

original: kha cig ni rang byang gi rgyu dang chos can yin la rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni 'bras bu dang chos can de'i chos nyid do zhes zer zhing de'i lung ni /
analyzed: kha cig ni rang byang gi rgyu dang chos can yin la rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni 'bras bu dang chos can de'i chos nyid do zhes zer zhing de'i lung ni /
translated: Some say: The cause and basis of a Solitary Realizer is the cause and basis of a Solitary Realizer, but the complete and perfect enlightenment of all aspects is the result and the reality of that basis.🔽The scriptural passage is:

original: rigs kyi bu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring nge 'dzin sangs rgyas shin tu rnam par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring nge 'dzin sangs rgyas shin tu rnam par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: “Son of the family, after the Bhagavan Buddhas fully and completely manifest enlightenment, they enter into the concentration of a Buddha that is fully and completely enlightened.

original: ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu sems can rnams ji snyed pa de snyed kyi sku kun tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu sems can rnams ji snyed pa de snyed kyi sku kun tu gnas pa'o //
translated: Immediately after entering that concentration, they abide in a body that is equal to the number of sentient beings.

original: sku ji snyed pa de nyid kyi gsungs dang thugs kun tu gnas so zhes gsungs pa'o zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: sku ji snyed pa de nyid kyi gsungs dang thugs kun tu gnas so zhes gsungs pa'o zhes 'dod do //
translated: The number of bodies is equal to the number of their speech and minds.”

original: nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' bye brag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni lam thams cad bsgom par bya ba yin zhes sngar bstan pas na /
analyzed: nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' bye brag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni lam thams cad bsgom par bya ba yin zhes sngar bstan pas na /
translated: The phrase due to the distinction of sravakas and bodhisattvas and so on indicates that it was previously taught that all paths are to be cultivated by bodhisattvas.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid byang chub sems dpas 'dris par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa na zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid byang chub sems dpas 'dris par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa na zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: When cultivating the knowledge of all aspects in order to become familiar with it, it is contaminated.

original: de dag ni ched du nyon mongs pa mi spong gi zil gyis gnon pa tsam zhig byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni ched du nyon mongs pa mi spong gi zil gyis gnon pa tsam zhig byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not abandon the afflictions on purpose, but only suppress them.

original: de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis bsgom pa'i tshe ni zag pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis bsgom pa'i tshe ni zag pa med pa ste /
translated: When cultivating it, sravakas and pratyekabuddhas make it uncontaminated.

original: de dag ni nyon mongs pa rnams mda' dug can dang 'dra bar spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni nyon mongs pa rnams mda' dug can dang 'dra bar spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They abandon the afflictions as if they were poisoned arrows.

original: de ni go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni don bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni don bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase in accordance with their order indicates the meaning.

original: nyon mongs pa shin tu ma spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'od srungs grong khyer chen po'i phyag dar dang ldan lji na dang mi gtsang ba rnams ni bu ram shing gi zhing dang / 'bras kyi shing dang / ril gyi zhing dag la phan par byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa shin tu ma spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'od srungs grong khyer chen po'i phyag dar dang ldan lji na dang mi gtsang ba rnams ni bu ram shing gi zhing dang / 'bras kyi shing dang / ril gyi zhing dag la phan par byed do //
translated: Kāśyapa, the dust and dirt of a great city is beneficial to sugarcane fields, rice fields, and grapevines.🔽Kāśyapa, in the same way, the afflictions of bodhisattvas are beneficial to enlightenment.

original: 'od drungs de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa yang byang chub la phan par byed do zhes gsungs pa'i dgongs pa mthong nas mi spong pa ste /
analyzed: 'od drungs de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa yang byang chub la phan par byed do zhes gsungs pa'i dgongs pa mthong nas mi spong pa ste /
translated: Seeing the intention of this statement, one should not abandon the afflictions.🔽Moreover, it is taught:

original: gzhan yang / thabs chen dag dang ldan pa la //
analyzed: gzhan yang / thabs chen dag dang ldan pa la //
translated: For those with great means,

original: nyon mongs byang chub yan lag 'gyur //🔽zhes bstan te /🔽yan lag gi don ni rgyu'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs byang chub yan lag 'gyur // zhes bstan te / yan lag gi don ni rgyu'i don to //
translated: the afflictions become limbs of enlightenment.

original: zag @67a * //
analyzed: zag @67a * //
translated: The meaning of “limb” is the meaning of “cause.”

original: pa ni nyon mongs pa'i ming gi bye brag ste 'di dag gis khams de dang der zag cing ltung par byed pas na zag pa ste zag pa ni ltung ba'i ming gi khyad par ro //
analyzed: pa ni nyon mongs pa'i ming gi bye brag ste 'di dag gis khams de dang der zag cing ltung par byed pas na zag pa ste zag pa ni ltung ba'i ming gi khyad par ro //
translated: Contaminants are specific types of afflictions. They are called “contaminants” because they contaminate and cause one to fall into that and that realm. “Contaminant” is a specific type of “falling.”

original: de bzhin du kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa dang / chu bo dang / sbyor ba dang / nye bar len pa dang / mdud pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa dang / chu bo dang / sbyor ba dang / nye bar len pa dang / mdud pa dang /
translated: Likewise, the terms fetter, bond, latent tendency, secondary affliction, entangle-ment, flood, yoke, grasping, knot,

original: sgrib pa dang / tha dag dang / dri ma dang / zug rdu dang / lci yang dang / nyes par spyod pa dang / phongs pa dang / yongs su gdung ba dang / 'khrug pa dang / 'thab pa dang / rims nad dang / nags sbyor dang /
analyzed: sgrib pa dang / tha dag dang / dri ma dang / zug rdu dang / lci yang dang / nyes par spyod pa dang / phongs pa dang / yongs su gdung ba dang / 'khrug pa dang / 'thab pa dang / rims nad dang / nags sbyor dang /
translated: obstruction, stain, dart, heavy and light, misdeed, misfortune, torment, quarrel, fight, fever, and thicket,

original: gags zhes bya ba rnams kyis kyang brjod par bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: gags zhes bya ba rnams kyis kyang brjod par bya ba rnams so //
translated: are also used to refer to the same things.

original: sbyor ba khyad par can dag gis zhes bya ba la sbyor ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba khyad par can dag gis zhes bya ba la sbyor ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi'o //
translated: By means of special applications. Application refers to the four stages conducive to penetration.

original: khyad par can ni nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par du gyur pa rgyu dang yongs su 'dzin pa la sogs pas khyad par du 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: khyad par can ni nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par du gyur pa rgyu dang yongs su 'dzin pa la sogs pas khyad par du 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Special means superior to those of the sravakas, etc., because they are superior in cause, in possession, etc.

original: yang na sngar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi skabs su sbyor ba bstan pa rnams ni thos pa dang bsam pa'i yul du gyur pas na mchog ma yin la /
analyzed: yang na sngar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi skabs su sbyor ba bstan pa rnams ni thos pa dang bsam pa'i yul du gyur pas na mchog ma yin la /
translated: Or else, the applications taught in the context of the three knowledges above are not supreme because they are the domain of hearing and reflection.

original: 'dir ni bsgom pa'i bya ba byas pas na mchog ces bya bar gdags so //
analyzed: 'dir ni bsgom pa'i bya ba byas pas na mchog ces bya bar gdags so //
translated: But here, since one performs the action of meditation, it is called supreme.

original: 'dir yang sbyor ba ni nyi shu zhes bsdus te /
analyzed: 'dir yang sbyor ba ni nyi shu zhes bsdus te /
translated: Here too, the application is twenty,

original: bstan pa nyi nges par 'gyed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi char gyi skabs su sbyor bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bstan pa nyi nges par 'gyed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi char gyi skabs su sbyor bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: because it should be applied in the context of all four aspects of the path of definite separation. This should be understood.

original: tshig gi don ni go sla'o //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the words is easy to understand.

original: yon tan zhes bya ba la yon tan 'di dag ni las dang po pa'i sa nas brtsams te ldan mod kyi legs par 'byor ba ni drod thob pa yan chad la sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: yon tan zhes bya ba la yon tan 'di dag ni las dang po pa'i sa nas brtsams te ldan mod kyi legs par 'byor ba ni drod thob pa yan chad la sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: As for the qualities, although these qualities begin from the stage of the beginner, their full development is to be applied from the stage of attaining warmth.

original: tshig gi don ni go sla bas ma bye'o //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni go sla bas ma bye'o //
translated: Since the meaning of the words is easy to understand, I will not elaborate.

original: bar chad byed pa skyon zhes bya ba ni las dang po pa'i sa nas bsgom pa'i lam phal pa'i bar du ldan par gzhag mod kyi //
analyzed: bar chad byed pa skyon zhes bya ba ni las dang po pa'i sa nas bsgom pa'i lam phal pa'i bar du ldan par gzhag mod kyi //
translated: The so-called faults that are obstacles are indeed to be posited as connected from the stage of the beginner up to the ordinary path of cultivation.

original: 'on kyang skyon 'di dag ni phal cher las dang po pa'i sa dang sbyor ba'i lam la rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang skyon 'di dag ni phal cher las dang po pa'i sa dang sbyor ba'i lam la rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: However, these faults are mostly posited on the stage of the beginner and on the path of preparation.

original: de ltar na yon tan gyis lam gong ma gong ma la ldan la /
analyzed: de ltar na yon tan gyis lam gong ma gong ma la ldan la /
translated: Thus, the qualities are to be known as connected to the higher and higher paths,

original: skyon ni lam 'og ma 'og ma la ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skyon ni lam 'og ma 'og ma la ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: and the faults are to be known as connected to the lower and lower paths.

original: da ni 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now this should be stated:

original: 'phags pa nam mkha'i mdzod kyis zhus pa'i mdo las /🔽bdud kyi las rab tu rig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @67b pa dang ; dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi man ngag gis bsdus so zhes gsungs pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbang du byas te ni yongs su 'dzin pa'i skabs dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa nam mkha'i mdzod kyis zhus pa'i mdo las / bdud kyi las rab tu rig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @67b pa dang ; dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi man ngag gis bsdus so zhes gsungs pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbang du byas te ni yongs su 'dzin pa'i skabs dang /
translated: In the noble Akasagarbhasutra,🔽it is said that the thorough knowledge of the activities of Mara is included in the perfection of wisdom and in the instructions of the spiritual master.🔽With respect to the perfection of wisdom, it should be understood that it is taught extensively in the section on thorough grasping

original: skabs 'dir mdo las rgyas par bstan pa khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir mdo las rgyas par bstan pa khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: and in this section.

original: gang lung gzhan las legs par bsdus pa de ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag ste /
analyzed: gang lung gzhan las legs par bsdus pa de ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag ste /
translated: The instructions of a spiritual master are the well-summarized teachings from other scriptures.

original: de ni ji skad du 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i le'u las /
analyzed: de ni ji skad du 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i le'u las /
translated: As it says in the chapter on the supramundane perfections in the Bodhisattva Levels:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud de /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud de /
translated: “O son of good family, there are ten demons for bodhisattvas.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di ltar mngon par chags pa'i phyir phung po'i bdud dang / glags su 'gyur ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / sgrib pa'i phyir las kyi bdud dang / slong ba'i phyir sems kyi bdud dang / skyes pa dang bral bar byed pas the tshom gyi bdud dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon par chags pa'i phyir phung po'i bdud dang / glags su 'gyur ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / sgrib pa'i phyir las kyi bdud dang / slong ba'i phyir sems kyi bdud dang / skyes pa dang bral bar byed pas the tshom gyi bdud dang /
translated: They are the demon of the aggregates, because of their attachment; the demon of the afflictions, because they provide an opportunity; the demon of karma, because of its obscuring; the demon of mental states, because of their arising; the demon of doubt, because of its separation from what has arisen;

original: g-yo ba dang rlom bar 'gyur ba dang bag med par spyod pas lha'i bu'i bdud dang / de la zhen pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bdud dang / ro myong bar byed pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi bdud dang / gzugs brnyan gyi phyir dge ba'i bzhes gnyen gyi bdud dang /
analyzed: g-yo ba dang rlom bar 'gyur ba dang bag med par spyod pas lha'i bu'i bdud dang / de la zhen pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bdud dang / ro myong bar byed pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi bdud dang / gzugs brnyan gyi phyir dge ba'i bzhes gnyen gyi bdud dang /
translated: The demon of the divine sons is due to being unsteady, conceited, and indulging in carelessness. The demon of the roots of virtue is due to attachment to them. The demon of meditative concentration is due to savoring them. The demon of virtuous friends is due to taking their reflections as real.

original: smon lam mngon par mi bsgrub pas /
analyzed: smon lam mngon par mi bsgrub pas /
translated: The demon of not accomplishing prayers is due to not accomplishing them.

original: chos kyi ye shes khong du chud ba'i bdud do //
analyzed: chos kyi ye shes khong du chud ba'i bdud do //
translated: The demon of not realizing the wisdom of the Dharma is due to not realizing it.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud de dag yongs su spang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' brtson par bya ba dag go zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud de dag yongs su spang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' brtson par bya ba dag go zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: O son of the conquerors, these ten are the demons of the bodhisattvas.

original: yang de nyid las /
analyzed: yang de nyid las /
translated: The same text says,

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las te /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las te /
translated: “O son of the conquerors, these ten are the activities of demons for bodhisattvas.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems nyams par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba brtsams pa thams cad ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems nyams par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba brtsams pa thams cad ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: In this way, all the roots of virtue that are undertaken to undermine the Awakening Mind are the work of Māra.

original: sems mi nyam pa'i sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa la yongs su 'khrugs pa dang / ngan sems dang ldan pa yongs su spong ba dang / le lo can yongs su gtong ba dang / sems 'khrugs pa la brnyas pa dang /
analyzed: sems mi nyam pa'i sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa la yongs su 'khrugs pa dang / ngan sems dang ldan pa yongs su spong ba dang / le lo can yongs su gtong ba dang / sems 'khrugs pa la brnyas pa dang /
translated: Giving to those who are undermining the Awakening Mind, being angry with those who have broken their ethics, avoiding those who are full of ill will, giving up on the lazy, despising those whose minds are disturbed,

original: shes rab 'chal pa can smod pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal pa can smod pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: and disparaging the unwise are the work of Māra.

original: chos la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud byed pa dang / bcab pa dang / chos kyi snod la khyad du gsod pa dang / zang zing dang 'brel par chos ston pa ni @68a * //
analyzed: chos la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud byed pa dang / bcab pa dang / chos kyi snod la khyad du gsod pa dang / zang zing dang 'brel par chos ston pa ni @68a * //
translated: Being stingy with the Dharma out of a sense of proprietorship, being secretive, despising those who are receptive to the Dharma, and teaching the Dharma for the sake of material reward

original: bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: bdud kyi las so //
translated: are the work of Māra.

original: snod ma yin pa la chos rgya chen po ston pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: snod ma yin pa la chos rgya chen po ston pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: Teaching the vast Dharma to those who are not receptive is the work of Māra.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mi thos pa dang thos nas log par 'jug pa dang / log par zhugs nas le lo byed pa dang / le lo byas nas sems zhum par byed pa dang / sems zhum par gyur nas byang chub kyi lam yangs pa dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems pas byung ba'i chos mi 'byung ba ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mi thos pa dang thos nas log par 'jug pa dang / log par zhugs nas le lo byed pa dang / le lo byas nas sems zhum par byed pa dang / sems zhum par gyur nas byang chub kyi lam yangs pa dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems pas byung ba'i chos mi 'byung ba ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: Not hearing the perfections, or, having heard them, misapprehending them; misapprehending them, being lazy; being lazy, one’s mind becomes slack; with a slack mind, the mind and mental activities do not arise which are associated with the broad path of enlightenment.🔽This is the work of Mara.

original: sdig pa'i grogs po brten pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen yongs su spong ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'dod pa dang ; skye ba'i skye mched la mngon par mi dga' ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang /
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po brten pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen yongs su spong ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'dod pa dang ; skye ba'i skye mched la mngon par mi dga' ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang /
translated: To rely on evil friends, to abandon spiritual friends, to desire the vehicles of the disciples and the solitary Buddhas, to take no delight in the doors to the states of rebirth, to delight in nirvana,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / sems nye bar zhi ba ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / sems nye bar zhi ba ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: to be free from passion, and to have a mind at peace—this is the work of Mara.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la zhe sdang ba'i bsam pa dang / mi snyan pa brjod pa dang / thob pa'i gegs byed ba dang / 'khrul pa'i skyon tshol ba dang / mi bde ba'i mig gis lta ba ni bdud kyi las so //🔽dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / ma thos pa'i mdo sde thos nas smod pa dang / chos smra ba gzhan gyis bshad pa nyan par mi dga' zhing brnyas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la zhe sdang ba'i bsam pa dang / mi snyan pa brjod pa dang / thob pa'i gegs byed ba dang / 'khrul pa'i skyon tshol ba dang / mi bde ba'i mig gis lta ba ni bdud kyi las so // dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / ma thos pa'i mdo sde thos nas smod pa dang / chos smra ba gzhan gyis bshad pa nyan par mi dga' zhing brnyas te /
translated: It is a deed of Mara if one has an attitude of hostility toward the Bodhisattvas, if one speaks unpleasantly of them, if one creates obstacles to their attainment, if one seeks out their errors and faults, or if one looks at them with an unhappy countenance.

original: khyad du gsod pa dang / bdag bstod pa dang gzhan smod pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: khyad du gsod pa dang / bdag bstod pa dang gzhan smod pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: It is a deed of Mara if one rejects the holy Dharma, if one criticizes the Sutras one has not heard, if one does not like to listen to the explanations of other Dharma teachers, if one despises them, if one holds them in contempt, if one praises oneself, and if one disparages others.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa tshol zhing yi ge sna tshogs dang / 'bru sna tshogs su rang bzor byas pa'i rang bzo la dga' ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi gtam rjes su dran pa dang / zab mo'i gtam 'chab cing sbed pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa tshol zhing yi ge sna tshogs dang / 'bru sna tshogs su rang bzor byas pa'i rang bzo la dga' ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi gtam rjes su dran pa dang / zab mo'i gtam 'chab cing sbed pa dang /
translated: It is a deed of Mara if one delights in one's own compositions, in various kinds of literature and various kinds of poetry, if one recalls the teachings of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, if one conceals and hides the profound teachings,🔽and if one does not give them to others.

original: gtam sna tshogs rnam par brjod pa dang / snod ma yin pa la zab mo'i chos ston pa dang / byang chub kyi lam mi tshol ba dang / lam ngan pa'i rgyud la gnas pa ni bdud kyi las so //🔽grol ba dang / rgal ba dang / dbugs phyin pa la brten cing bsnyen pa dang bkur ba dang / rim gro byed kyi ma grol ba dang / ma brgal ba dang / dbugs ma phyin pa la ni mi brten mi bsnyen bkur bar mi byed /
analyzed: gtam sna tshogs rnam par brjod pa dang / snod ma yin pa la zab mo'i chos ston pa dang / byang chub kyi lam mi tshol ba dang / lam ngan pa'i rgyud la gnas pa ni bdud kyi las so // grol ba dang / rgal ba dang / dbugs phyin pa la brten cing bsnyen pa dang bkur ba dang / rim gro byed kyi ma grol ba dang / ma brgal ba dang / dbugs ma phyin pa la ni mi brten mi bsnyen bkur bar mi byed /
translated: To speak in various ways, to teach the profound to those who are not fit vessels, to not seek the path of awakening, and to abide in a continuum of bad paths are the work of Māra.🔽To rely on, to approach, to honor, and to serve those who are liberated, who have crossed over, and who have found relief, but not to rely on, to not approach, to not honor, and to not serve those who are not liberated, who have not crossed over, and who have not found relief,

original: rim gror mi byed yongs su smin par mi byed pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal du lhung ste /
analyzed: rim gror mi byed yongs su smin par mi byed pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal du lhung ste /
translated: to fall into manifest pride,

original: su la'ang mi 'dud cing nga rgyal yongs su 'phel bar byed pa dang / sems can la khong khro @68b ba dang / chos kyi ye shes mi tshol ba dang / ye shes kyi gter mi bsrung ba dang / sems rtag tu bslang ba dang /
analyzed: su la'ang mi 'dud cing nga rgyal yongs su 'phel bar byed pa dang / sems can la khong khro @68b ba dang / chos kyi ye shes mi tshol ba dang / ye shes kyi gter mi bsrung ba dang / sems rtag tu bslang ba dang /
translated: to not bow to anyone, and to increase one’s pride, to be angry with sentient beings, to not seek the wisdom of the Dharma, to not guard the treasure of wisdom, to always be agitated,🔽and to not be patient with the Dharma are the work of Māra.

original: mgu dka' zhing gsol ba gdab par dka' ba ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: mgu dka' zhing gsol ba gdab par dka' ba ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: It is the work of Mara if one finds it hard to be satisfied and hard to pray.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las te ;
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las te ;
translated: O Son of the Victor, these ten are the works of Mara for the bodhisattvas.

original: de dag yongs su spangs shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos tshol bar 'gyur ba dag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag yongs su spangs shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos tshol bar 'gyur ba dag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: Having completely abandoned them, the bodhisattvas will seek the qualities of the Buddha.

original: yang de nyid las /
analyzed: yang de nyid las /
translated: And the same text says,

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs te /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs te /
translated: O Son of the Victor, these ten are the Mara-inspired thoughts of the bodhisattvas.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?🔽They are:

original: 'di ltar sems zhum par gyur pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so //🔽bsam pa 'khrugs pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems zhum par gyur pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so // bsam pa 'khrugs pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so //
translated: The Mara-inspired thought of a depressed mind;🔽The Mara-inspired thought of a disturbed mind;

original: rgyal chung ngus mgu ba ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so //
analyzed: rgyal chung ngus mgu ba ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so //
translated: The Mara-inspired thought of being satisfied with a small amount;

original: gcig la mi bzod pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so //
analyzed: gcig la mi bzod pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so //
translated: The Mara-inspired thought of not being patient with a single person;

original: smon lam las lhag par mi dmigs pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so //
analyzed: smon lam las lhag par mi dmigs pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so //
translated: The Mara-inspired thought of not being concerned with a vow that exceeds one’s present abilities;

original: nyon mongs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang zhi ba 'dod pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so //🔽'khor ba'i rgyun gcod pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang zhi ba 'dod pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so // 'khor ba'i rgyun gcod pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so //
translated: The wish to turn away from and to pacify the afflictions is the blessing of Mara.🔽Cutting off the continuum of cyclic existence is the blessing of Mara.

original: spyod pa las phyir bzlog pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so //
analyzed: spyod pa las phyir bzlog pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so //
translated: Turning away from practice is the blessing of Mara.

original: sems can yongs su smin par mi byed pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par mi byed pa ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so //
translated: Not bringing sentient beings to full maturity is the blessing of Mara.

original: chos la the tshom za zhing dam pa'i chos spong ba ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so //
analyzed: chos la the tshom za zhing dam pa'i chos spong ba ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs so //
translated: Having doubts about the Dharma and rejecting the sublime Dharma is the blessing of Mara.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po de dag ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs te /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po de dag ni bdud kyi byin gyi rlabs te /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones, these ten are the blessings of Mara.

original: de dag yongs su spangs shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rlabs bla na med pa thob par 'gyur bdag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag yongs su spangs shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rlabs bla na med pa thob par 'gyur bdag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: Abandoning them, the bodhisattvas will attain the unsurpassed blessing.

original: yang 'phags pa 'jam dpal rnam par 'phrul pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: yang 'phags pa 'jam dpal rnam par 'phrul pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Moreover, the noble Sūtra on the Play of Mañjuśrī also says:

original: lha'i bu nyid shu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las yang dag phul nyi shu yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu nyid shu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las yang dag phul nyi shu yin no //
translated: These twenty are the bodhisattvas’ twenty supreme demonic forces.

original: nyi shu gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyi shu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa ba rnam par grol ba 'dod cing 'khor bas skrag pa rnams la bsnyen pa dang brten pa dang bsnyen bkur byed pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa ba rnam par grol ba 'dod cing 'khor bas skrag pa rnams la bsnyen pa dang brten pa dang bsnyen bkur byed pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: For those who practice yoga, who desire liberation, and who are afraid of cyclic existence, to be devoted to, to rely on, and to serve them is a demonic force.

original: stong pa nyid la so sor rtogs cing sems can yal bar 'dor ba yang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la so sor rtogs cing sems can yal bar 'dor ba yang bdud kyi las so //
translated: To understand emptiness and to abandon sentient beings is a demonic force.

original: 'dus ma byas la so sor rtog cing 'dus byas kyi dge ba'i rtsa bas yongs su skyo ba yang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la so sor rtog cing 'dus byas kyi dge ba'i rtsa bas yongs su skyo ba yang bdud kyi las so //
translated: To understand the unconditioned and to be discouraged by the roots of virtue that are conditioned is a demonic force.

original: @69a * // bsam gtan bskyed cing bsam gtan las rnam par ldog pa tshol ba yang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: @69a * // bsam gtan bskyed cing bsam gtan las rnam par ldog pa tshol ba yang bdud kyi las so //
translated: To generate meditative concentration and to seek to turn away from meditative concentration is a demonic force.

original: chos ston kyang chos nyan par rnams la snying rje chen po mi bskyed pa yang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: chos ston kyang chos nyan par rnams la snying rje chen po mi bskyed pa yang bdud kyi las so //
translated: To teach the Dharma and not to generate great compassion for those who listen to the Dharma is a demonic force.

original: yongs tan dang ldan pa dang sbyin gnas tshol zhing tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la khong khro ba yang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: yongs tan dang ldan pa dang sbyin gnas tshol zhing tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la khong khro ba yang bdud kyi las so //
translated: To seek out those who are endowed with good qualities and worthy of offerings, and to be angry with those who have faulty discipline is also the work of Māra.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi gtam ston cing theg pa chen po'i gtam 'chab pa yang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi gtam ston cing theg pa chen po'i gtam 'chab pa yang bdud kyi las so //
translated: To teach the vehicle of the hearers and solitary buddhas, and to conceal the teachings of the Great Vehicle, is also the work of Māra.

original: zab mo'i gtam 'chab cing gtam sna tshogs su ston pa yang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: zab mo'i gtam 'chab cing gtam sna tshogs su ston pa yang bdud kyi las so //
translated: To conceal the teachings on the profound, and to teach a variety of other subjects, is also the work of Māra.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lam shes kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam yongs su mi tshol ba yang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lam shes kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam yongs su mi tshol ba yang bdud kyi las so //
translated: Even though bodhisattvas know the path, if they do not seek the path of the perfection of wisdom, that is also the work of Māra.

original: rab tu brtson pa'i bsngags pa brjod kyang sems can mi brtson pa rnams mngon par mi sbyor ba yang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: rab tu brtson pa'i bsngags pa brjod kyang sems can mi brtson pa rnams mngon par mi sbyor ba yang bdud kyi las so //
translated: To praise diligence while not engaging in it oneself, and to not apply oneself to the benefit of sentient beings, is also the work of Māra.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs kyang byang chub kyi sems mngon du mi byed pa yang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs kyang byang chub kyi sems mngon du mi byed pa yang bdud kyi las so //
translated: Even though one has planted roots of virtue, if one does not actualize the mind of awakening, that is also the work of Māra.

original: lhag mthong gi rnal 'byor dang ldan par gnas kyang sems can rnams lhag mthong yang dag par 'dzin du mi 'jug pa yang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi rnal 'byor dang ldan par gnas kyang sems can rnams lhag mthong yang dag par 'dzin du mi 'jug pa yang bdud kyi las so //
translated: It is also a deed of Mara if, though one has the yoga of insight, one does not cause sentient beings to take up insight.

original: nyon mongs pa ma lus pa zad pa tshol zhing 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi nyin mongs pa rnams la smod pa yang bdud kyi las so ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma lus pa zad pa tshol zhing 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi nyin mongs pa rnams la smod pa yang bdud kyi las so ;
translated: It is also a deed of Mara if one seeks to end the defilements without remainder, but despises the defilements in the stream of cyclic existence.

original: / shes rab kyis rnam par dpyod cing snying rje chen po la dmigs pa mi 'dzin pa yang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: / shes rab kyis rnam par dpyod cing snying rje chen po la dmigs pa mi 'dzin pa yang bdud kyi las so //
translated: It is also a deed of Mara if one analyzes with wisdom, but does not hold the focus of great compassion.

original: thabs dang mi ldan par dge ba spyod pa thams cad kyang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: thabs dang mi ldan par dge ba spyod pa thams cad kyang bdud kyi las so //
translated: It is also a deed of Mara if one practices all virtues without skill in means.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod mi tshol gyi 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i gsang tshig 'dzin pa yang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod mi tshol gyi 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i gsang tshig 'dzin pa yang bdud kyi las so //
translated: It is also a deed of Mara if one does not seek the Bodhisattva Canon, but holds the secret spells of the Lokayatas.

original: mang du thos kyang gzhan gyis shes kyi dogs te chos la slob dpon gyis dpe mkhyud byed pa yang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: mang du thos kyang gzhan gyis shes kyi dogs te chos la slob dpon gyis dpe mkhyud byed pa yang bdud kyi las so //
translated: It is also a deed of Mara if one is learned, but out of fear of being known by others, one is stingy with the Dharma as a teacher.

original: 'jig rten pa'i dgos pa zhal ta byed cing mang du thos pa mi tshol ba yang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dgos pa zhal ta byed cing mang du thos pa mi tshol ba yang bdud kyi las so //
translated: It is also a deed of Māra if, for the sake of worldly needs, one does not seek much learning from a Dharma teacher.🔽It is also a deed of Māra if, when one is a bodhisattva who has set out in the Great Vehicle and is a Dharma teacher, one does not attend upon and honor those who are of equal fortune,🔽or if one delights in those who are of unequal fortune, that is, those who have set out in the vehicles of the disciples and the solitary sages.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos smra bar thag pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa skal ba mnyam pa rnams mi bsnyen bsnyen bkur mi byed pa de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa skal ba mi mnyam pa🔽la dga' ba'ang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos smra bar thag pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa skal ba mnyam pa rnams mi bsnyen bsnyen bkur mi byed pa de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa skal ba mi mnyam pa la dga' ba'ang bdud kyi las so //
translated: It is also a deed of Māra if, when one is a bodhisattva who has set out in the Great Vehicle, one does not attend upon and honor the Tathāgata, or the collections of Dharma and of monastic community, or the bodhisattvas, or the solitary sages, or the disciples.🔽It is also a deed of Māra if, when one is a bodhisattva who has set out in the Great Vehicle, one does not attend upon and honor the elders, the monastic community, the parents, the spiritual teachers, and those who are worthy of honor.

original: gang gi tshe brgya byin nam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe brgya byin nam /
translated: It is also a deed of Māra if, when one is a bodhisattva who has set out in the Great Vehicle, one does not attend upon and honor Śakra,

original: tshangs pa'am / 'ji rten skyong ba'am @69b rgyal po'am /
analyzed: tshangs pa'am / 'ji rten skyong ba'am @69b rgyal po'am /
translated: Brahmā, the world protectors, kings,

original: tshong dpon nam /
analyzed: tshong dpon nam /
translated: merchants,

original: khyim bdag go longs spyod dang / nor dang / rin po che dang / dbang phyug gi che ba nyid du gyur pa de'i tshe chos kyi che ba nyid dang ldan pa rnams la mi bsnyen bsnyen bkur mi byed pa 'di dag ni lha'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las yang dag phul nyi shu'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khyim bdag go longs spyod dang / nor dang / rin po che dang / dbang phyug gi che ba nyid du gyur pa de'i tshe chos kyi che ba nyid dang ldan pa rnams la mi bsnyen bsnyen bkur mi byed pa 'di dag ni lha'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las yang dag phul nyi shu'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: When a householder has wealth, property, jewels, and great power, at that time he does not serve or honor those who have the greatness of the Dharma. These, divine prince, are the twenty supreme works of Mara for the bodhisattvas.

original: yang 'phags pa klu'i rgyal po ma dros pas zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo las kyang bla ma rnams la mi gus pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: yang 'phags pa klu'i rgyal po ma dros pas zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo las kyang bla ma rnams la mi gus pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: And in the noble Mahayana sutra called the Questions of the Naga King Anavatapta, it says, “Lack of respect for gurus is a work of Mara.

original: bdag brjod pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa yang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: bdag brjod pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa yang bdud kyi las so //
translated: Conceit about oneself is a work of Mara.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam 'dor ba yang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam 'dor ba yang bdud kyi las so //
translated: Abandoning the bodhisattva canon and the path of the perfections is a work of Mara.

original: 'jig rten ba dang 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i gsang tshig dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i mdo kun tu 'dzin pa mi bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: 'jig rten ba dang 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i gsang tshig dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i mdo kun tu 'dzin pa mi bdud kyi las so //
translated: To hold the scriptures of the worldly and the Lokāyatas, and those of the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, is the work of Māra.

original: thabs dang bral ba'i shes rab dang / shes rab dang bral ba'i thabs dang / thos pa nyung bas bsam gtan rnyed pa dang / mang du thos kyang bdag bstod pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: thabs dang bral ba'i shes rab dang / shes rab dang bral ba'i thabs dang / thos pa nyung bas bsam gtan rnyed pa dang / mang du thos kyang bdag bstod pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: Wisdom without means, means without wisdom, and meditation due to little learning, and even with much learning, self-praise—these are the work of Māra.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang bral bas skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags kyang theg pa chung du 'dod pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang bral bas skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags kyang theg pa chung du 'dod pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: To take rebirth without the roots of virtue, and even if one has accumulated the roots of virtue, to desire the Lesser Vehicle—these are the work of Māra.

original: dam pa'i chos mi bsrung ba dang ; sems can yongs su smin par mi byed pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos mi bsrung ba dang ; sems can yongs su smin par mi byed pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: Not to protect the holy Dharma and not to bring sentient beings to maturity—these are the work of Māra.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la zhe sdang ba dang / chos smra ba'i bsngags pa mi brjod pa yang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la zhe sdang ba dang / chos smra ba'i bsngags pa mi brjod pa yang bdud kyi las so //
translated: To be hostile to the bodhisattvas and not to praise the Dharma teachers—these are the work of Māra.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par blangs pa 'dor ba dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang du len pa yang bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par blangs pa 'dor ba dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang du len pa yang bdud kyi las so //
translated: Abandoning the roots of virtue that have been taken up and accepting an unvirtuous mind are also the work of Māra.

original: dgon pa la gnas kyang 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / 'khor gyi tshogs kyi nang du zhugs kyang rnyed pa dang bkur stis bskor ba ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: dgon pa la gnas kyang 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / 'khor gyi tshogs kyi nang du zhugs kyang rnyed pa dang bkur stis bskor ba ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: Even if you live in the wilderness, if you have thoughts of desire, ill will, and violence, and even if you live in the midst of a community, if you are surrounded by gain and honor, these are the work of Māra.

original: snod ma yin pa la chos ston pa dang snod du gyur pa khyad du gsod pa yang bdud kyi las so ;
analyzed: snod ma yin pa la chos ston pa dang snod du gyur pa khyad du gsod pa yang bdud kyi las so ;
translated: Teaching the Dharma to those who are not suitable recipients and despising those who are suitable recipients are also the work of Māra.

original: / bdud kyi las 'di lta bu 'di dag khong du ma chud pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems la g-yeng ba yang bdud kyi las so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: / bdud kyi las 'di lta bu 'di dag khong du ma chud pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems la g-yeng ba yang bdud kyi las so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Not understanding these and other such works of Māra and being distracted from the mind of omniscience are also the work of Māra.

original: mdor bsdus na 'phags pa 'jam dpal rnam par 'phrul ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: mdor bsdus na 'phags pa 'jam dpal rnam par 'phrul ba'i mdo las /
translated: In brief, the noble Sūtra on the Play of Mañjuśrī says,

original: mdor na ji tsam du @70a * //
analyzed: mdor na ji tsam du @70a * //
translated: In brief, to the extent that there is

original: g-yo ba dang rlom pa dang spros pa dang gnyis su rtog pa de tsam du bdud kyi las so zhes gsungs pa'i don gyi dbang du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba dang rlom pa dang spros pa dang gnyis su rtog pa de tsam du bdud kyi las so zhes gsungs pa'i don gyi dbang du shes par bya'o //
translated: The same text says, “To the extent that there is movement, pride, conceptual elaboration, and the idea of duality, to that extent there is the work of Māra.”🔽Moreover, the same text says, “Divine princes! You should know that the work of Māra for bodhisattvas arises from their efforts.”

original: gzhan yang de nyid las lha'i bu byang chub sems dpa'i bdud kyi las ni brtson 'grus las byung bar rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pas rab tu sbyor ba'i dus na bdud kyi las rnams 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las lha'i bu byang chub sems dpa'i bdud kyi las ni brtson 'grus las byung bar rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pas rab tu sbyor ba'i dus na bdud kyi las rnams 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that the works of Māra occur when you are applying yourself.🔽Once you have understood them, you should turn away from them.

original: de dag rig par gyur nas bzlog par bya ba ni ji skad du 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i le'u las /
analyzed: de dag rig par gyur nas bzlog par bya ba ni ji skad du 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i le'u las /
translated: The noble Sūtra on the Application of Mindfulness to the Holy Dharma says,

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las bzlog pa ste /
translated: “O jinaputras! There are ten actions of Māra that bodhisattvas should turn away from.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsnyen bkur ba'i phyir nga rgyal thams cad yongs su spong ba ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsnyen bkur ba'i phyir nga rgyal thams cad yongs su spong ba ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Giving up all pride in order to serve spiritual teachers is an action of Māra that bodhisattvas should turn away from.

original: bdag la mi bstod mi bsngags pa ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la mi bstod mi bsngags pa ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
translated: To avoid praise and fame is to avoid the works of Mara.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo la mos shing mi spong ba ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo la mos shing mi spong ba ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
translated: To believe in the profound Dharma of the Buddha and not to reject it is to avoid the works of Mara.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems yongs su nyams par mi byed pa ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems yongs su nyams par mi byed pa ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
translated: To not lose the thought of omniscience is to avoid the works of Mara.

original: chos zab mo'i tshul la brtson zhing bag yod par gnas pa ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: chos zab mo'i tshul la brtson zhing bag yod par gnas pa ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
translated: To be diligent in the way of the profound Dharma and to abide in heedfulness is to avoid the works of Mara.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la gnas shing chos thams cad yongs su tshol ba ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la gnas shing chos thams cad yongs su tshol ba ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
translated: To abide in the Bodhisattva Canon and to seek all Dharmas is to avoid the works of Mara.

original: yang dang yang nyan cing yang dag pa'i gtam gyis yongs su mi skyo ba ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang nyan cing yang dag pa'i gtam gyis yongs su mi skyo ba ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
translated: To not be weary of listening again and again and of being instructed in the right Dharma is to avoid the works of Mara.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la skyabs dang dpung gnyen tshol ba'i 'du shes ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la skyabs dang dpung gnyen tshol ba'i 'du shes ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
translated: To have the notion of seeking refuge and protection in all the Tathagatas who abide in all the world systems is to avoid the works of Mara.

original: sgrub pa la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs rjes su dran zhing mos pa yang dag par len pa ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs rjes su dran zhing mos pa yang dag par len pa ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The recollection and aspiration for the blessing of all the Buddhas in one's practice is the avoidance of the works of Mara.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i grogs thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mi gnyis par mngon par bsgrub pa ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i grogs thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mi gnyis par mngon par bsgrub pa ni bdud kyi las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the roots of virtue of all the Bodhisattvas as one's own is the avoidance of the works of Mara.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las bzlog ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las bzlog ste /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones, these ten are the avoidance of the works of Mara for the Bodhisattvas.

original: de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' bdud kyi las thams cad las 'da' bar 'gyur ba dag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' bdud kyi las thams cad las 'da' bar 'gyur ba dag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: By means of them the Bodhisattvas transcend all the works of Mara.

original: rang gi gzhung gi tshig gi don ni go sla bas rnam @70b par ma phye'o //
analyzed: rang gi gzhung gi tshig gi don ni go sla bas rnam @70b par ma phye'o //
translated: The meaning of the words of our own scriptures is easy to understand, so we will not analyze it.

original: da ni byang chub sems dpa' legs par zhugs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid las brtsams te /
analyzed: da ni byang chub sems dpa' legs par zhugs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid las brtsams te /
translated: Now, beginning with the three knowledges, which are the essence of the omniscience of all the well-entered Bodhisattvas,

original: rgyal ba'i yum 'di'i mtshan nyid ji snyed pa ston par byed pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnams dgrol ba'i phyir skyon gyi 'og ru de dag gi mtshan nyid gsungs te zhes sbyar ro //🔽de la de dag gi zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sbyor ba po'am /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i yum 'di'i mtshan nyid ji snyed pa ston par byed pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnams dgrol ba'i phyir skyon gyi 'og ru de dag gi mtshan nyid gsungs te zhes sbyar ro // de la de dag gi zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sbyor ba po'am /
translated: The words of the Mother of the Victorious Ones that teach the characteristics are verses. In order to explain them, the characteristics of those are taught.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum po de dag gis zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum po de dag gis zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, “those” refers to the bodhisattvas who are the performers or the three omnisciences.

original: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang rnam pa rang gi mtshan nyid dang rnam par dbye ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang rnam pa rang gi mtshan nyid dang rnam par dbye ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: “Characteristics” are the intrinsic characteristics, the aspects, and the differentiating characteristics.

original: rnam par dbye ba'i ba'i mtshan nyid ni bum pa la sogs pa dag dung la sogs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dngos po gcig pu yang dpag ru med par ldog pa'i dbang gis brjod pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba'i ba'i mtshan nyid ni bum pa la sogs pa dag dung la sogs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dngos po gcig pu yang dpag ru med par ldog pa'i dbang gis brjod pa ste /
translated: The differentiating characteristics are, for example, that a vase is not a conch and so on. Even a single entity is expressed by the power of exclusion, which is beyond measure.

original: ji skad du tshad ma rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: ji skad du tshad ma rnam 'grel las /
translated: As it is said in the Pramanavarttika:

original: gang phyir dngos kun rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos kun rang bzhin gyis //
translated: Because all entities are by nature

original: rang rang ngo bo la gnas phyir /🔽mthun dngos gzhan gyi dngos dag las //
analyzed: rang rang ngo bo la gnas phyir / mthun dngos gzhan gyi dngos dag las //
translated: Because they abide in their own nature.🔽The definition of the homogeneous is

original: ldog pa la ni brten pa can //
analyzed: ldog pa la ni brten pa can //
translated: the opposite of the heterogeneous.

original: zhes bstan cing /
analyzed: zhes bstan cing /
translated: And,

original: chos tshul zab mo rgya mtsho lta bu'i pha rol gzigs //
analyzed: chos tshul zab mo rgya mtsho lta bu'i pha rol gzigs //
translated: You have seen the other shore of the profound ocean of the way of the Dharma.

original: zhes bstod pa brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bstod pa brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is like the praise.

original: de la slob dpon zla ba grags kyi zhal snga nas ni /
analyzed: de la slob dpon zla ba grags kyi zhal snga nas ni /
translated: The master Candrakirti explains that

original: 'di dag ni dgos pa nye bar gyur ba'i dbang dang rnam par rtog pa'i dbang tsam gyis phye bar zad pas na dngos po la mi ldan pas mtshan nyid du mi 'grang ngo zhes 'chad cing /
analyzed: 'di dag ni dgos pa nye bar gyur ba'i dbang dang rnam par rtog pa'i dbang tsam gyis phye bar zad pas na dngos po la mi ldan pas mtshan nyid du mi 'grang ngo zhes 'chad cing /
translated: since these are distinguished only by the power of the need to be expressed and the power of thought, they are not established as characteristics in the object.

original: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyang /
translated: The master also says,

original: sdar don gcig tu rab tu sbyor ba la ldog pa la ltos pas nye bar bskyed pa'i tha dad pa'i ngo bor dbyer bzod pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sdar don gcig tu rab tu sbyor ba la ldog pa la ltos pas nye bar bskyed pa'i tha dad pa'i ngo bor dbyer bzod pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, the application of one meaning is not distinguished by a different nature that is generated in dependence on the different isolates.

original: gzhan dag ni gal te rigs pa'i lam du 'jug pa zhig na de'i tshe dngos po thams cad kyang sgra'i spyi'i rnam pa ming tsam du zad cing brtags pa tsam zhig snying por gyur pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gal te rigs pa'i lam du 'jug pa zhig na de'i tshe dngos po thams cad kyang sgra'i spyi'i rnam pa ming tsam du zad cing brtags pa tsam zhig snying por gyur pa kho na'o //
translated: Others say: If one enters the path of reasoning, then all things are just the mere name that is the aspect of a universal sound, and mere imputation is their essence.

original: mngon par zhen pa stug po phyi rol gyi don yod pa ltar gnas pa'i dbang du byas pa'i tshe ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob rnams ni ji snyed du btags pa de snyed kyi nus pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po re re la yang ldan zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa stug po phyi rol gyi don yod pa ltar gnas pa'i dbang du byas pa'i tshe ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob rnams ni ji snyed du btags pa de snyed kyi nus pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po re re la yang ldan zhes zer ro //
translated: When one is governed by the thick adherence to external objects as existent, then all things that are correct conventionalities are endowed with the characteristics of the capacity to the extent that they are imputed.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni rang gi thun mong ma yin pa'i yan lag me la sogs pa'i tsha ba la sogs pa 'jig rten rnams na rigs pas ma bcom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni rang gi thun mong ma yin pa'i yan lag me la sogs pa'i tsha ba la sogs pa 'jig rten rnams na rigs pas ma bcom pa'i tshe /
translated: Specific characteristics are the specific parts of things, such as the heat of fire and so on, which are not destroyed by reasoning in the world.

original: gzhan la mi @71a * //🔽ltos par don byed par snang ba'i dngos po rags pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan la mi @71a * // ltos par don byed par snang ba'i dngos po rags pa rnams so //
translated: They are not dependent on others.🔽They are gross things that appear to function.

original: 'dir ni rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid bzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir ni rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid bzung ngo //
translated: Here the specific characteristic is taken to be the nature of things.

original: de yang mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni shes pa dang / khyad par dang byed pa rnams te /
analyzed: de yang mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni shes pa dang / khyad par dang byed pa rnams te /
translated: The characteristics that illustrate it are: knowledge, distinction, and function.

original: de la shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi tha dad pa gsum char yang rgyal ba'i yum 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi tha dad pa gsum char yang rgyal ba'i yum 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas shes par bya'o //
translated: Among them, the characteristic of knowledge is that this Mother of Conquerors is the producer of the Tathagata, etc.

original: gal te de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum char gyi rgyal ba'i yum gyi bdag nyid kyi che ba shes par byed par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum char gyi rgyal ba'i yum gyi bdag nyid kyi che ba shes par byed par gyur na /
translated: If one understands that this Mother of Conquerors is the producer of the three knowledges,

original: de'i tshe gzhi thams cad shes par gyur pa kho nas chog pas lam thams cad shes pas ci zhig bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhi thams cad shes par gyur pa kho nas chog pas lam thams cad shes pas ci zhig bya snyam pa la /
translated: then at that time, since one has already known all the bases, what is the use of knowing all the paths?

original: shes par byed par mtshungs su zin kyang de dag gi khyad par ni 'di dang 'di lta bu'o zhes ston par byed pa ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: shes par byed par mtshungs su zin kyang de dag gi khyad par ni 'di dang 'di lta bu'o zhes ston par byed pa ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Although they are the same in being the producer of knowledge, the characteristic of distinction is the teaching that their differences are such and such.

original: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid des don ci zhig byed snyam pa la ni byed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid des don ci zhig byed snyam pa la ni byed pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: The characteristic of function is taught for the purpose of thinking, “What is the purpose of the object by that characteristic of distinction?”

original: ngo bo nyid mtshon par bya ba'i mtshan nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de gsum gyi rang bzhin gzhan khong du chud par bya ba la gtso bor ma gyur ba'i rang bzhin du zad do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid mtshon par bya ba'i mtshan nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de gsum gyi rang bzhin gzhan khong du chud par bya ba la gtso bor ma gyur ba'i rang bzhin du zad do //
translated: The characteristic of the object to be characterized as the nature is omniscience, which is the nature of those three.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni 'di tsam zhig tu zad cing gang dag bdag gis re re nas ma phye ba'i don rnams ni 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sde'i zhal snga nas rnam par sbyar ba tshig le'ur byas pa mdo bar ma'i dbang du mdzad pa las rgyas par
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni 'di tsam zhig tu zad cing gang dag bdag gis re re nas ma phye ba'i don rnams ni 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sde'i zhal snga nas rnam par sbyar ba tshig le'ur byas pa mdo bar ma'i dbang du mdzad pa las rgyas par
translated: The summarized meaning is just this much. The meanings that I have not analyzed individually should be understood from the extensive teaching in the commentary on the medium length discourses by Ārya Vimuktisena, which is based on the medium length discourses.

original: bstan pa las shes par gyis shig / thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa zhes bya ba la thar pa ni las dang nyon mongs pa ches rags pa mi khom pa brgyad du 'phen par byed pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan pa las shes par gyis shig / thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa zhes bya ba la thar pa ni las dang nyon mongs pa ches rags pa mi khom pa brgyad du 'phen par byed pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: The term “conducive to liberation” is as follows: Liberation is the freedom from the very coarse karma and afflictions that propel one into the eight unfavorable states and so on.

original: de las thar pas na drod la sogs pa sbyor ba'i lam yin te /
analyzed: de las thar pas na drod la sogs pa sbyor ba'i lam yin te /
translated: Since one is liberated from that, heat and so on are the path of preparation.

original: don 'di ni 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i zhal snga nas /
analyzed: don 'di ni 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i zhal snga nas /
translated: This point is taught by Vimuktasena:

original: de la 'dir thar pa ni bral ba'i khyad par yin la de'i cha la phan pas ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de la 'dir thar pa ni bral ba'i khyad par yin la de'i cha la phan pas ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Here liberation is a specific separation and since it benefits that, it is called an approach to liberation.

original: de'i phyir chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos mngon pa las /
translated: Therefore the Abhidharmakośa declares:

original: thar pa bal na med pa yin //
analyzed: thar pa bal na med pa yin //
translated: Liberation is not near for those with desire.

original: zhes brjod pa ni 'dir mi sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa ni 'dir mi sbyar ro //
translated: This is not applied here.

original: de'i cha zhes smos pa ni phyogs gcig tsam gyis phan 'dogs kyi /
analyzed: de'i cha zhes smos pa ni phyogs gcig tsam gyis phan 'dogs kyi /
translated: The term its part refers to benefit through just a portion.

original: dngos su ni thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa thob nas @71b dmigs pa dang rnam pa la sogs pa ji skad du bstan pa'i khyad par can la slob pas drod la sogs pa thob ste /
analyzed: dngos su ni thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa thob nas @71b dmigs pa dang rnam pa la sogs pa ji skad du bstan pa'i khyad par can la slob pas drod la sogs pa thob ste /
translated: But in fact, one obtains heat and so on through training in the specific objects, aspects and so on that are taught after obtaining an approach to liberation.

original: de'i phyir lam spyi dang khyad par dag gi mtshams su rang gi lam thob kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir lam spyi dang khyad par dag gi mtshams su rang gi lam thob kyang /
translated: Therefore, although one obtains one's own path at the juncture of the general and specific paths,

original: de'i khongs su bslan pas bstan pa lam 'og ma dag las khyad du zhugs pa'i mtshams sbyor gyi ngo bo dag yod do zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i khongs su bslan pas bstan pa lam 'og ma dag las khyad du zhugs pa'i mtshams sbyor gyi ngo bo dag yod do zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: The Path of Application is the path on which one is endowed with the nature of the unhindered path which is superior to the lower paths.

original: ai ya zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ai ya zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The word “etc.” refers to the explanation of the Path of Application as above.

original: 'di'i dbye ba ni 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i zhal snga nas chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu zhes gsungs la lam 'di mtshon par 'gyur ba'i rtags kyang sems mi 'jug pa dang / mi 'gong ba dang yid la 'gyod par 'gyur ba med pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di'i dbye ba ni 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i zhal snga nas chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu zhes gsungs la lam 'di mtshon par 'gyur ba'i rtags kyang sems mi 'jug pa dang / mi 'gong ba dang yid la 'gyod par 'gyur ba med pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: The divisions of the Path of Application are said by Arya Vimuktasena to be the great, medium, and small. The signs which indicate this path are said to be the non-engagement of the mind, the non-arrogance, and the non-remorse.

original: gzhan yang lam 'di thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes kha cig 'chad do //
analyzed: gzhan yang lam 'di thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes kha cig 'chad do //
translated: Moreover, some explain that this path is of the nature of hearing and reflection.

original: gzhan dag ni 'di dag ni thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab phal che ba yin gyi bsgom pa'i shes rab kyang med ces nges par mi dgag go zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'di dag ni thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab phal che ba yin gyi bsgom pa'i shes rab kyang med ces nges par mi dgag go zhes 'chad do //
translated: Others explain that it is not definitely denied that this path is of the nature of the wisdom of hearing and reflection, but that it is not of the nature of the wisdom of cultivation.

original: 'phags pa rnam pa rnam par grol ba'i zhal snga nas ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin du bzhed pa'i phyir /🔽'di rnams thams cad kyang thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin can yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnam pa rnam par grol ba'i zhal snga nas ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin du bzhed pa'i phyir / 'di rnams thams cad kyang thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin can yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Arya Vimuktasena asserts that the root of virtue that is conducive to liberation is the nature of hearing and contemplation.🔽Therefore understand that all of these are the nature of hearing and contemplation because they are the cause of engaging in the teaching from the very beginning.

original: de thog ma kho nar bstan pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod cing sbyor ba'i lam du ni de ltar nges par gdags pa mdzad pas so //
analyzed: de thog ma kho nar bstan pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod cing sbyor ba'i lam du ni de ltar nges par gdags pa mdzad pas so //
translated: This is stated and the path of preparation is definitely presented in that way.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'di yang phyir mi ldog par rnam par gzhag gam ci ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'di yang phyir mi ldog par rnam par gzhag gam ci ma yin zhe na /
translated: Is this also posited as irreversible?

original: re zhig phyir mi ldog pa ni byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa dang / byang chub khyad par can las phyir mi ldog pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sa las phyir mi ldog pa dang / rtsol ba med pa las phyir mo ldog pa dag go //
analyzed: re zhig phyir mi ldog pa ni byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa dang / byang chub khyad par can las phyir mi ldog pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sa las phyir mi ldog pa dang / rtsol ba med pa las phyir mo ldog pa dag go //
translated: One is irreversible from the stage of a non-returner, the second from the stage of a once-returner, the third from the stage of a stream-enterer, and the fourth from the stage of a pure-hearted ordinary person.

original: de la dang po ni 'phags pa nyan thos rnams dang thun mong du byas pa thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa nas bzod pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: de la dang po ni 'phags pa nyan thos rnams dang thun mong du byas pa thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa nas bzod pa'i bar ro //
translated: The first is from the stage of the aids to penetration up to the stage of patience, which is shared with the noble disciples.

original: gnyis pa ni theg pa chen po'i drod nas brtsams pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni theg pa chen po'i drod nas brtsams pa'i bar ro //
translated: The second is from the stage of heat of the Great Vehicle up to the stage of patience.

original: gnyis pa ni sa dang po'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sa dang po'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The third is the nature of the first stage.

original: bzhi pa ni sa mi g-yo ba la'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni sa mi g-yo ba la'o //
translated: The fourth is on the Immovable stage.

original: de ltar na thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni theg pa khyad par can gyi byang chub las mi ldog par nges pa ma yin pas na phyir mi ldog pa zhes mi brjod @72a * //
analyzed: de ltar na thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni theg pa khyad par can gyi byang chub las mi ldog par nges pa ma yin pas na phyir mi ldog pa zhes mi brjod @72a * //
translated: Thus, the aids to liberation are not called irreversible because they are not certain to be irreversible from the enlightenment of the special vehicle.

original: do ; / theg pa chen po 'dir ni dro bar gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rgyud la skyes par gyur pa'i tshe phan chad du byang chub chen po las phyir mi ldog pa ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa las nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la
analyzed: do ; / theg pa chen po 'dir ni dro bar gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rgyud la skyes par gyur pa'i tshe phan chad du byang chub chen po las phyir mi ldog pa ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa las nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la
translated: In this Mahayana, once the root of virtue of the stage of heat has arisen in the mindstream, one does not turn away from great enlightenment, as is taught in the stage of peak realization.

original: rmi lam na yang mi 'dod par ston par 'gyur ro //🔽'o na 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: rmi lam na yang mi 'dod par ston par 'gyur ro // 'o na 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: Even in dreams, one does not wish for the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels.🔽Well then, in the Abhidharma and so on,🔽the factors conducive to liberation are posited for śrāvakas.

original: chos mngon pa la sogs par thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'di de dag gi phyir mi ldog par gzhag gam ci ste ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos mngon pa la sogs par thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'di de dag gi phyir mi ldog par gzhag gam ci ste ma yin zhe na /
translated: Are they not posited for the sake of those who do not turn back?

original: kha cig na re de dag ni shes rab dang snying rje chung ba dang / sbyangs pa yun thung ba'i dbang gis na thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyes su zin kyang nges par phyir mi ldog par nges pa med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re de dag ni shes rab dang snying rje chung ba dang / sbyangs pa yun thung ba'i dbang gis na thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyes su zin kyang nges par phyir mi ldog par nges pa med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: Due to having little wisdom and compassion and brief training, even though the root of virtue of the factors conducive to liberation has arisen, it is not definite that one will definitely not turn back.

original: gzhan dag ni de dag gi dbang du byas te /🔽yang rang gi mngon par 'dod pa'i ched du bsgrub pa'i byang chub las ni slar ldog par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de dag gi dbang du byas te / yang rang gi mngon par 'dod pa'i ched du bsgrub pa'i byang chub las ni slar ldog par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Others say:

original: dus ring zhig gis de thob pas na ring du thogs pa'i dbang tsam las phyir mi ldog par mi bzhag go zhes zer te /
analyzed: dus ring zhig gis de thob pas na ring du thogs pa'i dbang tsam las phyir mi ldog par mi bzhag go zhes zer te /
translated: They do not turn away from enlightenment, which is the goal they themselves desire, but they are not posited as irreversible because they attain that goal after a long time.

original: 'dir ni phyir ldog pa dang mi ldog pa la brtsams te /
analyzed: 'dir ni phyir ldog pa dang mi ldog pa la brtsams te /
translated: Here, they are discussed in terms of turning away and not turning away.

original: glengs par zad na dus nye ba dang ring ba'i rtsod pa su zhig byed /
analyzed: glengs par zad na dus nye ba dang ring ba'i rtsod pa su zhig byed /
translated: If that is so, then who would argue about whether the time is long or short?

original: de ltar na drod bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dbang po rtul zhing nyon mongs pa mang ba la sogs pa mngon par shes pa bul la dka' ba la sogs pa yang phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na drod bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dbang po rtul zhing nyon mongs pa mang ba la sogs pa mngon par shes pa bul la dka' ba la sogs pa yang phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus bodhisattvas who generate heat and sravakas of dull faculty who have many afflictions and so on who have the superknowledges that are slow and difficult and so on are not irreversible.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?
