original: rang gi rgyud nges pa'i rgyu mtshan gtso bor mdzad pa zhig na thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di yang phyir mi ldog par brjod mod kyi rang gi rtogs pa dang 'tsham par gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yon tan rnams 'di la med
analyzed: rang gi rgyud nges pa'i rgyu mtshan gtso bor mdzad pa zhig na thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di yang phyir mi ldog par brjod mod kyi rang gi rtogs pa dang 'tsham par gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yon tan rnams 'di la med
translated: Although it is said that this root of virtue that is conducive to penetrative insight is irreversible, it does not have the qualities that inspire confidence in others in accordance with one's realization.

original: pas na de'i phyir dang / rang yang dngos por nges kyang rang nges par byed pa'i rtags pa zung sla ba yang med pa'i phyir tha snyad gdags pa'i gzhir ma gyur pas na 'di phyir mi ldog pa'o zhes gang du yang ma gsungs te /
analyzed: pas na de'i phyir dang / rang yang dngos por nges kyang rang nges par byed pa'i rtags pa zung sla ba yang med pa'i phyir tha snyad gdags pa'i gzhir ma gyur pas na 'di phyir mi ldog pa'o zhes gang du yang ma gsungs te /
translated: And although one is certain about the thing, there is no easy sign that makes one certain about oneself, so it is not a basis for designating it as irreversible.

original: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa de dag la yang drod la sogs pa'i rtags ci rigs su rang dang gzhan nges par 'byed pa dag 'byung bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa de dag la yang drod la sogs pa'i rtags ci rigs su rang dang gzhan nges par 'byed pa dag 'byung bar shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that even for noble beings who have become free from attachment, signs such as heat arise in various ways that inspire certainty in oneself and others.

original: rang gi rgyud la bskyed par mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don la dmigs pa rab tu @72b srab pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la bskyed par mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don la dmigs pa rab tu @72b srab pa ste /
translated: Skill in generating the path in one's mindstream refers to the extremely subtle focus on the benefit of others.

original: drod ma rnyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can la dmigs par byed mod kyi /
analyzed: drod ma rnyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can la dmigs par byed mod kyi /
translated: Bodhisattvas who have not acquired the heat stage of the path of preparation do focus on sentient beings,

original: da dung bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa dang bdag dang gzhan brje bar nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: da dung bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa dang bdag dang gzhan brje bar nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: but they are not yet able to equalize self and others or to exchange self for others.

original: de'i phyir yang 'di phyir mi ldog pa ga la yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang 'di phyir mi ldog pa ga la yin /
translated: So how can they be irreversible?

original: rang bzhin gyi dbang du byas pa'i tshe ni rigs dang rkyen gnyi gas byang chub sems dpa' kha cig tshogs kyi lam phal pa'i dus nyid na phyir mi ldog par gyur pas na rang gi rgyud las lung bstan pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi dbang du byas pa'i tshe ni rigs dang rkyen gnyi gas byang chub sems dpa' kha cig tshogs kyi lam phal pa'i dus nyid na phyir mi ldog par gyur pas na rang gi rgyud las lung bstan pa gsungs te /
translated: When it is a question of their natural state, some bodhisattvas are irreversible from the stage of the ordinary path of accumulation on account of both their potential and their conditions and they are therefore said to be predicted from their own series.

original: 'on kyang phyir mi ldog par brjod pas su zhig yid ches byed par nus /
analyzed: 'on kyang phyir mi ldog par brjod pas su zhig yid ches byed par nus /
translated: But who could believe in their irreversibility just on the basis of their words?

original: ni zhes bya ba ni nges par bzung ba'o //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni nges par bzung ba'o //
translated: The word “only” is a term of exclusion.

original: dbang po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are not irreversible by the very nature of their intellectual faculty.

original: dbang byed pa'i don gyis dbang por brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: dbang byed pa'i don gyis dbang por brjod pa yin na /
translated: If the faculties are so called because they exercise controlling power,

original: lam 'dir ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa dang / le lo la sogs pa gzhom par nges par dbang byed par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lam 'dir ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa dang / le lo la sogs pa gzhom par nges par dbang byed par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: then in this path they are not able to exercise controlling power in the destruction of their resistant tendencies, such as faithlessness, laziness, etc.

original: res 'ga' mi mthun pa'i phyogs mthu che bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' mi mthun pa'i phyogs mthu che bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because sometimes the resistant tendencies are stronger.🔽Not all of them attain unsurpassed enlightenment,

original: thams cad kyis bla na med pa'i byang chub 'thob pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la bar chad med par 'thob pa ma yin gyi zhes dgag gi rim gyis mi 'phags pa'i skye bo thams cad sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur bar sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyis bla na med pa'i byang chub 'thob pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la bar chad med par 'thob pa ma yin gyi zhes dgag gi rim gyis mi 'phags pa'i skye bo thams cad sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur bar sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means that they do not attain it without interruption, but not that all ordinary men will become Buddhas in order, because that has already been taught.

original: de dag nyid dbang po rtul pos rtogs par dka' ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag nyid dbang po rtul pos rtogs par dka' ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are difficult for those of dull faculties to understand.

original: theg pa chen po dbu ma pa dag gis rtogs par dka' bar brjod pa 'di nyid la rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag ni rigs chad pas sa bon tshig pa lta bu zhes de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po la skur ba smra par byed do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po dbu ma pa dag gis rtogs par dka' bar brjod pa 'di nyid la rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag ni rigs chad pas sa bon tshig pa lta bu zhes de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po la skur ba smra par byed do //
translated: The Yogacarins, however, deprecate this very statement of the Madhyamikas that the Mahayana is difficult to understand, and they say that the Tathagatagarbha is depreciated by the statement that the seed is burned up by the fire of wisdom.

original: chos nyid yin pas zhes bya ba ni byed pa po med bzhin du dngos po sgyu ma lta bu rnams kyi nus pa sgyu ma tsam zhig rigs pa'i khur mi theg par de ltar grub par zad de /
analyzed: chos nyid yin pas zhes bya ba ni byed pa po med bzhin du dngos po sgyu ma lta bu rnams kyi nus pa sgyu ma tsam zhig rigs pa'i khur mi theg par de ltar grub par zad de /
translated: The word because means that the mere illusion-like potency of the illusion-like things, even though they are without an agent, is not able to bear the burden of logic, and so it is established in this way.

original: 'di ci'i phyir zhes sus kyang dpyad du ni med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ci'i phyir zhes sus kyang dpyad du ni med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of by no one is that this cannot be analyzed by anyone.

original: 'dis ni 'thad pa bsgrub pa'i rigs pa rtog gi bkag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'thad pa bsgrub pa'i rigs pa rtog gi bkag pa'o //
translated: This is the refutation of the reasoning of proof by the Yogacarins.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun par 'byung ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun par 'byung ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase arising as a factor of penetration means that

original: 'dir nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'di dag re re la yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po gsum gsum du dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'di dag re re la yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po gsum gsum du dbye bar bya ste /
translated: here, each of these factors of penetration should be divided into three: small, medium, and great.

original: re zhig drod kyi dbang du byas te mnyam pa ni chung ngu'o //
analyzed: re zhig drod kyi dbang du byas te mnyam pa ni chung ngu'o //
translated: In the stage of heat, the five aspects of the nature of love are small.

original: byams pa dang phan pa dang / khong khro ba med pa dang / rnam @73a * //
analyzed: byams pa dang phan pa dang / khong khro ba med pa dang / rnam @73a * //
translated: The five aspects of the nature of love are love, benefit, absence of hostility, absence of malice, and absence of violence.

original: par 'tshe ba'i sems med pa'i rnam pa lnga ni 'bring ngo //
analyzed: par 'tshe ba'i sems med pa'i rnam pa lnga ni 'bring ngo //
translated: The five aspects of the nature of love are medium.🔽The five aspects of the nature of love are great.🔽In the stage of summits, the five aspects of the nature of love are small.🔽The five aspects of the nature of love are medium.🔽The five aspects of the nature of love are great.🔽In the stage of acceptance, the five aspects of the nature of love are small.🔽The five aspects of the nature of love are medium.🔽The five aspects of the nature of love are great.🔽In the stage of the highest worldly realization, the five aspects of the nature of love are small.🔽The five aspects of the nature of love are medium.

original: pha dang ma'i sems dang / spun dang sring mo'i sems dang / bu dang bu mo'i sems dang / bshes dang grogs kyi sems dang / gnyen dang snag gi gnyen mtshams kyi sems rnams ni chen po'o //
analyzed: pha dang ma'i sems dang / spun dang sring mo'i sems dang / bu dang bu mo'i sems dang / bshes dang grogs kyi sems dang / gnyen dang snag gi gnyen mtshams kyi sems rnams ni chen po'o //
translated: The five aspects of the nature of love are great.🔽In the path of seeing, the five aspects of the nature of love are small.🔽The five aspects of the nature of love are medium.🔽The five aspects of the nature of love are great.🔽In the path of cultivation, the five aspects of the nature of love are small.🔽The five aspects of the nature of love are medium.🔽The five aspects of the nature of love are great.🔽In the stage of the eighth person, the five aspects of the nature of love are small.

analyzed: rtse mo'i dbang du byas te ni mi dge ba dang dge ba la grangs bzhin du nyams pa dang / len pa'i sgo nas ldog pa dang zhugs pa'i bdag nyid can de'i sgo nas rnam pa gzhan rnams sdig pa las ldog pa dang / dge ba la gnas pa dag la sbyor ba'i rnam pa gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni rim pa bzhin du chung ngu dang 'bring ngo ;
translated: The five aspects of the nature of love are medium.🔽The five aspects of the nature of love are great.🔽In the stage of the ninth person, the five aspects of the nature of love are small.🔽The five aspects of the nature of love are medium.🔽The five aspects of the nature of love are great.🔽In the stage of the tenth person, the five aspects of the nature of love are small.🔽The five aspects of the nature of love are medium.🔽The five aspects of the nature of love are great.🔽In the stage of the eighth person, the five aspects of the nature of love are small.🔽The five aspects of the nature of love are medium.🔽The five aspects of the nature of love are great.🔽In the stage of the ninth person, the five aspects of the nature of love are small.🔽The five aspects of the nature of love are medium.🔽The five aspects of the nature of love are great.🔽In the stage of the tenth person, the five

original: / gzhan dag nyid de ltar zhugs pa rnams la bsngags pa pa brjod pa dang mthun par byed pa zhes bya ba ni chen po'o //
analyzed: / gzhan dag nyid de ltar zhugs pa rnams la bsngags pa pa brjod pa dang mthun par byed pa zhes bya ba ni chen po'o //
translated: The great is the one who praises others who have entered in that way and acts in accordance with their praise.

original: bzod pa'i dbang du byas te ni sbyor ba dang bsngags pa brjod pa dang mthun par byed pa zhes bya ba rnams rim pa bzhin du chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po sbyar ro //
analyzed: bzod pa'i dbang du byas te ni sbyor ba dang bsngags pa brjod pa dang mthun par byed pa zhes bya ba rnams rim pa bzhin du chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po sbyar ro //
translated: In terms of patience, the small, medium, and great are respectively applied to the preparation, praising others who have entered, and acting in accordance with their praise.

original: 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gi dbang du byas te ni smin par byed pa dang / grol bar byed pa'i lam thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi dbang du byas pa de dag rim pa bzhin du chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen por sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gi dbang du byas te ni smin par byed pa dang / grol bar byed pa'i lam thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi dbang du byas pa de dag rim pa bzhin du chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen por sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In terms of the supreme mundane state, the small, medium, and great are respectively applied to the path that brings to maturity, the path that liberates, and all the paths in terms of the three knowledges.

original: de ltar na 'dir zhes bya bas sngar thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir zhes bya bas sngar thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: Thus, here, by the word “thus,” in terms of the knowledge of all aspects and so on,🔽the path is gradually generated in the mindstream,

original: rim gyis rgyud la lam bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: rim gyis rgyud la lam bskyed pa'am /
translated: The path is gradually generated in the mindstream.🔽

original: thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes pa'i shes rab gtso bor byas pa'i tshe ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa de dag de yang rjes su mthun pa dang / khyad par can dang / rab tu rtogs pa dang / gzhan du yongs su bsgyur ba dang /
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes pa'i shes rab gtso bor byas pa'i tshe ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa de dag de yang rjes su mthun pa dang / khyad par can dang / rab tu rtogs pa dang / gzhan du yongs su bsgyur ba dang /
translated: concordant, special, fully realized, transformed elsewhere,

original: tshe gcig pa dang / stan gcig pa ste /🔽rnam pa drug ces brjod par bya la /
analyzed: tshe gcig pa dang / stan gcig pa ste / rnam pa drug ces brjod par bya la /
translated: in one lifetime, and in one sitting.

original: 'dir ni dbye'o zhes dgongs pa'i phyir 'dir zhes bya ba sgra smos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni dbye'o zhes dgongs pa'i phyir 'dir zhes bya ba sgra smos pa yin no //
translated: Here, the word “here” is used because it is intended to divide them here.

original: lhag ma rnams ni go sla bas rnam par ma phye'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni go sla bas rnam par ma phye'o //
translated: The rest are easy to understand, so they are not distinguished.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par ma zhen pa'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa rab tu srab cing rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par ma zhen pa'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa rab tu srab cing rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: The phrase “having the aspect of non-attachment to grasped and grasper” means that the natural conceptualization is very slight and there is no subsequent conceptualization.

original: rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba la rang ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes te de dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni ji ltar mnyam par gzhag pa'i tshe na dngos po gnyis su mi 'dzin pas na gzung ba @73b dang 'dzin par snang ba nyid
analyzed: rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba la rang ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes te de dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni ji ltar mnyam par gzhag pa'i tshe na dngos po gnyis su mi 'dzin pas na gzung ba @73b dang 'dzin par snang ba nyid
translated: The result that is consistent with itself is as follows: since one is not apprehending the two things of an apprehended object and an apprehending subject when one is equipoised in that way, the appearance of an apprehended object and an apprehending subject

original: med pa ltar de las langs pa na yang gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba tsam zhig yod du zin kyang gnyis su zhen pa med pa'i phyir na de rang gi rgyud dang mthun pa'i 'bras bur brjod do //
analyzed: med pa ltar de las langs pa na yang gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba tsam zhig yod du zin kyang gnyis su zhen pa med pa'i phyir na de rang gi rgyud dang mthun pa'i 'bras bur brjod do //
translated: does not exist. Even though there is merely the appearance of an apprehended object and an apprehending subject when one has arisen from that equipoise, because there is no conception of the two, it is said to be the result that is consistent with its cause.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni bden pa mthong ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni bden pa mthong ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: The yogis and yoginis is to say those who have seen the truth.

original: tha snyad rnams ni bya ba la 'jug pa'i bdag nyid rnams te de rnams ni dus dang yul thams cad du rang gis mnyam par gzhag pa'i dus na chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba'i rang bzhin rtogs pa dang mthun pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: tha snyad rnams ni bya ba la 'jug pa'i bdag nyid rnams te de rnams ni dus dang yul thams cad du rang gis mnyam par gzhag pa'i dus na chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba'i rang bzhin rtogs pa dang mthun pa kho na yin te /
translated: The conventional is the nature of engagement in action. It is always and everywhere in harmony with the realization of the nature of the universal ground of phenomena, when one is in a state of meditative equipoise.

original: 'di ni bzang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni bzang ngo //
translated: This is good.

original: 'di ni ngan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ngan pa'o //
translated: This is bad.

original: bdag gis chos 'di'i phyir chos smra ba 'di la lus 'di 'bul zhing srog ni btang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med de /
analyzed: bdag gis chos 'di'i phyir chos smra ba 'di la lus 'di 'bul zhing srog ni btang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med de /
translated: For the sake of this Dharma, I will give this Dharma teacher my body and even give up my life.

original: brda la blo byang ba dag gis me long la sogs par gzugs brnyan mthong ba na snang ba tsam zhig yod kyang de la ji ltar yang mi rtsol bar gnas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: brda la blo byang ba dag gis me long la sogs par gzugs brnyan mthong ba na snang ba tsam zhig yod kyang de la ji ltar yang mi rtsol bar gnas pa bzhin no //
translated: Those whose minds are trained in symbols, when they see a reflection in a mirror, etc., know that there is only an appearance, and they do not make any effort with regard to it.

original: de ltar na 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sa rab tu dga' ba thob pa ni skad cig la sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya yongs su sbyong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sa rab tu dga' ba thob pa ni skad cig la sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya yongs su sbyong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In that case, how could it be established that a bodhisattva who has attained the ground of Supreme Joy purifies a hundred buddhafields in an instant?🔽Therefore, except for the power of the need to train sentient beings, it is certain that it is not like that.

original: de'i phyir sems can gdul ba'i dgos pa'i dbang ma gtogs par ni de ltar nges pa'o zhes tshig tha ma khong nas dbyung ste des na sems can thams cad gdul ba'i dgos pa'i dbang nye bar gnas pa na sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthus sgyu ma tsam du
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can gdul ba'i dgos pa'i dbang ma gtogs par ni de ltar nges pa'o zhes tshig tha ma khong nas dbyung ste des na sems can thams cad gdul ba'i dgos pa'i dbang nye bar gnas pa na sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthus sgyu ma tsam du
translated: The last line of the root verse is to be understood as, “Therefore, when the power of the need to train all sentient beings is present, through the power of previous aspirations, like an illusion,🔽the thought ‘I will teach this suchness to them’ and so on arises.”

original: 'di la chos nyid 'di lta bu zhig bdag gi bstan to snyam pa la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la chos nyid 'di lta bu zhig bdag gi bstan to snyam pa la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: As taught:

original: dgos pa'i dbang du rgyal ba rnams //🔽nga dang nga yi gsungs pa ltar //
analyzed: dgos pa'i dbang du rgyal ba rnams // nga dang nga yi gsungs pa ltar //
translated: The victors, through the power of the need,

original: zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: say ‘I’ and ‘mine’ as if they were real.

original: 'gro ba 'ga' zhig 'dul ba'i phrin las mi mdzad pa'i tshe na ni sngar bstan pa ltar rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu tsam zhig la gnas kyi don mdzad pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa ci yang mi mnga' bas de dag kyang nye bar brtags nas
analyzed: 'gro ba 'ga' zhig 'dul ba'i phrin las mi mdzad pa'i tshe na ni sngar bstan pa ltar rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu tsam zhig la gnas kyi don mdzad pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa ci yang mi mnga' bas de dag kyang nye bar brtags nas
translated: When they do not perform the deeds of guiding some beings, they abide in the mere result that is concordant with the cause, as previously explained.

original: bshad de / btags pa ni 'dir don mdzad pa'i gnas skabs de mi mdzad pa'i dus la yang 'bras bus rgyu la btags te brjod do //
analyzed: bshad de / btags pa ni 'dir don mdzad pa'i gnas skabs de mi mdzad pa'i dus la yang 'bras bus rgyu la btags te brjod do //
translated: They do not have any thoughts of performing deeds and so on.

original: btags pa'i dgos pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni rnam par rtog pa med pas chos nyid rtogs pa kho na dang mthun pa yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btags pa'i dgos pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni rnam par rtog pa med pas chos nyid rtogs pa kho na dang mthun pa yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The purpose of the designation is to make bodhisattvas understand that they are in accord with the realization of dharmatā alone, since they are free of discursive thoughts.

original: gzhan dag ni @74a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni @74a * //
translated: Others say that

original: don mdzad pa dang mi mdzad pa'i gnas skabs gnyis su ni mi dbye'i don mdzad par snang ba'i tshe na yang rtogs pa dang mthun pa las ma nyams mod kyi /
analyzed: don mdzad pa dang mi mdzad pa'i gnas skabs gnyis su ni mi dbye'i don mdzad par snang ba'i tshe na yang rtogs pa dang mthun pa las ma nyams mod kyi /
translated: the two states of performing and not performing deeds are not differentiated. Even when they appear to perform deeds, they do not lose their concordance with realization.

original: don gang dang gang zhig mdzad pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams su lhun gyis grub pa'i tshul gyis 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: don gang dang gang zhig mdzad pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams su lhun gyis grub pa'i tshul gyis 'jug pa yin te /
translated: He enters spontaneously into the samadhis that perform any and all deeds.

original: ji skad du 'jam dpal sgra skad thams cad brda zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod de /
analyzed: ji skad du 'jam dpal sgra skad thams cad brda zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod de /
translated: As it is said, there is the samadhi called “all sounds and voices are symbols.”

original: ting nge 'dzin de thob na byang chub sems dpa' sgra skad dang / brjod pa dang brda thams cad rtogs shing yi ge thams cad kyi yi ge gcig ston pa dang / yi ge gcig gis yi ge thams cad ston par byed do ;
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de thob na byang chub sems dpa' sgra skad dang / brjod pa dang brda thams cad rtogs shing yi ge thams cad kyi yi ge gcig ston pa dang / yi ge gcig gis yi ge thams cad ston par byed do ;
translated: When bodhisattvas have attained this samadhi, they understand all sounds, voices, and languages and can show all the letters of the alphabet with a single letter and show a single letter with all the letters of the alphabet.

original: /'jam dpal las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba bsod nams dang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dogs shing ston par byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod de /
analyzed: /'jam dpal las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba bsod nams dang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dogs shing ston par byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod de /
translated: There is the samadhi called “all the merit and roots of virtue that arise from the ripening of karma are revealed and shown.”

original: de ting nge 'dzin de thob nas byang chub sems dpa' cang mi smra bar snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: de ting nge 'dzin de thob nas byang chub sems dpa' cang mi smra bar snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: When bodhisattvas have attained this samadhi, they remain in meditative equipoise without speaking.

original: yi ge gcig tsam yang mi brjod par sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi sgra dang / chos kyi sgra dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra dang / nyan thos kyi sgra dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sgra dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sgra dang /
analyzed: yi ge gcig tsam yang mi brjod par sems can thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi sgra dang / chos kyi sgra dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra dang / nyan thos kyi sgra dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sgra dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sgra dang /
translated: Without uttering even a single syllable, they cause all sentient beings to hear the sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, the sound of the Saṅgha, the sound of śrāvakas, the sound of pratyekabuddhas, the sound of bodhisattvas,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgra thos par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgra thos par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: and the sound of the perfections.”

original: de ltar gang yang rung ste phyogs gnyi ga la btags par bstan pa yod pas btags pa'i dgos pa bstan pa ni de lta ma yin na rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la so so rang gis rig pas skad cig ma rnams ji ltar gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i
analyzed: de ltar gang yang rung ste phyogs gnyi ga la btags par bstan pa yod pas btags pa'i dgos pa bstan pa ni de lta ma yin na rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la so so rang gis rig pas skad cig ma rnams ji ltar gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i
translated: Thus, since there are teachings that impute both of those, the purpose of imputation is taught. If it were not so, how could the moments of the yogi’s continuum be characterized as something that causes others to have confidence in them through their individual self-awareness?

original: mtshan nyid dag yin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dag yin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said, “What are their characteristics?”

original: btags pa tsam gyis kyang de'i yon tan ma bstan na su zhig mthong ba'i lam la yid ches nas thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug ches bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: btags pa tsam gyis kyang de'i yon tan ma bstan na su zhig mthong ba'i lam la yid ches nas thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug ches bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one does not teach its virtues even by way of mere designation, then who would enter into the path of seeing in order to attain it by way of belief?🔽The path of meditative development is profound,

original: bsgom pa'i lam zab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam ni zab pa dang / rgya che ba yin la bsgom pa'i lam ni phal cher shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por stong pa nyid du goms par byed pas na zab pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam zab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam ni zab pa dang / rgya che ba yin la bsgom pa'i lam ni phal cher shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por stong pa nyid du goms par byed pas na zab pa ste /
translated: the path of seeing is profound and vast, but the path of meditative development is profound, for the most part, because it is the cultivation of emptiness as the counteragent to the obscurations that are pertinent to the knowable.

original: de ltar na zab pa la rab tu goms par byas pa'i dbang gis na sa brgyad pa la sangs rgyas kyis bskul ba'i mthar thug pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na zab pa la rab tu goms par byas pa'i dbang gis na sa brgyad pa la sangs rgyas kyis bskul ba'i mthar thug pa yin no //
translated: Thus, on account of the fact that one has become well acquainted with the profound, the Buddha urges one to reach the culmination of the path on the eighth spiritual level.

original: de ltar rab tu zab pa'i stong pa nyid chen po mngon du byed pas na sngar stong pa nyid la sogs pa la yang gzugs @74b med la ;
analyzed: de ltar rab tu zab pa'i stong pa nyid chen po mngon du byed pas na sngar stong pa nyid la sogs pa la yang gzugs @74b med la ;
translated: In this way, one manifests the extremely profound emptiness by way of the great and thus, even in regard to emptiness etc. previously, one does not perceive form etc. as non-existent.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa gzugs las gzhan pa yang ma yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas don dam pa'i bden pa bstan te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa gzugs las gzhan pa yang ma yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas don dam pa'i bden pa bstan te /
translated: Since emptiness and so on are not different from form and so on, the ultimate truth is taught by the passage that begins with emptiness is not other than form, and so on.

original: gnyen po'i stobs kyi blo chos kyi dbyings ji lta bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyen po'i stobs kyi blo chos kyi dbyings ji lta bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase the mind becomes like the dharmadhatu through the power of the antidote means that the mind becomes like the dharmadhatu through the power of the antidote.

original: pa ri ni gong du'o //
analyzed: pa ri ni gong du'o //
translated: Pari means above.

original: mthong ba'i don ni ye shes kyis rim gyis nyams su myong ba'i don de la'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i don ni ye shes kyis rim gyis nyams su myong ba'i don de la'o //
translated: The phrase the object seen refers to the object that is gradually experienced by wisdom.

original: sems pa ni thos pa'i shes rab kyis sam sbyor ba'i dus na'o //
analyzed: sems pa ni thos pa'i shes rab kyis sam sbyor ba'i dus na'o //
translated: The phrase the mind that thinks refers to the wisdom of listening or to the time of preparation.

original: 'jam pa ni bsam pa'i shes rab kyis sam dngos kyis so //
analyzed: 'jam pa ni bsam pa'i shes rab kyis sam dngos kyis so //
translated: The phrase the gentle refers to the wisdom of reflection or to the actual stage.

original: nges par rtogs pa ni bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis sam rjes las byung bas so //
analyzed: nges par rtogs pa ni bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis sam rjes las byung bas so //
translated: The phrase the definite realization refers to the wisdom of meditation or to the post-meditation stage.

original: de rnam pa du zhig ce na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dang po lam shes pa'i skabs su phye ba'i bsgom pa'i lam de dag re re la yang rnam par dag pa dgu dgur bstan cing de las mang ba ni rgyal ba'i yum de dang de
analyzed: de rnam pa du zhig ce na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dang po lam shes pa'i skabs su phye ba'i bsgom pa'i lam de dag re re la yang rnam par dag pa dgu dgur bstan cing de las mang ba ni rgyal ba'i yum de dang de
translated: The phrase how many types are there? and so on refers to the fact that each of those paths of meditation that were distinguished in the context of the knowledge of the path are taught to have nine types of purity, and that there are more than that in the Mother of the Victorious Ones.

original: las zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gegs par bya'o //🔽ji ltar de bzhin nyid rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi don mngon sum du grub par snang ba ltar rang gi don yang don dam par rang bzhin med bzhin du kun rdzob tu 'grub par cis na mi
analyzed: las zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gegs par bya'o // ji ltar de bzhin nyid rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi don mngon sum du grub par snang ba ltar rang gi don yang don dam par rang bzhin med bzhin du kun rdzob tu 'grub par cis na mi
translated: This is refuted by “action” and so forth.

original: 'gyur zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: “Just as suchness is the characteristic of the culmination of the perfection of wisdom” and so forth teaches that just as the benefit of others is established in the way it appears, so too the ultimate establishment of the benefit of self is established conventionally, even though ultimately it is essenceless.

original: rgyu med par 'jig pa yin la zhes bya ba ni sems can pha rol la sogs pas gnod pa ma byas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: rgyu med par 'jig pa yin la zhes bya ba ni sems can pha rol la sogs pas gnod pa ma byas kyang rung ste /
translated: “Destruction is causeless” means that even without being harmed by other sentient beings and so forth,

original: 'jig pa'i byed pa po med par rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i byed pa po med par rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa yin te /
translated: destruction occurs naturally without an agent.

original: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma //
translated: All conditioned phenomena are momentary.

original: mi gnas bya ba la yod //
analyzed: mi gnas bya ba la yod //
translated: They do not endure.

original: bya ba byung ba nyid yin pas //
analyzed: bya ba byung ba nyid yin pas //
translated: Since the action of arising has already occurred,

original: byed pa zhes su de la bya //
analyzed: byed pa zhes su de la bya //
translated: how could it be called an agent?

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is what is said.

original: skad cig ma nyid kyis zhes bya ba 'di ni de'i rgyu mtshan du sbyar ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid kyis zhes bya ba 'di ni de'i rgyu mtshan du sbyar ro //
translated: “By virtue of being momentary” is to be connected as the reason for that.

original: des na gsum pa 'di ni rgyu mtshan du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na gsum pa 'di ni rgyu mtshan du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this third [reason] should be seen as the reason.

original: 'dir slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas ni dngos po rnams la ni skad cig ma'i mi rtag pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas ni dngos po rnams la ni skad cig ma'i mi rtag pa med mod kyi /
translated: Here, the master Candrakīrti says, “Things do not have momentary impermanence.

original: gdul bya'i yid 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir de ltar bstan te mi rtag pa ni rgyun chad pa'i mi rtag pa 'ba' zhig go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gdul bya'i yid 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir de ltar bstan te mi rtag pa ni rgyun chad pa'i mi rtag pa 'ba' zhig go zhes gsungs so //
translated: However, in order to generate disgust in the minds of those to be tamed, it is taught in that way. Impermanence is only the impermanence of the cessation of a continuum.”

original: mdo sde rgyan la sogs pa'i lugs kyis ni dngos po rnams la de ldan par bstan te /
analyzed: mdo sde rgyan la sogs pa'i lugs kyis ni dngos po rnams la de ldan par bstan te /
translated: According to the system of the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras and so on, it is taught that things have that [impermanence].

original: rang rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i dbang tsam las de dngos po zhes bya ba rang grub pa med ces brjod pas de dag 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i dbang tsam las de dngos po zhes bya ba rang grub pa med ces brjod pas de dag 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is said that “that which is called a thing does not exist as established from its own side, but only from the power of one’s own conception,” those [things] are tenable.

original: phyogs 'dis kyang @75a * //
analyzed: phyogs 'dis kyang @75a * //
translated: By this position,

original: rgol ba de ni mi gnod ces lan dang por brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rgol ba de ni mi gnod ces lan dang por brjod pa'o //
translated: the opponent’s objection is not damaging. This is the first response.

original: grub pa'i mtha' las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang lan gnyis pa ston te dngos por mngon par zhen pa rab tu ma spangs pa khyed rang gi grub pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang lan gnyis pa ston te dngos por mngon par zhen pa rab tu ma spangs pa khyed rang gi grub pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: The second reply is indicated by the passage beginning “Also, in your tenets…”

original: rigs pa dang lung gis rang tu bstan par rang gi 'dod pa grub pa ni de nas phar yang 'gror med pas na mtha'o //
analyzed: rigs pa dang lung gis rang tu bstan par rang gi 'dod pa grub pa ni de nas phar yang 'gror med pas na mtha'o //
translated: You have not completely abandoned clinging to things. Your tenets are taught by reason and scripture. Your assertions are established, but there is no going beyond them, and so they are a limit.

original: de tsam du khyed kyis gtan la phab pa'i 'dod pa ston pa'i gzhung las ni /
analyzed: de tsam du khyed kyis gtan la phab pa'i 'dod pa ston pa'i gzhung las ni /
translated: In the treatises that teach the assertions that you have thus established,

original: 'jig rten sna tshogs las las skyes //
analyzed: 'jig rten sna tshogs las las skyes //
translated: it says, “The various worlds arise from karma.”🔽Therefore, if one’s karma causes one’s own death, how could the killer be sinful?

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir na rang gi las kyis rang shi na de la gsod pa po la sdig par ji ltar 'gyur zhes 'dri ba 'di khyed la kho bo cag gi zla'i shugs kyis dris pa na khyed la yang kho bo cag dang mtshungs par gnod par 'gyur
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir na rang gi las kyis rang shi na de la gsod pa po la sdig par ji ltar 'gyur zhes 'dri ba 'di khyed la kho bo cag gi zla'i shugs kyis dris pa na khyed la yang kho bo cag dang mtshungs par gnod par 'gyur
translated: When we ask you this question by the power of your own assertions, you will be harmed in the same way that we are.

original: te / de'i phyir slob dpon dul ba lha'i zhal snga nas nyes pa mtshungs pa kho nas pha rol po tshoms par 'gyur bas de la nyes pa gzhan ni mi brjod do zhes bstan te 'di yang chos nyid kyi rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: te / de'i phyir slob dpon dul ba lha'i zhal snga nas nyes pa mtshungs pa kho nas pha rol po tshoms par 'gyur bas de la nyes pa gzhan ni mi brjod do zhes bstan te 'di yang chos nyid kyi rigs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, Master Vinītadeva states that since the opponent is defeated by the same fault, no other fault is stated. This is also a reasoning of reality.

original: chos kha cig 'gro ba rnams la mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa lta bur snang yang chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyis de khas blang bar bya ba yod de /
analyzed: chos kha cig 'gro ba rnams la mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa lta bur snang yang chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyis de khas blang bar bya ba yod de /
translated: Although some phenomena appear to be undermined by direct perception and so on for some beings, there are phenomena that must be accepted due to the reality of phenomena.

original: tsha bas tig pa la slar tsha bas gdung ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: tsha bas tig pa la slar tsha bas gdung ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, one who is tormented by heat is tormented by heat again.

original: don dam par zhes bya ba ni khyed kyi don dam pa nges par yod cing don byed pa'i dang du byas su zin kyang rang gi las kyi 'bras bu la dpyad par zad pas na gang zag gzhan du bgrang bar sus kyang su yang bsad pa yang med
analyzed: don dam par zhes bya ba ni khyed kyi don dam pa nges par yod cing don byed pa'i dang du byas su zin kyang rang gi las kyi 'bras bu la dpyad par zad pas na gang zag gzhan du bgrang bar sus kyang su yang bsad pa yang med
translated: Although you assert that the ultimate exists and performs a function, since it is merely analyzed in terms of the result of its own action, no one can count another person as an agent, and no one is killed.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i klan ka khyed la yang 'byung zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i klan ka khyed la yang 'byung zhes sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied to you as well, since the fault of “no one is killed” and so on arises for you.

original: de dang de la phyogs gzhan nas zhes bya ba ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos dag tu gang don dam par med pa de dag ni kun rdzob tu yang med de zhes rtsod pa smra ba'i lan btab pa'i gnas skabs de dang de dag tu zhib tu bstan gyis
analyzed: de dang de la phyogs gzhan nas zhes bya ba ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos dag tu gang don dam par med pa de dag ni kun rdzob tu yang med de zhes rtsod pa smra ba'i lan btab pa'i gnas skabs de dang de dag tu zhib tu bstan gyis
translated: “In other contexts” means that this should be understood in detail in other contexts, such as the refutation of the argument that “whatever does not exist ultimately is also nonexistent conventionally” in the Madhyamaka treatises.

original: der ltos shig ces bya'o //
analyzed: der ltos shig ces bya'o //
translated: So look there.

original: phyogs gzhan nas zhes bya ba ni rigs pa gzhan yang de dag bstan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan nas zhes bya ba ni rigs pa gzhan yang de dag bstan zhes bya'o //
translated: “In other contexts” means that other arguments should be taught.

original: dpe ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa ni don dam par 'dod pa yin la rmi lam gyi gnas skabs la sogs pa ni kun rdzob tu yang rmi lam la sogs pa 'dra zhes 'dod pas dpe ma grub la /
analyzed: dpe ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa ni don dam par 'dod pa yin la rmi lam gyi gnas skabs la sogs pa ni kun rdzob tu yang rmi lam la sogs pa 'dra zhes 'dod pas dpe ma grub la /
translated: “The example is not established” means that the lack of intrinsic nature is asserted to be ultimate, but the dream state, etc., are asserted to be like dreams, etc., even conventionally, so the example is not established.

original: gal te kun rdzob pa nyid du zhes zer na yang @75b gnyid log pa'i tshe sems gnyid kyis mthu nyams pa dang / gnyid ma log pa'i tshe ma nyams pa ni nus pa ga la mnyam pas na dpe ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob pa nyid du zhes zer na yang @75b gnyid log pa'i tshe sems gnyid kyis mthu nyams pa dang / gnyid ma log pa'i tshe ma nyams pa ni nus pa ga la mnyam pas na dpe ma grub pa'o //
translated: If you say that it is in terms of the conventional, then how can the mind be impaired by sleep when one is asleep and not impaired when one is not asleep? Since they are not equal in their capacity, the example is not established.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bya dgos pas thabs la mkhas pas gsungs te zhes bya ba la thabs mkhas pa bcu po 'di sangs rgyas kun tu bzang po'i chos su bstan tam 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bya dgos pas thabs la mkhas pas gsungs te zhes bya ba la thabs mkhas pa bcu po 'di sangs rgyas kun tu bzang po'i chos su bstan tam 'on te ma yin /
translated: Are these ten skillful means taught as the qualities of the buddha Samantabhadra or not?

original: gal te phyogs dang po ltar na ni phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags zhes bya ba la 'di ji ltar rung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te phyogs dang po ltar na ni phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags zhes bya ba la 'di ji ltar rung bar 'gyur /
translated: If the former, then how can it be correct to say they are signs of irreversibility?

original: gal te phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa zhes smos par mi rigs kyi byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba bya dgos pas zhes smos par rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa zhes smos par mi rigs kyi byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba bya dgos pas zhes smos par rigs so zhe na /
translated: If the latter, then it is incorrect to say he must perform the deeds of a buddha, and it is correct to say he must perform the deeds of a bodhisattva.

original: 'di ni sngar sa bcu pa la ni byang chub sems dpa' la sangs rgyas zhes bya bar brjod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis na /
analyzed: 'di ni sngar sa bcu pa la ni byang chub sems dpa' la sangs rgyas zhes bya bar brjod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis na /
translated: This is because previously, in the tenth chapter, it says, “On the tenth level the bodhisattva is called a buddha.”

original: sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dbang bskur ba'i sa la gnas pa dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa sangs rgyas su snang ba'i dbang du byas pa'i mdzad pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dbang bskur ba'i sa la gnas pa dang / skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa sangs rgyas su snang ba'i dbang du byas pa'i mdzad pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the deeds of the bodhisattvas on the tenth stage, who are on the stage of consecration, and of those who are impeded by only one birth, are from the point of view of the appearance of Buddhahood.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa bcu ni thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa bcu ni thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: The ten aspects of the perfection of wisdom are the ten kinds of skill in means.

original: de dag byang chub sems dpa'i mchog de dag gis dmigs par bya ba yin pas na yul te /
analyzed: de dag byang chub sems dpa'i mchog de dag gis dmigs par bya ba yin pas na yul te /
translated: They are the domain of those supreme bodhisattvas.

original: mngon sum du bya ba ni dka' thub spyod pa la sogs pa lus dang ngag dang sems kyis ci rigs su nyams su blang ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du bya ba ni dka' thub spyod pa la sogs pa lus dang ngag dang sems kyis ci rigs su nyams su blang ba'o //
translated: The practice of the direct realization is the practice of the body, speech, and mind, such as the practice of austerities, in whatever way is appropriate.

original: dus dang dus ma yin pa shes pa'i sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba ni sems can 'dul bar 'gyur ba ni mngon sum du bya ba'i dus yin la /
analyzed: dus dang dus ma yin pa shes pa'i sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba ni sems can 'dul bar 'gyur ba ni mngon sum du bya ba'i dus yin la /
translated: The application of the knowledge of the right and the wrong time is this: the time for the direct realization is when sentient beings are to be converted.

original: gal te de dag mi 'dul na don med pas mngon du bya ba'i dus ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de dag mi 'dul na don med pas mngon du bya ba'i dus ma yin no //
translated: If they are not to be converted, then it is not the time for the direct realization, because it would be useless.

original: de ltar shes pa'i sbyor ba ste shes nas mngon sum du bya ba'am mi bya ba la sbyor ba ni thabs mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar shes pa'i sbyor ba ste shes nas mngon sum du bya ba'am mi bya ba la sbyor ba ni thabs mkhas pa yin no //
translated: The application of knowing that is the skill in means, in that one applies oneself to the direct realization or non-realization of that.

original: des na ni zhes bya ba ni nges par bzung ba'o //
analyzed: des na ni zhes bya ba ni nges par bzung ba'o //
translated: The word then is a particle of certainty.

original: skabs bzhi pa'i 'grel bshad rdzogs so /
analyzed: skabs bzhi pa'i 'grel bshad rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the fourth chapter is finished.

original: // / de ltar skabs bzhi pa rnam par phye nas da ni skabs lnga pa bstan pa dbye ba'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: // / de ltar skabs bzhi pa rnam par phye nas da ni skabs lnga pa bstan pa dbye ba'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, having analyzed the fourth chapter, now, in order to teach the fifth chapter, it is said, from the complete clear realization of all aspects, and so on.

original: rab kyis mthar phyin pa'i rtogs pa 'byung ngo zhes go sla bar bya ba'i phyir rtogs la sogs pa bsnyad pa sngon du 'gro ba'i rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya @76a * //
analyzed: rab kyis mthar phyin pa'i rtogs pa 'byung ngo zhes go sla bar bya ba'i phyir rtogs la sogs pa bsnyad pa sngon du 'gro ba'i rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya @76a * //
translated: In order to make it easy to understand that the realization of the peak arises for the best, the explanation of the peak clear realization is preceded by the mention of realization and so on.

original: pa la ; rab kyis mthar phyin pa ni 'og nas 'chad pa'i tshul gyis sa mi g-yo ba thob par gyur phyin cad do //
analyzed: pa la ; rab kyis mthar phyin pa ni 'og nas 'chad pa'i tshul gyis sa mi g-yo ba thob par gyur phyin cad do //
translated: The best's final attainment is from the time of attaining the immovable ground, as will be explained below.

original: de nas brtsams te sngar ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i drod la sogs pa yang 'dris par byed pa'i tshe rtags rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i rtogs pa 'byung ngo zhes skabs tha dad pa gcig tu bstan pa ni bslab pa'i tshe sa mtshams
analyzed: de nas brtsams te sngar ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i drod la sogs pa yang 'dris par byed pa'i tshe rtags rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i rtogs pa 'byung ngo zhes skabs tha dad pa gcig tu bstan pa ni bslab pa'i tshe sa mtshams
translated: Then, when one is familiar with the experience of heat and so on, as before, the realization endowed with the twelve signs and so on arises.

original: gang du 'di dag sbyar ba go sla bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang du 'di dag sbyar ba go sla bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The teaching in a different context that these are the signs of heat and so on is for the sake of ease in applying them to the levels of training.

original: dgos pa de gzigs nas sngar bstan zin pa'i drod la sogs pa yang rtags la sogs par bsnyad pa ste /
analyzed: dgos pa de gzigs nas sngar bstan zin pa'i drod la sogs pa yang rtags la sogs par bsnyad pa ste /
translated: Seeing that purpose, the previously explained heat and so on are called signs and so forth.

original: ming gzhan du btags pas de dag sngon du 'gro ba'i rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ming gzhan du btags pas de dag sngon du 'gro ba'i rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Since they are designated with other names, the peak realization that precedes them is taught.

original: de'i phyir na 'dir rtse mo zhes bya ba ni dang po rim gyis skye ba'i dus dang / sa gnyis pa la sogs pa sngar ji ltar bskyed pa goms par byas pa'i chos dag pas mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir skabs 'dis bsdus pa'i don kun rtse mor gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'dir rtse mo zhes bya ba ni dang po rim gyis skye ba'i dus dang / sa gnyis pa la sogs pa sngar ji ltar bskyed pa goms par byas pa'i chos dag pas mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir skabs 'dis bsdus pa'i don kun rtse mor gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, here the term “peak” refers to the time of the initial gradual arising, and since the phenomena that were previously generated on the second stage, etc., are supreme due to the purity of cultivation, all the topics included in this section are posited as the peak.

original: yang na rtse mo ni skabs 'dir bstan pa'i drod la bya ste 'dir bstan pa'i drod ni sngar bstan pa'i mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir na rtse mo'o //
analyzed: yang na rtse mo ni skabs 'dir bstan pa'i drod la bya ste 'dir bstan pa'i drod ni sngar bstan pa'i mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir na rtse mo'o //
translated: Or, the peak is the heat taught in this section, and the heat taught here is the peak because it is supreme to the path of seeing, etc., taught previously.

original: de ltar na rtse mo la sogs pa pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'o ;
analyzed: de ltar na rtse mo la sogs pa pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'o ;
translated: Thus, the clear realization of the peak, etc., is the clear realization of the peak.

original: / de la rtags ni phyi dang nang gi rtags bcu gnyis bstan pa dang ldan pas rtags te /
analyzed: / de la rtags ni phyi dang nang gi rtags bcu gnyis bstan pa dang ldan pas rtags te /
translated: The sign is the sign possessed by the teaching of the twelve signs of external and internal signs.

original: des bstan pa'i don gyis rtags can las rtags su bstan pa'o //
analyzed: des bstan pa'i don gyis rtags can las rtags su bstan pa'o //
translated: The sign is taught from the possessor of the sign by the meaning taught by that.

original: rnam par 'phel ba ni ji skad smos pa'i bsod nams bcu drug gis 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'phel ba ni ji skad smos pa'i bsod nams bcu drug gis 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is increasing because it increases through the sixteen previously mentioned merits.

original: nges pa zhes bya ba ni sngar nyams su myong ba mi gsal ba rnams 'dir rab tu gsal bar mthong bas na mthong ba phyin ci ma log pa ni nges pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba ni sngar nyams su myong ba mi gsal ba rnams 'dir rab tu gsal bar mthong bas na mthong ba phyin ci ma log pa ni nges pa ste /
translated: It is definite because what was previously experienced but unclear is now seen to be very clear.

original: de'i phyir na bstan pa zhes kyang bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir na bstan pa zhes kyang bstan to //
translated: Thus, it is taught that the teaching is also unmistaken seeing.

original: sems kun tu gnas pa ni 'ga' zhig nges par gtan la phebs pas mthong ba'i don la the tshom med pa de ni de nyid la sems rtse gcig pa'i tshul gyis kun nas gnas kyi dmigs pa gzhan mi tshol bas na sems kun tu gnas pa'i //
analyzed: sems kun tu gnas pa ni 'ga' zhig nges par gtan la phebs pas mthong ba'i don la the tshom med pa de ni de nyid la sems rtse gcig pa'i tshul gyis kun nas gnas kyi dmigs pa gzhan mi tshol bas na sems kun tu gnas pa'i //
translated: The mind is fully present because, having ascertained something, one has no doubt about the meaning that is seen. Thus, the mind is fully present in the manner of one-pointedness on that very object, without seeking another object.

original: tshig gi don ni go sla'o //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the words is easy to understand.

original: da ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams re re yang rnam par rtog pa bzhi bzhi dang ldan par bstan pa dang / gnyen po'i tshogs kyang rnam par rtog pa'i rigs bzhi @76b po gnyis su bsdus pa khams kyis phye na khams re re na sum cu rtsa drug tu yod pas spyir khams gsum car gyi dbang du byas pa'i tshe rnam par rtog pa brgya rtsa brgyad du bgrang ba
analyzed: da ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams re re yang rnam par rtog pa bzhi bzhi dang ldan par bstan pa dang / gnyen po'i tshogs kyang rnam par rtog pa'i rigs bzhi @76b po gnyis su bsdus pa khams kyis phye na khams re re na sum cu rtsa drug tu yod pas spyir khams gsum car gyi dbang du byas pa'i tshe rnam par rtog pa brgya rtsa brgyad du bgrang ba
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that each of the factors conducive to penetrative insight is endowed with four kinds of conceptualization and that the collection of antidotes is also subsumed in two kinds of conceptualization, when divided by realm, there are thirty-six in each realm, and in general, when taking the three realms, there are one hundred and eight conceptualizations.

original: de dag 'dir spong ba de bstan pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag 'dir spong ba de bstan pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that they are abandoned here, the text says “the favorable side” and so on.

original: sngar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o zhes bstan pa'i tshul gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni rnam par rtog pa'i rigs gnyis so //
analyzed: sngar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o zhes bstan pa'i tshul gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni rnam par rtog pa'i rigs gnyis so //
translated: In the above, the afflictions of bodhisattvas are said to be conceptualization.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Therein, conceptualization is of four kinds.

original: rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang gnyen po'i rnam par rtog pa pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ngan 'gro'i gnyen por gyur ba dang / de kho na'i rnam par rtog pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang gnyen po'i rnam par rtog pa pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ngan 'gro'i gnyen por gyur ba dang / de kho na'i rnam par rtog pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid la sogs pa dang /
translated: The conceptual thoughts of the nature are the conceptual thoughts of desire and so on, and the conceptual thoughts of the antidotes are the conceptual thoughts of the perfections and so on, which are the antidotes to the lower realms.

original: 'thob pa'i rnam par rtog pa sku gsum gyis bsdus pa rnam pa te /
analyzed: 'thob pa'i rnam par rtog pa sku gsum gyis bsdus pa rnam pa te /
translated: The conceptual thoughts of reality are the conceptual thoughts of the doors of liberation such as emptiness and so on, and the conceptual thoughts of attainment are subsumed by the three bodies.

original: 'di dag ni 'phags pa rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'phags pa rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: These should be understood from the dhāraṇī called Entering Nonconceptuality.

original: de dag la 'dir dang po mthong ba'i lam gyi dbang du byas pa'i gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyi ga yang gnyen po la rnam par rtog pa dang / de kho na'i rnam par rtog pa dang / 'thob pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams su ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag la 'dir dang po mthong ba'i lam gyi dbang du byas pa'i gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyi ga yang gnyen po la rnam par rtog pa dang / de kho na'i rnam par rtog pa dang / 'thob pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams su ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: Here, in terms of the path of seeing, both the conceptual thoughts of the apprehended and the conceptual thoughts of the apprehender are conceptual thoughts of the antidotes, conceptual thoughts of reality and conceptual thoughts of attainment, as is appropriate.

original: de nyid la 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis kyang de dang 'dra ba nyid las 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa tha ma ni rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i gnyen po'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid la 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis kyang de dang 'dra ba nyid las 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa tha ma ni rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i gnyen po'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: The two kinds of conceptual thought that apprehend that are similar to that. The last kind of conceptual thought that apprehends is a conceptual thought that is an antidote arising from the cause of natural conceptual thought.

original: rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa 'dod chags la sogs pa ni lam drug tu bskal pa du ma zhig tu zil gyis mnan te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa 'dod chags la sogs pa ni lam drug tu bskal pa du ma zhig tu zil gyis mnan te /
translated: Natural conceptual thoughts such as attachment are suppressed for many eons on the six paths.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la sogs par de dag rab tu bsrab pa'i phyir gcig tu 'bad par bya ba ma yin pas na de dag la ma smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la sogs par de dag rab tu bsrab pa'i phyir gcig tu 'bad par bya ba ma yin pas na de dag la ma smos so //
translated: Therefore, since they are very weak on the path of seeing and so on, they are not mentioned because they are not to be strenuously abandoned.

original: yang bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rigs bzhi yang gnyen po dang de kho na dang thob pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas par ci rigs su sbyar te /
analyzed: yang bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rigs bzhi yang gnyen po dang de kho na dang thob pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas par ci rigs su sbyar te /
translated: Moreover, the four types of conceptual thought that are based on the path of meditation are to be applied as appropriate to the antidotes, reality, and attainment.

original: rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The reason that they are not natural conceptual thoughts is as before.

original: de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams lam gnyi ga'i sbyor ba'i gnas skabs nyer bsngogs kyis spong bar byed pa ni de dag rags pas shes par @77a * //🔽sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams lam gnyi ga'i sbyor ba'i gnas skabs nyer bsngogs kyis spong bar byed pa ni de dag rags pas shes par @77a * // sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Conceptualization of the apprehended is abandoned by the access concentrations of both the path of seeing and the path of meditation, because it is easy to understand since it is gross.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams lam gnyi gas 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis spong ba ni de dag phra ba'i phyir nyer bsdogs kyis spong bar mi nus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams lam gnyi gas 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis spong ba ni de dag phra ba'i phyir nyer bsdogs kyis spong bar mi nus pa'i phyir te /
translated: Conceptualization of the apprehender is abandoned by the minds and mental factors of the state of engagement through belief in both the path of seeing and the path of meditation, because it is subtle and cannot be abandoned by access concentrations.

original: sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na mos pa yid la byed pa lta bu yin la 'jug pa'i gnas skabs ni de kho na de kho na yid la byed pa lta bu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na mos pa yid la byed pa lta bu yin la 'jug pa'i gnas skabs ni de kho na de kho na yid la byed pa lta bu'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the state of engagement is like attention engaged in belief and the state of entry is like attention engaged in reality.

original: de la de dag kyang gnas skabs gnyis po de der gcig nas phye ste spong ngam 'on te bsdoms te spong zhe na /
analyzed: de la de dag kyang gnas skabs gnyis po de der gcig nas phye ste spong ngam 'on te bsdoms te spong zhe na /
translated: Are these two conceptualizations abandoned by the two states of engagement and entry separately or are they abandoned together?

original: sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su ni gcig nas phye ste spong la 'jug pa'i gnas skabs su ni bsdoms te spong bar byed do //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su ni gcig nas phye ste spong la 'jug pa'i gnas skabs su ni bsdoms te spong bar byed do //
translated: At the time of preparation, one should apply oneself to abandoning them by distinguishing them one by one. At the time of engagement, one should abandon them by combining them.

original: 'dir spong bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i rigs de dag sngar mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni mngon par rtogs pa'i don bsgom pa'i rim pas legs par yid la byas la /
analyzed: 'dir spong bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i rigs de dag sngar mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni mngon par rtogs pa'i don bsgom pa'i rim pas legs par yid la byas la /
translated: Here, those types of conceptual thoughts to be abandoned should be well attended to by one who is not yet equipoised, by the process of cultivating the meaning of clear realization.

original: de nas snying po'i don bsgom pa ni de dag re re yang gcig dang du ma la sogs pas dben zhing /
analyzed: de nas snying po'i don bsgom pa ni de dag re re yang gcig dang du ma la sogs pas dben zhing /
translated: Then, the cultivation of the meaning of the essence is that each of them is devoid of one and many, etc.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i bdag dang phung po nas brtsams te yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi bar du yang dag par ma grub par bsgoms pas rim gyi spong ba dang / ji ltar yid la byas pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams lcug ma bkram pa gtubs pa'i dpes dus gcig tu bsgoms pas gzhom par bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i bdag dang phung po nas brtsams te yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi bar du yang dag par ma grub par bsgoms pas rim gyi spong ba dang / ji ltar yid la byas pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams lcug ma bkram pa gtubs pa'i dpes dus gcig tu bsgoms pas gzhom par bya'o //
translated: By cultivating the non-establishment of the self and aggregates, etc., up to correct wisdom as they are taught, one should gradually abandon them, and by cultivating the conceptual thoughts as they are attended to all at once, like cutting a clump of reeds, one should destroy them.

original: de bzhin du khams re re na rnam par rtog pa sum cu rtsa drug drug yod pa ni de dag tu skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bden pa ma mthong ba rnams dang / bden pa mthong ba'i yang snyoms par 'jug pa rgyu'i sgo nas de dag la de ltar ldan par bstan pas tshul snga mas khams dang der de dag rang rang gi khams kyi rnam par rtog pa spong ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams re re na rnam par rtog pa sum cu rtsa drug drug yod pa ni de dag tu skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bden pa ma mthong ba rnams dang / bden pa mthong ba'i yang snyoms par 'jug pa rgyu'i sgo nas de dag la de ltar ldan par bstan pas tshul snga mas khams dang der de dag rang rang gi khams kyi rnam par rtog pa spong ba'i phyir dang /
translated: Thus, through the former method, one should understand that the realms and the concepts of each realm are abandoned by the bodhisattvas born in those realms.

original: khams gcig po gang yang rung ba dag tu lam bsgoms pas kyang rim gyis sam sdom pa'i tshul gyis snying po'i don bsgom pa kho nas de dag spong bar byed par shes par bya'o ;
analyzed: khams gcig po gang yang rung ba dag tu lam bsgoms pas kyang rim gyis sam sdom pa'i tshul gyis snying po'i don bsgom pa kho nas de dag spong bar byed par shes par bya'o ;
translated: And through the latter method, one should understand that the concepts are abandoned by meditating on the meaning of the essence in any one of the realms through the path of meditation, either gradually or in a combined manner.

original: / de'i phyir na mngon par rtogs pa'i don yid la byed pa'i dus su ni rgyal po'i lta ba pos nyes ba byed pa rnams nges par bzung ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: / de'i phyir na mngon par rtogs pa'i don yid la byed pa'i dus su ni rgyal po'i lta ba pos nyes ba byed pa rnams nges par bzung ba lta bu yin no //
translated: Therefore, when one is attending to the meaning of realization, it is like a king who has captured criminals and is about to punish them.

original: snying po'i don gyi nyer bsdogs kyi dus su ni nyes pa byes pa'i mi rnams gshed ma'i lag tu khrid pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: snying po'i don gyi nyer bsdogs kyi dus su ni nyes pa byes pa'i mi rnams gshed ma'i lag tu khrid pa lta bu yin no //
translated: At the time of the threshold of the meaning of the essence, it is like the people who have committed crimes being led to the executioner.

original: de'i 'jug pa la @77b sogs pa'i gnas skabs na ni de dag la yan lag bcad pa dang / mig dgag pa la sogs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'jug pa la @77b sogs pa'i gnas skabs na ni de dag la yan lag bcad pa dang / mig dgag pa la sogs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: At the time of the entry into the path of application, it is like having the limbs of those people cut off, having their eyes gouged out, and so on.

original: snying po'i bsgom pa'i rab kyi mtha' bar chad med pa'i lam la ni de dag mgo bcad pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: snying po'i bsgom pa'i rab kyi mtha' bar chad med pa'i lam la ni de dag mgo bcad pa lta bu yin no //
translated: At the time of the culmination of the meditation on the essence, it is like having their heads cut off.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa kun tu bzang po slar mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa kun tu bzang po slar mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa lta bu'o //
translated: At the stage of the Buddha ground, Samantabhadra, it is like the non-arising of phenomena.

original: 'di ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi bsdus pa'i don cig car bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi bsdus pa'i don cig car bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the concise meaning of the concepts of percepts and perceivers taught all at once.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i 'og tu mthong ba'i lam yin te zhes bya ba ni drod la sogs pa bzhi char du phyir rol gyi don spong ba la rab tu goms par byas nas de'i 'og tu 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog gi lam du
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i 'og tu mthong ba'i lam yin te zhes bya ba ni drod la sogs pa bzhi char du phyir rol gyi don spong ba la rab tu goms par byas nas de'i 'og tu 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog gi lam du
translated: Having become thoroughly familiar with the abandonment of external objects in the four stages of heat and so on, then on the path of the supreme mundane state,

original: dus ci rigs par dbang po la sogs pa dang rjes su mthun par 'dzin pa rang bzhin med par goms par byas te /
analyzed: dus ci rigs par dbang po la sogs pa dang rjes su mthun par 'dzin pa rang bzhin med par goms par byas te /
translated: one becomes familiar with the absence of intrinsic existence of the apprehender in accordance with the faculties and so on at any given time.

original: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnams par rtog pa rab tu nyams smad pas skyes bu lus bkru sman gyis sbyangs pa ltar byas nas mthong ba'i ye shes rnam par dag pa sman bcud kyis len lta bu rgyud la skyed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnams par rtog pa rab tu nyams smad pas skyes bu lus bkru sman gyis sbyangs pa ltar byas nas mthong ba'i ye shes rnam par dag pa sman bcud kyis len lta bu rgyud la skyed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, by thoroughly reducing the conception of apprehendeds and apprehenders, like a person whose body has been cleansed by a purifying medicine, one generates in one's mindstream the pure transcendent wisdom of the path of seeing, which is like a medicinal elixir.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam de la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam de la'o //
translated: With regard to that, that is the path of seeing.

original: 'dir kha cig na re mthong ba'i lam ni skad cig ma gcig kho na'i bdag nyid yin pas na gcig gi tshig can du mdzad do zhes zer te ;
analyzed: 'dir kha cig na re mthong ba'i lam ni skad cig ma gcig kho na'i bdag nyid yin pas na gcig gi tshig can du mdzad do zhes zer te ;
translated: Some say: Since the path of seeing has the nature of a single moment, it is called “single.”

original: gal te skad cig ma gcig yin na ji ltar gnyen po rnam pa bzhi yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma gcig yin na ji ltar gnyen po rnam pa bzhi yod ce na /
translated: If it is a single moment, how can it have four aspects?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bzhi yod pa la brten par zad de gang dag rnam par rtog pa med pa de dag ni skad cig mar nges te mngon sum gyi tshad ma bzhin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bzhi yod pa la brten par zad de gang dag rnam par rtog pa med pa de dag ni skad cig mar nges te mngon sum gyi tshad ma bzhin no //
translated: It is based on the four aspects of the antidotes to the four discordant classes. Those that are nonconceptual are definitely momentary, like the valid knowledge of direct perception.

original: gal te skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs par gyur pa na ni //
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs par gyur pa na ni //
translated: If it is a second moment and so on,

original: nges par rtog pa dang bcad par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nges par rtog pa dang bcad par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: it would definitely be conceptual and analytical.

original: 'dis ni phyin ci log tu smras pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni phyin ci log tu smras pa ste /
translated: This is a mistaken statement.

original: chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i rgyu las ni bskal pa du ma zhig tu yang rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang / mthong ba'i lam de yang thob par byed pa des bsdus pa'i nyer bsdogs dang de'i rjes las thob pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pas cig car du zhing brgya sbyong zhing /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i rgyu las ni bskal pa du ma zhig tu yang rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang / mthong ba'i lam de yang thob par byed pa des bsdus pa'i nyer bsdogs dang de'i rjes las thob pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pas cig car du zhing brgya sbyong zhing /
translated: Because the cause for realizing the dharmadhatu does not arise for many eons and because the path of seeing is obtained through the access concentrations and subsequent attainment that are subsumed by that cause and that possess conception, it is not a single moment.🔽How could it be a single moment?

original: ting nge 'dzin brgya la snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pas mang du yod pas ba skad cig ma gcig tu ga la zhig tu 'gyur de nyid kyi phyir kha cig gis rnam par rtog @78a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin brgya la snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pas mang du yod pas ba skad cig ma gcig tu ga la zhig tu 'gyur de nyid kyi phyir kha cig gis rnam par rtog @78a * //
translated: Since there are many, such as the purification of one hundred realms and the equipoise on one hundred concentrations, some say:

original: pa brgya rtsa brgyad spang ba'i phyir mthong ba'i lam yum 'di'i snying po la lan brgya rtsa brgyad du yang snyoms par 'jug pa'o zhes kyang bstan to //
analyzed: pa brgya rtsa brgyad spang ba'i phyir mthong ba'i lam yum 'di'i snying po la lan brgya rtsa brgyad du yang snyoms par 'jug pa'o zhes kyang bstan to //
translated: In order to abandon the one hundred and eight conceptions, one enters meditative attainment on this mother, the essence of the path of seeing, one hundred and eight times.

original: brda sprod pa'i rigs pa rnams ni don gyi shugs kyis kha cig tu ma nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: brda sprod pa'i rigs pa rnams ni don gyi shugs kyis kha cig tu ma nges par 'gyur te /
translated: The reasonings of grammar are not definite in some cases due to the power of the meaning.

original: drug pa 'di ni bzhi bar sbyar ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: drug pa 'di ni bzhi bar sbyar ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: The sixth is applied to the fourth, and so on.

original: de ltar na mthong ba'i lam de la dus ji snyed cig thogs she na /
analyzed: de ltar na mthong ba'i lam de la dus ji snyed cig thogs she na /
translated: How long does it take to traverse the path of seeing?

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' shes rab dang brtson 'grus dang dad pa'i rjes su 'brang bas ni gcig tu 'chad pa ci yang med de /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' shes rab dang brtson 'grus dang dad pa'i rjes su 'brang bas ni gcig tu 'chad pa ci yang med de /
translated: For the bodhisattva who follows wisdom, effort, and faith, there is no fixed time at all.

original: de bzhin du spyi'i dus bskal pa grangs med pa gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dus kyang nges par ni nam yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du spyi'i dus bskal pa grangs med pa gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dus kyang nges par ni nam yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, the general time of three incalculable aeons and so on is also not fixed.

original: gnyen po rnam par bzhi ni de dang de spong ba'i gnyen po zhes bzlog bas gdags so /
analyzed: gnyen po rnam par bzhi ni de dang de spong ba'i gnyen po zhes bzlog bas gdags so /
translated: The four kinds of antidotes are the antidote that abandons that and that which is designated by cessation.

original: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yul 'dogs par srid pa dgag par gzung bar bya'o zhes gzung bar rnam par rtog pa zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yul 'dogs par srid pa dgag par gzung bar bya'o zhes gzung bar rnam par rtog pa zhes 'chad do //
translated: The term “conception of apprehendeds” should be understood to negate the possibility of designating objects.

original: nyon mongs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Because of affliction” means “because of conception.”

original: rnam par rtog par gcig mod ji ltar dgu yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog par gcig mod ji ltar dgu yin snyam pa la /
translated: But how can there be nine, when there is only one conceptual differentiation?

original: yul gyi dbye bas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yul gyi dbye bas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore he says: “due to the differentiation of the objective supports”.

original: lnga pa 'di ni rgyu mtshan du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: lnga pa 'di ni rgyu mtshan du sbyar ba'o //
translated: The fifth case is to be supplied here, i.e. “due to the differentiation of the objective supports”.

original: dngos po dang ma 'brel bar 'jug pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dngos po dang ma 'brel bar 'jug pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of the engagement without a basis.

original: dngos po ni ming can te ji ltar rtogs par byed pa'i yul lo //🔽ma 'brel ba ni gal te dngos po de dag brtags pa ltar yod na de'i tshe 'brel bar yang 'gyur ba lta zhig na /
analyzed: dngos po ni ming can te ji ltar rtogs par byed pa'i yul lo // ma 'brel ba ni gal te dngos po de dag brtags pa ltar yod na de'i tshe 'brel bar yang 'gyur ba lta zhig na /
translated: A basis is that which possesses a name, i.e. the objective support in regard to which there is the process of understanding.

original: de dag med pa'i phyir ma 'brel te des ni ma 'brel zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa bzhi med pa tsam zhig tu zad ces ston pa'o //
analyzed: de dag med pa'i phyir ma 'brel te des ni ma 'brel zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa bzhi med pa tsam zhig tu zad ces ston pa'o //
translated: There is no basis if those entities do not exist as they are imagined. Therefore, it is said that there is no basis. This shows that the four kinds of conceptual differentiation are merely non-existent.

original: 'jug pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni skyes bu 'ga' zhig dha du ra zos pa'i rgyus nam mkha' la gser gyi khab len pa'i phyir 'jug pa lta bur gzhi med par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni skyes bu 'ga' zhig dha du ra zos pa'i rgyus nam mkha' la gser gyi khab len pa'i phyir 'jug pa lta bur gzhi med par 'jug pa ste /
translated: Because of the engagement, i.e. the engagement without a basis, like the engagement of a certain person in the sky in order to attract gold because of the cause of eating dhātrī fruit.

original: de'i phyir bar chad med pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas te phyin ci log gzhi med pa spang ba'i ye shes zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir bar chad med pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas te phyin ci log gzhi med pa spang ba'i ye shes zhes bstan to //
