translated: Therefore, from the point of view of the uninterrupted path, it is called the intuition which abandons the error that has no basis.

original: so so'i skye bo yul du byas te de skyes bu rdzas su yod par 'dzin pa dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag yul du byas te de la btags par yod par 'dzin pa zhes gzung ba dang 'dzin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo yul du byas te de skyes bu rdzas su yod par 'dzin pa dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag yul du byas te de la btags par yod par 'dzin pa zhes gzung ba dang 'dzin par sbyar ro //
translated: The ordinary man takes the object, and grasps it as the substantial person; the noble person takes the object, and grasps it as the nominal person. Thus, there is the connection between the grasped and the grasper.

original: de la so so'i skye bo de dag ni skyes bu zhes bya ba ste 'jig rten la grags @78b ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: de la so so'i skye bo de dag ni skyes bu zhes bya ba ste 'jig rten la grags @78b ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: In this regard, the ordinary men are called “persons” in accordance with the world’s usage.

original: de dag rdzas su yod pa ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob don bya ba la mthu dang ldan pa zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag rdzas su yod pa ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob don bya ba la mthu dang ldan pa zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa lta bu ma yin no //
translated: Their substantial existence is the correct conventional, which is able to perform a function, and is not like a second moon, etc.

original: 'dzin pa ni 'di ni bden te mngon sum du gyur ba'i phyir dang / lung las kyang 'gro ba'i las kyang rang bzhin dang dbye ba gsungs pa'i phyir ro snyam pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni 'di ni bden te mngon sum du gyur ba'i phyir dang / lung las kyang 'gro ba'i las kyang rang bzhin dang dbye ba gsungs pa'i phyir ro snyam pa'o //
translated: The grasping is the thought that “this is true, because it is manifest, and because the scriptures also declare the activity of the world, and the nature and the classification of action.”

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
translated: Noble persons are nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni btags pa tsam ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni btags pa tsam ste /
translated: Nirvana is a mere designation.

original: ji skad du dge slong dag chos lnga po 'di dag ni btags pa tsam ste lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du dge slong dag chos lnga po 'di dag ni btags pa tsam ste lnga gang zhe na /
translated: As it is said, “Monks, these five things are mere designations. What are the five?

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / gang zag rnams te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / gang zag rnams te /
translated: The past, the future, nirvana, analytical cessation, and the person.

original: 'di dag ni ming tsam mo zhes gsungs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni ming tsam mo zhes gsungs pa rnams so //
translated: These are mere names.”🔽Thus, one who grasps in this way thinks, “This is true, but since it is known that this exists as a mere name, and if that mere name did not exist, who would strive on the path?”

original: de ltar 'dzin pa ni 'di ni bden te 'di ni ming tsam du yod par grags pas grub cing ming tsam po de med na su zhig lam la nan gtan byed ces ming tsam gyi zhen pas 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams yod par rjes su dpog par yang
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin pa ni 'di ni bden te 'di ni ming tsam du yod par grags pas grub cing ming tsam po de med na su zhig lam la nan gtan byed ces ming tsam gyi zhen pas 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams yod par rjes su dpog par yang
translated: Thus, one who is attached to mere names infers that noble persons exist.

original: byed pa'o // de dag ji ltar na mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par 'gyur snyam du kha cig rtogs par srid pa la /
analyzed: byed pa'o // de dag ji ltar na mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par 'gyur snyam du kha cig rtogs par srid pa la /
translated: Some may think, “How could they be discordant classes?”

original: gang gi tshe de dag gi yul gyi dngos por gyur pa gzung ba'i don so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa'i gang zag de dag blos btags pa de bzhin du gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag gi yul gyi dngos por gyur pa gzung ba'i don so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa'i gang zag de dag blos btags pa de bzhin du gzung bar bya ste /
translated: When the objects of those are the apprehended objects that are the things of the objects, the individual and ārya persons are imputed by the mind. They should be apprehended in that way.

original: yul gyi ngo bor yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs su sbyar te /
analyzed: yul gyi ngo bor yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs su sbyar te /
translated: Because they do not exist as the entities of the objects, this is applied as the reason.

original: dang po phyag 'tshal ba'i don dgrol ba'i skabs su gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i tshad mas dngos po rnams ma grub par bstan pa'i tshul gyis snying po'i don bsgoms pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyi ga sgyu ma tsam du yang ma grub
analyzed: dang po phyag 'tshal ba'i don dgrol ba'i skabs su gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i tshad mas dngos po rnams ma grub par bstan pa'i tshul gyis snying po'i don bsgoms pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyi ga sgyu ma tsam du yang ma grub
translated: In the context of the meaning of the homage at the beginning, by meditating on the meaning of the essence in the manner of demonstrating that things are not established by valid knowledge, such as being one or many, since both saṃsāra and nirvāṇa are not established even as mere illusions,

original: pas na de dag la 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yul can rnams lta ga la zhig 'grub ces dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: pas na de dag la 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yul can rnams lta ga la zhig 'grub ces dgongs pa'o //
translated: how could the conceptual consciousnesses that apprehend them be established?

original: kha cig 'dir /
analyzed: kha cig 'dir /
translated: Some say,

original: gal te gzung don rang bzhin med //
analyzed: gal te gzung don rang bzhin med //
translated: If the apprehended object has no nature,

original: de dag gang gis 'dzin par 'dod //
analyzed: de dag gang gis 'dzin par 'dod //
translated: by what is it apprehended?

original: de ltar de dag 'dzin pa yi ;
analyzed: de ltar de dag 'dzin pa yi ;
translated: In that case,

original: / ngo bos stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa bcva brgyad ni yul yin la 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bcva brgyad ni yul can no zhes rnam par rtog pa'i rigs gnyis yul dang yul can du sbyor ba de dag gis ni cung zad kyang khong
analyzed: / ngo bos stong pa'i mtshan nyid do // zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa bcva brgyad ni yul yin la 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bcva brgyad ni yul can no zhes rnam par rtog pa'i rigs gnyis yul dang yul can du sbyor ba de dag gis ni cung zad kyang khong
translated: The characteristic of emptiness of intrinsic reality.🔽By this statement, the eighteen conceptual thoughts of the apprehended are the objects, and the eighteen conceptual thoughts of the apprehender are the subjects.

original: du ma chud de /
analyzed: du ma chud de /
translated: Those who connect the two types of conceptual thoughts in terms of object and subject do not understand anything at all.🔽In order to refute them, the master Nagarjuna says,

original: @79a * // de dgag pa'i phyir slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas gzung bar bya'o zhes gzung bar rnam par rtog pa zhes sngar smos pa mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: @79a * // de dgag pa'i phyir slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas gzung bar bya'o zhes gzung bar rnam par rtog pa zhes sngar smos pa mdzad pa'o //
translated: The conceptual thought of apprehending that which is to be apprehended.

original: gal te 'phags pa'i gang zag btags par yod pa tsam du rtog pa yang skyon yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'phags pa'i gang zag btags par yod pa tsam du rtog pa yang skyon yin na /
translated: If it is a fault to think that an aryan person is merely an imputed existent,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu'o //
translated: then nirvana is also like an illusion, like a dream.

original: gang mya ngan las 'das pa las ches mchog tu gyur pa'i chos 'ga' zhig yod na de yang sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu'o zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gang mya ngan las 'das pa las ches mchog tu gyur pa'i chos 'ga' zhig yod na de yang sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu'o zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If there were any phenomenon superior to nirvana, that also would be like an illusion, like a dream.

original: de ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i shes pa mngon par zhen pa rab tu srab pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: de ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i shes pa mngon par zhen pa rab tu srab pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: This is from the perspective of non-equipoise, when the conception of clinging is very slight.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i tshe ni sgyu ma tsam du yang rtog pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i tshe ni sgyu ma tsam du yang rtog pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: But when in equipoise, even the conception of mere illusion is to be stopped,

original: gang la sems kyi rgyu ba yang med na yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas so //
analyzed: gang la sems kyi rgyu ba yang med na yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas so //
translated: because it is said, “If there is no movement of mind, what need is there to mention syllables?”

original: ji ltar rnam par dgu yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar bstan pa'i dbang ltar gzhi re re la brten pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam par 'byung ba bstan te go sla'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par dgu yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar bstan pa'i dbang ltar gzhi re re la brten pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam par 'byung ba bstan te go sla'o //
translated: How is it ninefold? and so on teaches the arising of conceptions based on each basis, as previously indicated.

original: rgyu gang yin pa de dag zhes bya ba la rgyu dang po ni 'gro ba rnams byang chub thog par bya ba'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu gang yin pa de dag zhes bya ba la rgyu dang po ni 'gro ba rnams byang chub thog par bya ba'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: Those causes are the first cause, which is the application to the path of seeing, etc. in order to cause beings to attain enlightenment.

original: gnyis pa ni mthong ba'i lam skyes pa de dag bsgom pa'i lam gyis 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mthong ba'i lam skyes pa de dag bsgom pa'i lam gyis 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa'o //
translated: The second is the teaching of the perfection of wisdom in order to increase those who have generated the path of seeing by the path of cultivation.

original: gsum pa ni nges par byang chub par 'gyur zhing de nas 'gro bar rab tu mang po gang yang byang chub par byed pa'i rgyur rgyal ba'i yum gyi don bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni nges par byang chub par 'gyur zhing de nas 'gro bar rab tu mang po gang yang byang chub par byed pa'i rgyur rgyal ba'i yum gyi don bsgom pa'o //
translated: The third is the cultivation of the meaning of the Mother of Conquerors, which is the cause of the enlightenment of many beings who are certain to become enlightened.

original: bar chad med pa'i rgyu ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi dngos kyi rgyu ste de yid la byas pas bdag gcig pu byang chub thob par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i rgyu ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi dngos kyi rgyu ste de yid la byas pas bdag gcig pu byang chub thob par ma zad kyi /
translated: The uninterrupted cause is the direct cause of buddhahood. By taking that to mind, one should apply oneself, thinking, “Not only will I attain enlightenment,

original: rang bas ches mang ba'i sems can thams cad kyang byang chub thob par byed par 'gyur zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang bas ches mang ba'i sems can thams cad kyang byang chub thob par byed par 'gyur zhes sbyar ro //
translated: but I will also cause all beings, who are far more numerous than myself, to attain enlightenment.”

original: mthong ba'i lam 'di byang chub chen po'i rgyu mtshan du bstan pa ni rgyu'i gtso bo ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam 'di byang chub chen po'i rgyu mtshan du bstan pa ni rgyu'i gtso bo ste /
translated: The path of seeing is taught as the reason for great enlightenment, because it is the principal cause.

original: bsgom pa'i lam yang des nges par byas la /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam yang des nges par byas la /
translated: The path of cultivation is also ascertained by it.

original: drod la sogs pa yang de'i ched tsam du gyur pas so //
analyzed: drod la sogs pa yang de'i ched tsam du gyur pas so //
translated: And heat, etc. are merely for the sake of that.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag don dam par yod par 'thad pa'i dngos po med de /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag don dam par yod par 'thad pa'i dngos po med de /
translated: There is no entity that is tenable as existing ultimately, either as cause or as effect,

original: tshad ma la sogs pas ma grub pa'i phyir zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: tshad ma la sogs pas ma grub pa'i phyir zhes sbyar te /
translated: because it is not established by valid cognition, etc.

original: sogs pa zhes pas ni nges pa'i don dang ldan pa'i lung bsdu bar bya'o //🔽gzhan dag ni tshad ma zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa sgrub @79b pa'i rigs pa yin la sogs pa zhes pas ni /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes pas ni nges pa'i don dang ldan pa'i lung bsdu bar bya'o // gzhan dag ni tshad ma zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa sgrub @79b pa'i rigs pa yin la sogs pa zhes pas ni /
translated: The word “etc.” includes scripture that has a definitive meaning.

original: rigs pa lhag ma gsum dang lung bzung ngo zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: rigs pa lhag ma gsum dang lung bzung ngo zhes 'dod do //
translated: Others believe that “valid cognition” is the reasoning that establishes tenability, and the word “etc.” includes the remaining three reasonings and scripture.

original: chos kyi sku la sogs pa zhes bya bas ni sku bzhi char bzung ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sku la sogs pa zhes bya bas ni sku bzhi char bzung ste /
translated: “The Dharma Body, etc.” includes all four Bodies,

original: de dag ni ma lus par yang 'khrul pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de dag ni ma lus par yang 'khrul pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: because they are the nature just as it is, since they are free from all the stains of error.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'am de kho na zhes bya ba'i tshig tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'am de kho na zhes bya ba'i tshig tu ston pa'o //
translated: “Indeed” indicates the reason or the word “that itself.”🔽Since that is so, therefore, this is the teaching of the previous passage, “Because the nature of the realm of phenomena is like space, it is without origination and cessation.”

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sngar chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid de rnams nam mkha' bzhin du skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ram zhes bya ba la chos nyid kyi rigs pa 'di kho na'i dbang gis🔽zhes ston pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sngar chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid de rnams nam mkha' bzhin du skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ram zhes bya ba la chos nyid kyi rigs pa 'di kho na'i dbang gis zhes ston pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching of the previous passage, “By the power of this very reasoning of reality alone.”

original: chos kyi dbyings la zad pa dang mi skye ba med pa'i phyir khyed kyi lta ba 'di mi 'thad do zhes ston pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la zad pa dang mi skye ba med pa'i phyir khyed kyi lta ba 'di mi 'thad do zhes ston pa'o //
translated: Since the realm of phenomena is without exhaustion and non-arising, this view of yours is untenable.

original: gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa de lta yin pa gang yin pa de'i phyir zhes brjod pa'i tshe ni rigs pa 'dis khyed la gnod par 'gyur ba de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa de lta yin pa gang yin pa de'i phyir zhes brjod pa'i tshe ni rigs pa 'dis khyed la gnod par 'gyur ba de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: When it is said “because of the reasoning of establishing what is possible, such as the nature of singularity and multiplicity,” the meaning of “because” is “by this reasoning, you will be harmed.”

original: kha cig ni rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i tshad mas yin la /
analyzed: kha cig ni rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i tshad mas yin la /
translated: Some assert that the so-called cause and effect are established by the valid cognition of dependent origination.

original: sogs pas zhes bya ba ni rdo rje gzegs ma lta bu dang / mtha' bzhi las skye ba dgag par dag bsdu'o zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: sogs pas zhes bya ba ni rdo rje gzegs ma lta bu dang / mtha' bzhi las skye ba dgag par dag bsdu'o zhes 'dod do //
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes the diamond slivers and the refutation of arising from the four alternatives.

original: gang dag ces bya ba ni 'gags pa nyan thos rnams dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba rnams te de dag ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du ma gtogs pas na zad pa la zad do snyam pa la sogs pa'i shes pa nges par 'byung bas so //
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba ni 'gags pa nyan thos rnams dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba rnams te de dag ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du ma gtogs pas na zad pa la zad do snyam pa la sogs pa'i shes pa nges par 'byung bas so //
translated: Those who are called “those who have ceased” are the śrāvakas, and those who are called “those who have awareness only” are the proponents of mere awareness. Since they are not included in the nature of the dharmadhātu, they are said to have the awareness that thinks, “I have exhausted the afflictions.”🔽The yogis

original: rnal 'byor ba rnams ni //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba rnams ni //
translated: assert that the dharmadhātu is pure

original: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' rnams ;🔽/ dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //
analyzed: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' rnams ; / dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //
translated: like the water element, gold, and space.

original: ces bya bas dag pa'i gzhi yongs su grub pa don dam pa'i dngos por khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya bas dag pa'i gzhi yongs su grub pa don dam pa'i dngos por khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they assert that the pure basis, the perfect [nature], is an ultimate entity.

original: kho bo cag dbu ma pa la ni don dam par dngos po yod pa ni skra'i rtse mos bstan par bya ba tsam yang ma mthong bas na /
analyzed: kho bo cag dbu ma pa la ni don dam par dngos po yod pa ni skra'i rtse mos bstan par bya ba tsam yang ma mthong bas na /
translated: We Madhyamikas do not see any existent thing whatsoever in the ultimate, not even something as small as the tip of a hair.

original: yang dag par zad pa dang mi skye ba ni 'di la rung ngo zhes byas ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag par zad pa dang mi skye ba ni 'di la rung ngo zhes byas ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is appropriate to say that “cessation is real and non-arising is real.”

original: go rims bzhin du zhes bya bas ni skyes pa rnams ni zad pas de 'gog pa'i ngo bo yin la ma skyes pa rnams ni slar skye ba'i gegs byed pa'i dbang gis 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zhes bya bas ni skyes pa rnams ni zad pas de 'gog pa'i ngo bo yin la ma skyes pa rnams ni slar skye ba'i gegs byed pa'i dbang gis 'gog pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “in accordance with the order” means that those that have arisen cease through exhaustion, and those that have not arisen cease through the prevention of their future arising.

original: de ltar skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid la gnod pa'i 'gog pa de dag @80a * //
analyzed: de ltar skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid la gnod pa'i 'gog pa de dag @80a * //
translated: In this way, cessation is the absence of the characteristics of that which has arisen and that which has not arisen.

original: dang bral te rnam par rtog pa de dag mi rgyu ba ni kho bo cag dbu ma pa'i don dam par bzhag pa de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo'i rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: dang bral te rnam par rtog pa de dag mi rgyu ba ni kho bo cag dbu ma pa'i don dam par bzhag pa de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo'i rang bzhin yin na /
translated: If that cessation is free from the faults of the characteristics of that which has arisen and that which has not arisen, and if the conceptualizations do not occur, then that is the nature of reality, the essence of suchness, which we Madhyamikas posit as the ultimate.

original: khyed ni rnam par rtog pa de dag dang ma bral ba'i phyir la don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs pa'i lta ba med cing de med pa'i rgyus na khyed kyi mthong ba'i lam kun rdzob kyi bden pa la don dam pa'i ldan pa'i dngos por log par mngon
analyzed: khyed ni rnam par rtog pa de dag dang ma bral ba'i phyir la don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs pa'i lta ba med cing de med pa'i rgyus na khyed kyi mthong ba'i lam kun rdzob kyi bden pa la don dam pa'i ldan pa'i dngos por log par mngon
translated: Because you are not free from those thoughts, you do not have the view that realizes ultimate truth, and because you do not have that, you wrongly adhere to the conventional truth that is your path of seeing as an ultimate existent.

original: par zhen pa de'i stobs kyis ci zhig zad cing ci zhig skye zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: par zhen pa de'i stobs kyis ci zhig zad cing ci zhig skye zhes sbyar ro //
translated: By the power of that, what is exhausted and what is produced?

original: de'i dbang las /
analyzed: de'i dbang las /
translated: The power of that

original: gzhan gyi mar 'dod gang yin pa //
analyzed: gzhan gyi mar 'dod gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever is asserted to be another’s wife

original: de nyid gzhan gyi chung ma ste //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan gyi chung ma ste //
translated: Is for another, another’s wife.

original: khyed kyi don dam gang yin pa //🔽de ni kho bos kun rdzob 'dod //
analyzed: khyed kyi don dam gang yin pa // de ni kho bos kun rdzob 'dod //
translated: Whatever is your ultimate

original: ces bstan to //
analyzed: ces bstan to //
translated: I assert to be conventional.

original: de la skye ba dang 'jig pas stong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas snying po'i don bsgom pa'i rigs pa yid la bya ba 'di ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos las las gsal bas bdag gis 'dir mi bsam mo //
analyzed: de la skye ba dang 'jig pas stong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas snying po'i don bsgom pa'i rigs pa yid la bya ba 'di ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos las las gsal bas bdag gis 'dir mi bsam mo //
translated: Here, since it is empty of arising and disintegration, and so on, this mental contemplation of the reasoning that meditates on the meaning of the essence is clear in the treatise of the middle way, so I will not consider it here.

original: nor bu dang dngul zhes smos pa ni ye shes de'i dmigs pa dag cing yid du 'ong bar ston pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: nor bu dang dngul zhes smos pa ni ye shes de'i dmigs pa dag cing yid du 'ong bar ston pa'i dpe'o //
translated: The mention of jewels and silver is an example showing that the object of that intuition is pure and pleasing.

original: sogs pa zhes dpe du ma smos pa ni nor bu la sogs pa'i dngos po dag pa du ma zhig skyes bu mig dag pas dus gcig kho nar mthong la /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes dpe du ma smos pa ni nor bu la sogs pa'i dngos po dag pa du ma zhig skyes bu mig dag pas dus gcig kho nar mthong la /
translated: The phrase “and so on” refers to many examples. Just as a person with pure eyes sees many pure things such as jewels at one time,

original: de dag blangs pas phan pa byed pa ltar mthong ba'i lam skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'i dmigs pa'i yul du ni kun rdzob kyi dngos po ma lus pa lag mthil gyi shing thog ltar gsal ba 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag blangs pas phan pa byed pa ltar mthong ba'i lam skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'i dmigs pa'i yul du ni kun rdzob kyi dngos po ma lus pa lag mthil gyi shing thog ltar gsal ba 'gyur te /
translated: and by taking them he is benefited, so the bodhisattva who has generated the path of insight sees all conventional things as clearly as a fruit in the palm of his hand,

original: de dag gis gnod pa yang mi byed cing sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la yang phan 'dogs par byed ces bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis gnod pa yang mi byed cing sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la yang phan 'dogs par byed ces bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and they do not harm him, but help him to the enlightenment of buddhahood.

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon rgan po kha cig gi zhal snga nas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon rgan po kha cig gi zhal snga nas /
translated: For this very reason, some elder masters say:

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is conventional truth?

original: gang sa rab tu dga' ba ma thob ba rnams kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pas bsdus pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang sa rab tu dga' ba ma thob ba rnams kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pas bsdus pa rnams so //
translated: Those that are included in the apprehended object and apprehending subject of those who have not attained the Joyous Ground.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the ultimate truth?

original: sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes rnam pa gnyis yul dang bcas pa dag go zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes rnam pa gnyis yul dang bcas pa dag go zhes bstan to //
translated: It is the two kinds of knowledge of the bodhisattvas who abide in the Joyous Ground and so forth, together with their objects.

original: 'khrul pa'i mtshan ma mtha' dag spangs pa zhes bya ba la 'khrul pa ni sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i mtshan ma mtha' dag spangs pa zhes bya ba la 'khrul pa ni sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa ste /
translated: The phrase “having abandoned all signs of error” means that error is exaggeration and deprecation.

original: de'i mtshan ma ni bden par 'dzin pa brjod du med par ma shes pa 'khrul pa'i rgyur gyur pa rnams te mtha' dag ni @80b rigs thams cad do //
analyzed: de'i mtshan ma ni bden par 'dzin pa brjod du med par ma shes pa 'khrul pa'i rgyur gyur pa rnams te mtha' dag ni @80b rigs thams cad do //
translated: The signs of that are the causes of error, which are the inexpressible apprehensions of true existence, and all of them are of every kind.

original: spangs pa zhes bya ba ni rags pa rnams te /
analyzed: spangs pa zhes bya ba ni rags pa rnams te /
translated: “Having abandoned” means having abandoned the coarse ones.

original: phra ba mtha' dag spangs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa kun tu 'od gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phra ba mtha' dag spangs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa kun tu 'od gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Having abandoned all the subtle ones” means the Buddha Ground, the Completely Luminous.

original: da ni dpe'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dpe'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach by way of example, it says:

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i bdag nyid du snang ba'i blo rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i bdag nyid du snang ba'i blo rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: The mind that appears as an illusory nature is called “nonconceptual.”

original: gang zhig rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i mthu'i dbang gis rab tu gsal bar ni snang la /
analyzed: gang zhig rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i mthu'i dbang gis rab tu gsal bar ni snang la /
translated: Whatever appears clearly through the power of the assembly of causes and conditions,

original: 'on kyang de la rtag dang glang po che dang gru dang khyim la sogs pa'i dngos po rnam par smin pa las byung ba med pa de dag ni sgyu ma'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de la rtag dang glang po che dang gru dang khyim la sogs pa'i dngos po rnam par smin pa las byung ba med pa de dag ni sgyu ma'o //
translated: but in which there is no real thing that has arisen from maturation, such as an elephant, a boat, a house, and so on, is an illusion.

original: de lta bu'i bdag nyid du snang ba'i blo ni byang chub sems dpa' gang gi ye shes kyi dngos po kun rdzob pa rim mor 'bris pa lta bu 'di dag padma 'dab ma ltar yang ma 'dres par mthong la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bdag nyid du snang ba'i blo ni byang chub sems dpa' gang gi ye shes kyi dngos po kun rdzob pa rim mor 'bris pa lta bu 'di dag padma 'dab ma ltar yang ma 'dres par mthong la /
translated: The mind that appears as such a nature is the nonconceptual wisdom of a bodhisattva. He sees all these conventional things, which are like drawings on water, as distinct, like the petals of a lotus.

original: des de ltar mthong ba'i tshe nyid ni yod pa'o zhes bya ba dang / med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs par gang du yang mi 'dzin cing rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dang bral ba rab tu zab pa rnam par mi rtog pa skye la /
analyzed: des de ltar mthong ba'i tshe nyid ni yod pa'o zhes bya ba dang / med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs par gang du yang mi 'dzin cing rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dang bral ba rab tu zab pa rnam par mi rtog pa skye la /
translated: When one sees in this way, one does not grasp anything at all as existent or nonexistent, and so on, and one is born into the profound non-conceptuality of the reality of dependent origination, free from the extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: de yang don dam par ni rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang don dam par ni rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, in the ultimate, it is just the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: de bzhin nyid la brjod par mi nus pas na so so rang gis rig par mi nus so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la brjod par mi nus pas na so so rang gis rig par mi nus so //
translated: Since it cannot be expressed in suchness, it cannot be known by individual self-awareness.

original: med pa yang ma yin la gzhan la brjod par yang mi nus pa'i phyir tha snyad gdags par dka' bas na /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin la gzhan la brjod par yang mi nus pa'i phyir tha snyad gdags par dka' bas na /
translated: It is not nonexistent, but because it cannot be expressed to others, it is difficult to designate conventionally.

original: ci zhig ltar yang dag par skyes na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ci zhig ltar yang dag par skyes na zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “If it is somehow truly born…”

original: de'i phyir skyes bu mig btsums pas gzungs rnams mi mthong ba ltar ci yang mthong ba med pa ni mthong ba'i lam ma yin gyi sna tshogs mthong yang sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur ba 'debs pa med pa ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu mig btsums pas gzungs rnams mi mthong ba ltar ci yang mthong ba med pa ni mthong ba'i lam ma yin gyi sna tshogs mthong yang sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur ba 'debs pa med pa ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
translated: Therefore, just as a person with closed eyes does not see anything, the path of seeing is not the non-seeing of anything at all. Rather, it is the path of seeing that sees the variety of things without exaggeration or denigration.

original: 'di ni byang chub kyi sems dang po zhes bya bar chad med pa'i lam dang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang rab tu mthun par skyes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub kyi sems dang po zhes bya bar chad med pa'i lam dang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang rab tu mthun par skyes pa ste /
translated: This is called the first thought of enlightenment, which is born in accordance with the path of no obstacles and the stage of buddhahood.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam 'di gcig pu yang byang chub chen po'i rgyur gyur pa bsngags pa mdzad do ;
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam 'di gcig pu yang byang chub chen po'i rgyur gyur pa bsngags pa mdzad do ;
translated: Therefore, this path of seeing alone is praised as the cause of great enlightenment.

original: / de nas de'i 'og tu ni mthong ba'i lam gyi rgyun dang / bsgom pa'i lam la res 'ga'i tshe ni snying po'i don bsgom pa na blo don dam pa'i bden pa kho na dang mthon par skye bas sna tshogs 'di dag rdul phra rab tsam yang mi snang la /
analyzed: / de nas de'i 'og tu ni mthong ba'i lam gyi rgyun dang / bsgom pa'i lam la res 'ga'i tshe ni snying po'i don bsgom pa na blo don dam pa'i bden pa kho na dang mthon par skye bas sna tshogs 'di dag rdul phra rab tsam yang mi snang la /
translated: Then, after that, sometimes when cultivating the meaning of the essence in the continuity of the path of seeing and the path of cultivation, the mind is born only in the ultimate truth, and not even an atom of this variety appears.

original: med pa la sogs pa yang de'i tshe mi rtog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: med pa la sogs pa yang de'i tshe mi rtog par 'gyur te /
translated: Non-existence, etc. would also not be conceptualized at that time.

original: @81a * // sa brgyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bskul ba las ston pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: @81a * // sa brgyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bskul ba las ston pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the teaching in the Bodhisattvabhumi about the bodhisattva on the eighth stage who is urged to do something.

original: res 'ga' yang de'i ye shes rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pas bsdus pa med kyang rang gi ngo bo'i rnam par rtog pa stug po ldan zhing gnyen po'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa mang pos glags pa 'byung
analyzed: res 'ga' yang de'i ye shes rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pas bsdus pa med kyang rang gi ngo bo'i rnam par rtog pa stug po ldan zhing gnyen po'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa mang pos glags pa 'byung
translated: Sometimes, even though there is no conceptualization of the knowledge of that stage, which is included in natural conceptualization, there is the occurrence of conceptualization of its own nature, which is dense and obstructed by many conceptualizations of antidotes, etc.

original: ba ni res kyi tshul gyis so //
analyzed: ba ni res kyi tshul gyis so //
translated: This is the way of the occasional.

original: de nas sa brgyad pa la ni snang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de nas sa brgyad pa la ni snang ba med pa'o //
translated: Then, on the eighth stage, there is non-appearance.

original: de nas gzhan gnyis la ni snang ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de nas gzhan gnyis la ni snang ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Then, on the other two stages, there is appearance.

original: de nas bar chad med pa'i lam las brtsams te dang po'i sems kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu skabs bdun pa nas bstan pa'i ngo bo skye ba dang de la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas bar chad med pa'i lam las brtsams te dang po'i sems kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu skabs bdun pa nas bstan pa'i ngo bo skye ba dang de la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, beginning from the uninterrupted path, the result that is the natural outflow of the first mind, which is the essence taught from the seventh chapter, arises and abides in that.

original: de ltar na mdo las ce yang mthong ba med pa ni don dam pa mthong ba'o zhes gsungs pa 'di ji ltar drang zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na mdo las ce yang mthong ba med pa ni don dam pa mthong ba'o zhes gsungs pa 'di ji ltar drang zhe na /
translated: Thus, how is this to be interpreted: “Non-seeing of anything is seeing the ultimate”?

original: 'di ni byang chub kyi sems dang po dang bar chad med pa'i lam la sogs pa'i dbang du byas te ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa dang ldan pa cir yang mi mthong ba ni don dam pa mthong ba'o zhes bya bas ma yin par dgag
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub kyi sems dang po dang bar chad med pa'i lam la sogs pa'i dbang du byas te ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa dang ldan pa cir yang mi mthong ba ni don dam pa mthong ba'o zhes bya bas ma yin par dgag
translated: This is not to be interpreted as “seeing the ultimate” in the sense of not seeing anything at all, as a result of the superimposition and denial that occur in the context of the first thought of awakening, the uninterrupted path, and so on.

original: pa bzung ste /
analyzed: pa bzung ste /
translated: It is to be interpreted as a negation,

original: bram ze ma mthong zhes bya bas rgyal po la sogs pa mthong ba ni mi 'gegs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bram ze ma mthong zhes bya bas rgyal po la sogs pa mthong ba ni mi 'gegs pa bzhin no //
translated: just as the statement “I do not see the brahmin” does not deny seeing the king and so on.

original: 'on kyang 'di ni don dam pa'i de'i bdag nyid mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni don dam pa'i de'i bdag nyid mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Nevertheless, this is called “seeing the ultimate nature of things.”

original: sa mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i dbang du byas te ni med par dgag pa kho na ste /
analyzed: sa mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i dbang du byas te ni med par dgag pa kho na ste /
translated: In the context of the Immovable and other grounds, it is a negation,

original: sgra ji lta ba bzhin du de ni mthong ba skra'i rtse mos gzung bar bya ba tsam yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ji lta ba bzhin du de ni mthong ba skra'i rtse mos gzung bar bya ba tsam yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, as the words state, there is not even the slightest thing to be seen, like the tip of a hair.

original: rnal 'byor pas shes bya'i sgrib pa yang dag par spong ngo zhes bya ba ni ye shes 'di gnyis kas so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas shes bya'i sgrib pa yang dag par spong ngo zhes bya ba ni ye shes 'di gnyis kas so //
translated: The yogi/nī abandons the obscurations of the knowable” means that both of these two wisdoms do so.

original: de dag la chung zad kyang mi byed do zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag la chung zad kyang mi byed do zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: “ They do not do anything to them at all” means that they are not related.

original: shes pa dang shes bya don dam par rang grub pas ri man da ra ba skyod cing bcom pas ri 'bigs byed la ci zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya don dam par rang grub pas ri man da ra ba skyod cing bcom pas ri 'bigs byed la ci zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: If consciousness and the knowable are ultimately established, then what would happen if one were to move and destroy Mount Meru?

original: kho bo cag ni don dam par thams cad chos kyi dbyings su bsdus par 'dod pas te rtogs pa'i tshe na gcig gis thams cad g-yo ba la sogs par 'dod la /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni don dam par thams cad chos kyi dbyings su bsdus par 'dod pas te rtogs pa'i tshe na gcig gis thams cad g-yo ba la sogs par 'dod la /

original: de ma rtogs pa'i bar du ni ji tsam grags pa tsam zhig khas len pa'i phyir ro //

original: ji skad du /

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //

original: 'di ni mdo las pi wang gi sgra tshol ba'i dpes bstan te /
analyzed: 'di ni mdo las pi wang gi sgra tshol ba'i dpes bstan te /
translated: This is taught in the sūtras by the example of searching for the sound of a lute.

original: gal te pi wang rgyud sbreng ba la sogs pa'i 'bad pa med par yang sgra mi 'byung la pi wang gi sbubs la sogs pa bshig pa las kyang sgra'i dngos po mi rnyed kyi slar rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te pi wang rgyud sbreng ba la sogs pa'i 'bad pa med par yang sgra mi 'byung la pi wang gi sbubs la sogs pa bshig pa las kyang sgra'i dngos po mi rnyed kyi slar rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the sound of a lute does not occur without the effort of plucking the strings and so on, and if the entity of the sound is not found by destroying the interior of the lute and so on, then the continuum of the sound is severed.

original: de bzhin du srid pa dang zhi ba gang du yang mi lhung ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rab tu zab pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa 'di kho na yang ma yin la /

translated: In the same way, the very profound essence of the Tathāgata, which does not fall into either existence or peace, is not just these things such as form.

original: 'di dag spangs te snang ba med par 'gyur bas yang zhi ba'i dbyings tsam zhig yin pas rab tu spangs bas de'i phyir 'di dag gi rang bzhin 'di dag dang / gzhan nyid dang 'di nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa tsam zhig khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya bar gnas so //

translated: Since these are abandoned, they become non-apparent. Therefore, since they are just the sphere of peace, they are thoroughly abandoned. Therefore, one should understand that their nature is just inexpressible as either the same or different.

original: de ltar na sgyu ma'i glang pos sgyu ma'i glang po gzhan zhig pham par byas pa lta bur phyin ci ma log pas de kho na nyid mthong na rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes smos te /

translated: For, when the natural conceptual thoughts connected with women, etc. are not destroyed by the latent afflictions, the manifest causes arise, in the manner of the shadow following the flying bird,

analyzed: shing n+ya gro dha'i rtsa ba las cher 'phel ba lta bu'o //

analyzed: yang snang ba dang bcas pas ni zhi ba'i dbyings su mi ltung bar byed pa'o //

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ni dngos po kun rdzob pa'i rang bzhin kun rdzob pa la goms par byed pa'o //
translated: With conceptualization, one becomes familiar with the conventional nature of things.

original: de ltar mthong ba'i lam rnam par rtog pa dang bcas mod kyi dus ring zhig tu dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par mos par byas pa'i dbang gis na brda la blo byang ba'i skyes bus me long la sogs pa'i nang du gzugs brnyan mthong ba ltar mngon

translated: Thus, although the path of seeing is conceptual, due to the power of having cultivated the conviction that things lack intrinsic existence for a long time, manifest clinging is extremely weak, like a person who has become familiar with seeing reflections in a mirror and so on.

original: par zhen pa shin tu srab pas kha cig gis ni don dam pa'i bden par bzhag cing sa de dag tu nyon mongs pa yang mi rgyu ba nyid do //
analyzed: par zhen pa shin tu srab pas kha cig gis ni don dam pa'i bden par bzhag cing sa de dag tu nyon mongs pa yang mi rgyu ba nyid do //

analyzed: de med pa ni de skyed par nus pa'i bsgom pa'i lam med pa'o //
translated: The present is the cause of the production of the effect, because it is the cause of the effect that is occurring.🔽The past is the cause of the occurrence of the effect, because it is the cause of the effect that has already occurred.🔽The future is the cause of the non-interruption of the effect, because it is the cause of the effect that has not yet occurred.🔽The present is the cause of the production of the effect, because it is the cause of the effect that is occurring.

original: nyan thos kyi rigs can nyid kyi phyir de'i theg pa yid la byed pa dang zhes bya ba la nyan thos kyi rigs can zhes bya ba ni rkyen 'ga' @83a * //🔽zhig gis de la dga' bas de'i lam du zhugs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs can nyid kyi phyir de'i theg pa yid la byed pa dang zhes bya ba la nyan thos kyi rigs can zhes bya ba ni rkyen 'ga' @83a * //🔽zhig gis de la dga' bas de'i lam du zhugs pa yin gyi /
translated: The past is the cause of the occurrence of the effect, because it is the cause of the effect that has already occurred.🔽The future is the cause of the non-interruption of the effect, because it is the cause of the effect that has not yet occurred.🔽The present is the cause of the production of the effect, because it is the cause of the effect that is occurring.🔽The past is the cause of the occurrence of the effect, because it is the cause of the effect that has already occurred.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa ba rnams smra ba ltar dang po nas de dag gi rigs can yin zhes ni mi brjod kyi /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa ba rnams smra ba ltar dang po nas de dag gi rigs can yin zhes ni mi brjod kyi /
translated: But we do not say that they are of that type from the very beginning, as the Yogacaras claim.

original: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can yin te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can yin te /
translated: All sentient beings have the essence of the Tathagata.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dpal mchog dang po las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dpal mchog dang po las /
translated: As the Sri-Paramdiitya says:

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can no zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can no zhes gsungs la /
translated: The Bodhisattva Samantabhadra says: All sentient beings have the essence of the Tathagata.

original: 'phags pa zla ba sgron me'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa zla ba sgron me'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And the Arya-Candrapradlpa-sutra says:

original: 'di na snod min sems can 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: 'di na snod min sems can 'ga' yang med //
translated: There are no sentient beings here who are not fit vessels.

original: 'gro ba 'di rnams ma lus sangs rgyas 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di rnams ma lus sangs rgyas 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: All these beings will become Buddhas.

original: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig lam der zhugs na /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig lam der zhugs na /
translated: But if some of them enter that path,

original: dman pa la goms pa ni sgrub par sla ba'i phyir phyis dus ring du yang de la 'dun pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: dman pa la goms pa ni sgrub par sla ba'i phyir phyis dus ring du yang de la 'dun pa 'byung ste /
translated: then, because it is easy to practice the inferior, later on, even after a long time, their aspiration will arise.

original: don 'di las dgongs nas /
analyzed: don 'di las dgongs nas /
translated: With this point in mind,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa'i zhal snga nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa'i zhal snga nas /
translated: The Bodhisattva Maitreya says:

original: nyan thos ma nges rnam gnyis te //🔽theg don mthong dang ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos ma nges rnam gnyis te // theg don mthong dang ma mthong ba'o //
translated: The Hearers who are not definite are of two kinds:🔽Those who have seen the truth of their vehicle and those who have not.

original: don mthong 'dod chags bral ba dang // 'dod chags bral min 'di dman pa'o //
analyzed: don mthong 'dod chags bral ba dang // 'dod chags bral min 'di dman pa'o //
translated: Those who have seen the truth are either free from attachment or not free from attachment.

original: 'di gnyis 'phags pa'i lam thob pa //
analyzed: 'di gnyis 'phags pa'i lam thob pa //
translated: These two, having obtained the path of the Aryas,

original: sred pa dag tu 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sred pa dag tu 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: are born in the desire realm because of craving.🔽They are born in the desire realm

original: bsam gyis mi khyab sgyur ba yi //🔽skye ba dang ni yang dag ldan //🔽gcig ni smon lam dbang gis ni //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab sgyur ba yi // skye ba dang ni yang dag ldan // gcig ni smon lam dbang gis ni //
translated: because of their inconceivable transformation.

original: skye ba rab tu sgyur bar byed //
analyzed: skye ba rab tu sgyur bar byed //
translated: One of them transforms his birth through the power of his vow.🔽The other, because he possesses the state of a non-returner,

original: cig shos phyir mi 'ong ba dang // ldan phyir sprul ba rab tu bsgrub //
analyzed: cig shos phyir mi 'ong ba dang // ldan phyir sprul ba rab tu bsgrub //
translated: accomplishes his emanation.

original: de gnyis yang dang yang du ni //
analyzed: de gnyis yang dang yang du ni //
translated: Both of them, again and again,

original: rang sems kun tu 'byung ldan pas //
analyzed: rang sems kun tu 'byung ldan pas //
translated: possess the arising of their own mind.

original: mya ngan 'das la mngon dga'i phyir ;
analyzed: mya ngan 'das la mngon dga'i phyir ;
translated: Because they delight in nirvana,

original: / rtogs pa bul ba yin par 'dod //
analyzed: / rtogs pa bul ba yin par 'dod //
translated: they are considered to be slow in understanding.

original: don byas ma la yin de sangs rgyas //
analyzed: don byas ma la yin de sangs rgyas //
translated: The one who has accomplished his purpose is a Buddha.

original: med par skyes nas sprul don gnyer //
analyzed: med par skyes nas sprul don gnyer //
translated: Having been born in the formless realm, he strives for the purpose of emanation.

original: bsam gtan don brtsan der brten nas //
analyzed: bsam gtan don brtsan der brten nas //
translated: Relying on that, one attains

original: byang chub dam pa thob par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub dam pa thob par 'gyur // zhes gsungs te /
translated: the highest enlightenment.

original: 'dir rtogs pa bul ba zhes bya ba khungs nyid du 'od par bya'i ma lus pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rtogs pa bul ba zhes bya ba khungs nyid du 'od par bya'i ma lus pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, the so-called “slow understanding” is not the only source of the teaching,

original: de ni rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag gi ngor gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag gi ngor gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it was taught for the sake of the Yogācāras.

original: de bzhin du chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos mngon pa las /
translated: Similarly, the Abhidharma does not assert:

original: gnyis slob rigs las bzlog nas ni //🔽sangs rgyas su 'gyur gzhan gsum yang //
analyzed: gnyis slob rigs las bzlog nas ni // sangs rgyas su 'gyur gzhan gsum yang //
translated: “Having turned away from the two trainings and from the lineage,🔽one becomes a buddha.

original: ston dang bse ru byang chub par //
analyzed: ston dang bse ru byang chub par //
translated: The other three, the teacher and the rhinoceros,

original: bsam gtan mtha' rten gcig la @83b kun ;🔽/ zhes pa yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: bsam gtan mtha' rten gcig la @83b kun ; / zhes pa yang mi 'dod do //
translated: attain enlightenment in one life, based on the final dhyāna.”

original: 'dir ni 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas /
translated: Here, the venerable Nāgārjuna says:

original: theg pa gnyis po dag kyang ni //
analyzed: theg pa gnyis po dag kyang ni //
translated: “The two vehicles

original: theg pa chen por 'byung bas na //
analyzed: theg pa chen por 'byung bas na //
translated: are subsumed in the Mahāyāna,

original: srid pa'i lam gyis dub pa rnams //
analyzed: srid pa'i lam gyis dub pa rnams //
translated: so for those weary of the paths of existence,

original: ngal so'i don te de nyid min //
analyzed: ngal so'i don te de nyid min //
translated: it is a rest, not the ultimate.

original: nyan thos de dag ji srid du //
analyzed: nyan thos de dag ji srid du //
translated: As long as the śrāvakas

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis ma bskul ba ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis ma bskul ba ;
translated: are not urged on by the buddhas,

original: / de srid ye shes lus gcig gis //
analyzed: / de srid ye shes lus gcig gis //
translated: With that wisdom body,

original: ting 'dzin dregs pas myos te gnas //
analyzed: ting 'dzin dregs pas myos te gnas //
translated: he remains intoxicated with the pride of samadhi.

original: bskul nas sna tshogs gzugs kyis ni /
analyzed: bskul nas sna tshogs gzugs kyis ni /
translated: Then, having been urged on, he takes on various forms

original: sems can don la dga' byed cing //
analyzed: sems can don la dga' byed cing //
translated: and delights in the welfare of sentient beings.

original: bsod nams ye shes nyer 'phel nas //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes nyer 'phel nas //
translated: His merit and wisdom having increased,

original: sangs rgyas byang chub thob par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i rjes su 'brang zhing byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa rab tu dbye ba'i le'u las kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub thob par 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa'i rjes su 'brang zhing byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa rab tu dbye ba'i le'u las kyang /
translated: he attains the enlightenment of buddhahood.

original: bye brag med pa kho nar nyan thos rnams bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i skye ba bsgyur bar bstan to //
analyzed: bye brag med pa kho nar nyan thos rnams bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i skye ba bsgyur bar bstan to //
translated: Following this, the chapter on the analysis of the bodhisattva’s training also teaches that the disciples are transformed into inconceivable births without any distinction.

original: lhag ma rnams ni go sla bas rnam par ma phye'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni go sla bas rnam par ma phye'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand and so is not analyzed.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa ste /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa ste /
translated: The samadhi without obstruction is the complete enlightenment in a single moment.

original: 'di yang byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: 'di yang byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: This is also from the point of view of generating the thought of enlightenment.

original: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa lngas bstan no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa lngas bstan no //
translated: It is taught by the five, beginning with the superknowledges.

original: rigs kyi dbang du byas te shes rab dang thabs dang / slob ma rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'i chos dang / gzhan gyi don gyi go rims dag gis bstan to //
analyzed: rigs kyi dbang du byas te shes rab dang thabs dang / slob ma rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'i chos dang / gzhan gyi don gyi go rims dag gis bstan to //
translated: It is taught in terms of lineage, wisdom and means, the Dharma that is not shared with disciples, and the order of benefit for others.

original: theg pa gzhan gyis nges par 'byung ba bas mchog tu gyur pa'i dbang du byas te nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa brgyad kyis bstan to //
analyzed: theg pa gzhan gyis nges par 'byung ba bas mchog tu gyur pa'i dbang du byas te nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa brgyad kyis bstan to //
translated: In terms of being supreme compared to the deliverance of other vehicles, it is taught by the eight deliverances.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas te ni rnam par dag pas bstan to //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas te ni rnam par dag pas bstan to //
translated: In terms of the path of cultivation, it is taught by purity.

original: rnam pa'i dbang du byas te ni spong ba'i lam du btags pa bden pa bzhis bsdus pa nyon mongs pa dang mi ldan pa'i mtshan nyid bzhir bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa'i dbang du byas te ni spong ba'i lam du btags pa bden pa bzhis bsdus pa nyon mongs pa dang mi ldan pa'i mtshan nyid bzhir bstan to //
translated: In terms of aspect, it is taught by the four characteristics of the path of elimination, which is designated as the four truths.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po'i dbang du byas te ni 'dir bstan te //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po'i dbang du byas te ni 'dir bstan te //
translated: In terms of the great accumulation of merit, it is taught here.

original: dmigs pa dang bdag po dang / rnam pa'i dbang du byas pa dang / log par rtog pa rnams kyang 'dir bstan to //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bdag po dang / rnam pa'i dbang du byas pa dang / log par rtog pa rnams kyang 'dir bstan to //
translated: The bases of designation, the master, the object, the aspect, and the misconceptions are also taught here.

original: sa mtshams dang mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas te ni skabs bdun par ston par 'gyur ro //🔽thub pa chen po'i phrin las kyi dbang du byas te ni chos kyi sku'i phrin las las /
analyzed: sa mtshams dang mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas te ni skabs bdun par ston par 'gyur ro // thub pa chen po'i phrin las kyi dbang du byas te ni chos kyi sku'i phrin las las /
translated: The seven topics are taught in the seventh chapter from the perspective of the boundaries and characteristics of the dharmakāya.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag dang / las chud mi za ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa brgyad kyis ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag dang / las chud mi za ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa brgyad kyis ston par 'gyur te /
translated: From the perspective of the activity of the Great Sage, the dharmakāya’s activity is taught through eight topics, such as the branches of enlightenment and the nonexpiration of karma.

original: 'di dag dang gzhan yang yon tan la @84a * //🔽sogs pa mtha' dag gis 'dir gtan la dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag dang gzhan yang yon tan la @84a * // sogs pa mtha' dag gis 'dir gtan la dbab par bya'o //
translated: These and other qualities are to be ascertained here.

original: stong gsum gyis stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ba lan mang zhig smos pa 'di'i tshad ni /
analyzed: stong gsum gyis stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ba lan mang zhig smos pa 'di'i tshad ni /
translated: The term “world systems of a billion worlds” is mentioned many times in this text. The measure of a world system of a billion worlds is as follows:🔽Four continents, a sun and moon,

original: gling bzhi pa dang nyi zla dang // ri rab dang ni 'dod lha dang // tshangs pa'i 'jig rten stong la ni //
analyzed: gling bzhi pa dang nyi zla dang // ri rab dang ni 'dod lha dang // tshangs pa'i 'jig rten stong la ni //
translated: Mount Meru, the desire gods, and the world of Brahmā—🔽a thousand of these

original: stong ni spyi phud yin par 'dod //
analyzed: stong ni spyi phud yin par 'dod //
translated: is considered a small chiliocosm.

original: de stong la ni stong gnyis pa //
analyzed: de stong la ni stong gnyis pa //
translated: A thousand of those is a second chiliocosm,

original: bar ma'i 'jig rten khams yin no //
analyzed: bar ma'i 'jig rten khams yin no //
translated: the middle world system.

original: de stong gsum mo //
analyzed: de stong gsum mo //
translated: A thousand of those is a third chiliocosm.

original: mnyam du 'jig cing 'byung ba yin //
analyzed: mnyam du 'jig cing 'byung ba yin //
translated: They arise and are destroyed together.

original: zhes ji skad bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes ji skad bstan pa'o //
translated: This is how it is taught.

original: yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing rgya chen po shes rab 'dod pa dag gis ni gling bzhi pa bye ba phrag brgyal ni stong gsum mo //
analyzed: yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing rgya chen po shes rab 'dod pa dag gis ni gling bzhi pa bye ba phrag brgyal ni stong gsum mo //
translated: Those who desire wisdom and a vast buddha field should know that a billion four-continent worlds is a trichiliocosm.

original: stong gsum bye ba phrag brgya la ni rab 'byam gyi mtshams sbyor ba'o //🔽de bye ba phrag brgya la ni rab 'byam gyi rgyud gcig go //
analyzed: stong gsum bye ba phrag brgya la ni rab 'byam gyi mtshams sbyor ba'o // de bye ba phrag brgya la ni rab 'byam gyi rgyud gcig go //
translated: A billion trichiliocosms is a world system of a thousand million worlds.🔽A billion of those is a single world system of a thousand million worlds.

original: de bye ba phrag brgya la ni rab 'byam gyi rgyud bar ma gcig go //
analyzed: de bye ba phrag brgya la ni rab 'byam gyi rgyud bar ma gcig go //
translated: A billion of those is a single intermediate world system of a thousand million worlds.

original: de bye ba phrag brgya la ni me tog gi gzhi'i snying po'i rgyan bkod pa gcig ste /
analyzed: de bye ba phrag brgya la ni me tog gi gzhi'i snying po'i rgyan bkod pa gcig ste /
translated: A billion of those is a single flower-base heart ornament array.

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snam par snang mdzad de'i rnam par smin pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ngo zhes shes par bya zhing /
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snam par snang mdzad de'i rnam par smin pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ngo zhes shes par bya zhing /
translated: This is the buddha field of the Blessed One Vairocana, which is the result of his evolution.

original: de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad gangs chen mtsho'i phyag gi mthil gyi rdul phra rab gcig la gnas te /
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad gangs chen mtsho'i phyag gi mthil gyi rdul phra rab gcig la gnas te /
translated: Moreover, it abides in a single atom of the palm of the hand of the Bhagavat Buddha Vairocana Ocean of Wisdom.

original: 'di lta bu'i bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that this Bhagavat Vairocana is the Enjoyment Body.🔽The objective condition is the observation of all dharmas as non-entities.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni chos thams cad dngos po med par dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid de la dmigs pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de skye ba zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni chos thams cad dngos po med par dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid de la dmigs pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de skye ba zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: This means that the non-conceptual intuition is generated by observing the reality of natural luminosity.

original: gal te chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa de ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ltar ming tsam zhig yin pa'i phyir shin tu med par gyur na ni de'i phyir de dmigs pa'i rkyen du yang ji ltar zhig 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa de ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ltar ming tsam zhig yin pa'i phyir shin tu med par gyur na ni de'i phyir de dmigs pa'i rkyen du yang ji ltar zhig 'gyur /
translated: If all dharmas are unreal, like the horns of a rabbit, and are mere names, then they are utterly non-existent, so how can they be the objective condition?

original: shin tu med pa gang yin pa ni nus pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir dmigs pa ga la zhig gzhag / gal te 'o na rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar gyur ba zhig 'di'i dmigs par rnam par gzhag na 'o na de nyid dngos por 'gyur🔽ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: shin tu med pa gang yin pa ni nus pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir dmigs pa ga la zhig gzhag / gal te 'o na rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar gyur ba zhig 'di'i dmigs par rnam par gzhag na 'o na de nyid dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If one posits that which is naturally clear light as the object of observation, then is it not that it becomes a thing?

original: de'i tshe ji ltar na chos thams cad dngos po med par dmigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar na chos thams cad dngos po med par dmigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: At that time, how is it that all phenomena are observed as not being things?

original: byis pa rnams la tha snyad tsam zhig tu rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: byis pa rnams la tha snyad tsam zhig tu rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba zhes brjod kyi /
translated: It is said to be naturally clear light to childish beings as a mere convention.

original: rang gi rang bzhin brjod @84b par ni de sus kyang nam yang mi nus shing yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i dngos po gang du yang ma grub pas na 'phags pa so so rang gi rig pa'i spyod yul zhes bsgrags pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin brjod @84b par ni de sus kyang nam yang mi nus shing yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i dngos po gang du yang ma grub pas na 'phags pa so so rang gi rig pa'i spyod yul zhes bsgrags pa'o //
translated: No one is ever able to express its own nature, and since it is not established as any thing whatsoever, such as existent or nonexistent, it is proclaimed to be the domain of the individual intuitive wisdom of the āryas.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni dran pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni dran pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The dominant condition is mindfulness.

original: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba la byang chub kyi sems dang po bden pa rnam pa gnyis dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes de yang nas yang du 'dris par byas pa'i dngos po de ma brjed pa ni 'di skyed par bdag po'i rkyen te /
analyzed: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba la byang chub kyi sems dang po bden pa rnam pa gnyis dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes de yang nas yang du 'dris par byas pa'i dngos po de ma brjed pa ni 'di skyed par bdag po'i rkyen te /
translated: The dominant condition that generates this is the thing that is not forgotten, the repeated acquaintance with the pristine wisdom that is the nature of the indivisibility of the two truths, the first thought of enlightenment, on the first ground, Very Joyful.

original: bdag po'i sgra ni gtso bo'i don ston pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po'i sgra ni gtso bo'i don ston pa'o //
translated: The word dominant indicates the primary meaning.

original: rnam pa ni rang bzhin gyis zhi ba nyin yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa ni rang bzhin gyis zhi ba nyin yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The aspect is peace by nature.

original: rnam pa ni kha cig tu rang bzhin gcig tha dad par snang ba la bya bar mthong ste /
analyzed: rnam pa ni kha cig tu rang bzhin gcig tha dad par snang ba la bya bar mthong ste /
translated: In some contexts, aspect is seen to refer to the appearance of a single nature as different.

original: me'i rnam pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: me'i rnam pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aspect of fire?

original: zlum po dang grub bzhi dang 'phro ba dang / 'khyil ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zlum po dang grub bzhi dang 'phro ba dang / 'khyil ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is round, square, spreading, swirling, and so on.

original: kha cig tu ni rang gi rang bzhin la rnam pa zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni rang gi rang bzhin la rnam pa zhes zer te /
translated: In some contexts, the nature of something is called its aspect.

original: rnam pa dman pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dman pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the case in statements such as the inferior aspect.

original: de dag las 'dir ni rang gi rang bzhin la rnam pa zhes 'dod de /
analyzed: de dag las 'dir ni rang gi rang bzhin la rnam pa zhes 'dod de /
translated: Here, the nature of something is asserted to be its aspect.

original: 'di'i rang bzhin ni rang gi ngo bo'i rnam par rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa zhi ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin ni rang gi ngo bo'i rnam par rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa zhi ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Its nature is the pacification of conceptualization in the aspect of intrinsic reality, the pacification of conceptualization in the aspect of memory, and so on.

original: gal te de ltar rnam par rtog pa thams cad zhi na snang ba med pa'i ye shes tsam du 'gyur zhing de ltar ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de ltar rnam par rtog pa thams cad zhi na snang ba med pa'i ye shes tsam du 'gyur zhing de ltar ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If all conceptualization is pacified in that way, it would be mere pristine wisdom without appearance, and in that case, it would not be the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gal te zhi ba'i rnam pa ma yin na yang dngos por 'dzin pa dang bral bar ma gyur pa 'dis sangs rgyas nyid de ma thag tu ga la zhig skyed ces bden pa gnyis 'gal bar 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: gal te zhi ba'i rnam pa ma yin na yang dngos por 'dzin pa dang bral bar ma gyur pa 'dis sangs rgyas nyid de ma thag tu ga la zhig skyed ces bden pa gnyis 'gal bar 'gyur bas na /
translated: If it is not in the aspect of peace, then how could it generate buddhahood, since it would not be free from the apprehension of entity? Thus, the two truths would be contradictory.

original: gnas 'di la ni gti la ni gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gnas 'di la ni gti la ni gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “This point is difficult to fathom, and so on.”

original: zab pa nyid ces bya ba ni byis pa gang da bden pa gnyis dbyer med par mi shis pa dag 'jigs pa'i gnas su gyur pa dang / gting rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zab pa nyid ces bya ba ni byis pa gang da bden pa gnyis dbyer med par mi shis pa dag 'jigs pa'i gnas su gyur pa dang / gting rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The profound is that which is a source of fear for the childish who do not understand the inseparability of the two truths, and which is difficult to fathom.

original: blo'i nor can rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni bden pa gnyis dbyer med pa khong du nud pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: blo'i nor can rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni bden pa gnyis dbyer med pa khong du nud pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Those endowed with the wealth of mind are those who can comprehend the inseparability of the two truths.

original: log par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdu na /🔽ji srid du don dam pa'i bden pa 'ba' zhig 'dod pas kun rdzob pa'i rang bzhin spong ba dang / gang dag kun rdzob pa 'dod pas rang bzhin med par sun 'byin zhing bden pa gnyis dbyer med pa'i don 'di mi spyod pa thams cad @85a * //
analyzed: log par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdu na / ji srid du don dam pa'i bden pa 'ba' zhig 'dod pas kun rdzob pa'i rang bzhin spong ba dang / gang dag kun rdzob pa 'dod pas rang bzhin med par sun 'byin zhing bden pa gnyis dbyer med pa'i don 'di mi spyod pa thams cad @85a * //
translated: Misconception is, in brief,

original: log par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: log par rtog pa ste /
translated: as long as one is attached to the ultimate truth alone and rejects the nature of the conventional, or as long as one is attached to the conventional and refutes the absence of intrinsic nature, and does not engage in the meaning of the inseparability of the two truths, one is a misconceiver.

original: de las phye bas ni rnam pa bcu drug tu 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de las phye bas ni rnam pa bcu drug tu 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By dividing that, there are sixteen types.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams dag tha dad pa'i dngos po med pa nyid kyis bden pa gnyis cig car dmigs pa 'thad pa dang zhes bya ba tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams dag tha dad pa'i dngos po med pa nyid kyis bden pa gnyis cig car dmigs pa 'thad pa dang zhes bya ba tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The two truths are simultaneously observed, because the compounded and uncompounded realms are not different things.🔽The words are to be connected in this way.

original: de la sogs pas ni bden pa re re zhig bzung bas 'gal bar 'dod pa rnams sel te go sla'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pas ni bden pa re re zhig bzung bas 'gal bar 'dod pa rnams sel te go sla'o //
translated: And so on. By taking each of the two truths, one can eliminate the assertions of contradiction. This is easy to understand.

original: de bas na kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sgo can gyi klan ka la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang dag bden pa re re zhig tshad mar byas nas cig shos sun phyung nas /
analyzed: de bas na kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sgo can gyi klan ka la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang dag bden pa re re zhig tshad mar byas nas cig shos sun phyung nas /
translated: Therefore, those who seek to find fault with the approach of the two truths, saying, “If one is taken as valid cognition, the other must be invalidated,”

original: yang de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa klan ka tshol ba rnams so //
analyzed: yang de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa klan ka tshol ba rnams so //
translated: and so on, and who say, “For that reason, it would not be omniscience,” and so on, are seeking to find fault.

original: bden pa gnyi ga la la brten pa'i thabs mkhas pas zhes bya ba ni bden pa gcig cig 'di'i yul yin zhes mi smra ba'i thabs kyis so //
analyzed: bden pa gnyi ga la la brten pa'i thabs mkhas pas zhes bya ba ni bden pa gcig cig 'di'i yul yin zhes mi smra ba'i thabs kyis so //
translated: The phrase “through the skillful means of relying on both truths” means that one does not say, “One of the two truths is the object of this.”

original: rnams pa stong du zhes bya ba ni thabs de la brten pa las ni lan mi zad pa'i don te /
analyzed: rnams pa stong du zhes bya ba ni thabs de la brten pa las ni lan mi zad pa'i don te /
translated: The phrase in a thousand ways means that, based on that method, there is an endless purpose.

original: stong ni mi zad pa mtshon pa gzhan gyis don to //
analyzed: stong ni mi zad pa mtshon pa gzhan gyis don to //
translated: The word thousand is a metaphor for endless.

original: nges par rnams par thams cad yang dag par bskyed pa ni rang dang gzhan gnyi ga la'o //
analyzed: nges par rnams par thams cad yang dag par bskyed pa ni rang dang gzhan gnyi ga la'o //
translated: The phrase completely generates all aspects refers to both oneself and others.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bden pa gnyis su dbyer med pa la mos pa yid la byed pa dang / de kho na yid la bya ba'i sgo nas so ;
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bden pa gnyis su dbyer med pa la mos pa yid la byed pa dang / de kho na yid la bya ba'i sgo nas so ;
translated: The phrase one should generate the uninterrupted meditative stabilization refers to the mental attention of conviction in the indivisibility of the two truths and the mental attention of reality.

original: / skabs lnga ba'i 'grel bshad rdzogs so /
analyzed: / skabs lnga ba'i 'grel bshad rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the fifth chapter is finished.

original: // / de ltar skabs lnga pa'i don rnam par phye nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar skabs lnga pa'i don rnam par phye nas /
translated: Having thus analyzed the meaning of the fifth chapter,

original: da ni skabs drug pa ston par mdzad pa /
analyzed: da ni skabs drug pa ston par mdzad pa /
translated: now the sixth chapter is taught.

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa thob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsung ste /
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa thob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsung ste /
translated: The phrase attaining the peak clear realization and so on is stated.

original: da ni sa bcu pa'i bar gyis thob par gzhag go //
analyzed: da ni sa bcu pa'i bar gyis thob par gzhag go //
translated: Now, up to the tenth stage, one should attain.

original: de la sa bcu pa ni gnas skabs gsum du dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la sa bcu pa ni gnas skabs gsum du dbye bar bya ste /
translated: Therein, the tenth stage is divided into three states.

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la sogs pa yongs su spyod cing rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i skabs su gsungs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang ba la sogs pa byed pa /
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa la sogs pa yongs su spyod cing rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i skabs su gsungs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang ba la sogs pa byed pa /
translated: He enjoys the realization of the peak, etc., and he purifies the buddhaverse, etc., in the situation of the complete realization of all aspects.

original: 'og min du rnam par smin pa'i lus skyes pa /
analyzed: 'og min du rnam par smin pa'i lus skyes pa /
translated: He is born in the Akanistha heaven with a body that is the result of evolution.

original: dbang bskur ba'i sa la gnas pa ni gnas skabs gcig ste /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i sa la gnas pa ni gnas skabs gcig ste /
translated: He is on the level of consecration. This is one situation.

original: 'di'i che ba'i bdag nyid ni chos kyi dbyings las bstod pa las 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di'i che ba'i bdag nyid ni chos kyi dbyings las bstod pa las 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: His greatness is like that described by the noble Nagarjuna in the Praise of the Dharmadhatu.

original: de nas skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i ngo bo dga' ldan du skyes pa ni gnas skabs gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: de nas skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i ngo bo dga' ldan du skyes pa ni gnas skabs gnyis pa ste /
translated: Then, born in the Tusita heaven, he is one life away from Buddhahood. This is the second situation.

original: gnas @85b skabs 'di dang srid pa tha ma pa'i byang chub kyis snying por bdud btul ba'i bar du ni mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i skabs la spyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnas @85b skabs 'di dang srid pa tha ma pa'i byang chub kyis snying por bdud btul ba'i bar du ni mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i skabs la spyod par byed pa'o //
translated: From this situation up to the subjugation of Mara at the heart of enlightenment in his final life, he practices in the situation of the serial realization.

original: de nas snying po byang chub der skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bskyed pa ni gnas skabs gsum pa ste /
analyzed: de nas snying po byang chub der skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bskyed pa ni gnas skabs gsum pa ste /
translated: Then, in the heart of enlightenment, in one instant, he generates the exalted wisdom of omniscience by means of wisdom. This is the third stage.

original: der ni skabs bdun pa bstan pa'i don rdzogs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: der ni skabs bdun pa bstan pa'i don rdzogs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: There, he completes the meaning of the seventh chapter.

original: 'di ni sprul pa'i sku'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sprul pa'i sku'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: This is from the point of view of the emanation body.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi mngon par byang chub pa'i dbang du byas te ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi mngon par byang chub pa'i dbang du byas te ni /
translated: From the point of view of the manifest enlightenment of the essential body,

original: 'og min de nyid du skabs snga ma gnyis kyi don khong du chud nas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'og min de nyid du skabs snga ma gnyis kyi don khong du chud nas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: in that Akaniṣṭha itself, having understood the meaning of the two previous chapters, he becomes fully enlightened.

original: so so dang bsdus ba nyid du rtogs pa'i don rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: so so dang bsdus ba nyid du rtogs pa'i don rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of the individual and the summarized realizations.

original: so so'i don rnams ni skabs re res ji ltar bstan pa dang / tshogs kyi lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs re re la yang rang bzhin ji snyed yod ces mngon par rtogs pa'i don te /
