analyzed: so so'i don rnams ni skabs re res ji ltar bstan pa dang / tshogs kyi lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs re re la yang rang bzhin ji snyed yod ces mngon par rtogs pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of the individual is the meaning of realization, which is the meaning of what is taught in each chapter and the meaning of how many natures there are in each stage such as the path of accumulation.

original: de'i rjes kyi ngo bor thob pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes kyi ngo bor thob pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: The wisdom that is attained subsequently to that is the realization.

original: bsdus ba nyid kyi don ni snying po'i don chos kyi dbyings rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: bsdus ba nyid kyi don ni snying po'i don chos kyi dbyings rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The meaning of “comprising” is the meaning of “essence,” which is the nature of nonconceptual wisdom, the expanse of reality.

original: don de ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes kyi rtogs par mdzad nas so //
analyzed: don de ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes kyi rtogs par mdzad nas so //
translated: That meaning is realized by the wisdom of meditative equipoise.

original: de ltar na go rims bzhin du bklags nas zhes bya ba ni yid kyis bklags nas zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de ltar na go rims bzhin du bklags nas zhes bya ba ni yid kyis bklags nas zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Thus, “in due order” means that one reads it with the mind, that is, one reads it mentally.

original: bskal ba grangs med pa dang po ni 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gi bar du'o /
analyzed: bskal ba grangs med pa dang po ni 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gi bar du'o /
translated: The first incalculable eon is up to the supreme mundane state.

original: brtan pa ni sa mi g-yo ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: brtan pa ni sa mi g-yo ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The firm is up to the immovable stage.

original: gsum pa ni sa bcu pa'i bar du de srid du goms par bya ba ni go rims bzhin du bklags pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni sa bcu pa'i bar du de srid du goms par bya ba ni go rims bzhin du bklags pa'o //
translated: The third is up to the tenth stage. The cultivation up to that point is the reading in due order.

original: 'on kyang da dung de la goms par bya bar ma zad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang da dung de la goms par bya bar ma zad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: However, in order to show that the cultivation is not yet complete,

original: brtan por bya ba'i phyir rnam par sgom par byed pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brtan por bya ba'i phyir rnam par sgom par byed pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, “in order to make it firm, one cultivates it.”

original: brtan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lhun gyis grub par 'jug pas ched du 'bad pa mi dgos par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lhun gyis grub par 'jug pas ched du 'bad pa mi dgos par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to stabilize means in order to engage spontaneously, without the need for deliberate effort.

original: rnam par zhes bya ba ni khyad par can du ste sngon pa sgoms pa dag pas ches phul du byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽sgom par byed pa zhes bya ba'i yid de'i skal ba can du byed pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par zhes bya ba ni khyad par can du ste sngon pa sgoms pa dag pas ches phul du byung ba'i phyir ro // sgom par byed pa zhes bya ba'i yid de'i skal ba can du byed pa'am /
translated: In order to purify means in order to purify the path of cultivation, which is superior to the path of preparation.🔽In order to perfect means in order to perfect the path of cultivation, which is superior to the path of preparation.

original: de'i dngos por byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos por byed pa'o //
translated: In order to stabilize means in order to stabilize the path of cultivation, which is superior to the path of preparation.🔽In order to purify means in order to purify the path of cultivation, which is superior to the path of preparation.🔽In order to perfect means in order to perfect the path of cultivation, which is superior to the path of preparation.🔽In order to stabilize means in order to stabilize the path of cultivation, which is superior to the path of preparation.🔽In order to purify means in order to purify the path of cultivation, which is superior to the path of preparation.

original: mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to perfect means in order to perfect the path of cultivation, which is superior to the path of preparation.🔽In order to stabilize means in order to stabilize the path of cultivation, which is superior to the path of preparation.🔽In order to purify means in order to purify the path of cultivation, which is superior to the path of preparation.🔽In order to perfect means in order to perfect the path of cultivation, which is superior to the path of preparation.🔽In order to stabilize means in order to stabilize the path of cultivation, which is superior to the path of preparation.🔽In order to purify means in order to purify the path of cultivation, which is superior to the path of preparation.🔽In order to perfect means in order to perfect the path of cultivation, which is superior to the path of preparation.

original: dang po'i tshogs kyi lam phal pa nas bzung stes bcu pa dbang bskur ba'i sa la gnas pa'i bar du rang dang gzhan gyi don ji snyed cig brtsams pa de dag la rab tu @86a * //🔽'dris bas slar yang yid la byed pas na 'di mthar gyis pa ste /
analyzed: dang po'i tshogs kyi lam phal pa nas bzung stes bcu pa dbang bskur ba'i sa la gnas pa'i bar du rang dang gzhan gyi don ji snyed cig brtsams pa de dag la rab tu @86a * // 'dris bas slar yang yid la byed pas na 'di mthar gyis pa ste /
translated: In order to stabilize means in order to stabilize the path of cultivation, which is superior to the path of preparation.🔽In order to purify means in order to purify the path of cultivation, which is superior to the path of preparation.🔽In order to perfect means in order to perfect the path of cultivation, which is superior to the path of preparation.

original: don 'di ni 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las 'phags pa mi pham pa'i zhal snga nas /
analyzed: don 'di ni 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las 'phags pa mi pham pa'i zhal snga nas /
translated: In order to stabilize means in order to stabilize the path of cultivation, which is superior to the path of preparation.🔽In order to purify means in order to purify the path of cultivation, which is superior to the path of preparation.

original: tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzangs la rang gi mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ji lta ba khang bzangs rnam par snang mdzad la gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du bstan pa'i rim pa ltar de shes bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzangs la rang gi mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ji lta ba khang bzangs rnam par snang mdzad la gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du bstan pa'i rim pa ltar de shes bar bya'o //
translated: The merchant's son Sudhana should be understood in accordance with the sequence of his own realizations, in the manner of a reflection in the palace of Vairocana.

original: de ltar rnam par bsgom pa de nyid ni mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par bsgom pa de nyid ni mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That very cultivation is called realization,

original: dus ji lta ba'i rim gyis rtogs pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus ji lta ba'i rim gyis rtogs pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is directed toward realization in accordance with the sequence of time.

original: gzhung yang de brjod pas de'i ming btags pa ste 'bras bu ni de las byung ba'i phyir de skad ces gdags so //
analyzed: gzhung yang de brjod pas de'i ming btags pa ste 'bras bu ni de las byung ba'i phyir de skad ces gdags so //
translated: The treatise is named after that, because it expresses that. The result is designated as such because it arises from that.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the four perfections are included in the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: thabs dang / stobs dang / smon lam dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi po 'di rnams ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du 'dus bar 'gyur ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams byang chub chen por bsngos pa'i mthus chung du tsam yang
analyzed: thabs dang / stobs dang / smon lam dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi po 'di rnams ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du 'dus bar 'gyur ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams byang chub chen por bsngos pa'i mthus chung du tsam yang
translated: The four perfections of means, power, aspiration, and gnosis are included within the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'khor ba ji srid du mi zad par byed pa'i thabs ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa phyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba ji srid du mi zad par byed pa'i thabs ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa phyin pa ste /
translated: The means of making even a small act of generosity and so forth inexhaustible for as long as samsara lasts through the power of dedicating it to great enlightenment is the perfection of means.

original: de ni shes rab kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: de ni shes rab kyi khyad par ro //
translated: This is the difference in wisdom.

original: yang sbyin pa la sogs pa dngos po ngan pa'am nyung du zhig na yang 'phags pa nam mkha'i mdzod kyi mdo la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brangs te /
analyzed: yang sbyin pa la sogs pa dngos po ngan pa'am nyung du zhig na yang 'phags pa nam mkha'i mdzod kyi mdo la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brangs te /
translated: Moreover, even if generosity and so forth are inferior or small, following the noble Cloud of Jewels Sutra and so forth,

original: mang zhing khyad par can du sprul te /
analyzed: mang zhing khyad par can du sprul te /
translated: they are emanated as many and special

original: phan 'dogs pas 'di ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pas 'di ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: and benefit others. This is the perfection of power.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rtag par rab tu ngu ba la sogs pa'i khrag rnams brgya byin gyis tsandan gyi chur byin gyis brlabs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rtag par rab tu ngu ba la sogs pa'i khrag rnams brgya byin gyis tsandan gyi chur byin gyis brlabs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Just as the blood of the Bodhisattvas Sadaprarudita and so on was transformed into sandalwood water by Indra.

original: 'di yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bye brag go //
analyzed: 'di yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bye brag go //
translated: This is also a special feature of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' legs par spyad pa rnams blos gcig tu bsdus te /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' legs par spyad pa rnams blos gcig tu bsdus te /
translated: When a Bodhisattva has gathered all his good actions into one🔽and does not despise even the smallest of them, he makes the following aspiration:🔽“By this good action of mine, may I become a Buddha, a leader of the world.

original: dngos po dman pa rnams kyang khyad du mi gsod par bdag dge ba'i las 'dis sangs rgyas nas 'jig rten gyi 'dren par gyur cig / de ma thob kyi bar du yang rigs dang longs spyod la sogs pa 'di dang 'di lta bur gyur cig ces smon lam
analyzed: dngos po dman pa rnams kyang khyad du mi gsod par bdag dge ba'i las 'dis sangs rgyas nas 'jig rten gyi 'dren par gyur cig / de ma thob kyi bar du yang rigs dang longs spyod la sogs pa 'di dang 'di lta bur gyur cig ces smon lam
translated: And until I have attained that, may I be reborn in such and such a family, with such and such resources, and so on.”

original: 'debs bas de'i ji ltar smon pa ltar 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'debs bas de'i ji ltar smon pa ltar 'grub ste /
translated: And it is just as he has aspired.

original: chos rnams thams cad rkyen bzhin te //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad rkyen bzhin te //
translated: All things are like a reflection,

original: 'dus pa'i rtsal rab tu gnas //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rtsal rab tu gnas //
translated: And their power is in their combination.

original: bdag gis smon lam 'di btab pas //
analyzed: bdag gis smon lam 'di btab pas //
translated: I have made this aspiration,

original: de @86b dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu 'thob //
analyzed: de @86b dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu 'thob //
translated: And I will obtain the fruit that corresponds to it.

original: ces ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ces ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is as stated.

original: 'di yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'di yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: This is also a special feature of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de de ltar smon lam gyi 'bras bu grub pa spyod pa na yang tshe gzhan dang gzhan de dag tu de lta bu'i go 'phang las mi nyams pa'i ye shes kyi spyod pa dang / ji ltar 'thob pa'i bden pa rnams legs par spyod pa'i 'bras bur 'dod kyi rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyur smra ba la sogs par mi 'dod pa 'di ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de de ltar smon lam gyi 'bras bu grub pa spyod pa na yang tshe gzhan dang gzhan de dag tu de lta bu'i go 'phang las mi nyams pa'i ye shes kyi spyod pa dang / ji ltar 'thob pa'i bden pa rnams legs par spyod pa'i 'bras bur 'dod kyi rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyur smra ba la sogs par mi 'dod pa 'di ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: When one practices the accomplishment of the result of such a vow, one does not fall from such a state in other lives, and one practices with wisdom. One does not assert that the result of practicing the truths as they are attained is causeless or caused by an incompatible cause. This is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bye brag go //
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bye brag go //
translated: This is also a particular feature of the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'dir nye bar bsdu ba'i dbang du gsungs kyi mdor na legs pa'i las ji snyed pa ni shes rab la brten par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir nye bar bsdu ba'i dbang du gsungs kyi mdor na legs pa'i las ji snyed pa ni shes rab la brten par shes par bya'o //
translated: Here it is stated in terms of a summary, but in brief, it should be understood that all good actions are based on wisdom.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa dgongs pa nges bar 'grel pa'i mdo la sogs pa las pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi nang du bsdu ba'i tshul rnams kyang shes par bya ste 'dir sbyar ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa dgongs pa nges bar 'grel pa'i mdo la sogs pa las pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi nang du bsdu ba'i tshul rnams kyang shes par bya ste 'dir sbyar ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: Moreover, one should understand the ways of subsuming the perfections within the six perfections in the noble sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning and so forth.

original: lnga ba 'di ni gtan tshigs su blta bar bya'o //🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba drug ces bya ba la /
analyzed: lnga ba 'di ni gtan tshigs su blta bar bya'o // sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba drug ces bya ba la /
translated: The fifth is to be regarded as a reason.🔽The six perfections are distinguished by the purity of the three spheres.

original: 'dir sbyin pa la sogs pa drug 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas pha rol tu phyin pa rab tu phyin pa rab tu phye ba zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dir sbyin pa la sogs pa drug 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas pha rol tu phyin pa rab tu phyin pa rab tu phye ba zhes sbyar te /
translated: Here, the six perfections such as generosity are distinguished by the perfection of the perfections through the purity of the three spheres.

original: de la 'khor gsum ni sbyin pa dang len pa dang rdzas zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: de la 'khor gsum ni sbyin pa dang len pa dang rdzas zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The three spheres are the giver, the recipient and the substance.

original: 'di dag ni gtso bos yongs su dag par ma byas na srid pa'i bde ba tsam las bgrod par mi nus pa'i phyir rgyal po'i phyag rgya dang bral ba'i dmag gi dpung lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni gtso bos yongs su dag par ma byas na srid pa'i bde ba tsam las bgrod par mi nus pa'i phyir rgyal po'i phyag rgya dang bral ba'i dmag gi dpung lta bu'o //
translated: These are like an army lacking the king's seal, for without the purification by the chief one, they cannot go beyond the mere happiness of existence.

original: de dag gi gtso bo ni gang gis de dag pha rol tu phyin pa pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su gtogs par byed pa yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste 'di ni rgyal po lta bu'o //
analyzed: de dag gi gtso bo ni gang gis de dag pha rol tu phyin pa pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su gtogs par byed pa yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste 'di ni rgyal po lta bu'o //
translated: The chief one is the Mother, the perfection of wisdom, by which they are called perfections, and it is like the king.

original: de'i phyir ji skad du gsungs pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad du gsungs pa //
translated: Therefore, as it is said:

original: dmus long dmigs bu med pa byed ba khrag khrig rnams //
analyzed: dmus long dmigs bu med pa byed ba khrag khrig rnams //
translated: Millions of blind men can make no progress,

original: lam yang mi shes grong khyer 'jug par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: lam yang mi shes grong khyer 'jug par ga la 'gyur //
translated: not knowing the path, how can they enter the city?

original: de bzhin mig med pha rol phyin snga 'di dag kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin mig med pha rol phyin snga 'di dag kyang /
translated: In the same way, these perfections without the eye of wisdom,

original: dmigs bu med pas byang chub reg par nus ma yin //
analyzed: dmigs bu med pas byang chub reg par nus ma yin //
translated: cannot reach enlightenment without a guide.

original: zhes so // rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas sa bcu yang dag par sgrub par byed pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes so // rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas sa bcu yang dag par sgrub par byed pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The ten stages are perfectly accomplished through the completion of all aspects.

original: 'di dag la 'ga' zhig ma tshang yang sa bcu pa'i dbang phyug tu mi 'gyur bas na rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'di dag la 'ga' zhig ma tshang yang sa bcu pa'i dbang phyug tu mi 'gyur bas na rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas zhes smos te /
translated: Here, even if some of these are incomplete, one does not become a master of the ten stages. Therefore, it is said that they are completed in all aspects.

original: gsum pa ni rgyu mtshan du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni rgyu mtshan du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The third is to be seen as the reason.

original: de yang sa re re la @87a * //
analyzed: de yang sa re re la @87a * //
translated: Moreover, each stage

original: pha rol tu phyin pa re re zhig shas che bar zad kyi dngos kyi tshul spyad pa'i tshe ni sa re re la yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug car sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa re re zhig shas che bar zad kyi dngos kyi tshul spyad pa'i tshe ni sa re re la yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug car sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: is dominated by one perfection, but when one practices the actual way of life, one should apply all six perfections to each stage.

original: 'dis ni gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthu 'ba' zhig gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes smra ba de dag kyang bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthu 'ba' zhig gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes smra ba de dag kyang bsal ba yin te /
translated: This also refutes those who claim that one attains complete enlightenment solely through the power of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: smra ba'i mchog ni gang yang rung //
analyzed: smra ba'i mchog ni gang yang rung //
translated: Whatever be the supreme teaching,

original: chos gcig gis ni 'byung ba med //
analyzed: chos gcig gis ni 'byung ba med //
translated: there is no arising through a single factor.

original: gang yang 'byung ba yod min te //🔽'byung bar yang dag mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yang 'byung ba yod min te // 'byung bar yang dag mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Nor is there any arising whatsoever.

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It does not arise in reality.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnams te /
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness, the four right efforts, and the four legs of manifestation.

original: de dag ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang zhes bstan pa dang sbyar te /🔽de dag tshogs kyi lam la ni slob pa yin pa'i phyir grub pa ni /
analyzed: de dag ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang zhes bstan pa dang sbyar te / de dag tshogs kyi lam la ni slob pa yin pa'i phyir grub pa ni /
translated: They are taught as the factors conducive to penetration.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gzhag par dgongs pas na sngon las gzhan du bstan to ;
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gzhag par dgongs pas na sngon las gzhan du bstan to ;
translated: On the path of accumulation, they are training, so they are taught as different from before, with the intention of establishing them in the stage of non-regression.

original: / byang chub kyi yan lag gi rnam pa dang zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: / byang chub kyi yan lag gi rnam pa dang zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The aspects of the branches of enlightenment.

original: dran pa yang dag byang dag chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang dag chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa ste /
translated: The right mindfulness branch of enlightenment, etc.

original: de dag ni mthong ba'i lam zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag ni mthong ba'i lam zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: They are connected with what is called the path of seeing.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa ste de dag ni bsgom pa'i lam zhes smos pa dang rab tu sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa ste de dag ni bsgom pa'i lam zhes smos pa dang rab tu sbyar ro //
translated: The eightfold noble path is right view and so on, and these are applied to the path of meditation.

original: de ltar na ji ltar sbyar ba de dag ni go rims bzhin du tshig gzhan du bstan pas rang gi don ming gi rnam drangs kyis rjod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na ji ltar sbyar ba de dag ni go rims bzhin du tshig gzhan du bstan pas rang gi don ming gi rnam drangs kyis rjod par byed pa ste /
translated: Thus, these are respectively expressed by the names that indicate their own objects, since they are taught in other words.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi mtshan nyid rjes su dran pa lam rnam pa gsum po 'di dag gis dran par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi mtshan nyid rjes su dran pa lam rnam pa gsum po 'di dag gis dran par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should recall the Buddha through these three aspects of the path.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa ni lam gyi bdag nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa ni lam gyi bdag nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But aren’t the stages conducive to penetrative insight and so on the nature of the path?

original: sangs rgyas ni 'bras bu'i bdag nyid yin na ji ltar lam dran pas de rjes su dran par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni 'bras bu'i bdag nyid yin na ji ltar lam dran pas de rjes su dran par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: And if the Buddha is the nature of the result, how can one recall him through recalling the path?

original: 'di ni nyes pa med de 'og nas lam thams cad ni chos kyi sku'i phrin las su 'chad pas las kyi byed pa po rjes su dran par bya ba'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas de dang po lam ji lta bu brnyes pas byang chub pas byang chub par gyur pa lam dang bcas par dran pa ni gcig tu rab tu dang bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni nyes pa med de 'og nas lam thams cad ni chos kyi sku'i phrin las su 'chad pas las kyi byed pa po rjes su dran par bya ba'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas de dang po lam ji lta bu brnyes pas byang chub pas byang chub par gyur pa lam dang bcas par dran pa ni gcig tu rab tu dang bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not a fault, because later it will be explained that all paths are the activity of the body of truth, and in order to remember the agent of that activity, and because remembering the path by which the Buddha first attained enlightenment and became enlightened, together with the path, is the cause of single pointed faith.

original: gal te dngos por 'dzin pas de rjes su dran par byed pa srid pas de dag par bya ba'i phyir don dam par dran pa @87b med pa'i mtshan nyid du rjes su dran par bya'o zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: gal te dngos por 'dzin pas de rjes su dran par byed pa srid pas de dag par bya ba'i phyir don dam par dran pa @87b med pa'i mtshan nyid du rjes su dran par bya'o zhes sbyar te /
translated: If it is possible to remember that by apprehending it as an entity, then in order to purify that, one should remember it as having the characteristic of non memory in the ultimate.

original: gang gis nga la sgrar shes shing //
analyzed: gang gis nga la sgrar shes shing //
translated: Those who know me as sound

original: gang gis nga la gzugs su mthong //
analyzed: gang gis nga la gzugs su mthong //
translated: and see me as form

original: log par spong bar zhugs pa ste //
analyzed: log par spong bar zhugs pa ste //
translated: are engaged in false renunciation

original: skye bo de yis nga mi mthong /🔽sangs rgyas rnams ni chos kyi sku //
analyzed: skye bo de yis nga mi mthong / sangs rgyas rnams ni chos kyi sku //
translated: and do not see me.🔽The buddhas are the body of truth.

original: chos nyid du ni sangs rgyas blta //
analyzed: chos nyid du ni sangs rgyas blta //
translated: The buddhas should be seen as reality.

original: chos nyid shes par bya min pas /
analyzed: chos nyid shes par bya min pas /
translated: Because reality is not to be known,

original: de ni rnam par shes mi nus //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes mi nus //
translated: it cannot be known.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang yang mi 'gal la //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang yang mi 'gal la //
translated: This is not inconsistent with the statement.🔽One should remember the teachings as they have been taught, such as the applications of mindfulness, and as they are taught in the noble Candrapradīpa Sūtra:

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ji skad bstan pa rnams dang / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ji skad bstan pa rnams dang / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa //
translated: The Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, the one with perfect knowledge and conduct,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: the Well-Gone One,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa //🔽skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa // skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa //
translated: the Knower of the World,🔽the Unsurpassed One,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo mnga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'phags pa zla ba sgron me'i mdo las gsungs pa ltar yang dran par byed pa ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo mnga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'phags pa zla ba sgron me'i mdo las gsungs pa ltar yang dran par byed pa ste /
translated: the Teacher of Gods and Men, the Buddha, the Blessed One, who has the name of Suviśuddhamati.

original: 'di ni las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams myur du sangs rgyas dang phrad par 'gyur ba'i rgyur yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams myur du sangs rgyas dang phrad par 'gyur ba'i rgyur yang rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be known as the cause for beginner bodhisattvas to quickly meet the Buddha.

original: de bzhin du rjes su dran pa dang zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su dran pa dang zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The same should be applied to the recollection of breathing.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of the body.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni don dam par dran pa med pa'i mtshan nyid du zhes bya ba la sbyor ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni don dam par dran pa med pa'i mtshan nyid du zhes bya ba la sbyor ba'i don to //
translated: The same should be applied to the recollection of the mind.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of dharmas.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of virtue, generosity, and the gods.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of breathing.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos zhes bya ba la dge ba rnams ni bcom ldan 'das kyi chos ni legs par gsungs pa /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos zhes bya ba la dge ba rnams ni bcom ldan 'das kyi chos ni legs par gsungs pa /
translated: The same should be applied to the recollection of the body.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of the mind.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of dharmas.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of virtue, generosity, and the gods.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of breathing.

original: 'di mthong ba la don yod pa //
analyzed: 'di mthong ba la don yod pa //
translated: The same should be applied to the recollection of the body.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of the mind.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of dharmas.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of virtue, generosity, and the gods.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of breathing.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of the body.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyi rang gis rig par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa dran par bya'o //🔽mi dge ba rnams ni mi dge ba rang gi rang bzhin gyis grub pa med pa dang / de'i rang bzhin ma shes pa'i dbang du byas te ni spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyi rang gis rig par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa dran par bya'o // mi dge ba rnams ni mi dge ba rang gi rang bzhin gyis grub pa med pa dang / de'i rang bzhin ma shes pa'i dbang du byas te ni spang bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the recollection of the mind.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of dharmas.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of virtue, generosity, and the gods.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of breathing.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of the body.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of the mind.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of dharmas.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of virtue, generosity, and the gods.

original: lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni de dag la mi 'jug cing dge bar gyur pa rnams la 'jug par dran par bya'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni de dag la mi 'jug cing dge bar gyur pa rnams la 'jug par dran par bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the recollection of breathing.🔽The same should be applied to the recollection of the body.🔽The same should be applied

original: yang na chos rnam par gsum du phye ba ni rang gi blo'i 'jug pa'i dbang tsam la rag las pa yin gyi //
analyzed: yang na chos rnam par gsum du phye ba ni rang gi blo'i 'jug pa'i dbang tsam la rag las pa yin gyi //
translated: Or else, the division of phenomena into three is dependent only on the power of one’s own mind.

original: chos rnams la de ltar rang grub pa ni med pas sems rnams par rigs pa'i mtha' las ni lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang dge bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos rnams la de ltar rang grub pa ni med pas sems rnams par rigs pa'i mtha' las ni lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang dge bar 'gyur te /
translated: But since phenomena do not exist in that way by themselves, in the Pramaṇavarttika, even neutral phenomena become virtuous.

original: ji skad du rigs pa dang bzo la sogs pa gus par byas te byin pas byin pa ri dvags ae ne ya'i lta bu nyid dang zhes gsungs te ya ni pa se kha sgo'o //🔽yang sdig @88a * //
analyzed: ji skad du rigs pa dang bzo la sogs pa gus par byas te byin pas byin pa ri dvags ae ne ya'i lta bu nyid dang zhes gsungs te ya ni pa se kha sgo'o // yang sdig @88a * //
translated: As it says, “By respectfully giving knowledge, crafts, and so on, one obtains the gift of the antelope-like gait.”

original: pa srab pa'i dbang du byas te stobs bskyed pa rnyed pa rnyed pa rnams la bde ba nye bar ston pa'i slad du dbul lo zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: pa srab pa'i dbang du byas te stobs bskyed pa rnyed pa rnyed pa rnams la bde ba nye bar ston pa'i slad du dbul lo zhes gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, in terms of the weakening of evil, it says, “In order to show the happiness of those who have obtained the power of attainment, one should give.”

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams ni rang bzhin gyis 'dod gsal ba tsam zhig tu bden gyi lhag ma'i snang ba rnams ni ma nges par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams ni rang bzhin gyis 'dod gsal ba tsam zhig tu bden gyi lhag ma'i snang ba rnams ni ma nges par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore one should understand that things are only true as mere appearances of desire, and the remaining appearances are uncertain.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa dang ldan par rnams la ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis thams cad la phan 'dogs pas na ngan song la sogs par lhung ba las 'dzin ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa dang ldan par rnams la ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis thams cad la phan 'dogs pas na ngan song la sogs par lhung ba las 'dzin ba'i phyir ram /
translated: The Dharma is so called because it benefits all those who have realization in the manner that has been explained, or because it holds one back from falling into miserable realms, and so on.

original: yang na rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis chos so //
analyzed: yang na rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis chos so //
translated: Or else, it is the Dharma in the manner of verbal expression because it holds one’s own characteristics.

original: snga ma bzhin du rjes su dran par bya'o zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rjes su dran par bya'o zhes sbyar te /
translated: One should recollect it as before.

original: de la snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba 'dis ni don gnyis ston par byed de /
analyzed: de la snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba 'dis ni don gnyis ston par byed de /
translated: Here, as before refers to the two meanings.

original: sngar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i skabs su gdams ngag bstan pa las /
analyzed: sngar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i skabs su gdams ngag bstan pa las /
translated: In the section on the knowledge of all aspects, the instruction was given:🔽The dull and sharp faculties

original: dbang po rtul dang rnon po dag / ces bya ba la yang snyegs te /
analyzed: dbang po rtul dang rnon po dag / ces bya ba la yang snyegs te /
translated: are to be understood in terms of the two vehicles.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the irreversible saṅgha of bodhisattvas is mentioned.

original: de las gzhan pa ni don dam par dran ba med pa'i mtshan nyid du zhes bya ba la yang snyegs par byed do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni don dam par dran ba med pa'i mtshan nyid du zhes bya ba la yang snyegs par byed do //
translated: The other is to be supplied with the words: “in the ultimate sense, it has the characteristic of being without memory.”

original: de la rjes su dran par bya ba ni thun mong du dran par bya ba bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa //
analyzed: de la rjes su dran par bya ba ni thun mong du dran par bya ba bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa //
translated: The recollection of the common is the recollection of the Sangha of the Lord’s disciples, who are said to be “well-disciplined,”

original: mthun par zhugs pa /
analyzed: mthun par zhugs pa /
translated: “harmonious,”

original: drang por zhugs pa phyag 'chal ba'i 'os su gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lung gis so //
analyzed: drang por zhugs pa phyag 'chal ba'i 'os su gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lung gis so //
translated: “upright,” “worthy of offerings,” and so on.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i yin tan rjes su dran pa ni phyir mi ldog ba'i sa rab tu brnyes pa //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i yin tan rjes su dran pa ni phyir mi ldog ba'i sa rab tu brnyes pa //
translated: The recollection of the uncommon qualities is the recollection of the irreversible stage,

original: chos kyi rgyal po'i sras bzhin 'dzum zhing gsong por smra ba /
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal po'i sras bzhin 'dzum zhing gsong por smra ba /
translated: the recollection of the bodhisattvas who are like the sons of the Dharma King, smiling and speaking pleasantly,🔽thinking, “What can I do for all sentient beings?” and so on.

original: sems can thams cad kyi bya ba ci yod ces sems pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa shin tu rgyas pa'i sder gtogs pa'i mdo sde dang // de las ji skad du gsungs pa ltar rjes su dran par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bya ba ci yod ces sems pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa shin tu rgyas pa'i sder gtogs pa'i mdo sde dang // de las ji skad du gsungs pa ltar rjes su dran par bya'o //
translated: One should recollect them as they are described in the sutras of the vaipulya class.

original: de bzhin du rjes su dran par bya'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su dran par bya'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: One should recollect them in the same way means as before.

original: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims rnams te /🔽de dag rjes su dran par bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims rnams te / de dag rjes su dran par bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The morality of restraint, the morality of accumulating virtuous natures, and the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: tshul khrims ni 'gyod pa med pas rgyud bil bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni 'gyod pa med pas rgyud bil bar byed pa'o //
translated: One should recollect them in the following way: Morality is the cause of non-remorse.

original: mtho ris kyi lam du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mtho ris kyi lam du gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the path to heaven.

original: ji ltar smon pa'i 'bras bu sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar smon pa'i 'bras bu sgrub pa'o //
translated: It accomplishes the fruits as wished for.

original: 'gyod pa med pas ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa med pas ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa'o //
translated: It generates concentration through non-remorse.

original: lha dang me'i sbyin pa yongs su @88b sbyong bo'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: lha dang me'i sbyin pa yongs su @88b sbyong bo'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim pas so //
translated: It purifies the giving of divine and human enjoyments.

original: gtong ba ni ser sna spangs pas sems la kun tu 'dzin pa med cing rang gi lus dang srog la sogs pa rnams par 'gyed pa ste /
analyzed: gtong ba ni ser sna spangs pas sems la kun tu 'dzin pa med cing rang gi lus dang srog la sogs pa rnams par 'gyed pa ste /
translated: Giving is the complete absence of grasping in the mind through abandoning stinginess, and the distribution of one's own body, life, and so on.

original: de'i yon tan rjes su dran par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i yon tan rjes su dran par bya ba ni /
translated: One should recollect its virtues in the following way:

original: sbyin pa ni mdza' bshes 'phel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni mdza' bshes 'phel bar byed pa'o //
translated: Giving increases friends.

original: tshe rabs su rab tu bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs su rab tu bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the cause of great happiness in all one's lives.

original: pha ma dang bla ma la mchod pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: pha ma dang bla ma la mchod pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the branch of worship of parents and teachers.

original: gzhan la rag ma las pa'i gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan la rag ma las pa'i gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: It is the principal thing that does not depend on others.

original: rgya cher ni 'phags pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo la sogs pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher ni 'phags pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo la sogs pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: The stages of these and other topics should be understood in detail from the noble Perfection of Generosity Sutra and so forth.

original: lha ni rgyal chen rigs bzhi la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: lha ni rgyal chen rigs bzhi la sogs pa ste ;
translated: Gods are the Four Great Kings and so forth.

original: de dag rjes su dran par bya ba ni de dag ni yid du 'ong ba'i las khyad par can las grub pa ste /
analyzed: de dag rjes su dran par bya ba ni de dag ni yid du 'ong ba'i las khyad par can las grub pa ste /
translated: Recollecting them is that they are established from special virtuous karma.🔽It is said:

original: rnam rtog dge las byung ba yi //
analyzed: rnam rtog dge las byung ba yi //
translated: The virtuous karma that arises from virtuous conceptuality

original: las dge 'bras bu lha rnams te //
analyzed: las dge 'bras bu lha rnams te //
translated: Is the result of virtuous karma, the gods.

original: rab tu dang pa'i yid kyis ni //
analyzed: rab tu dang pa'i yid kyis ni //
translated: With a mind of faith

original: mdzes pa'i lha rnams mngon par grub //🔽ces gsungs pas so //
analyzed: mdzes pa'i lha rnams mngon par grub // ces gsungs pas so //
translated: The beautiful gods are manifestly established.

original: de'i phyir bdag gis kyang sems can rnams yid rab tu dang bar byas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gis kyang sems can rnams yid rab tu dang bar byas te /
translated: Therefore, I too should make sentient beings' minds very clear.

original: lhar skye bar bya ba la dgod cing rim gyis theg pa gsum gyis yongs du'o //🔽khong du chad pas zhes bya ba dran pa dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa 'jig rten dbang phyug dang / rje btsun lha mo skul byed ma dang / rje btsun sgro la ma la sogs te /
analyzed: lhar skye bar bya ba la dgod cing rim gyis theg pa gsum gyis yongs du'o // khong du chad pas zhes bya ba dran pa dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa 'jig rten dbang phyug dang / rje btsun lha mo skul byed ma dang / rje btsun sgro la ma la sogs te /
translated: and to be reborn as a god, and gradually to be fully matured by the three vehicles.

original: mdo gang gang dag las mchog tu thugs brtse ba dang ldan pa rnams lhag pa'i lha de'i yon tan ji skad bstan pa rnams rjes su dran par bya ba ni 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las /
analyzed: mdo gang gang dag las mchog tu thugs brtse ba dang ldan pa rnams lhag pa'i lha de'i yon tan ji skad bstan pa rnams rjes su dran par bya ba ni 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las /
translated: By understanding means by remembering the qualities of the supreme deity of those who possess supreme compassion, as taught in the sutras.🔽 As it is said in the noble Array of Stalks:

original: de nas kho mo sngon yongs su bsten pa'i lha mo zhig gis bskul te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yon tan 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: de nas kho mo sngon yongs su bsten pa'i lha mo zhig gis bskul te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yon tan 'thob pa'o //
translated: Then, a goddess who had attended me before exhorted me, and so on, describing the qualities she attained.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad ces bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bas bsdus pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad ces bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bas bsdus pa rnams so //
translated: All phenomena such as form, etc. are included in the defiled and the purified.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du'o //
translated: The phrase by realization means by the attention of reality.🔽Alternatively, the terms understanding and realization refer to the meaning of direct realization and the meaning of essence.🔽Alternatively, the terms are stated in a different order.🔽The phrase in the nature of the insubstantiality of all things means in the nature of the Reality realm.

original: khong du chud pas zhes bya ba ni mos pa yid la byed pas so //
analyzed: khong du chud pas zhes bya ba ni mos pa yid la byed pas so //
translated: The phrase by understanding means by the attention of conviction.

original: rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid yid la byed pas so //
analyzed: rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid yid la byed pas so //
translated: The phrase by realization means by the attention of reality.🔽Alternatively, the terms understanding and realization refer to the meaning of direct realization and the meaning of essence.

original: yang na de dag mngon par rtogs pa'i don dang snying po'i don la sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na de dag mngon par rtogs pa'i don dang snying po'i don la sbyar ro //
translated: Alternatively, the terms are stated in a different order.🔽The phrase in the nature of the insubstantiality of all things means in the nature of the Reality realm.🔽The phrase by understanding means by the attention of conviction.🔽The phrase by realization means by the attention of reality.🔽Alternatively, the terms understanding and realization refer to the meaning of direct realization and the meaning of essence.

original: yang na rnam grangs kyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rnam grangs kyis bstan pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, the terms are stated in a different order.🔽The phrase in the nature of the insubstantiality of all things means in the nature of the Reality realm.🔽The phrase by understanding means by the attention of conviction.

original: kang yin pa de ni mthar gyis pa'i bya bar bzhed pa yin no zhes bya ba la skabs 'dir @89a * //
analyzed: kang yin pa de ni mthar gyis pa'i bya bar bzhed pa yin no zhes bya ba la skabs 'dir @89a * //
translated: The phrase by realization means by the attention of reality.🔽Alternatively, the terms understanding and realization refer to the meaning of direct realization and the meaning of essence.🔽Alternatively, the terms are stated in a different order.🔽The phrase in the nature of the insubstantiality of all things means in the nature of the Reality realm.🔽The phrase by understanding means by the attention of conviction.🔽The phrase by realization means by the attention of reality.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / rjes su dran pa drug dang / chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs pa zhes bya ba rnam pa bcu gsum zhig bstan pa ni sngar rnam par g-yeng ba spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / rjes su dran pa drug dang / chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs pa zhes bya ba rnam pa bcu gsum zhig bstan pa ni sngar rnam par g-yeng ba spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Alternatively, the terms understanding and realization refer to the meaning of direct realization and the meaning of essence.🔽Alternatively, the terms are stated in a different order.🔽The phrase in the nature of the insubstantiality of all things means in the nature of the Reality realm.

original: ngag re res kyang mngon par rtogs pa'i don ma lus pa ston par byed pa'o zhes bshad pa'i tshul gyis na byang chub sems dpa' skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dang / srid pa tha ma pa de ni rnam pa bcu gsum po 'di dag la brten nas bshad pa dang /
analyzed: ngag re res kyang mngon par rtogs pa'i don ma lus pa ston par byed pa'o zhes bshad pa'i tshul gyis na byang chub sems dpa' skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dang / srid pa tha ma pa de ni rnam pa bcu gsum po 'di dag la brten nas bshad pa dang /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is impeded by only one birth and the one in his final existence, on the basis of these thirteen, explain and

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pa thams cad yid la rab tu goms par byed de /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pa thams cad yid la rab tu goms par byed de /
translated: they fully familiarize their minds with all the stages that will be explained.

original: kha cig na re mthar gyis ba'i bya ba 'di ni dbang bskur ba'i sa dang sa dgu pa la sogs pa yang yid la byed do zhes zer ba ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: kha cig na re mthar gyis ba'i bya ba 'di ni dbang bskur ba'i sa dang sa dgu pa la sogs pa yang yid la byed do zhes zer ba ni mi 'thad do //
translated: Some say that this activity of gradual familiarization is also done on the level of empowerment and the ninth level, but that is untenable.

original: 'di ni skabs 'og ma bar chad med pa'i lam dang cis kyang bar du ma chod par bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di ni skabs 'og ma bar chad med pa'i lam dang cis kyang bar du ma chod par bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: This is because it is taught that the uninterrupted path of the lower stage is not interrupted by anything.

original: skabs drug pa'i 'grel bshad rdzogs so /
analyzed: skabs drug pa'i 'grel bshad rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the explanation of the sixth chapter.

original: // / da ni skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dang / srid pa'i tha mar yang shin tu goms bar byas pa dbang bskur ba'i sa la sogs par yang ci rigs kyis goms par byas pas /
analyzed: // / da ni skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dang / srid pa'i tha mar yang shin tu goms bar byas pa dbang bskur ba'i sa la sogs par yang ci rigs kyis goms par byas pas /
translated: Now, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is impeded by only one birth and who has also become very familiar with the stage of empowerment and so on, in the end of existence, by becoming familiar with them in whatever way is appropriate,

original: lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa la rab tu las su rung bar gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi snying po'i mchog dam pa la 'dug par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa la rab tu las su rung bar gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub kyi snying po'i mchog dam pa la 'dug par gyur pa ste /
translated: is the one who sits on the sublime, supreme seat of enlightenment, who is extremely fit for spontaneous engagement.

original: skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes skyed par byed pa de bstan pa'i phyir mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa rnam par bsgom pa ni sngar ji ltar bslabs pa'i don de dag nyid shin tu goms par bya
analyzed: skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes skyed par byed pa de bstan pa'i phyir mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa rnam par bsgom pa ni sngar ji ltar bslabs pa'i don de dag nyid shin tu goms par bya
translated: In order to demonstrate that he generates the wisdom of omniscience in a single instant, the meditative realization of the sequential clear realization is the meditative realization of the meaning of the trainings that were previously explained, in order to become very familiar with them.

original: ba'i phyir skad cig ma gcig gis bsgoms pas /
analyzed: ba'i phyir skad cig ma gcig gis bsgoms pas /
translated: Since he meditates in a single instant,

original: skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He is fully enlightened in a single instant.

original: 'dir skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i don 'di ji ltar blta bar bya /
analyzed: 'dir skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i don 'di ji ltar blta bar bya /
translated: Here, how should one view the meaning of the term instant?

original: kha cig tu ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams myur du 'gro ba'i skad cig ma se gol gtogs pa gcig la yang de dpag tu med pa zhig 'gag ces grub pa'i mtha' las bstan te /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams myur du 'gro ba'i skad cig ma se gol gtogs pa gcig la yang de dpag tu med pa zhig 'gag ces grub pa'i mtha' las bstan te /
translated: In some places, the philosophical system teaches that in a single finger snap, an immeasurable number of conditioned phenomena quickly pass.

original: de'i yun la yang 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyis ni de sum brgya dang drug cu rtsa brgyad 'gro bar 'dod de /
analyzed: de'i yun la yang 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyis ni de sum brgya dang drug cu rtsa brgyad 'gro bar 'dod de /
translated: In that time, arya sravakas assert that three hundred and sixty-eight instants pass.

original: skad cig ma 'di'o ngo bor bya ba'am /
analyzed: skad cig ma 'di'o ngo bor bya ba'am /
translated: Is this instant the entity of a moment?

original: yang na gdags pa'i bstan bcos la sogs pa las dus @89b rnams kyi mthar rnam par gzhag pa'i skad cig ma ji skad bstan pa'i dbang du 'di bya'am /
analyzed: yang na gdags pa'i bstan bcos la sogs pa las dus @89b rnams kyi mthar rnam par gzhag pa'i skad cig ma ji skad bstan pa'i dbang du 'di bya'am /
translated: Or is it the instant posited at the end of time in treatises on temporal designation?

original: gal te zhig na skyes bu'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub pa'i dus skad cig ma de la bdag gi bya ba rdzogs so zhes brjod pa'i skad cig ma 'di bzung ngo //
analyzed: gal te zhig na skyes bu'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub pa'i dus skad cig ma de la bdag gi bya ba rdzogs so zhes brjod pa'i skad cig ma 'di bzung ngo //
translated: If it does, then at the moment of the accomplishment of the aim desired by the person, the moment when one says, “My action is complete,” that moment is grasped.

original: de la dang po dang bar ma'i dbang du byas so zhe na /
analyzed: de la dang po dang bar ma'i dbang du byas so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the first and the middle are the basis,

original: ni ha cang yang dus yun thung bas ji ltar de rdzogs par nus /
analyzed: ni ha cang yang dus yun thung bas ji ltar de rdzogs par nus /
translated: then, since the time is too short, how can it be complete?

original: tha ma ltar byas na ni ting nge 'dzin 'di'i dus nges pa med de snying po byang chub der yang yun ji srid cig bzhugs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tha ma ltar byas na ni ting nge 'dzin 'di'i dus nges pa med de snying po byang chub der yang yun ji srid cig bzhugs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is like the last, then there is no certainty as to the time of this concentration. How long will he remain at the site of enlightenment?

original: 'dir sngar nyid bdag gis dus rnams ni ring thung du gyur pa bsam pa'i dbang las rang grub pa med ces bstan zin pas 'di lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa bskyed pa'i mi cha'o //
analyzed: 'dir sngar nyid bdag gis dus rnams ni ring thung du gyur pa bsam pa'i dbang las rang grub pa med ces bstan zin pas 'di lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa bskyed pa'i mi cha'o //
translated: Here, since it has already been taught that the times are not established by themselves, but are a matter of the power of thought, whether long or short, it is not proper to generate such a conception.

original: 'on kyang phyogs gsum pa la brten par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang phyogs gsum pa la brten par bya ste /
translated: However, one should rely on a third position.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin de ni nges par snying po byang chub der skyed par byed kyi //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin de ni nges par snying po byang chub der skyed par byed kyi //
translated: That uninterrupted concentration is definitely generated in the heart of enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'ga' zhig snying po byang chub der zhugs pa las ting nge 'dzin de ma bskyed par slar ldang ba ni mi srid ces gsungs la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'ga' zhig snying po byang chub der zhugs pa las ting nge 'dzin de ma bskyed par slar ldang ba ni mi srid ces gsungs la /
translated: It is impossible for a bodhisattva to rise from the heart of enlightenment without generating that concentration.

original: snying po byang chub der yang dus ji srid cig gis ting nge 'dzin de bskyed pa ni rang bzhin brtsan par byas pa'i tshe ni bzhed pa la rag las pa'i phyir dang / dus la mnga' brnyes pas skad cig ma phyogs dang po'i yun gyis kyang de brnyes pa la gnod pa med mod kyi //
analyzed: snying po byang chub der yang dus ji srid cig gis ting nge 'dzin de bskyed pa ni rang bzhin brtsan par byas pa'i tshe ni bzhed pa la rag las pa'i phyir dang / dus la mnga' brnyes pas skad cig ma phyogs dang po'i yun gyis kyang de brnyes pa la gnod pa med mod kyi //
translated: Moreover, it is not definite that the time required to generate that concentration in the heart of enlightenment is one eon, because if one is powerful, it depends on one's wish and if one is powerful in time, it is not undermined that one attains it in the duration of the first moment.

original: gdul bar bya ba'i dbang gis gcig kho nar nges pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gdul bar bya ba'i dbang gis gcig kho nar nges pa med pa ste /
translated: However, it is not definite that it is only one eon because it depends on the power of those to be trained.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa dam pa'i chos padma dkar po zhes bya ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa dam pa'i chos padma dkar po zhes bya ba'i mdo las /
translated: Therefore the sutra called the noble Dharma Flower Garland states:

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par shes pa'i ye shes chen po zhes bya ba de btsun mo'i 'khor nas mngon par byung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par shes pa'i ye shes chen po zhes bya ba de btsun mo'i 'khor nas mngon par byung ste /
translated: The Bhagavat said, “The Tathagata called Mahaabhijñaajnanarata, after leaving the harem,

original: sras bcu drug spangs nas snying po byang chub la bzhugs te /🔽bdud bcom nas de'i 'og tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sras bcu drug spangs nas snying po byang chub la bzhugs te / bdud bcom nas de'i 'og tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: abandoned his sixteen sons and sat on the seat of enlightenment.

original: bar gyi bskal pa lnga bcur skyil mo krung ma bshig par bzhugs pa las /
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa lnga bcur skyil mo krung ma bshig par bzhugs pa las /
translated: After conquering Mara, he sat there for fifty minor kalpas without changing his cross-legged posture in order to manifest the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de nas gdod mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: de nas gdod mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes gsungs la /
translated: Only then did he become a perfect buddha.🔽”

original: bdag cag gi rje btsun sh'akya thub pa'i zhal snga nas ni snying po byang chub la bzhugs pa'i zhag de nyid kyi tho rangs bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin brnyes pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: bdag cag gi rje btsun sh'akya thub pa'i zhal snga nas ni snying po byang chub la bzhugs pa'i zhag de nyid kyi tho rangs bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin brnyes pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par bstan to //
translated: Our Lord Sakyamuni, however, taught that he became a perfect buddha at dawn on the very day he sat on the seat of enlightenment, because he attained the uninterrupted samadhi.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,🔽the Sutra of the Questions of Susthitamati Bodhisattva says:

original: khyod kyi dang por lha'i bu yi //
analyzed: khyod kyi dang por lha'i bu yi //
translated: “Son of the gods, you first became a buddha.

original: @90a * // bdud kyi me rtog rgyal mtshan bsnyal //🔽de nas nyon mongs bdud kyi ni //
analyzed: @90a * // bdud kyi me rtog rgyal mtshan bsnyal // de nas nyon mongs bdud kyi ni //
translated: The banner of the fire of Mara was lowered.🔽Then the banner of pride of the Mara of the afflictions

original: nga rgyal rgyal mtshan mthon po gtib //
analyzed: nga rgyal rgyal mtshan mthon po gtib //
translated: was lowered.🔽You conquered the lord of the desire realm

original: khyod kyis byang chub ma brnyes par //🔽'dod khams dbang phyug las rgyal te //
analyzed: khyod kyis byang chub ma brnyes par // 'dod khams dbang phyug las rgyal te //
translated: without attaining enlightenment.

original: byang chub bar chad med lam la //
analyzed: byang chub bar chad med lam la //
translated: On the uninterrupted path to enlightenment,

original: khams gsum dbang phyug las rgyal lo //
analyzed: khams gsum dbang phyug las rgyal lo //
translated: you conquered the lord of the three realms.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul yang gdul bar bya ba'i snang ba dang 'tsham par brjod kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul yang gdul bar bya ba'i snang ba dang 'tsham par brjod kyi /
translated: In this way, it is said in accordance with the perceptions of those to be tamed.

original: rang gi rang bzhin ni ci khyod byang chub pa dang dus gcig kho nar bdud thams cad nges par bcom pa lags sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin ni ci khyod byang chub pa dang dus gcig kho nar bdud thams cad nges par bcom pa lags sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
translated: But what is your nature? You should follow the statement, Did you conquer all Maras at the very time of your enlightenment?

original: de yang mtshan nyid kyis rnam pa bzhi yod pas dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de yang mtshan nyid kyis rnam pa bzhi yod pas dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: And that has four aspects by nature. Therefore, it is said first and so on.

original: rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag skad cig la rtogs par byed dam 'on te rim gyis byed /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag skad cig la rtogs par byed dam 'on te rim gyis byed /
translated: Are these four aspects realized simultaneously or sequentially?

original: phyogs dang po ltar na gnyis pa la sogs pa'i don ji ltar drang bar bya /
analyzed: phyogs dang po ltar na gnyis pa la sogs pa'i don ji ltar drang bar bya /
translated: If the first position is correct, how should the meaning of the second and so on be interpreted?

original: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang skad cig ma gcig pa'i ming ji ltar rung ste /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang skad cig ma gcig pa'i ming ji ltar rung ste /
translated: If the second position is correct, how can it be called a single moment?

original: skad cig ma bzhi pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig ma bzhi pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why not say that perfect enlightenment occurs in the fourth moment?

original: de ni nyes pa nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de ni nyes pa nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault in the first position,

original: phyogs dang po ltar na yang dang po dang gnyis pa la sogs pa ni grangs ji ltar bstan pa'i rim pa smos par zad kyi /
analyzed: phyogs dang po ltar na yang dang po dang gnyis pa la sogs pa ni grangs ji ltar bstan pa'i rim pa smos par zad kyi /
translated: because in the first position, first, second and so on are merely mentioned in the order they are taught.

original: don gyi dbang du byas pa'i tshe ni dang po la sogs par mi rjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi dbang du byas pa'i tshe ni dang po la sogs par mi rjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But when the meaning is considered, they are not called first and so on.

original: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang nyes pa med de /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na yang nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault in the second position either,

original: byis pa rnams kyis skad cig gcig kho na la dus la dbang thob pa de rnams kyi skad cig ma bzhi'i skabs su 'gyur pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis skad cig gcig kho na la dus la dbang thob pa de rnams kyi skad cig ma bzhi'i skabs su 'gyur pa'i phyir na /
translated: because for those who obtain power over time in a single moment alone, it becomes four moments.

original: de 'dod na skad cig kyang bskal pa tsam du byin gyis rlob par byed do zhes ji skad gsungs pa'i tshul gyis so //🔽gal te de ltar skad cig ma bzhi'i rim pas yid la byed pa la skyon med cing bcom ldan 'das mngon par shes pa'i ye shes chen po'i zhal snga nas kyang skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa 'di bar gyi bskal pa lnga
analyzed: de 'dod na skad cig kyang bskal pa tsam du byin gyis rlob par byed do zhes ji skad gsungs pa'i tshul gyis so // gal te de ltar skad cig ma bzhi'i rim pas yid la byed pa la skyon med cing bcom ldan 'das mngon par shes pa'i ye shes chen po'i zhal snga nas kyang skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa 'di bar gyi bskal pa lnga
translated: If one wishes, one can bless a single instant to be a kalpa.🔽If there is no fault in mental contemplation through the process of four instants, and if the Bhagavat, the one with the knowledge of great higher perception,

original: bcur bsgom pa zhig na /
analyzed: bcur bsgom pa zhig na /
translated: meditates on the single instant of manifest complete enlightenment for fifty intermediate kalpas,

original: de'i tshe 'di yang ji ltar mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di yang ji ltar mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then at that time, how is this not manifest realization in sequence?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa skabs dang po lngar ni tshogs kyi lam la sogs pa sngar ma mthong ba dang / mthong ba'i don rnams la re re la yang dus ring zhig tu sgom par byed pa na rang rang gi gnas skabs pa yin @90b gyi ;
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa skabs dang po lngar ni tshogs kyi lam la sogs pa sngar ma mthong ba dang / mthong ba'i don rnams la re re la yang dus ring zhig tu sgom par byed pa na rang rang gi gnas skabs pa yin @90b gyi ;
translated: In the first five topics, such as omniscience, one meditates for a long time on each of the topics not seen before, such as the path of accumulation, and on the topics seen.

original: mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ma yin la /🔽mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i skabs su ni padma 'dab ma brgya 'bigs pa'i rab tu myur ba'i shugs kyis sngar ji ltar mthong ba'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa rnams rim gyis 'jug pa'i tshul las rim pa snga ma la sogs pa spangs te /
analyzed: mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ma yin la / mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i skabs su ni padma 'dab ma brgya 'bigs pa'i rab tu myur ba'i shugs kyis sngar ji ltar mthong ba'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa rnams rim gyis 'jug pa'i tshul las rim pa snga ma la sogs pa spangs te /
translated: It is not the realization of the serial abiders.🔽In the context of the realization of the serial abiders, the path previously seen together with its result is entered serially by the very swift force of piercing a hundred lotus petals.

original: de ma thag pa'i 'jug pas rim pa 'og ma yang dran pa'i sbyor bas yid la byed kyi /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i 'jug pas rim pa 'og ma yang dran pa'i sbyor bas yid la byed kyi /
translated: The former stages and so on are abandoned and the lower stages are recalled by the application of memory through the force of the immediately preceding stage.

original: rim pa re re la yun ring du mi gnas pas na mthar gyis pa ste /
analyzed: rim pa re re la yun ring du mi gnas pas na mthar gyis pa ste /
translated: Since they do not remain for a long time on each stage, they are serial.

original: rab tu myur ba'i rim gyis rtogs pa ni mthar gyis pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu myur ba'i rim gyis rtogs pa ni mthar gyis pa'o //
translated: Realization by the very swift force is serial.

original: skabs bdun pa'i dbang du byas te ni skyes bu rtsig pa la mchod ba'i dpes ni de ltar rim gyis yid la byed pa ni gnyi ga ltar ma yin gyis /
analyzed: skabs bdun pa'i dbang du byas te ni skyes bu rtsig pa la mchod ba'i dpes ni de ltar rim gyis yid la byed pa ni gnyi ga ltar ma yin gyis /
translated: From the perspective of the seventh chapter, the example of a person climbing a wall illustrates that mental attention is not like that.

original: sngar ji ltar yid la byas pa'i don rnams gcig tu bsdus te /
analyzed: sngar ji ltar yid la byas pa'i don rnams gcig tu bsdus te /
translated: The objects previously attended to are combined into one.

original: de dag gi spyi'i mtshan nyid gcig tu bar ma chad pas bzhi char dus gcig la rtogs par byed cing dus ring zhig thogs pa lta zhig na yang yid la byed pa gcig nyid la yang nas yang du gtod kyi sngon bzhin du rim gyis ma yin pa'i
analyzed: de dag gi spyi'i mtshan nyid gcig tu bar ma chad pas bzhi char dus gcig la rtogs par byed cing dus ring zhig thogs pa lta zhig na yang yid la byed pa gcig nyid la yang nas yang du gtod kyi sngon bzhin du rim gyis ma yin pa'i
translated: Even if a long time elapses, one focuses the mind again and again on a single mental contemplation, not gradually as before.

original: phyir 'di ni mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa las mtshan nyid gzhan du grub bo //
analyzed: phyir 'di ni mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa las mtshan nyid gzhan du grub bo //
translated: Therefore this is established as different from the realization of the four truths in sequence.🔽Nonmaturation is uncontaminated states.

original: rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'i zag pa med par zhes bya ba la rnam par smin pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'i zag pa med par zhes bya ba la rnam par smin pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Maturation is threefold:

original: sa dang po la 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par smin pa dang / sa brgyad pa la mtshan ma med par rnam par smin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa la bsam gyis mi khyab cing lhun gyis grub par rnam par smin pa ste /
analyzed: sa dang po la 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par smin pa dang / sa brgyad pa la mtshan ma med par rnam par smin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa la bsam gyis mi khyab cing lhun gyis grub par rnam par smin pa ste /
translated: the supramundane maturation on the first level, the signless maturation on the eighth level and the inconceivable and spontaneous maturation on the buddha level.

original: de dag tu chos thams cad gnas skabs snga ma las mi 'dra bar smin pas na rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag tu chos thams cad gnas skabs snga ma las mi 'dra bar smin pas na rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: Since all phenomena in those are ripened differently from their previous state, they are fully ripened.

original: de ltar rnam par smin pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag mthong ba'i lam rgyud la ma bskyed pa de dag gi gzung ba dang 'dzin pas bsdus pa'i chos ji snyed snang ba de thams cad ni rnam par smin pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o
analyzed: de ltar rnam par smin pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag mthong ba'i lam rgyud la ma bskyed pa de dag gi gzung ba dang 'dzin pas bsdus pa'i chos ji snyed snang ba de thams cad ni rnam par smin pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o
translated: Thus, that which is called not fully ripened refers to all the phenomena that appear as the apprehended object and apprehending subject of those who have not generated the path of seeing in their mindstreams. All of that is called not fully ripened.🔽In terms of their engagement,

original: // zag pa med pa zhes bya ba la de dag gi 'jug pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: // zag pa med pa zhes bya ba la de dag gi 'jug pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: those phenomena are called uncontaminated.

original: rnam bar smin pa ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: rnam bar smin pa ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though they are not fully ripened,

original: chos de dag gi rang bzhin ni zag pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: chos de dag gi rang bzhin ni zag pa med pa yin te /
translated: the nature of those phenomena is uncontaminated.🔽As it is said:

original: byis pas byang chub mi shes kyang //
analyzed: byis pas byang chub mi shes kyang //
translated: The childish do not know awakening,

original: de dag de la rnam par gnas //🔽zhes gsungs ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de dag de la rnam par gnas // zhes gsungs ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: but it abides in them.

original: 'dir zag pa ni rtog pa dang nyon mongs pa gnyis ka la sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir zag pa ni rtog pa dang nyon mongs pa gnyis ka la sbyar ro //
translated: Here, contamination refers to both thoughts and afflictions.

original: gnyis pa rnam par smin @91a * //
analyzed: gnyis pa rnam par smin @91a * //
translated: The second is fully ripened.

original: pa'i chos nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi zag pa med par zhes bya ba ni sngar ji skad bshad pa'i rnam par smin pa gsum gyis bsdus pa 'phags pa'i skye bo rnams kyi rgyud la yod pa'i chos ji snyed pa gnas par gyur pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa
analyzed: pa'i chos nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi zag pa med par zhes bya ba ni sngar ji skad bshad pa'i rnam par smin pa gsum gyis bsdus pa 'phags pa'i skye bo rnams kyi rgyud la yod pa'i chos ji snyed pa gnas par gyur pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa
translated: The phrase “the uncontaminated state of reality” refers to the uncontaminated nature of those elements that are included in the three types of results that were explained earlier and that exist in the mind continuum of a spiritually advanced person.🔽Because they are present in that manner, they are called “results.”

original: zhes brjod pa de dag gi rang bzhin chos nyid kyi gnas skabs zag pa med pa kho nar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa de dag gi rang bzhin chos nyid kyi gnas skabs zag pa med pa kho nar gnas pa'o //
translated: The nature of those elements is such that they exist only in the uncontaminated state of reality.

original: rnam par smin pa ni gnas yongs su gyur pa'o zhes brjod na gnas gyur pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni gnas yongs su gyur pa'o zhes brjod na gnas gyur pa ci zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the state of having completed the results is a “transformation,” what is this transformation?

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi snang ba rnam par dag pa ltar gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi snang ba rnam par dag pa ltar gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: It is the state in which the appearance of the reality realm becomes pure.

original: gang dag gis /
analyzed: gang dag gis /
translated: By what means does this transformation occur?

original: 'gog dang 'du shes med snyoms 'jug /'du shes med pa pa las 'byung //
analyzed: 'gog dang 'du shes med snyoms 'jug /'du shes med pa pa las 'byung //
translated: The root text states, “It is the emergence from cessation, the state of composure without conception, and the existence that is without conception.”

original: mig la ltos bzhin rgyu rkyen ltos //
analyzed: mig la ltos bzhin rgyu rkyen ltos //
translated: The root text states, “It is dependent on the eye and dependent on causes and conditions.”

original: chad nas yang 'byung 'khor 'jug ldog / ces bya ba dang / len dang bzod dang gsal ba dang // sa bon dang ni las rnams dang // lus kyis myong dang sems med pa'i //
analyzed: chad nas yang 'byung 'khor 'jug ldog / ces bya ba dang / len dang bzod dang gsal ba dang // sa bon dang ni las rnams dang // lus kyis myong dang sems med pa'i //
translated: the experience by the body,

original: snyoms 'jug de bzhin 'chi mi 'thad //
analyzed: snyoms 'jug de bzhin 'chi mi 'thad //
translated: the mindless meditative absorptions, and death.

original: ces bya ba'i rigs pas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yod par 'dod cing de gnas yongs su gyur pa dang / ma gyur pa las rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par smin pa ma yin par brjod pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /🔽rnam par shes pa de ni yul gang zhig 'dzin par byed pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig tu yang ma mthong la /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i rigs pas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yod par 'dod cing de gnas yongs su gyur pa dang / ma gyur pa las rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par smin pa ma yin par brjod pa ni rigs pa ma yin te / rnam par shes pa de ni yul gang zhig 'dzin par byed pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig tu yang ma mthong la /
translated: It is illogical to say that the foundation consciousness is karmic maturation or not karmic maturation on the basis of the transformation or nontransformation of the foundation consciousness.🔽That consciousness is not seen to apprehend any object simultaneously with the eye consciousness and so on.

original: brgyal ba la sogs pa'i tshe de dag rgyun chad pa na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: brgyal ba la sogs pa'i tshe de dag rgyun chad pa na yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that when those eye consciousnesses and so on are interrupted, as in fainting, it apprehends objects.

original: de'i phyir rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa'i lta ba las bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa'i lta ba las bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to reverse the views of eternalism and nihilism and so on,

original: bdag dang kun gzhi la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: bdag dang kun gzhi la sogs pa ni /
translated: The self, the all-base, and so forth are

original: chos kyi dbyings dgongs pa'i gzhir bzhag nas de nyid la de ltar bstan cing brtags pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dgongs pa'i gzhir bzhag nas de nyid la de ltar bstan cing brtags pa ste /
translated: posited as the basis of the intention of the dharmadhatu.

original: ji skad du gsung ba'i bdag po de la 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas /
analyzed: ji skad du gsung ba'i bdag po de la 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas /
translated: As it is said, the lord of speech, from beginningless samsara,

original: byis pa'i skye bo rnams ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin par mngon par zhen pas bdag gi khyad par grangs med pa rab tu brtags te /
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo rnams ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin par mngon par zhen pas bdag gi khyad par grangs med pa rab tu brtags te /
