translated: childish beings have been fixated on the apprehension of “I” and the apprehension of “mine.” Therefore they have thoroughly imputed countless features of a self.

original: gsang ba ba'i bdag po de dag bdag gi ngo bo nyid la ma dpyad bar bdag go zhes ngar 'dzin ba kun nas slong ngo //
analyzed: gsang ba ba'i bdag po de dag bdag gi ngo bo nyid la ma dpyad bar bdag go zhes ngar 'dzin ba kun nas slong ngo //
translated: O Lord of Secrets, without analyzing the very essence of self, they are motivated by the apprehension of “I.”

original: gzhan dag ni dus las byung ba dang 'dzin pa pos sprul pa dang nges par 'byung ba dang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni dus las byung ba dang 'dzin pa pos sprul pa dang nges par 'byung ba dang 'di lta ste /
translated: Others say that it arises from time, that it is emanated by the apprehender, and that it is the definite emergence of this.

original: dbang phyug dang / 'byin pa po dang / dus dang / gtso bo dang / byed pa po dang / byed pa po ma yin pa @91b dang ; rnal 'byor dang / tshad ma dang / dag pa dang / ma dag pa dang / nang gi bdag dang /🔽skyes bu dang / khyab bdag dang / srog dang / gang zag dang / rnam par shes pa dang / kun gzhi dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / shes pa dang / shes bya dang /🔽shes par bya ba dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin par rtog ste /

original: / de ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos de dag gnyi ga yang bye brag med par mtshan nyid med par rtogs par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / de ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos de dag gnyi ga yang bye brag med par mtshan nyid med par rtogs par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the realization of the absence of the characteristics of both of those, mundane and supramundane phenomena, without distinction,

original: gsum pa mtshan nyid med par zhes bya ba smos te mtshan nyid ni chos rnams kyi rang gi thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin srab dang / grang ba dang / rig pa dang / bems po la sogs pa so so rang gi mtshan nyid ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa mtshan nyid med par zhes bya ba smos te mtshan nyid ni chos rnams kyi rang gi thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin srab dang / grang ba dang / rig pa dang / bems po la sogs pa so so rang gi mtshan nyid ma lus pa'o //
translated: the third is called “the absence of characteristics.” The characteristics are the individual, intrinsic natures of phenomena, such as solidity, fluidity, heat, motility, and so forth.

original: de med par don dam par rigs pa'i mthu mi theg pas na med ces brjod kyi //
analyzed: de med par don dam par rigs pa'i mthu mi theg pas na med ces brjod kyi //
translated: Since they cannot withstand the power of reasoning in the ultimate, they are said to be “nonexistent.”

original: ri bong gi rva ltar bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva ltar bu ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not like the horns of a rabbit,

original: ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i ngo bo sgyu ma tsam du de dag rang rang gi mtshan nyid du yod pa ni mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i ngo bo sgyu ma tsam du de dag rang rang gi mtshan nyid du yod pa ni mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their mere illusory nature, which is delightful when not examined, exists as their individual characteristics. This is evident.

original: de ltar mtshan nyid med pa de dag kyang mtshan gzhi tha dad pa srab dang / tsha ba la sogs pa tha dad pa ltar /
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid med pa de dag kyang mtshan gzhi tha dad pa srab dang / tsha ba la sogs pa tha dad pa ltar /
translated: Thus, those without characteristics are merely the opposite of the individual characteristics of existence, like the individual differences of thinness, hotness, and so on.

original: rang rang gi yod pa'i mtshan nyid las log pa tsam du gnas so snyam du rtogs la /
analyzed: rang rang gi yod pa'i mtshan nyid las log pa tsam du gnas so snyam du rtogs la /
translated: One should understand that they exist as merely the opposite of their individual characteristics of existence.

original: don dam pa ni chos rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa ni chos rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The ultimate is the general characteristic of phenomena.

original: de ltar ni mi bsam bar ston pa bzhi pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar ni mi bsam bar ston pa bzhi pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid du zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to show that one should not think in that way, the fourth statement is made: “The characteristic of nonduality.”

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i stong ba nyid gang dag yin pa de dag ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med de so sor ma yin tha mi dag par rtogs par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i stong ba nyid gang dag yin pa de dag ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med de so sor ma yin tha mi dag par rtogs par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The emptiness of form and the emptiness of feeling and so on are nondual and indivisible, and one should understand that they are not separate and not different.

original: rtogs pa zhes bzhi tshar gyi mthar chos thams cad ces bya ba bstan pa ni rtogs pa de dag re re yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dngos po ma lus par bsdus pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bzhin du skad cig ma gcig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba smos pa yang rtogs pa de dag bzhi char yang khyad par @92a * //
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes bzhi tshar gyi mthar chos thams cad ces bya ba bstan pa ni rtogs pa de dag re re yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dngos po ma lus par bsdus pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin du skad cig ma gcig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba smos pa yang rtogs pa de dag bzhi char yang khyad par @92a * //
translated: The teaching of all dharmas at the end of the four realizations is because each of those realizations includes all things that are afflicted and purified.

original: can gyi ye shes kyi skad cig ma gcig la mngon sum du byed par ston pa'o //
analyzed: can gyi ye shes kyi skad cig ma gcig la mngon sum du byed par ston pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the statement about the characteristic of a single moment shows that all four of those realizations are manifested in a single moment of special gnosis.

original: de bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Similarly, the statement about manifest complete enlightenment

original: sam ni rdzogs pa'i don ston pa ste chos thams cad ces smos pas so //
analyzed: sam ni rdzogs pa'i don ston pa ste chos thams cad ces smos pas so //
translated: shows that the sam of samyak means complete, because of the statement about all dharmas.

original: de nas ni mngon du byang chub pa ste mngon du rtogs par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nas ni mngon du byang chub pa ste mngon du rtogs par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Then, it is manifest enlightenment, which means manifest realization.

original: 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa mang po zhig tu kun rdzogs kyi dngos po rnams kyang ma lus par padma'i 'dab ma ltar ma 'dres par rang gi mtshan nyid dang / las sam rgyu la sogs par shes pa la goms par byas la /
analyzed: 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa mang po zhig tu kun rdzogs kyi dngos po rnams kyang ma lus par padma'i 'dab ma ltar ma 'dres par rang gi mtshan nyid dang / las sam rgyu la sogs par shes pa la goms par byas la /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva, for many eons, has cultivated the understanding of the individual characteristics, functions, causes, and so on, of all the elements of the perfection stage, without mixing them up, like the petals of a lotus.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin spros pa dang bral ba'i chos nyid la kyang yun ring du goms par byas pa la goms par byas pa la goms pa'i mthu mthar thug pa'i rtogs pa 'di skye ba na kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis cig car nyid du ye shes kyis yul du byas nas phan chun 'gal bar snang ba dag mi 'gal bar yul du byed pa ni yul gyi rang bzhin de nyid de ltar gnas pa'i phyir yang ste ji skad du //
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin spros pa dang bral ba'i chos nyid la kyang yun ring du goms par byas pa la goms par byas pa la goms pa'i mthu mthar thug pa'i rtogs pa 'di skye ba na kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis cig car nyid du ye shes kyis yul du byas nas phan chun 'gal bar snang ba dag mi 'gal bar yul du byed pa ni yul gyi rang bzhin de nyid de ltar gnas pa'i phyir yang ste ji skad du //
translated: And he has cultivated for a long time the nature of those elements, which is the reality free from conceptual elaborations. When the realization that is the culmination of that cultivation arises, the two truths, the conventional truth and the ultimate truth, are simultaneously taken as objects by his wisdom. The appearance of their mutual exclusion is not excluded from the object, because the nature of the object abides in that way.🔽As it is said:

original: 'o na de ni rtogs gyur pas //
analyzed: 'o na de ni rtogs gyur pas //
translated: When that is realized,

original: de yi rang bzhin mngon sum phyir //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin mngon sum phyir //
translated: the nature of that is directly perceived.

original: mi mkhas rnams kyang dngos rnams kyi //
analyzed: mi mkhas rnams kyang dngos rnams kyi //
translated: Even the unwise do not think🔽that things are like this.

original: dngos po 'di 'dra ci mi rtogs //
analyzed: dngos po 'di 'dra ci mi rtogs //
translated: It is not so; due to the force of

original: ma yin thog med rgyud lci bar //
analyzed: ma yin thog med rgyud lci bar //
translated: the imprints of beginningless continuum,

original: dngos por sgro btags dbang bas //
analyzed: dngos por sgro btags dbang bas //
translated: they are overpowered by the superimposition of entities.

original: de phyir srog chags thams cad kyis //
analyzed: de phyir srog chags thams cad kyis //
translated: Therefore, all living beings

original: mngon sum par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: do not perceive it.

original: de la sgro btags gcod byed pa //
analyzed: de la sgro btags gcod byed pa //
translated: The one who cuts the superimposition

original: shes rab byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyis //
analyzed: shes rab byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyis //
translated: with the reasoning of the agent of wisdom

original: rjes su dpogs na shes par byed //
analyzed: rjes su dpogs na shes par byed //
translated: will understand it through inference.

original: rnal 'byor dbang rnams mngon sum gsal //🔽zhes bya ba las glengs te /🔽thog ma med pa'i srid par skyes pa dngos po la mngon par zhen ba'i dug gis dkrugs pa'i blo can dag gis mngon sum tsam du rtogs pas rnam pa rnams khong du chud par mi nus te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor dbang rnams mngon sum gsal // zhes bya ba las glengs te / thog ma med pa'i srid par skyes pa dngos po la mngon par zhen ba'i dug gis dkrugs pa'i blo can dag gis mngon sum tsam du rtogs pas rnam pa rnams khong du chud par mi nus te /
translated: The lords of yogins perceive it directly.🔽Those whose minds are disturbed by the poison of clinging to entities, who have been born in cyclic existence without beginning, do not understand the aspects because they merely understand them as direct perception.

original: 'dra ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dmigs pas blo snang ba dag gis skad cig ma mi rtogs pa bzhin no zhes bshad cing de las kyang brtsams te /
analyzed: 'dra ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dmigs pas blo snang ba dag gis skad cig ma mi rtogs pa bzhin no zhes bshad cing de las kyang brtsams te /
translated: They do not understand the momentary because they observe a continuity of similarity from one moment to the next.

original: 'dis ni dngos po rnams kyi sgro btags pa'i rnam pa sben pa ni stong pa nyid ces byon /
analyzed: 'dis ni dngos po rnams kyi sgro btags pa'i rnam pa sben pa ni stong pa nyid ces byon /
translated: This shows that the superimposed aspect of things is called emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid sgro btags pa'i rnam pas bsgribs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin bzung bzhin du byis pa rnams kyis nges par mi 'gyur @92b te ;
analyzed: stong pa nyid sgro btags pa'i rnam pas bsgribs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin bzung bzhin du byis pa rnams kyis nges par mi 'gyur @92b te ;
translated: Because the nature of things is obscured by the superimposed aspect of emptiness, the foolish do not ascertain it.

original: de'i phyir gzung mod kyi tha snyad gdags su mi rung ba'i phyir ma bzung ba dang 'dra ba nyid yin pas 'di ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzung mod kyi tha snyad gdags su mi rung ba'i phyir ma bzung ba dang 'dra ba nyid yin pas 'di ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, although it is apprehended, it is as if it is not apprehended because it is not suitable to be designated conventionally. Thus, it is shown that it does not become an object of apprehension.

original: de'i phyir blo'i 'jug pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo'i 'jug pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: Therefore, from the perspective of the engagement of the mind,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa las rnam par dben pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa las rnam par dben pa yin te /
translated: ultimate truth is isolated from conventional truth,

original: sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes la kun rdzob rnams mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes la kun rdzob rnams mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because conventional truths do not appear to the wisdom of meditative equipoise on the ground of Supreme Joy and so on.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa de yang don dam pa'i bden pa las so rnam par dben pa ste byis pa rnams kyi shes pa la ni kun rdzob 'ba' zhig snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa de yang don dam pa'i bden pa las so rnam par dben pa ste byis pa rnams kyi shes pa la ni kun rdzob 'ba' zhig snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, this conventional truth is isolated from the ultimate truth, because only the conventional appears to the consciousness of the childish.

original: shes rab dang thabs gnyi ga la goms pa phul du byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po snying po byang chub la bzhugs pa dang / thub pa'i dbang po rnams kyi ye shes kyi snang ba rab 'byam gyis ni gnyi ga ltar snang ba rnam par btang ste /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs gnyi ga la goms pa phul du byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po snying po byang chub la bzhugs pa dang / thub pa'i dbang po rnams kyi ye shes kyi snang ba rab 'byam gyis ni gnyi ga ltar snang ba rnam par btang ste /
translated: The great bodhisattvas who are accustomed to both wisdom and method, who are seated at the heart of enlightenment, and the lords of sages, by the light of their wisdom, have abandoned the appearance of both.

original: bden pa gnyis su dbyer med par snang ba'i dbang gis srid pa dang / zhi ba gnyi gar mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa grub ste /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis su dbyer med par snang ba'i dbang gis srid pa dang / zhi ba gnyi gar mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa grub ste /
translated: By the power of the appearance of the two truths as inseparable, they have attained nirvana, which does not abide in either existence or peace.

original: don 'di la sbyar ba'i phyir ni 'phags pas bcu pa'i le'u las /
analyzed: don 'di la sbyar ba'i phyir ni 'phags pas bcu pa'i le'u las /
translated: In order to apply to this meaning, the noble Candra has said in the tenth chapter of his Illumination of the Middle Way,

original: sa mi g-yo ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par bskul ba'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: sa mi g-yo ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par bskul ba'i dbang du byas te /
translated: in the context of exhorting the bodhisattva who is abiding in the stage of Immovable:

original: de dag sa bdun shes rab thabs kyis rab sbyangs shing //
analyzed: de dag sa bdun shes rab thabs kyis rab sbyangs shing //
translated: On the seventh ground, they are skilled in wisdom and means,

original: shin tu tshogs bsags smon lam chen po rab tu btab //
analyzed: shin tu tshogs bsags smon lam chen po rab tu btab //
translated: Have gathered the accumulations, and made great aspirational prayers.

original: mi yi dam pas byin rlabs dge ba'i rtsal ldan zhing //
analyzed: mi yi dam pas byin rlabs dge ba'i rtsal ldan zhing //
translated: They are empowered by the supreme ones among men, have the power of virtue,

original: ye shes mngon 'dod mkhas pa brgyad pa yongs su gnon //
analyzed: ye shes mngon 'dod mkhas pa brgyad pa yongs su gnon //
translated: And are skilled in the desire for wisdom, and they surpass the eighth ground.

original: bsod nams ye shes nyer bsags snying rje byams ldan zhing //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes nyer bsags snying rje byams ldan zhing //
translated: They have accumulated merit and wisdom, have compassion and love,

original: tshad med sems kyi rjes song mkha' dang 'dra ba'i blo //
analyzed: tshad med sems kyi rjes song mkha' dang 'dra ba'i blo //
translated: And have a space-like mind that follows immeasurable thoughts.

original: drang srong chen po chos thos rtogs pa'i stobs ldan pa //
analyzed: drang srong chen po chos thos rtogs pa'i stobs ldan pa //
translated: The great sages have the power of realization from hearing the Dharma,

original: mi skye ba yi bzod pa phra zhing zhi ba rab tu thob //
analyzed: mi skye ba yi bzod pa phra zhing zhi ba rab tu thob //
translated: And they attain the subtle and peaceful acceptance of the unborn.🔽From the beginning, they are unborn, do not arise, are without characteristics,🔽Do not occur, do not perish, and are without causes.

original: snga nas ma skyes mi skye mtshan nyid med pa dang // ma byung 'jig pa med cing rgyu med pa dang // dngos po skye 'jig med cing de nyid rtog med pa //
analyzed: snga nas ma skyes mi skye mtshan nyid med pa dang // ma byung 'jig pa med cing rgyu med pa dang // dngos po skye 'jig med cing de nyid rtog med pa //
translated: Things are without arising and perishing, and they are not conceptualized.

original: yid dang sems kyi rgyu ba med cing nam mkha' 'dra //
analyzed: yid dang sems kyi rgyu ba med cing nam mkha' 'dra //
translated: They are without the movement of mind and thought, and are like space.

original: de dang 'di 'dra'i bzod ldan spros pa med gyu pa'i //
analyzed: de dang 'di 'dra'i bzod ldan spros pa med gyu pa'i //
translated: Those who have such acceptance are free from conceptual elaboration.

original: mkhas pa'i zab spyod zhi ba'i gnas rab thob pa yin //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i zab spyod zhi ba'i gnas rab thob pa yin //
translated: The profound conduct of the wise is to attain the state of peace.

original: dgra bcom rang rgyal 'gro ba kun gyis shes par dka' //
analyzed: dgra bcom rang rgyal 'gro ba kun gyis shes par dka' //
translated: Arhats and pratyekabuddhas are difficult for all beings to know.

original: mtshan ma snang tshogs @93a * //
analyzed: mtshan ma snang tshogs @93a * //
translated: The various appearances of signs

original: 'dzin pa'i 'du shes rnam par bsal //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i 'du shes rnam par bsal //
translated: are eliminated by the perception of grasping.

original: de ltar gnas pa'i yid dang sems ni rtog pa med //
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa'i yid dang sems ni rtog pa med //
translated: In that way, the mind and thoughts that abide are non-conceptual.

original: dge slong 'gog dang ldan ltar rnam par rtog mi 'thob //
analyzed: dge slong 'gog dang ldan ltar rnam par rtog mi 'thob //
translated: Like a monk possessing cessation, conceptual thoughts are not obtained.

original: rmi lam chus khyer gnyid sad bzhin du rtsol dang bral //
analyzed: rmi lam chus khyer gnyid sad bzhin du rtsol dang bral //
translated: Free from effort, like one carried away by water in a dream who awakens,

original: tshangs pa'i gnas kyi 'dod pa ji bzhin nyid kyang med //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas kyi 'dod pa ji bzhin nyid kyang med //
translated: the desire for the abode of Brahma is just as it is.

original: sngon gyi byin gyis brlabs kyis bde gshegs bskul ba mdzad //
analyzed: sngon gyi byin gyis brlabs kyis bde gshegs bskul ba mdzad //
translated: The Sugatas of the past were inspired by blessings.

original: 'di ni bde gshegs dbang bskur bzod pa dam pa ste //
analyzed: 'di ni bde gshegs dbang bskur bzod pa dam pa ste //
translated: This is the supreme patience of the Sugata's empowerment.

original: nged kyi ye shes stobs spangs sangs rgyas chos kyi rnams //
analyzed: nged kyi ye shes stobs spangs sangs rgyas chos kyi rnams //
translated: The qualities of the Buddha's Dharma, abandoning the power of our wisdom,

original: de dag khyod la med kyis de la brtson 'grus rtsoms //
analyzed: de dag khyod la med kyis de la brtson 'grus rtsoms //
translated: are not in you, so strive in that!

original: ci phan khyod kyi nyon mongs 'bar ba kun zhi yang //
analyzed: ci phan khyod kyi nyon mongs 'bar ba kun zhi yang //
translated: Even though you have pacified all the blazing afflictions,

original: 'jig rten nyon mongs mes tshig de dag mi lta'am //🔽sems can phyir spyad pa yi sngon gyi smon lam sems //
analyzed: 'jig rten nyon mongs mes tshig de dag mi lta'am // sems can phyir spyad pa yi sngon gyi smon lam sems //
translated: Do they not see the world burning with the fire of the afflictions?

original: 'gro ba mthar gyur ye shes don zhugs shes rab kyis //

translated: Since there are four aspects, there are the natures of the essential body, the enjoyment body, and the emanation body.

original: kha cig na re slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas ni gzhung gzhan du sku gsum du bstan pas de ltar bzhed mod kyi //
analyzed: kha cig na re slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas ni gzhung gzhan du sku gsum du bstan pas de ltar bzhed mod kyi //
translated: Some say that the master’s own position is that there are three bodies, as taught in other scriptures.

original: 'di ni mkhan po yang dag rnam par snang mdzad kyi //
analyzed: 'di ni mkhan po yang dag rnam par snang mdzad kyi //
translated: However, this is the position of the abbot Parahitabhadra,

original: gdams ngag gtso bor mdzad pas na //🔽de yi bzhed pa bkod pa'o //
analyzed: gdams ngag gtso bor mdzad pas na // de yi bzhed pa bkod pa'o //
translated: who primarily taught the instructions of Vairocana.

original: zhes zer te /
analyzed: zhes zer te /
translated: Therefore, this is his position.

original: 'og nas sku'i grangs nges par tha dad pa bstan pa'i lugs gang yang sun ma phyung bas na /
analyzed: 'og nas sku'i grangs nges par tha dad pa bstan pa'i lugs gang yang sun ma phyung bas na /
translated: Since he does not refute any of the systems that teach the definite number of bodies below,

original: de ltar nges pa ni ci yang med de /🔽slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas ni sku dur bzhag kyang /
analyzed: de ltar nges pa ni ci yang med de / slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas ni sku dur bzhag kyang /
translated: there is no certainty at all.🔽The Acarya's own position is that there is no fault in positing three bodies.

original: nyes pa med par bzhed par gsal lo //
analyzed: nyes pa med par bzhed par gsal lo //
translated: This is clear.

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi dang po'am /
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi dang po'am /
translated: First means first in the order of enumeration,

original: yang na mchog gi don gyi dngos po ste /🔽sngar rang bzhin gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i che ba'i @95a * //
analyzed: yang na mchog gi don gyi dngos po ste / sngar rang bzhin gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i che ba'i @95a * //
translated: or it means the supreme, the entity of the highest.

original: bdag nyid bstan pa'i skabs su bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: bdag nyid bstan pa'i skabs su bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: It is like the way in which the greatness of the perfection of wisdom was previously taught in the section on the nature of reality.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi sku zhes bya ba ni 'di ni ngo bo nyid kyang yin la sku yang yin pas na ngo bo nyid kyi sku zhes gzhi mthun pa'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi sku zhes bya ba ni 'di ni ngo bo nyid kyang yin la sku yang yin pas na ngo bo nyid kyi sku zhes gzhi mthun pa'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: The essence body is so called because it is both an essence and a body, and it is a compound of terms that share a common referent.

original: de la ngo bo nyid ni chos can khyad par can rnams kyi chos nyid khyad par can gang yin pa de 'dir ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid ni chos can khyad par can rnams kyi chos nyid khyad par can gang yin pa de 'dir ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Here, essence means the special reality of special phenomena.

original: chos can khyad par can rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi sa kun tu bzang po'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos can khyad par can rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi sa kun tu bzang po'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The special subjects are the Buddha stage, the perfect mindfulness of Samantabhadra, and so on.

original: de dag gi chos nyid khyad par can gang yin pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa gang la sems kyi rgyu ba yang med na yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dag gi chos nyid khyad par can gang yin pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa gang la sems kyi rgyu ba yang med na yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The special reality of those is the ultimate truth, where there is not even the movement of mind, let alone the use of letters.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa dang rnam par dag pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni chos can gyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa ma yin pa gzhan gyis ni cung zad kyang rnam par gzhag pa nus pa ma yin la //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa dang rnam par dag pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni chos can gyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa ma yin pa gzhan gyis ni cung zad kyang rnam par gzhag pa nus pa ma yin la //
translated: Therefore, the purity and impurity of thusness are not established by the power of the subject. No one else can establish it in any way.

original: chos can dang / de'i chos nyid kyang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod du med pa'o zhes sngar bstan to //
analyzed: chos can dang / de'i chos nyid kyang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod du med pa'o zhes sngar bstan to //
translated: And it has been shown previously that the subject and its reality are inexpressible as either the same or different.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'grel pa ni de dag gi rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'grel pa ni de dag gi rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary on the phrase “their nature” is “their nature is their essence.”

original: mtshan nyid can zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'grel pa ni skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid 'di yin te zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid can zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'grel pa ni skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid 'di yin te zhes bya ste /
translated: The commentary on the phrase “the nature of reality” is “this is the nature of non-arising.”

original: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni rang bzhin de'i tha dad pa ma yin pa'i chos kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig la blos tha dad par gzung ba'i ngo bo nyid la bya ba'i phyir la 'dir ni tha dad pa ma yin pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid de yang skye🔽ba med pa nyid la 'dod de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni rang bzhin de'i tha dad pa ma yin pa'i chos kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig la blos tha dad par gzung ba'i ngo bo nyid la bya ba'i phyir la 'dir ni tha dad pa ma yin pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid de yang skye ba med pa nyid la 'dod de /
translated: “Nature of reality” means that the nature of reality is apprehended by the mind as a particular quality of a phenomenon that is not different from its nature. Here, the nature of reality that is not different from a phenomenon is asserted to be non-arising.

original: des na rang bzhin dang de'i mtshan nyid skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: des na rang bzhin dang de'i mtshan nyid skye ba med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the nature and its reality of non-arising are not different.

original: de las gzhan ma yin pa blos mtshon par bya ba dang / mtshon par byed pa tsam du btags pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan ma yin pa blos mtshon par bya ba dang / mtshon par byed pa tsam du btags pa'o //
translated: They are imputed to be merely the object that is characterized and the characteristic that characterizes.

original: bcos ma ma yin pa'i don gyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bcos ma ma yin pa'i don gyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “in the sense of not being fabricated” means

original: ngo bo nyid dang lhan cig skyes pa dang / ma bcos pa zhes bya ba ni ming gi rnam grangs te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang lhan cig skyes pa dang / ma bcos pa zhes bya ba ni ming gi rnam grangs te /
translated: that the nature, the innate, and the unfabricated are synonyms.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyis de ltar yin gyi sus kyang byas pa ma yin pas zhes bstan te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyis de ltar yin gyi sus kyang byas pa ma yin pas zhes bstan te /
translated: Therefore, it is so by the reality of phenomena, and since it is not made by anyone,

original: gsum pa 'di ni gtan tshigs su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsum pa 'di ni gtan tshigs su blta bar bya'o //
translated: this third reason should be seen as the reason.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis 'thob kyi zhes bya ba ni sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa sems rgyu ba med pa ni de thob pa ste de dang @95b dbyer med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis 'thob kyi zhes bya ba ni sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa sems rgyu ba med pa ni de thob pa ste de dang @95b dbyer med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Obtained by the supramundane path means that the non-conceptual cognition of the bodhisattva on the Joyous ground and so on is obtained by that, because it becomes inseparable from it.

original: de'i rjes las thob pa yang de'i 'phen pa dang ma bral bas na thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes las thob pa yang de'i 'phen pa dang ma bral bas na thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Also, the subsequent attainment is called obtained because it is not divorced from the impetus of that.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis thob pa nyid bstan pa ni rnam par shes pa sgyu ma lta bus chos thams cad rtogs pas thob pa yin no zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis thob pa nyid bstan pa ni rnam par shes pa sgyu ma lta bus chos thams cad rtogs pas thob pa yin no zhes smos te /
translated: The explanation of being obtained by the supramundane path is stated by saying that it is obtained by realizing all phenomena with illusion-like consciousness.
